analyzed: yathārūpaḥ ntarātmā te tathārūpam prabhāṣase
translated: You speak in accordance with the nature of your inner self.

original: santi vai puruṣāḥ śūrāḥ santi kāpuruṣās tathā
analyzed: santi vai puruṣāḥ śūrāḥ santi kāpuruṣāḥ tathā
translated: There are brave men, and there are cowards as well.

original: ubhāv etau dṛḍhau pakṣau dṛśyete puruṣān prati
analyzed: ubhau etau dṛḍhau pakṣau dṛśyete puruṣān prati
translated: Both these firm positions are seen among men.

analyzed: ekasmin eva jāyete kule klība mahā rathau
translated: In the same family, a eunuch and a great warrior are born.

analyzed: phala aphalavatī śākhe yathā ekasmin vanaspatau
translated: Like fruits and fruit-bearing branches on a single tree.

analyzed: na abhyasūyāmi te vākyam bruvataḥ lāṅgaladhvaja
translated: O one with the plough as his banner, I do not disapprove of your words.

original: ye tu śṛṇvanti te vākyaṃ tān asūyāmi mādhava
analyzed: ye tu śṛṇvanti te vākyam tān asūyāmi mādhava
translated: But I disapprove of those who listen to your words, O Madhava.

original: kathaṃ hi dharmarājasya doṣam alpam api bruvan
analyzed: katham hi dharmarājasya doṣam alpam api bruvan
translated: How can one, speaking even a little about the faults of Dharmaraja,

analyzed: labhate pariṣad madhye vyāhartum akutobhayaḥ
translated: obtain fearlessness and speak in the midst of the assembly?

analyzed: samāhūya mahātmānam jitavantaḥ kṣa kovidāḥ
translated: Having challenged the great-souled one, the skilled gamblers have won.

analyzed: an akṣa jñam yathāśraddham teṣu dharma jayaḥ kutas
translated: How can there be victory for Dharma in them, who are not skilled in dice, but play out of faith?

original: yadi kuntīsutaṃ gehe krīḍantaṃ bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
analyzed: yadi kuntī sutam gehe krīḍantam bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
translated: If the son of Kunti is playing at home with his brothers,

original: abhigamya jayeyus te tat teṣāṃ dharmato bhavet
analyzed: abhigamya jayeyuḥ te tat teṣām dharmataḥ bhavet
translated: If they had gone to him and defeated him, that would have been in accordance with dharma.

analyzed: samāhūya tu rājānam kṣatra dharma ratam sadā
translated: But having challenged the king who always delights in the dharma of kshatriyas,

original: nikṛtyā jitavantas te kiṃ nu teṣāṃ paraṃ śubham
analyzed: nikṛtyā jitavantaḥ te kim nu teṣām param śubham
translated: and having defeated him through deceit, what greater good is there for them?

original: kathaṃ praṇipatec cāyam iha kṛtvā paṇaṃ param
analyzed: katham praṇipatet ca ayam iha kṛtvā paṇam param
translated: How can he who has made a great wager here,

original: vanavāsād vimuktas tu prāptaḥ paitāmahaṃ padam
analyzed: vana vāsāt vimuktaḥ tu prāptaḥ paitāmaham padam
translated: having been freed from exile in the forest, attain the position of his grandfather?

analyzed: yadi ayam para vittāni kāmayeta yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: If Yudhishthira desires the wealth of others,

original: evam apy ayam atyantaṃ parān nārhati yācitum
analyzed: evam api ayam atyantam parān na arhati yācitum
translated: even then he does not deserve to beg from others to such an extreme.

original: kathaṃ ca dharmayuktās te na ca rājyaṃ jihīrṣavaḥ
analyzed: katham ca dharma yuktāḥ te na ca rājyam jihīrṣavaḥ
translated: How can they be righteous and not desire the kingdom?

original: nivṛttavāsān kaunteyān ya āhur viditā iti
analyzed: nivṛtta vāsān kaunteyān ye āhuḥ viditāḥ iti
translated: Those who say that the Kounteyas are known to have returned from exile,

original: anunītā hi bhīṣmeṇa droṇena ca mahātmanā
analyzed: anunītāḥ hi bhīṣmeṇa droṇena ca mahātmanā
translated: having been entreated by Bhishma and the great-souled Drona,

original: na vyavasyanti pāṇḍūnāṃ pradātuṃ paitṛkaṃ vasu
analyzed: na vyavasyanti pāṇḍūnām pradātum paitṛkam vasu
translated: do not agree to give back the paternal wealth to the Pandus.

original: ahaṃ tu tāñ śitair bāṇair anunīya raṇe balāt
analyzed: aham tu tām śitaiḥ bāṇaiḥ anunīya raṇe balāt
translated: But I will forcibly entreat them in battle with sharp arrows

analyzed: pādayoḥ pātayiṣyāmi kaunteyasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: and make them fall at the feet of the great-souled Kounteya.

original: atha te na vyavasyanti praṇipātāya dhīmataḥ
analyzed: atha te na vyavasyanti praṇipātāya dhīmataḥ
translated: If they do not agree to bow down to the wise one,

analyzed: gamiṣyanti saha amātyāḥ yamasya sadanam prati
translated: they will go to Yama's abode along with their advisers.

analyzed: daśa āśā chādayantam mām eka vīram mada utkaṭam
translated: The ten directions cover me, the single hero, intoxicated with pride,

original: vijiṣṇuṃ manyate loko yudhyantaṃ ca mahītale
analyzed: vijiṣṇum manyate lokaḥ yudhyantam ca mahī tale
translated: The world considers me victorious, fighting on the surface of the earth.

analyzed: satyam mama antevāsi tvam jayasya jaya śālinaḥ
translated: It is true that I am the disciple of Jaya, the victorious one.

original: chinadmi yadi khaḍgena bhīṣmādīnāṃ śirāṃsy aham
analyzed: chinadmi yadi khaḍgena bhīṣma ādīnām śirāṃsi aham
translated: If I were to cut off the heads of Bhishma and others with my sword,

original: na hi te yuyudhānasya saṃrabdhasya yuyutsataḥ
analyzed: na hi te yuyudhānasya saṃrabdhasya yuyutsataḥ
translated: None of them are capable of withstanding the force of Yuyudhana,

analyzed: vegam samarthāḥ saṃsoḍhum vajrasya iva mahīdharāḥ
translated: Angry and eager to fight, like the mountains against the thunderbolt.

original: ko hi gāṇḍīvadhanvānaṃ kaś ca cakrāyudhaṃ yudhi
analyzed: kaḥ hi gāṇḍīvadhanvānam kaḥ ca cakrāyudham yudhi
translated: Who can withstand the wielder of Gandiva, and who can withstand the wielder of the discus in battle,

original: māṃ cāpi viṣahet ko nu kaś ca bhīmaṃ durāsadam🔽yamau ca dṛḍhadhanvānau yamakalpau mahādyutī
analyzed: mām ca api viṣahet kaḥ nu kaḥ ca bhīmam durāsadam  yamau ca dṛḍha dhanvānau yama kalpau mahā dyutī
translated: And who can withstand me, and who can withstand the invincible Bhima,🔽And the twins, firm archers, equal to the twins born from Yama, of great splendor,

analyzed: virāṭa drupadau vīrau yama kāla upama dyutī
translated: And the heroes Virata and Drupada, shining like Yama and Death,

original: ko jijīviṣur āsīded dhṛṣṭadyumnaṃ ca pārṣatam
analyzed: kaḥ jijīviṣuḥ āsīdet dhṛṣṭadyumnam ca pārṣatam
translated: Who would dare to approach Dhristadyumna, the son of Prishata,

analyzed: pañca imān pāṇḍaveyān ca draupadyāḥ kīrti vardhanān
translated: And the five sons of Draupadi, who enhance the fame of the Pandavas,

analyzed: sama pramāṇān pāṇḍūnām sama vīryān mada utkaṭān
translated: Equal in age to the Pandavas, equal in valor, intoxicated with pride,

original: saubhadraṃ ca maheṣvāsam amarair api duḥsaham
analyzed: saubhadram ca mahā iṣvāsam amaraiḥ api duḥsaham
translated: And Subhadra's son, a great archer, difficult to withstand even by the immortals,

analyzed: gada pradyumna sāmbān ca kāla vajra anala upamān
translated: And Gada, Pradyumna, and Samba, equal to Death, the thunderbolt, and fire,

original: te vayaṃ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya putraṃ śakuninā saha
analyzed: te vayam dhṛtarāṣṭrasya putram śakuninā saha
translated: We, having killed Dhritarashtra's son, along with Shakuni,

analyzed: karṇena ca nihatya ājau abhiṣekṣyāma pāṇḍavam
translated: Karna and others in battle, will consecrate the Pandava (Yudhishthira).

original: nādharmo vidyate kaś cic chatrūn hatvātatāyinaḥ
analyzed: na adharmaḥ vidyate kaḥ cit śatrūn hatvā ātatāyinaḥ
translated: There is no sin in killing attacking enemies.

analyzed: adharmyam ayaśasyam ca śātravāṇām prayācanam
translated: To beg from enemies is sinful and shameful.

analyzed: agnidaḥ garadaḥ ca eva śastra pāṇiḥ dhana apahaḥ
translated: One who sets fire, one who administers poison, one who holds a weapon, one who takes away wealth,

original: kṣetradāraharaś caiva ṣaḍ ete hy ātatāyinaḥ
analyzed: kṣetra dāra haraḥ ca eva ṣaṭ ete hi ātatāyinaḥ
translated: and one who seizes fields and wives - these six are attackers.

analyzed: ātatāyinam āyāntam api vedānta vādinam
translated: Even if an attacker comes, even one who speaks Vedanta,

original: jighāṃsantaṃ jighāṃsīyān na tena brahmahā bhavet
analyzed: jighāṃsantam jighāṃsīyān na tena brahma hā bhavet
translated: if he is intent on killing, one should kill him in return, one does not become a killer of a Brahmin thereby.

original: hṛdgatas tasya yaḥ kāmas taṃ kurudhvam atandritāḥ🔽nisṛṣṭaṃ dhṛtarāṣṭreṇa rājyaṃ prāpnotu pāṇḍavaḥ
analyzed: hṛd gataḥ tasya yaḥ kāmaḥ tam kurudhvam atandritāḥ  nisṛṣṭam dhṛtarāṣṭreṇa rājyam prāpnotu pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: Do without delay what he desires in his heart.🔽Let the Pandava Yudhishthira obtain the kingdom given by Dhritarashtra.

original: adya pāṇḍusuto rājyaṃ labhatāṃ vā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: adya pāṇḍu sutaḥ rājyam labhatām vā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Either let Yudhishthira, the son of Pandu, obtain the kingdom today,

original: nihatā vā raṇe sarve svapsyanti vasudhātale
analyzed: nihatāḥ vā raṇe sarve svapsyanti vasudhā tale
translated: or all of them will be killed in battle and will sleep on the ground.

analyzed: drupadaḥ uvāca
translated: Drupada said:

original: evam etan mahābāho bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: evam etat mahā bāho bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O mighty-armed one, this will certainly happen, there is no doubt.

original: na hi duryodhano rājyaṃ madhureṇa pradāsyati
analyzed: na hi duryodhanaḥ rājyam madhureṇa pradāsyati
translated: Duryodhana will not give the kingdom sweetly.

analyzed: anuvartsyati tam ca api dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ suta priyaḥ
translated: And Dhritarashtra, who loves his son, will follow him.

analyzed: bhīṣma droṇau ca kārpaṇyāt maurkhyāt rādheya saubalau
translated: Bhishma and Drona out of weakness, and Radha's son and Subala's son out of folly,

original: baladevasya vākyaṃ tu mama jñāne na yujyate
analyzed: baladevasya vākyam tu mama jñāne na yujyate
translated: But I do not consider it proper to follow the advice of Baladeva,

original: etad dhi puruṣeṇāgre kāryaṃ sunayam icchatā
analyzed: etat hi puruṣeṇa agre kāryam su nayam icchatā
translated: For this is what a man should do first, if he desires good policy,

original: na tu vācyo mṛdu vaco dhārtarāṣṭraḥ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na tu vācyaḥ mṛdu vacaḥ dhārtarāṣṭraḥ katham cana
translated: But the son of Dhritarashtra should never be addressed with mild words,

original: na hi mārdavasādhyo 'sau pāpabuddhir mato mama
analyzed: na hi mārdava sādhyaḥ sau pāpa buddhiḥ mataḥ mama
translated: For I think that wicked-minded one cannot be subdued by mildness.

original: gardabhe mārdavaṃ kuryād goṣu tīkṣṇaṃ samācaret
analyzed: gardabhe mārdavam kuryāt goṣu tīkṣṇam samācaret
translated: One should show mildness towards an ass, but act harshly towards cows.

original: mṛdu duryodhane vākyaṃ yo brūyāt pāpacetasi
analyzed: mṛdu duryodhane vākyam yaḥ brūyāt pāpa cetasi
translated: He who would speak mild words to the wicked-minded Duryodhana,

original: aham eko 'pi jeṣyāmi prāk caiva prahiṇomi tam
analyzed: aham ekaḥ jeṣyāmi prāk ca eva prahiṇomi tam
translated: I alone will conquer, and I will send him forth first.

original: nāhaṃ kuryāṃ yad etad vai viśvāsād eva śāśvatam
analyzed: na aham kuryām yat etat vai viśvāsāt eva śāśvatam
translated: I would not do this, which is based solely on eternal trust.

original: aham eko vijeṣyāmi prāhatān saṃvidhāya ca
analyzed: aham ekaḥ vijeṣyāmi prāhatān saṃvidhāya ca
translated: I alone will conquer, having arranged for the destruction of the enemies.

original: nāhaṃ karomi tadvākyaṃ praṇipātanapūrvakam🔽mṛdu vai manyate pāpo bhāṣyamāṇam aśaktijam
analyzed: na aham karomi tad vākyam praṇipātana pūrvakam  mṛdu vai manyate pāpaḥ bhāṣyamāṇam aśakti jam
translated: I do not carry out his words preceded by a bow.🔽The wicked one considers what is spoken out of weakness to be mild.

original: jitam arthaṃ vijānīyād abudho mārdave sati
analyzed: jitam artham vijānīyāt abudhaḥ mārdave sati
translated: An ignorant one would consider what is conquered to be a fact, when there is mildness.

original: etac caiva kariṣyāmo yatnaś ca kriyatām iha
analyzed: etat ca eva kariṣyāmaḥ yatnaḥ ca kriyatām iha
translated: And we will do this, and let effort be made here.

analyzed: prasthāpayāma mitrebhyaḥ balāni udyojayantu naḥ
translated: We will send out armies to our allies, let them engage our forces.

analyzed: śalyasya dhṛṣṭaketoḥ ca jayatsenasya ca abhibhoḥ
translated: Shalya, Dhrishtaketu, Jayatsena, the lord of the Abhishahas,

original: kekayānāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ dūtā gacchantu śīghragāḥ
analyzed: kekayānām ca sarveṣām dūtāḥ gacchantu śīghra gāḥ
translated: And all the Kaikeyas, let swift messengers go to them.

original: sa tu duryodhano nūnaṃ preṣayiṣyati sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: sa tu duryodhanaḥ nūnam preṣayiṣyati sarvaśas
translated: But Duryodhana will certainly send messengers everywhere,

original: tāvad dūtān vayaṃ tūrṇaṃ preṣayiṣyāma māciram
analyzed: tāvat dūtān vayam tūrṇam preṣayiṣyāma māciram
translated: So let us quickly send our messengers without delay.

original: sa tu duryodhano nūnaṃ preṣayiṣyati tān nṛpān
analyzed: sa tu duryodhanaḥ nūnam preṣayiṣyati tān nṛpān
translated: He will certainly send messengers to those kings,

analyzed: pūrva abhipannāḥ santaḥ ca bhajante pūrva codakam
translated: The virtuous follow the one who first urges them.

original: tat tvaradhvaṃ narendrāṇāṃ pūrvam eva pracodane
analyzed: tat tvaradhvam narendrāṇām pūrvam eva pracodane
translated: Therefore, hasten to urge the kings first,

original: mahad dhi kāryaṃ voḍhavyam iti me vartate matiḥ
analyzed: mahat hi kāryam voḍhavyam iti me vartate matiḥ
translated: For I think a great task must be undertaken.

original: śalyasya preṣyatāṃ śīghraṃ ye ca tasyānugā nṛpāḥ
analyzed: śalyasya preṣyatām śīghram ye ca tasya anugāḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: Let messengers be sent quickly to Shalya and the kings who follow him,

original: bhagadattāya rājñe ca pūrvasāgaravāsine🔽amitaujase tathogrāya hārdikyāyāhukāya ca
analyzed: bhagadattāya rājñe ca pūrva sāgara vāsine  amita ojase tathā ugrāya hārdikyāya āhukāya ca
translated: To King Bhagadatta who lives by the eastern ocean,🔽To Amitouja, Ugra, Hardikya, Ahuka,

analyzed: dīrghaprajñāya mallāya rocamānāya ca abhibho
translated: To Dirgharprajna, Malla, and the lord Rochamana,

original: ānīyatāṃ bṛhantaś ca senābinduś ca pārthivaḥ
analyzed: ānīyatām bṛhantaḥ ca senābinduḥ ca pārthivaḥ
translated: And let Brihanta and King Senabindu be brought,

analyzed: pāpajit prativindhyaḥ ca citravarmā suvāstukaḥ
translated: Papjit, Prativindhya, Chitravakma, Suvastuka,

original: bāhlīko muñjakeśaś ca caidyādhipatir eva ca
analyzed: vāhlīkaḥ muñjakeśaḥ ca caidya adhipatiḥ eva ca
translated: The Bahlika, Munjakesha, and the lord of the Chedis,🔽And let the kings of the east, north, south, and west be brought.

original: supārśvaś ca subāhuś ca pauravaś ca mahārathaḥ
analyzed: supārśvaḥ ca subāhuḥ ca pauravaḥ ca mahā rathaḥ
translated: Supārśva, Subāhu, and the great chariot of the Pauravas,

original: śakānāṃ pahlavānāṃ ca daradānāṃ ca ye nṛpāḥ
analyzed: śakānām pahlavānām ca daradānām ca ye nṛpāḥ
translated: The kings of the Śakas, Pahlavas, and Daradas,

original: kāmbojā ṛṣikā ye ca paścimānūpakāś ca ye
analyzed: kāmbojāḥ ṛṣikāḥ ye ca paścimānūpakāḥ ca ye
translated: The Kambojas, Ṛṣikas, and those from the western marshlands,

original: jayatsenaś ca kāśyaś ca tathā pañcanadā nṛpāḥ
analyzed: jayatsenaḥ ca kāśyaḥ ca tathā pañcanadāḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: Jayatsena, Kāśya, and the kings of the five rivers,

original: krāthaputraś ca durdharṣaḥ pārvatīyāś ca ye nṛpāḥ
analyzed: krātha putraḥ ca durdharṣaḥ pārvatīyāḥ ca ye nṛpāḥ
translated: The invincible son of Kratha, and the kings of the mountainous regions,

original: jānakiś ca suśarmā ca maṇimān pautimatsyakaḥ
analyzed: jānakiḥ ca suśarmā ca maṇimān pautimatsyakaḥ
translated: Jānaki, Suśarman, Maṇimān, and the son of Putimatsyaka,

analyzed: pāṃsurāṣṭra adhipaḥ ca eva dhṛṣṭaketuḥ ca vīryavān
translated: The lord of the Pāṃsu kingdom, and the valiant Dhṛṣṭaketu,

original: auḍraś ca daṇḍadhāraś ca bṛhatsenaś ca vīryavān
analyzed: auḍraḥ ca daṇḍadhāraḥ ca bṛhatsenaḥ ca vīryavān
translated: Audra, Daṇḍadhāra, and the valiant Bṛhatsena,

original: aparājito niṣādaś ca śreṇimān vasumān api
analyzed: aparājitaḥ niṣādaḥ ca śreṇimān vasumān api
translated: The unconquered Niṣāda, Śreṇimat, Vasumat,

analyzed: bṛhat balaḥ mahaujāḥ ca bāhuḥ parapuraṃjayaḥ
translated: Bṛhadbala, Mahāujas, Bāhu, the conqueror of enemy cities,

original: samudraseno rājā ca saha putreṇa vīryavān
analyzed: samudrasenaḥ rājā ca saha putreṇa vīryavān
translated: King Samudrasena, and his valiant son,

original: adāriś ca nadījaś ca karṇaveṣṭaś ca pārthivaḥ
analyzed: adāriḥ ca nadījaḥ ca karṇaveṣṭaḥ ca pārthivaḥ
translated: Adāri, Nadīja, and King Karṇaveṣṭa,

original: samarthaś ca suvīraś ca mārjāraḥ kanyakas tathā
analyzed: samarthaḥ ca suvīraḥ ca mārjāraḥ kanyakaḥ tathā
translated: Samartha, Suvīra, Māṛjāra, and Kaṇyaka,
One who is haughty with the strength of valor,

analyzed: vīrabāhuḥ subāhuḥ ca
translated: Vīrabāhu, Subāhu,

analyzed: ca
translated: Vīrabāhu, the invincible king of Jālakīṭaka,

original: mahāvīraś ca kadruś ca nikaras tumulaḥ krathaḥ
analyzed: mahā vīraḥ ca kadruḥ ca nikaraḥ tumulaḥ krathaḥ
translated: Mahavir, Kadru, Nikara, Tumula, Krath,

original: nīlaś ca vīradharmā ca bhūmipālaś ca vīryavān
analyzed: nīlaḥ ca vīradharmā ca bhūmipālaḥ ca vīryavān
translated: Nila, Viradharma, the powerful king Bhumipala,

original: durjayo dantavaktraś ca rukmī ca janamejayaḥ
analyzed: durjayaḥ dantavaktraḥ ca rukmī ca janamejayaḥ
translated: Durjaya, Dantavaktra, Rukmi, Janamejaya,

original: āṣāḍho vāyuvegaś ca pūrvapālī ca pārthivaḥ
analyzed: āṣāḍhaḥ vāyuvegaḥ ca pūrvapālī ca pārthivaḥ
translated: Ashadha, Vayuvega, and the eastern king Purvapali,

original: ārṣo devā budhaḥ sūtas tathā harihayopamaḥ
analyzed: ārṣaḥ devāḥ budhaḥ sūtaḥ tathā harihaya upamaḥ
translated: Arsha, Deva, Budha, Suta, and one like Harihaya,

analyzed: bhūritejāḥ devakaḥ ca ekalavyasya ca ātmajaḥ
translated: Bhuriteja, Devaka, and the son of Ekalavya,

original: kārūṣakāś ca rājānaḥ kṣemadhūrtiś ca vīryavān
analyzed: kārūṣakāḥ ca rājānaḥ kṣemadhūrtiḥ ca vīryavān
translated: The Karusha kings, and the powerful Kshemadhurti,

original: udbhavaḥ kṣemakaś caiva vāṭadhānaś ca pārthivaḥ
analyzed: udbhavaḥ kṣemakaḥ ca eva vāṭadhānaḥ ca pārthivaḥ
translated: Udbhava, Kshemaka, and the king Vatadhana,

original: śrutāyuś ca dṛḍhāyuś ca śālvaputraś ca vīryavān

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

original: satyavāg bhava kalyāṇa varo vai mama dīyatām
analyzed: satya vāc bhava kalyāṇa varaḥ vai mama dīyatām
translated: Be truthful, O fortunate one, let the boon be given to me.

analyzed: sarva senā praṇetā me bhavān bhavitum arhati
translated: You should be the leader of all my troops.

original: yathaiva pāṇḍavās tubhyaṃ tathaiva bhavato hy aham
analyzed: yathā eva pāṇḍavāḥ tubhyam tathā eva bhavataḥ hi aham
translated: Just as the Pandavas are to you, so am I to you.

analyzed: śalyaḥ
translated: Shalya said:

original: anumānyaṃ ca pālyaṃ ca bhaktaṃ ca bhaja māṃ vibho
analyzed: anumānyam ca pālyam ca bhaktam ca bhaja mām vibho
translated: Honor me, protect me, and serve me, O lord.

original: evam etan mahārāja yathā vadasi bhārata
analyzed: evam etat mahā rāja yathā vadasi bhārata
translated: O great king, O descendant of Bharata, it shall be as you say.

original: varaṃ dadāmi te prīta evam etad bhaviṣyati
analyzed: varam dadāmi te prītaḥ evam etat bhaviṣyati
translated: Delighted, I grant you this boon, and it shall be so.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: kṛtam ity abravīc chalyaḥ kim anyat kriyatām iti
analyzed: kṛtam iti abravīt śalyaḥ kim anyat kriyatām iti
translated: Shalya said, It is done, and What else can be done?

original: kṛtam ity eva gāndhāriḥ pratyuvāca punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: kṛtam iti eva gāndhāriḥ pratyuvāca punar punar
translated: The son of Gandhari repeatedly replied, It is done.

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: gaccha duryodhana puraṃ svakam eva nararṣabha
analyzed: gaccha duryodhana puram svakam eva nara ṛṣabha
translated: Go, O Duryodhana, to your own city, O best of men.

original: ahaṃ gamiṣye draṣṭuṃ vai yudhiṣṭhiram ariṃdamam
analyzed: aham gamiṣye draṣṭum vai yudhiṣṭhiram ariṃdamam
translated: I will go to see Yudhishthira, the chastiser of enemies.

original: dṛṣṭvā yudhiṣṭhiraṃ rājan kṣipram eṣye narādhipa
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā yudhiṣṭhiram rājan kṣipram eṣye narādhipa
translated: Having seen Yudhishthira, O king, I will quickly return, O lord of men.

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

analyzed: avaśyam ca api draṣṭavyaḥ pāṇḍavaḥ puruṣa ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: The son of Pandu, that best of men, must certainly be seen.

original: kṣipram āgamyatāṃ rājan pāṇḍavaṃ vīkṣya pārthiva
analyzed: kṣipram āgamyatām rājan pāṇḍavam vīkṣya pārthiva
translated: Quickly go, O king, and see the son of Pandu, O lord of the earth.

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: tvayy adhīnāḥ sma rājendra varadānaṃ smarasva naḥ
analyzed: tvayi adhīnāḥ sma rāja indra vara dānam smarasva naḥ
translated: We are dependent on you, O lord of kings. Remember your promise to us.

original: kṣipram eṣyāmi bhadraṃ te gacchasva svapuraṃ nṛpa
analyzed: kṣipram eṣyāmi bhadram te gacchasva sva puram nṛpa
translated: I will come quickly. May you fare well. Go to your own city, O king.

analyzed: pariṣvajya tathā anyonyam śalya duryodhanau ubhau
translated: Having embraced each other, both Shalya and Duryodhana,

original: dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavān rājan na mithyā kartum utsahe
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavān rājan na mithyā kartum utsahe
translated: having seen the Pandavas, I am not inclined to act falsely.

original: sa tathā śalyam āmantrya punar āyāt svakaṃ puram
analyzed: sa tathā śalyam āmantrya punar āyāt svakam puram
translated: Having thus taken leave of Shalya, he again went to his own city.

original: śalyo jagāma kaunteyān ākhyātuṃ karma tasya tat
analyzed: śalyaḥ jagāma kaunteyān ākhyātum karma tasya tat
translated: Shalya went to the sons of Kunti to tell them about his deed.

original: upaplavyaṃ sa gatvā tu skandhāvāraṃ praviśya ca
analyzed: upaplavyam sa gatvā tu skandhāvāram praviśya ca
translated: Having gone to Upaplavya and entering the camp,

original: pāṇḍavān atha tān sarvāñ śalyas tatra dadarśa ha
analyzed: pāṇḍavān atha tān sarvām śalyaḥ tatra dadarśa ha
translated: Shalya saw all those Pandavas there.

original: cirāt tu dṛṣṭvā rājānaṃ mātulaṃ samitiṃjayam
analyzed: cirāt tu dṛṣṭvā rājānam mātulam samitiṃjayam
translated: Having seen his maternal uncle, the king, the conqueror in assemblies, after a long time,

analyzed: āsanebhyaḥ samutpetuḥ sarve saha yudhiṣṭhirāḥ
translated: all of them, together with Yudhishthira, rose from their seats.

original: sametya tu mahābāhuḥ śalyaḥ pāṇḍusutais tadā
analyzed: sametya tu mahā bāhuḥ śalyaḥ pāṇḍu sutaiḥ tadā
translated: Then the mighty-armed Shalya, having met with the sons of Pandu,

original: pādyam arghyaṃ ca gāṃ caiva pratyagṛhṇād yathāvidhi
analyzed: pādyam arghyam ca gām ca eva pratyagṛhṇāt yathāvidhi
translated: accepted the water for washing his feet, the arghya and the cow, in accordance with the rules.

analyzed: kṛtāñjaliḥ a dīna ātmā dharma ātmā śalyam abravīt
translated: The righteous-souled one, with a humble heart and folded hands, spoke to Shalya:

original: svāgataṃ te 'stu vai rājann etad āsanam āsyatām
analyzed: svāgatam te stu vai rājan etat āsanam āsyatām
translated: Welcome to you, O king! Sit on this seat.

original: tato nyaṣīdac chalyaś ca kāñcane paramāsane
analyzed: tatas nyaṣīdat śalyaḥ ca kāñcane parama āsane
translated: Then Shalya sat down on an excellent golden seat.

original: tatra pādyam athārghyaṃ ca nyavedayata pāṇḍavaḥ
analyzed: tatra pādyam atha arghyam ca nyavedayata pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: There the son of Pandu offered him water for washing his feet and the arghya.

analyzed: nivedya ca arghyam vidhivat madra rājāya bhārata
translated: Having offered the arghya to the king of Madra in accordance with the rules, O descendant of Bharata,

analyzed: kuśalam pāṇḍavaḥ pṛcchat śalyam sarva sukha āvaham
translated: the son of Pandu asked Shalya about his welfare, which brings all happiness.

original: sa taiḥ parivṛtaḥ sarvaiḥ pāṇḍavair dharmacāribhiḥ
analyzed: sa taiḥ parivṛtaḥ sarvaiḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ dharma cāribhiḥ
translated: Surrounded by all those Pandavas who follow the path of righteousness,

analyzed: tatas kuśala pūrvam sa madra rājaḥ ri sūdanaḥ
translated: then the king of Madra, the slayer of enemies, with his welfare enquired about first,

analyzed: prītyā paramayā yuktaḥ samāśliṣya yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: embraced Yudhishthira with supreme affection,

original: tathā bhīmārjunau hṛṣṭau svasrīyau ca yamāv ubhau
analyzed: tathā bhīma arjunau hṛṣṭau svasrīyau ca yamau ubhau
translated: and also Bhima and Arjuna, his delighted sister's sons, the twins,

original: draupadī ca subhadrā ca abhimanyuś ca bhārata
analyzed: draupadī ca subhadrā ca abhimanyuḥ ca bhārata
translated: Draupadi, Subhadra, and Abhimanyu, O descendant of Bharata,🔽and all the other Pandavas, with their wives, O king.

original: āsane copaviṣṭas tu śalyaḥ pārtham uvāca ha
analyzed: āsane ca upaviṣṭaḥ tu śalyaḥ pārtham uvāca ha
translated: Seated on a seat, Shalya spoke to Partha:

analyzed: kuśalam rāja śārdūla kaccit te kuru nandana
translated: O tiger among kings, O descendant of Kuru, I hope you are well,

analyzed: araṇya vāsāt diṣṭyā asi vimuktaḥ jayatām vara
translated: O best of the victorious, by good fortune you are free from dwelling in the forest.

original: suduṣkaraṃ kṛtaṃ rājan nirjane vasatā vane
analyzed: su duṣkaram kṛtam rājan nirjane vasatā vane
translated: O king, you have done what is extremely difficult, living in the desolate forest,

original: bhrātṛbhiḥ saha rājendra kṛṣṇayā cānayā saha
analyzed: bhrātṛbhiḥ saha rāja indra kṛṣṇayā ca anayā saha
translated: together with your brothers, O lord of kings, and with this Krishna.

original: ajñātavāsaṃ ghoraṃ ca vasatā duṣkaraṃ kṛtam
analyzed: ajñāta vāsam ghoram ca vasatā duṣkaram kṛtam
translated: You have done what is difficult, living in a terrible unknown residence.

original: duḥkham eva kutaḥ saukhyaṃ rājyabhraṣṭasya bhārata🔽duḥkhasyaitasya mahato dhārtarāṣṭrakṛtasya vai
analyzed: duḥkham eva kutas saukhyam rājya bhraṣṭasya bhārata  duḥkhasya etasya mahataḥ dhārtarāṣṭra kṛtasya vai
translated: O descendant of Bharata, how can there be happiness for one who has lost his kingdom?🔽O king, O scorcher of enemies, you will attain happiness by killing your enemies,

original: avāpsyasi sukhaṃ rājan hatvā śatrūn paraṃtapa
analyzed: avāpsyasi sukham rājan hatvā śatrūn paraṃtapa
translated: this great sorrow caused by the sons of Dhritarashtra.

analyzed: viditam te mahā rāja loka tattvam narādhipa
translated: O great king, O lord of men, the truth about the world is known to you,

original: tasmāl lobhakṛtaṃ kiṃ cit tava tāta na vidyate
analyzed: tasmāt lobha kṛtam kim cit tava tāta na vidyate
translated: therefore, O son, you have no greed whatsoever.

original: rājarṣīṇāṃ purāṇānāṃ mārgam anviccha bhārata🔽dāne tapasi satye ca bhava tāta yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: rājarṣīṇām purāṇānām mārgam anviccha bhārata  dāne tapasi satye ca bhava tāta yudhiṣṭhira
translated: O descendant of Bharata, follow the path of the ancient royal sages,🔽O Yudhishthira, be devoted to charity, austerity, and truth, O son.

original: kṣamā damaś ca satyaṃ ca ahiṃsā ca yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: kṣamā damaḥ ca satyam ca ahiṃsā ca yudhiṣṭhira
translated: O Yudhishthira, forgiveness, self-control, truth, and non-violence,

original: adbhutaś ca punar lokas tvayi rājan pratiṣṭhitaḥ
analyzed: adbhutaḥ ca punar lokaḥ tvayi rājan pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: and the wonderful world is established in you, O king.

analyzed: mṛduḥ vadānyaḥ brahmaṇyaḥ dātā dharma parāyaṇaḥ
translated: He was mild, generous, devoted to Brahmanas, charitable and devoted to dharma.

original: dharmās te viditā rājan bahavo lokasākṣikāḥ
analyzed: dharmāḥ te viditāḥ rājan bahavaḥ loka sākṣikāḥ
translated: O king, you know many dharmas that are witnessed by the world.

original: sarvaṃ jagad idaṃ tāta viditaṃ te paraṃtapa
analyzed: sarvam jagat idam tāta viditam te paraṃtapa
translated: O father, O scorcher of enemies, you know this entire world.

original: diṣṭyā kṛcchram idaṃ rājan pāritaṃ bharatarṣabha
analyzed: diṣṭyā kṛcchram idam rājan pāritam bharata ṛṣabha
translated: Fortunate it is, O king, that you have passed through this difficulty, O best of the Bharata race.

analyzed: diṣṭyā paśyāmi rāja indra dharma ātmānam saha anugam
translated: Fortunate it is that I see you, O king of kings, with your followers, O you of righteous soul.

original: nistīrṇaṃ duṣkaraṃ rājaṃs tvāṃ dharmanicayaṃ prabho
analyzed: nistīrṇam duṣkaram rājan tvām dharma nicayam prabho
translated: O king, O lord, you have passed through this difficult situation, O you who are a storehouse of dharma.

original: utthānaṃ saṃyamo dākṣyam apramādo dhṛtiḥ smṛtiḥ
analyzed: utthānam saṃyamaḥ dākṣyam apramādaḥ dhṛtiḥ smṛtiḥ
translated: Exertion, self-control, skill, carefulness, firmness, memory,

analyzed: tatas sya akathayat rājā duryodhana samāgamam
translated: Then the king told him about his meeting with Duryodhana,

original: tac ca śuśrūṣitaṃ sarvaṃ varadānaṃ ca bhārata
analyzed: tat ca śuśrūṣitam sarvam vara dānam ca bhārata
translated: And about all that he had heard, and about the boon granted, O Bharata.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhishthira said:

analyzed: sukṛtam te kṛtam rājan prahṛṣṭena antarātmanā
translated: O king, you have done well, with a delighted heart,

original: duryodhanasya yad vīra tvayā vācā pratiśrutam
analyzed: duryodhanasya yat vīra tvayā vācā pratiśrutam
translated: What you have promised with your words, O hero, for Duryodhana.

original: duryodhanasya cāsmākaṃ viśeṣo 'tra na vidyate🔽ekaṃ tv icchāmi bhadraṃ te kriyamāṇaṃ mahīpate
analyzed: duryodhanasya ca asmākam viśeṣaḥ tra na vidyate  ekam tu icchāmi bhadram te kriyamāṇam mahīpate
translated: There is no difference between Duryodhana and us in this matter.🔽But I wish for one thing to be done by you, O fortunate one, O lord of the earth.

original: rājann akartavyam api kartum arhasi sattama
analyzed: rājan akartavyam api kartum arhasi sattama
translated: O king, O best of kings, you should do what should not be done.

original: mama tv avekṣayā vīra śṛṇu vijñāpayāmi te
analyzed: mama tu avekṣayā vīra śṛṇu vijñāpayāmi te
translated: But, O hero, listen to my request, which I make for your sake.

original: spardhate hi sadā karṇaḥ pārthena raṇamūrdhani
analyzed: spardhate hi sadā karṇaḥ pārthena raṇa mūrdhani
translated: Karna always challenges Partha to a duel in the midst of the battle.

analyzed: bhavān iha mahā rāja vāsudeva samaḥ yudhi
translated: O great king, you are equal to Vasudeva in battle.

analyzed: karṇa arjunābhyām saṃprāpte dvairathe rāja sattama
translated: O best of kings, when a duel takes place between Karna and Arjuna,

analyzed: vāsudevena sārathyam kāryam pārthasya mātula
translated: O uncle, Vasudeva should be the charioteer of Partha,

original: karṇasya bhavatā kāryaṃ sārathyaṃ nātra saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: karṇasya bhavatā kāryam sārathyam na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: and you should undoubtedly be the charioteer of Karna.

original: tatra pālyo 'rjuno rājan yadi matpriyam icchasi
analyzed: tatra pālyaḥ rjunaḥ rājan yadi mad priyam icchasi
translated: There, O king, you should protect Arjuna if you desire to do what is pleasing to me.

original: tejovadhaś ca te kāryaḥ sauter asmajjayāvahaḥ
analyzed: tejaḥ vadhaḥ ca te kāryaḥ sauteḥ asmad jaya āvahaḥ
translated: And you should destroy the energy of the Suta's son, which will bring victory to us.

original: akartavyam api hy etat kartum arhasi mātula
analyzed: akartavyam api hi etat kartum arhasi mātula
translated: O uncle, you should do this, even though it is not to be done.

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: śṛṇu pāṇḍava bhadraṃ te yad bravīṣi durātmanaḥ
analyzed: śṛṇu pāṇḍava bhadram te yat bravīṣi durātmanaḥ
translated: Listen, O son of Pandu, to what you say about the wicked one.

analyzed: tejaḥ vadha nimittam mām sūtaputrasya saṃyuge
translated: For the purpose of destroying the energy of the Suta's son in battle,

original: tejovadhanimittaṃ māṃ tat kariṣyāmi te priyam
analyzed: tejaḥ vadha nimittam mām tat kariṣyāmi te priyam
translated: for the purpose of destroying his energy, I will do what is pleasing to you.

original: ahaṃ tasya bhaviṣyāmi saṃgrāme sārathir dhruvam
analyzed: aham tasya bhaviṣyāmi saṃgrāme sārathiḥ dhruvam
translated: I will certainly be his charioteer in the battle.

original: vāsudevena hi samaṃ nityaṃ māṃ sa hi manyate
analyzed: vāsudevena hi samam nityam mām sa hi manyate
translated: He always considers me to be equal to Vasudeva.

analyzed: tasya aham kuru śārdūla pratīpam ahitam vacaḥ
translated: O tiger among the Kurus, I will speak words that are disagreeable and harmful to him.

analyzed: dhruvam saṃkathayiṣyāmi yoddhu kāmasya saṃyuge
translated: I will certainly speak to him, to the one who desires to fight in battle.

analyzed: aham tasya bhaviṣyāmi sārathiḥ raṇa mūrdhani
translated: I will be his charioteer at the forefront of the battle.

original: yathā sa hṛtadarpaś ca hṛtatejāś ca pāṇḍava
analyzed: yathā sa hṛta darpaḥ ca hṛta tejāḥ ca pāṇḍava
translated: As to how the Pandava will be deprived of his pride and his energy,

original: bhaviṣyati sukhaṃ hantuṃ satyam etad bravīmi te
analyzed: bhaviṣyati sukham hantum satyam etat bravīmi te
translated: I tell you this truthfully, it will be easy to kill him.

original: evam etat kariṣyāmi yathā tāta tvam āttha mām
analyzed: evam etat kariṣyāmi yathā tāta tvam āttha mām
translated: I will do this, O father, as you have told me.

original: yac cānyad api śakṣyāmi tat kariṣyāmi te priyam
analyzed: yat ca anyat api śakṣyāmi tat kariṣyāmi te priyam
translated: And whatever else I can do, that will be pleasing to you.

original: yac ca duḥkhaṃ tvayā prāptaṃ dyūte vai kṛṣṇayā saha
analyzed: yat ca duḥkham tvayā prāptam dyūte vai kṛṣṇayā saha
translated: The sorrow that you have experienced in the gambling match with Krishna,

analyzed: paruṣāṇi ca vākyāni sūtaputra kṛtāni vai
translated: And the harsh words spoken by the son of a suta,

analyzed: jaṭāsurāt parikleśaḥ kīcakāt ca mahā dyute
translated: The distress from Jatasura and Kichaka, O greatly radiant one,

analyzed: draupadyā adhigatam sarvam damayantyā yathāśubham
translated: All that Droupadi has gone through, like the misfortune of Damayanti,

original: sarvaṃ duḥkham idaṃ vīra sukhodarkaṃ bhaviṣyati
analyzed: sarvam duḥkham idam vīra sukha udarkam bhaviṣyati
translated: All this sorrow, O hero, will have a happy ending.

original: nātra manyus tvayā kāryo vidhir hi balavattaraḥ
analyzed: na atra manyuḥ tvayā kāryaḥ vidhiḥ hi balavattaraḥ
translated: You should not harbor any resentment, for destiny is all-powerful.

analyzed: duḥkhāni hi mahātmānaḥ prāpnuvanti yudhiṣṭhira
translated: For great souls do experience sorrows, O Yudhishthira.

original: devair api hi duḥkhāni prāptāni jagatīpate
analyzed: devaiḥ api hi duḥkhāni prāptāni jagatīpate
translated: Even the gods have experienced sorrows, O lord of the earth.

analyzed: deva dānava gandharvāḥ kiṃnara uraga rākṣasāḥ
translated: Gods, demons, gandharvas, kinnaras, serpents and rakshasas,

original: duḥkhaṃ prāptā yathā rājaṃs tac chṛṇuṣva narādhipa
analyzed: duḥkham prāptāḥ yathā rājan tat śṛṇuṣva narādhipa
translated: O king, listen to how they attained misery, O lord of men.

analyzed: indreṇa śrūyate rājan sa bhāryeṇa mahātmanā
translated: O king, it is heard that the great Indra, along with his wife,

analyzed: anubhūtam mahat duḥkham devarājena bhārata
translated: experienced great misery, O king of the gods, O descendant of Bharata.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhishthira said:

analyzed: katham indreṇa rāja indra sa bhāryeṇa mahātmanā
translated: How did the great Indra, O lord of kings, along with his wife,

original: duḥkhaṃ prāptaṃ paraṃ ghoram etad icchāmi veditum
analyzed: duḥkham prāptam param ghoram etat icchāmi veditum
translated: attain the highest and terrible misery? I wish to know this.

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: śṛṇu rājan purā vṛttam itihāsaṃ purātanam
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan purā vṛttam itihāsam purātanam
translated: Listen, O king, to the ancient history of what happened in the past,

original: sabhāryeṇa yathā prāptaṃ duḥkham indreṇa bhārata
analyzed: sa bhāryeṇa yathā prāptam duḥkham indreṇa bhārata
translated: how Indra, along with his wife, attained misery, O descendant of Bharata.

original: tvaṣṭā prajāpatir hy āsīd devaśreṣṭho mahātapāḥ
analyzed: tvaṣṭā prajāpatiḥ hi āsīt deva śreṣṭhaḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: Tvaṣṭṛ was indeed a Prajāpati, the best of gods, of great austerities.

original: sa putraṃ vai triśirasam indradrohāt kilāsṛjat
analyzed: sa putram vai triśirasam indra drohāt kila asṛjat
translated: He is said to have created a three-headed son out of enmity towards Indra.

original: aindraṃ sa prārthayat sthānaṃ viśvarūpo mahādyutiḥ
analyzed: aindram sa prārthayat sthānam viśva rūpaḥ mahā dyutiḥ
translated: That one of universal form, of great splendor, desired the place of Indra.

analyzed: taiḥ tribhiḥ vadanaiḥ ghoraiḥ sūrya indu jvalana upamaiḥ
translated: With those three terrible faces, resembling the sun, moon and fire,

original: vedān ekena so 'dhīte surām ekena cāpibat
analyzed: vedān ekena saḥ dhīte surām ekena ca apibat

analyzed: icchāmi tvām aham jñātum kā tvam brūhi varānane
translated: I wish to know you. Who are you? Tell me, O beautiful one.

original: evam uktā tathendrāṇyā devī vākyam athābravīt
analyzed: evam uktā tathā indrāṇyā devī vākyam atha abravīt
translated: Thus addressed by Indrani, the goddess then spoke these words:

analyzed: upaśrutiḥ uvāca
translated: Upashruti said:

analyzed: upaśrutiḥ aham devi tava antikam upāgatā
translated: O Goddess! I am Upashruti, who has come before you.

original: darśanaṃ caiva saṃprāptā tava satyena toṣitā
analyzed: darśanam ca eva saṃprāptā tava satyena toṣitā
translated: I have come to see you and am satisfied with your truthfulness.

original: pativratāsi yuktā ca yamena niyamena ca
analyzed: pativratā asi yuktā ca yamena niyamena ca
translated: You are devoted to your husband and are engaged in self-restraint and vows.

analyzed: darśayiṣyāmi te śakram devam vṛtra niṣūdanam
translated: I will show you Shakra, the god who killed Vritra.

original: kṣipram anvehi bhadraṃ te drakṣyase surasattamam
analyzed: kṣipram anvehi bhadram te drakṣyase sura sattamam
translated: Quickly follow me, may you be fortunate, you will see the best of the gods.

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: tatas tāṃ prasthitāṃ devīm indrāṇī sā samanvagāt
analyzed: tatas tām prasthitām devīm indrāṇī sā samanvagāt
translated: Then that Goddess Indra's wife followed her as she left.

original: devāraṇyāny atikramya parvatāṃś ca bahūṃs tataḥ
analyzed: deva araṇyāni atikramya parvatān ca bahūn tatas
translated: Passing through the divine forests and many mountains,

analyzed: himavantam atikramya uttaram pārśvam āgamat
translated: she crossed the Himalayas and came to the northern side.

original: samudraṃ ca samāsādya bahuyojanavistṛtam🔽āsasāda mahādvīpaṃ nānādrumalatāvṛtam
analyzed: samudram ca samāsādya bahu yojana vistṛtam  āsasāda mahā dvīpam nānā druma latā āvṛtam
translated: Reaching the ocean, extending for many yojanas,🔽she came to a great island covered with various trees and creepers.

analyzed: tatra apaśyat saraḥ divyam nānā śakunibhiḥ vṛtam
translated: There she saw a divine lake surrounded by various birds,

analyzed: śata yojana vistīrṇam tāvat eva āyatam śubham
translated: extending for a hundred yojanas, auspicious and of the same size.

analyzed: tatra divyāni padmāni pañca varṇāni bhārata
translated: There were divine lotuses of five colors, O descendant of Bharata,

analyzed: ṣaṭpadaiḥ upagītāni praphullāni sahasraśas
translated: with thousands of blooming flowers sung by bees.

original: sarasas tasya madhye tu padminī mahatī śubhā
analyzed: sarasaḥ tasya madhye tu padminī mahatī śubhā
translated: In the middle of that lake was a great and auspicious lotus pond,

original: gaureṇonnatanālena padmena mahatā vṛtā🔽padmasya bhittvā nālaṃ ca viveśa sahitā tayā
analyzed: gaureṇa unnata nālena padmena mahatā vṛtā  padmasya bhittvā nālam ca viveśa sahitā tayā
translated: Surrounded by a large lotus with a white, tall stalk,🔽she pierced the stalk of the lotus and entered it together with her.

analyzed: bisa tantu praviṣṭam ca tatra apaśyat śatakratum
translated: And there she saw Shatakratu, who had entered the lotus fiber.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā ca susūkṣmeṇa rūpeṇāvasthitaṃ prabhum
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā ca su sūkṣmeṇa rūpeṇa avasthitam prabhum
translated: Having seen that lord abiding in a very subtle form,

analyzed: sūkṣma rūpa dharā devī babhūva upaśrutiḥ ca sā
translated: the goddess, who had assumed a subtle form, and Upa-Shruti,

analyzed: indram tuṣṭāva ca indrāṇī viśrutaiḥ pūrva karmabhiḥ
translated: Indrani praised Indra with his well-known former deeds.

original: stūyamānas tato devaḥ śacīm āha puraṃdaraḥ
analyzed: stūyamānaḥ tatas devaḥ śacīm āha puraṃdaraḥ
translated: Then, being praised, the god Purandara said to Shachi:

original: kimartham asi saṃprāptā vijñātaś ca kathaṃ tv aham
analyzed: kimartham asi saṃprāptā vijñātaḥ ca katham tu aham
translated: For what purpose have you come? And how did you recognize me?

analyzed: kena ca asmi tava ākhyātaḥ ihasthaḥ varavarṇini
translated: By whom have I been told that you are staying here, O best of women?

original: tataḥ sā kathayām āsa nahuṣasya viceṣṭitam
analyzed: tatas sā kathayām āsa nahuṣasya viceṣṭitam
translated: Then she told him about Nahusha's actions:

analyzed: indra tvam triṣu lokeṣu prāpya vīrya mada anvitaḥ
translated: Having attained the status of Indra in the three worlds, he, intoxicated with the pride of his prowess,

original: darpāviṣṭaś ca duṣṭātmā mām uvāca śatakrato
analyzed: darpa āviṣṭaḥ ca duṣṭa ātmā mām uvāca śatakrato
translated: and possessed by arrogance, that evil-minded one said to me, O Shatakratu:

original: upatiṣṭha mām iti krūraḥ kālaṃ ca kṛtavān mama
analyzed: upatiṣṭha mām iti krūraḥ kālam ca kṛtavān mama
translated: 'Serve me.' The cruel one has set a time limit for me.

original: yadi na trāsyasi vibho kariṣyati sa māṃ vaśe
analyzed: yadi na trāsyasi vibho kariṣyati sa mām vaśe
translated: If you do not protect me, O lord, he will bring me under his control.

original: etena cāhaṃ saṃtaptā prāptā śakra tavāntikam
analyzed: etena ca aham saṃtaptā prāptā śakra tava antikam
translated: It is for this that I am tormented, O Shakra, and have come to you.

analyzed: jahi raudram mahā bāho nahuṣam pāpa niścayam
translated: O mighty-armed one, kill the terrible Nahusha, who is determined on evil.

analyzed: prakāśayasva ca ātmānam daitya dānava sūdana
translated: And manifest yourself, O slayer of Daityas and Danavas.

original: tejaḥ samāpnuhi vibho devarājyaṃ praśādhi ca
analyzed: tejaḥ samāpnuhi vibho deva rājyam praśādhi ca
translated: O Lord, regain your splendor and rule the kingdom of the gods.

original: yathaiva ca mahārāja tvayā vṛtro niṣūditaḥ
analyzed: yathā eva ca mahā rāja tvayā vṛtraḥ niṣūditaḥ
translated: And just as, O great king, Vritra was slain by you,

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: evam uktaḥ sa bhagavāñ śacyā punar athābravīt
analyzed: evam uktaḥ sa bhagavān śacyā punar atha abravīt
translated: Thus addressed, the Lord then spoke again to Shachi:

analyzed: vikramasya na kālaḥ yam nahuṣaḥ balavattaraḥ
translated: This is not the time for valor. Nahusha is more powerful.

original: vivardhitaś ca ṛṣibhir havyaiḥ kavyaiś ca bhāmini
analyzed: vivardhitaḥ ca ṛṣibhiḥ havyaiḥ kavyaiḥ ca bhāmini
translated: And he has been strengthened by the sages through oblations and offerings, O beautiful lady.

original: nītim atra vidhāsyāmi devi tāṃ kartum arhasi
analyzed: nītim atra vidhāsyāmi devi tām kartum arhasi
translated: I will devise a plan here, O Goddess, and you should carry it out.

original: guhyaṃ caitat tvayā kāryaṃ nākhyātavyaṃ śubhe kva cit
analyzed: guhyam ca etat tvayā kāryam na ākhyātavyam śubhe kva cit
translated: And this should be kept secret by you, O auspicious one, and not revealed to anyone.

analyzed: gatvā nahuṣam ekānte bravīhi tanu madhyame
translated: Go and speak to Nahusha in private, O slender-waisted one:

analyzed: ṛṣi yānena divyena mām upaihi jagatpate
translated: 'Come to me, O Lord of the world, by the divine vehicle of the sages.'

original: evaṃ tava vaśe prītā bhaviṣyāmīti taṃ vada
analyzed: evam tava vaśe prītā bhaviṣyāmi iti tam vada
translated: And say to him, 'If you do this, I will be pleased and come under your control.'

original: ity uktā devarājena patnī sā kamalekṣaṇā
analyzed: iti uktā devarājena patnī sā kamala īkṣaṇā
translated: Thus addressed by the king of the gods, his lotus-eyed wife

original: evam astv ity athoktvā tu jagāma nahuṣaṃ prati
analyzed: evam astu iti atha uktvā tu jagāma nahuṣam prati
translated: said, So be it, and went to Nahusha.

original: nahuṣas tāṃ tato dṛṣṭvā vismito vākyam abravīt
analyzed: nahuṣaḥ tām tatas dṛṣṭvā vismitaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Nahusha, seeing her, was amazed and said:

original: svāgataṃ te varārohe kiṃ karomi śucismite
analyzed: svāgatam te varārohe kim karomi śuci smite
translated: Welcome, O beautiful lady! What can I do for you, O lady of sweet smiles?

original: bhaktaṃ māṃ bhaja kalyāṇi kim icchasi manasvini
analyzed: bhaktam mām bhaja kalyāṇi kim icchasi manasvini
translated: Worship me, O fortunate one! What do you desire, O intelligent one?

original: tava kalyāṇi yat kāryaṃ tat kariṣye sumadhyame
analyzed: tava kalyāṇi yat kāryam tat kariṣye sumadhyame
translated: O fortunate one, I will do whatever needs to be done for you, O slender-waisted one.

original: na ca vrīḍā tvayā kāryā suśroṇi mayi viśvasa
analyzed: na ca vrīḍā tvayā kāryā suśroṇi mayi viśvasa
translated: O broad-hipped one, you should not feel embarrassed. Trust in me.

original: satyena vai śape devi kartāsmi vacanaṃ tava
analyzed: satyena vai śape devi kartāsmi vacanam tava
translated: By truth, O goddess, I swear that I will do as you say.

analyzed: indrāṇī uvāca
translated: Indrani said:

original: yo me tvayā kṛtaḥ kālas tam ākāṅkṣe jagatpate
analyzed: yaḥ me tvayā kṛtaḥ kālaḥ tam ākāṅkṣe jagatpate
translated: The time that has been fixed by you for me, I await, O lord of the world.

original: tatas tvam eva bhartā me bhaviṣyasi surādhipa
analyzed: tatas tvam eva bhartā me bhaviṣyasi surādhipa
translated: Then you alone will be my husband, O lord of the gods.

original: kāryaṃ ca hṛdi me yat tad devarājāvadhāraya
analyzed: kāryam ca hṛdi me yat tat devarāja avadhāraya
translated: And the matter that is in my heart, O king of the gods, please understand.

original: vakṣyāmi yadi me rājan priyam etat kariṣyasi
analyzed: vakṣyāmi yadi me rājan priyam etat kariṣyasi
translated: If you will do what is dear to me, O king, I will speak.

original: vākyaṃ praṇayasaṃyuktaṃ tataḥ syāṃ vaśagā tava
analyzed: vākyam praṇaya saṃyuktam tatas syām vaśa gā tava
translated: Then I will be under your control.

original: indrasya vājino vāhā hastino 'tha rathās tathā
analyzed: indrasya vājinaḥ vāhāḥ hastinaḥ rathāḥ tathā
translated: Indra's horses are the vehicles, as well as elephants and chariots.

original: icchāmy aham ihāpūrvaṃ vāhanaṃ te surādhipa
analyzed: icchāmi aham iha apūrvam vāhanam te surādhipa
translated: I desire a new vehicle for you here, O lord of the gods,

original: yan na viṣṇor na rudrasya nāsurāṇāṃ na rakṣasām
analyzed: yat na viṣṇoḥ na rudrasya na asurāṇām na rakṣasām
translated: which is not of Vishnu, nor of Rudra, nor of the asuras, nor of the rakshasas.

original: vahantu tvāṃ mahārāja ṛṣayaḥ saṃgatā vibho
analyzed: vahantu tvām mahā rājaḥ ṛṣayaḥ saṃgatāḥ vibho
translated: Let the assembled sages carry you, O great king, O lord.

original: sarve śibikayā rājann etad dhi mama rocate
analyzed: sarve śibikayā rājan etat hi mama rocate
translated: All of them with a palanquin, O king, this is what pleases me.

original: nāsureṣu na deveṣu tulyo bhavitum arhasi
analyzed: na asureṣu na deveṣu tulyaḥ bhavitum arhasi
translated: You should not be equal to the demons or the gods.

original: sarveṣāṃ teja ādatsva svena vīryeṇa darśanāt
analyzed: sarveṣām tejaḥ ādatsva svena vīryeṇa darśanāt
translated: Take away the brilliance of all, by your own valor, by your sight.

original: na te pramukhataḥ sthātuṃ kaś cid icchati vīryavān
analyzed: na te pramukhatas sthātum kaḥ cit icchati vīryavān
translated: No powerful one wishes to stand in front of you.

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: evam uktas tu nahuṣaḥ prāhṛṣyata tadā kila
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu nahuṣaḥ prāhṛṣyata tadā kila
translated: Thus addressed, Nahusha was delighted then.

original: uvāca vacanaṃ cāpi surendras tām aninditām
analyzed: uvāca vacanam ca api sura indraḥ tām aninditām
translated: And the lord of the gods spoke these words to that faultless one:

analyzed: apūrvam vāhanam idam tvayā uktam varavarṇini
translated: O lady of excellent complexion, this vehicle you have mentioned is unprecedented.

original: dṛḍhaṃ me rucitaṃ devi tvadvaśo 'smi varānane
analyzed: dṛḍham me rucitam devi smi varānane
translated: O goddess, it is firmly pleasing to me. O beautiful-faced one, I am under your control.

original: na hy alpavīryo bhavati yo vāhān kurute munīn
analyzed: na hi alpa vīryaḥ bhavati yaḥ vāhān kurute munīn
translated: For one who makes the sages his vehicles cannot be of little valor.

analyzed: aham tapasvī balavān bhūta bhavya bhavat prabhuḥ
translated: I am an ascetic, powerful, the lord of the past, present and future.

original: mayi kruddhe jagan na syān mayi sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitam
analyzed: mayi kruddhe jagat na syāt mayi sarvam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: If I am angry, the world will not exist. Everything is established in me.

analyzed: deva dānava gandharvāḥ kiṃnara uraga rākṣasāḥ
translated: Gods, demons, gandharvas, kinnaras, serpents and rakshasas,

original: na me kruddhasya paryāptāḥ sarve lokāḥ śucismite
analyzed: na me kruddhasya paryāptāḥ sarve lokāḥ śuci smite
translated: are not all the worlds sufficient for me when I am angry, O you of pure smiles.

original: cakṣuṣā yaṃ prapaśyāmi tasya tejo harāmy aham
analyzed: cakṣuṣā yam prapaśyāmi tasya tejaḥ harāmi aham
translated: I take away the brilliance of him whom I look at with my eyes.

original: aham indro 'smi devānāṃ lokānāṃ ca maheśvaraḥ
analyzed: aham indraḥ smi devānām lokānām ca maheśvaraḥ
translated: I am Indra among the gods and the great lord of the worlds.

original: mayi havyaṃ ca kavyaṃ ca lokāś caiva sanātanāḥ
analyzed: mayi havyam ca kavyam ca lokāḥ ca eva sanātanāḥ
translated: In me are the eternal oblations, the worlds and the eternal rites.

original: tasmāt te vacanaṃ devi kariṣyāmi na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt te vacanam devi kariṣyāmi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Therefore, O goddess, I will undoubtedly carry out your words.

original: saptarṣayo māṃ vakṣyanti sarve brahmarṣayas tathā
analyzed: saptarṣayaḥ mām vakṣyanti sarve brahmarṣayaḥ tathā
translated: The seven sages and all the brahmin sages will speak of me.

original: paśya māhātmyam asmākam ṛddhiṃ ca varavarṇini
analyzed: paśya māhātmyam asmākam ṛddhim ca varavarṇini
translated: O lady of the best complexion, behold our greatness and prosperity.

analyzed: hata ojasaḥ mayā sarve deva gandharva dānavāḥ
translated: By me, all the gods, gandharvas and demons have been deprived of their energy.

original: yad yasya tejaḥ paśyāmi tasya tejo harāmy aham
analyzed: yat yasya tejaḥ paśyāmi tasya tejaḥ harāmi aham
translated: Whatever energy I see in someone, I take away that person's energy.

original: evam uktvā tu tāṃ devīṃ visṛjya ca varānanām
analyzed: evam uktvā tu tām devīm visṛjya ca varānanām
translated: Having said this, and having dismissed the goddess of beautiful face,

original: atha saṃcintya nahuṣo balavīryeṇa bhārata🔽visṛjya supratīkaṃ ca nāgam airāvataṃ tathā
analyzed: atha saṃcintya nahuṣaḥ bala vīryeṇa bhārata  visṛjya supratīkam ca nāgam airāvatam tathā
translated: Then, O descendant of Bharata, Nahusha, after thinking with his strength and prowess,🔽Dismissed the elephant Supratika and also Airavata,

original: haṃsayuktaṃ vimānaṃ ca hariyuktaṃ tathā ratham
analyzed: haṃsa yuktam vimānam ca hari yuktam tathā ratham
translated: And the chariot yoked with tawny horses, as well as the celestial chariot yoked with swans,

original: sa tu darpeṇa mahatā paribhūya mahāmunīn
analyzed: sa tu darpeṇa mahatā paribhūya mahā munīn
translated: But he, with great arrogance, having humiliated the great sages,

original: vimāne yojayitvā sa ṛṣīn niyamam āsthitān
analyzed: vimāne yojayitvā saḥ ṛṣīn niyamam āsthitān
translated: Having yoked the sages who were devoted to self-control to the celestial chariot,

analyzed: abrahmaṇyaḥ bala upetaḥ mattaḥ vara madena ca
translated: That one who is not fit to be a brahmin, being powerful, intoxicated with the pride of his boon,

original: kāmavṛttaḥ sa duṣṭātmā vāhayām āsa tān ṛṣīn
analyzed: kāma vṛttaḥ sa duṣṭa ātmā vāhayām āsa tān ṛṣīn
translated: That evil-minded one, acting out of desire, made the sages draw him.

original: nahuṣeṇa visṛṣṭā ca bṛhaspatim uvāca sā
analyzed: nahuṣeṇa visṛṣṭā ca bṛhaspatim uvāca sā
translated: And she, dismissed by Nahusha, spoke to Brihaspati,

analyzed: samayaḥ lpa avaśeṣaḥ me nahuṣeṇa iha yaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: The time that Nahusha has set for me here is almost over.

original: śakraṃ mṛgaya śīghraṃ tvaṃ bhaktāyāḥ kuru me dayām
analyzed: śakram mṛgaya śīghram tvam bhaktāyāḥ kuru me dayām
translated: Quickly search for Shakra and show compassion to me, your devotee.

original: bāḍham ity eva bhagavān bṛhaspatir uvāca tām
analyzed: bāḍham iti eva bhagavān bṛhaspatiḥ uvāca tām
translated: The illustrious Brihaspati said to her, So be it.

original: na bhetavyaṃ tvayā devi nahuṣād duṣṭacetasaḥ
analyzed: na bhetavyam tvayā devi nahuṣāt duṣṭa cetasaḥ
translated: You need not fear from Nahusha, O goddess, of wicked mind.

original: na hy eṣa sthāsyati ciraṃ gata eṣa narādhamaḥ
analyzed: na hi eṣa sthāsyati ciram gataḥ eṣa nara adhamaḥ
translated: For this worst of men will not remain for long.

original: adharmajño maharṣīṇāṃ vāhanāc ca hataḥ śubhe
analyzed: a dharma jñaḥ mahā ṛṣīṇām vāhanāt ca hataḥ śubhe
translated: He who knows not dharma, O auspicious one, has been thrown down from the vehicle of the great sages.

analyzed: iṣṭim ca aham kariṣyāmi vināśāya asya durmateḥ
translated: I shall perform a sacrifice for the destruction of that evil-minded one.

original: śakraṃ cādhigamiṣyāmi mā bhais tvaṃ bhadram astu te
analyzed: śakram ca adhigamiṣyāmi mā bhaiḥ tvam bhadram astu te
translated: And I shall find out Shakra. Do not fear. May you fare well.

original: tataḥ prajvālya vidhivaj juhāva paramaṃ haviḥ
analyzed: tatas prajvālya vidhivat juhāva paramam haviḥ
translated: Then, having duly kindled the fire, he offered the highest oblation.

analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ mahā tejāḥ devarāja upalabdhaye
translated: The greatly powerful Brihaspati, for the purpose of finding out the king of the gods,

original: hutvāgniṃ so 'bravīd rājañ chakram anviṣyatām iti
analyzed: hutvā agnim saḥ bravīt rājam śakram anviṣyatām iti
translated: Having offered to the fire, he said, Let us search for Shakra.

original: tasmāc ca bhagavān devaḥ svayam eva hutāśanaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt ca bhagavān devaḥ svayam eva hutāśanaḥ
translated: And from that very illustrious god, the fire itself,

analyzed: strī veṣam adbhutam kṛtvā sahasā antaradhīyata
translated: Having assumed a wonderful female form, disappeared all of a sudden.

original: sa diśaḥ pradiśaś caiva parvatāṃś ca vanāni ca
analyzed: sa diśaḥ pradiśaḥ ca eva parvatān ca vanāni ca
translated: He searched the directions, the sub-directions, the mountains, the forests,

analyzed: pṛthivīm ca antarikṣam ca vicīya ati manogatiḥ
translated: The earth, the sky, and with a mind that went beyond,

analyzed: nimeṣa antara mātreṇa bṛhaspatim upāgamat
translated: In just the twinkling of an eye, he approached Brihaspati.

analyzed: agniḥ uvāca
translated: Agni said:

original: bṛhaspate na paśyāmi devarājam ahaṃ kva cit
analyzed: bṛhaspate na paśyāmi devarājam aham kva cit
translated: O Brihaspati, I do not see the king of the gods anywhere.

original: āpaḥ śeṣāḥ sadā cāpaḥ praveṣṭuṃ notsahāmy aham
analyzed: āpaḥ śeṣāḥ sadā ca apaḥ praveṣṭum na utsahāmi aham
translated: The waters are always left, but I do not dare to enter them.

original: na me tatra gatir brahman kim anyat karavāṇi te
analyzed: na me tatra gatiḥ brahman kim anyat karavāṇi te
translated: I have no way there, O Brahman. What else can I do for you?

analyzed: śalyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shalya said:

original: tam abravīd devagurur apo viśa mahādyute
analyzed: tam abravīt devaguruḥ apaḥ viśa mahā dyute
translated: The preceptor of the gods said to him, O greatly radiant one, enter the waters.
