original: sarve hy astravidaḥ śūrāḥ sarve prāptā mahad yaśaḥ
analyzed: sarve hi astra vidaḥ śūrāḥ sarve prāptāḥ mahat yaśaḥ
translated: All of them are heroes skilled in weapons, all of them have attained great fame.

original: api sarvāmaraiśvaryaṃ tyajeyur na punar jayam
analyzed: api sarva amara aiśvaryam tyajeyuḥ na punar jayam
translated: They might give up the lordship of all the immortals, but not victory.

original: vadhe nūnaṃ bhavec chāntis tayor vā phalgunasya vā
analyzed: vadhe nūnam bhavet śāntiḥ tayoḥ vā phalgunasya vā
translated: Surely peace would come from the death of either of them or of Phālguna.

original: na tu jetārjunasyāsti hantā cāsya na vidyate
analyzed: na tu jetā arjunasya asti hantā ca asya na vidyate
translated: But there is no conqueror of Arjuna, and there is no slayer of him.

original: manyus tasya kathaṃ śāmyen mandān prati ya utthitaḥ
analyzed: manyuḥ tasya katham śāmyet mandān prati yaḥ utthitaḥ
translated: How can his anger, which has arisen against the wicked, be pacified?

original: anye 'py astrāṇi jānanti jīyante ca jayanti ca
analyzed: anye pi astrāṇi jānanti jīyante ca jayanti ca
translated: Others also know the weapons, they are defeated and they conquer.

original: ekāntavijayas tv eva śrūyate phalgunasya ha
analyzed: ekānta vijayaḥ tu eva śrūyate phalgunasya ha
translated: But the complete victory is heard only of Phālguna.

analyzed: trayastriṃśat samāhūya khāṇḍave gnim atarpayat
translated: Having challenged thirty-three, he satisfied Agni in Khāṇḍava.

original: jigāya ca surān sarvān nāsya vedmi parājayam
analyzed: jigāya ca surān sarvān na asya vedmi parājayam
translated: And he conquered all the gods, I do not know his defeat.

analyzed: yasya yantā hṛṣīkeśaḥ śīla vṛtta samaḥ yudhi
translated: Whose charioteer is Hṛṣīkeśa, equal in conduct and character in battle,

original: dhruvas tasya jayas tāta yathendrasya jayas tathā
analyzed: dhruvaḥ tasya jayaḥ tāta yathā indrasya jayaḥ tathā
translated: His victory is certain, O son, just as Indra's victory is.

original: kṛṣṇāv ekarathe yattāv adhijyaṃ gāṇḍivaṃ dhanuḥ
analyzed: kṛṣṇau eka rathe yattau adhijyam gāṇḍivam dhanuḥ
translated: When the two Krishnas are on one chariot, and the bow Gāṇḍiva is strung,

analyzed: yugapad trīṇi tejāṃsi sametāni anuśuśrumaḥ
translated: We have heard that these three energies are combined together.

original: naiva no 'sti dhanus tādṛṅ na yoddhā na ca sārathiḥ
analyzed: na eva naḥ sti dhanuḥ tādṛś na yoddhā na ca sārathiḥ
translated: We do not have such a bow, nor a warrior, nor a charioteer.

original: tac ca mandā na jānanti duryodhanavaśānugāḥ
analyzed: tat ca mandāḥ na jānanti duryodhana vaśa anugāḥ
translated: But those fools, following Duryodhana's lead, do not know this.

original: śeṣayed aśanir dīpto nipatan mūrdhni saṃjaya
analyzed: śeṣayet aśaniḥ dīptaḥ nipatan mūrdhni saṃjaya
translated: A flaming thunderbolt falling on the head might spare, O Sanjaya,

original: na tu śeṣaṃ śarāḥ kuryur astās tāta kirīṭinā
analyzed: na tu śeṣam śarāḥ kuryuḥ astāḥ tāta kirīṭinā
translated: But the arrows shot by Kiriti, O son, would leave nothing behind.

original: api cāsyann ivābhāti nighnann iva ca phalgunaḥ
analyzed: api ca asyan iva ābhāti nighnan iva ca phalgunaḥ
translated: Phalguna seems to be shooting and striking at the same time,

original: uddharann iva kāyebhyaḥ śirāṃsi śaravṛṣṭibhiḥ🔽api bāṇamayaṃ tejaḥ pradīptam iva sarvataḥ
analyzed: uddharan iva kāyebhyaḥ śirāṃsi śara vṛṣṭibhiḥ  api bāṇa mayam tejaḥ pradīptam iva sarvatas
translated: As if plucking off heads with showers of arrows from the bodies.🔽Will not the Gandīva-drawn arrows, burning like fire all around,

analyzed: gāṇḍīva iddham daheta ājau putrāṇām mama vāhinīm
translated: Consume my army?

analyzed: api sā ratha ghoṣeṇa bhaya ārtā savyasācinaḥ
translated: Will not the multitude of troops, frightened by the sound of Savyasachin's chariot,

original: vitrastā bahulā senā bhāratī pratibhāti me
analyzed: vitrastā bahulā senā bhāratī pratibhāti me
translated: The vast army of the Bharatas appear to me to be terrified?

original: yathā kakṣaṃ dahaty agniḥ pravṛddhaḥ sarvataś caran🔽mahārcir aniloddhūtas tadvad dhakṣyati māmakān
analyzed: yathā kakṣam dahati agniḥ pravṛddhaḥ sarvatas caran  mahā arciḥ anila uddhūtaḥ tadvat dhakṣyati māmakān
translated: Just as a raging fire, moving everywhere, burns up a forest,🔽So will the fire of the arrows of the son of Pandu, fanned by the wind, consume my troops.

analyzed: yadā udvaman niśitān bāṇa saṃghān
translated: When he vomits forth multitudes of sharp arrows,

analyzed: sthātā ātatāyī samare kirīṭī  sṛṣṭaḥ ntakaḥ sarva haraḥ vidhātrā
translated: The Kiriti, the killer, will stand in battle.🔽Just as the creator has created Death, the destroyer of all,

analyzed: yathā bhavet tadvat avāraṇīyaḥ
translated: So he is irresistible.

original: yadā hy abhīkṣṇaṃ subahūn prakārāñ /🔽śrotāsmi tān āvasathe kurūṇām
analyzed: yadā hi abhīkṣṇam su bahūn  śrotāsmi tān āvasathe kurūṇām
translated: For when I hear from the Kurus' abode, again and again, of the many kinds of calamities that befall the Pandavas,

analyzed: teṣām samantāt ca tathā raṇa agre
translated: And when I hear of the destruction of the Kurus on all sides and in the forefront of the battle,

analyzed: kṣayaḥ kila ayam bharatān upaiti
translated: It seems that this destruction befalls the Bharatas.

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

analyzed: yathā eva pāṇḍavāḥ sarve parākrāntāḥ jigīṣavaḥ
translated: Just as all the Pandavas are powerful and desirous of victory,

analyzed: tathā eva abhisarāḥ teṣām tyaktātmānaḥ jaye dhṛtāḥ
translated: So too are their followers, ready to give up their lives and devoted to victory.

original: tvam eva hi parākrāntān ācakṣīthāḥ parān mama
analyzed: tvam eva hi parākrāntān ācakṣīthāḥ parān mama
translated: You yourself should describe to me my powerful enemies,

analyzed: pāñcālān kekayān matsyān māgadhān vatsa bhūmipān
translated: The Panchalas, Kekayas, Matsyas, Magadhas, and the kings of Vatsa,

original: yaś ca sendrān imāṃl lokān icchan kuryād vaśe balī
analyzed: yaḥ ca sa indrān imān lokān icchan kuryāt vaśe balī
translated: And whoever else is powerful enough to bring these worlds under his control, even if he were Indra himself.

original: sa śreṣṭho jagataḥ kṛṣṇaḥ pāṇḍavānāṃ jaye dhṛtaḥ
analyzed: sa śreṣṭhaḥ jagataḥ kṛṣṇaḥ pāṇḍavānām jaye dhṛtaḥ
translated: That Krishna, the best in the world, is devoted to the victory of the Pandavas.

original: samastām arjunād vidyāṃ sātyakiḥ kṣipram āptavān
analyzed: samastām arjunāt vidyām sātyakiḥ kṣipram āptavān
translated: Satyaki has quickly acquired all the knowledge of archery from Arjuna,

original: śaineyaḥ samare sthātā bījavat pravapañ śarān
analyzed: śaineyaḥ samare sthātā bīja vat pravapam śarān
translated: And the grandson of Shini will stand in battle, sowing his arrows like seeds.

analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ ca pāñcālyaḥ krūra karmā mahā rathaḥ
translated: And Dhrishtadyumna of Panchala, a cruel warrior and a great chariot,

analyzed: māmakeṣu raṇam kartā baleṣu parama astra vid
translated: Will fight in my army, skilled in the use of supreme weapons.

original: yudhiṣṭhirasya ca krodhād arjunasya ca vikramāt
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhirasya ca krodhāt arjunasya ca vikramāt
translated: And because of Yudhishthira's anger and Arjuna's valor,

original: yamābhyāṃ bhīmasenāc ca bhayaṃ me tāta jāyate
analyzed: yamābhyām bhīmasenāt ca bhayam me tāta jāyate
translated: O son, fear arises in me from those two and from Bhimasena.

analyzed: amānuṣam manuṣya indraiḥ jālam vitatam antarā
translated: A net has been spread between the human lords and the superhuman,

original: mama senāṃ haniṣyanti tataḥ krośāmi saṃjaya🔽darśanīyo manasvī ca lakṣmīvān brahmavarcasī
analyzed: mama senām haniṣyanti tatas krośāmi saṃjaya  darśanīyaḥ manasvī ca lakṣmīvān brahmavarcasī
translated: They will destroy my army, therefore I cry out, O Sanjaya.🔽Handsome, intelligent, prosperous, and radiant with spiritual power,

analyzed: medhāvī su kṛta prajñaḥ dharma ātmā pāṇḍu nandanaḥ
translated: Wise, of good understanding, righteous, the son of Pandu,

analyzed: mitra amātyaiḥ su saṃpannaḥ saṃpannaḥ yojya yojakaiḥ
translated: Well-endowed with friends and ministers, equipped with those to be employed and employers,

analyzed: bhrātṛbhiḥ śvaśuraiḥ putraiḥ upapannaḥ mahā rathaiḥ
translated: Endowed with brothers, fathers-in-law, sons, and great warriors,

original: dhṛtyā ca puruṣavyāghro naibhṛtyena ca pāṇḍavaḥ🔽anṛśaṃso vadānyaś ca hrīmān satyaparākramaḥ
analyzed: dhṛtyā ca puruṣa vyāghraḥ naibhṛtyena ca pāṇḍavaḥ  anṛśaṃsaḥ vadānyaḥ ca hrīmān satya parākramaḥ
translated: And with patience, that tiger among men, the son of Pandu, is also modest,🔽Not cruel, generous, modest, of true prowess,

analyzed: bahu śrutaḥ kṛtātmā ca vṛddha sevī jita indriyaḥ
translated: Learned, self-controlled, serving the elders, with senses under control,

analyzed: tam sarva guṇa saṃpannam samiddham iva pāvakam
translated: That one endowed with all virtues, like a well-kindled fire,

original: tapantam iva ko mandaḥ patiṣyati pataṃgavat
analyzed: tapantam iva kaḥ mandaḥ patiṣyati pataṃga vat
translated: Who will that fool, like a moth, fly into, like the sun scorching?

analyzed: pāṇḍava agnim anāvāryam mumūrṣuḥ mūḍha cetanaḥ
translated: Desiring death, with a deluded mind, he will enter the unquenchable Pandava fire,

analyzed: tanuḥ uccaḥ śikhī rājā śuddha jāmbūnada prabhaḥ
translated: Tall, with a crest, the king, shining like pure gold,

analyzed: mandānām mama putrāṇām yuddhena antam kariṣyati
translated: Will bring an end to the battle of my foolish sons.

original: tair ayuddhaṃ sādhu manye kuravas tan nibodhata
analyzed: taiḥ ayuddham sādhu manye kuravaḥ tat nibodhata
translated: I consider it best to avoid war. The Kurus should understand this.

original: yuddhe vināśaḥ kṛtsnasya kulasya bhavitā dhruvam
analyzed: yuddhe vināśaḥ kṛtsnasya kulasya bhavitā dhruvam
translated: In a war, the destruction of the entire family is certain.

original: eṣā me paramā śāntir yayā śāmyati me manaḥ
analyzed: eṣā me paramā śāntiḥ yayā śāmyati me manaḥ
translated: This is my supreme peace, by which my mind is pacified.

original: yadi tv ayuddham iṣṭaṃ vo vayaṃ śāntyai yatāmahe
analyzed: yadi tu ayuddham iṣṭam vaḥ vayam śāntyai yatāmahe
translated: But if you desire peace, we will strive for peace.

original: na tu naḥ śikṣamāṇānām upekṣeta yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: na tu naḥ śikṣamāṇānām upekṣeta yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: But Yudhishthira will not ignore us while we are striving.

original: jugupsati hy adharmeṇa mām evoddiśya kāraṇam
analyzed: jugupsati hi adharmeṇa mām eva uddiśya kāraṇam
translated: He despises me, considering it an act of adharma.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: evam etan mahārāja yathā vadasi bhārata
analyzed: evam etat mahā rāja yathā vadasi bhārata
translated: It is so, great king, as you say, O descendant of Bharata.

analyzed: yuddhe vināśaḥ kṣatrasya gāṇḍīvena pradṛśyate
translated: The destruction of the Kshatriyas in battle is seen through the Gandiva.

original: idaṃ tu nābhijānāmi tava dhīrasya nityaśaḥ
analyzed: idam tu nā abhijānāmi tava dhīrasya nityaśas
translated: But I do not know this, of you who are always firm,

analyzed: yat putra vaśam āgaccheḥ sattva jñaḥ savyasācinaḥ
translated: That you have come under the control of your son, knowing the prowess of Savyasachi.

original: naiṣa kālo mahārāja tava śaśvat kṛtāgasaḥ
analyzed: na eṣa kālaḥ mahā rāja tava śaśvat kṛta āgasaḥ
translated: This is not the time, great king, for you who have always sinned.

original: tvayā hy evāditaḥ pārthā nikṛtā bharatarṣabha
analyzed: tvayā hi eva āditas pārthāḥ nikṛtāḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: For it was by you alone, O bull among the Bharata lineage, that the Parthas were deceived from the beginning.

original: svīkṛtās tair janapadāḥ kuravas te sajāṅgalāḥ
analyzed: svīkṛtāḥ taiḥ janapadāḥ kuravaḥ te sa jāṅgalāḥ
translated: The Kurus with their allies have taken possession of the lands and people that belonged to you.

original: kathaṃ vīraur jitāṃ bhūmim akhilāṃ pratipadyathāḥ
analyzed: katham vīrauḥ jitām bhūmim akhilām pratipadyathāḥ
translated: How will you regain the entire conquered land, O hero?

original: pitā śreṣṭhaḥ suhṛd yaś ca samyak praṇihitātmavān
analyzed: pitā śreṣṭhaḥ suhṛd yaḥ ca samyak praṇihita ātmavān
translated: The father is the best friend, if he is a well-wisher and has controlled his soul.

original: āstheyaṃ hi hitaṃ tena na drogdhā gurur ucyate🔽idaṃ jitam idaṃ labdham iti śrutvā parājitān
analyzed: āstheyam hi hitam tena na drogdhā guruḥ ucyate  idam jitam idam labdham iti śrutvā parājitān
translated: One should follow his beneficial advice. He is not called a guru if he is a deceiver.

analyzed: dyūta kāle mahā rāja smayase sma kumāra vat
translated: O great king, hearing that the Parthas had been defeated at the game of dice, you smiled like a child, thinking, This is won, this is gained.

original: paruṣāṇy ucyamānān sma purā pārthān upekṣase
analyzed: paruṣāṇi ucyamānān sma purā pārthān upekṣase
translated: Formerly, when the Parthas were being addressed harshly, you ignored them.

analyzed: kṛtsnam rājyam jayanti iti prapātam na anupaśyasi
translated: You did not foresee the fall, thinking that the entire kingdom was already won.

original: pitryaṃ rājyaṃ mahārāja kuravas te sajāṅgalāḥ
analyzed: pitryam rājyam mahā rāja kuravaḥ te sa jāṅgalāḥ
translated: O great king, the Kurus with the people of the Jangala country desire your paternal kingdom.

original: prārthayanti mahāyuddhe nānubandham avekṣase🔽atha vīrair jitāṃ bhūmim akhilāṃ pratyapadyathāḥ
analyzed: prārthayanti mahā yuddhe na anubandham avekṣase  atha vīraiḥ jitām bhūmim akhilām pratyapadyathāḥ
translated: You do not consider the consequences of a great war.🔽Or if you have obtained the entire conquered land through the heroes,

analyzed: bāhu vīrya arjitā bhūmiḥ tava pārthaiḥ niveditā
translated: the land conquered by the strength of your arms has been offered to you by the Parthas.

original: mayedaṃ kṛtam ity eva manyase rājasattama
analyzed: mayā idam kṛtam iti eva manyase rāja sattama
translated: O best of kings, you think that this has been done by you.

analyzed: grastān gandharvarājena majjataḥ hi aplave mbhasi
translated: When they were being drowned in the water without a raft, seized by the king of the Gandharvas,

original: ānināya punaḥ pārthaḥ putrāṃs te rājasattama
analyzed: ānināya punar pārthaḥ putrān te rāja sattama
translated: the Partha again brought back your sons, O best of kings.

original: kumāravac ca smayase dyūte vinikṛteṣu yat
analyzed: kumāra vat ca smayase dyūte vinikṛteṣu yat
translated: And when the Parthas were defeated at the game of dice, you smiled like a child.

original: pāṇḍaveṣu vanaṃ rājan pravrajatsu punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍaveṣu vanam rājan pravrajatsu punar punar
translated: O king, when the Pandavas were repeatedly leaving for the forest,

analyzed: pravarṣataḥ śara vrātān arjunasya śitān bahūn
translated: Even the oceans would dry up from the many sharp and continuous showers of arrows that Arjuna releases.

original: apy arṇavā viśuṣyeyuḥ kiṃ punar māṃsayonayaḥ
analyzed: api arṇavāḥ viśuṣyeyuḥ kim punar māṃsa yonayaḥ
translated: What to speak of those born of flesh?

original: asyatāṃ phalgunaḥ śreṣṭho gāṇḍīvaṃ dhanuṣāṃ varam🔽keśavaḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ cakrāṇāṃ ca sudarśanam
analyzed: asyatām phalgunaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ gāṇḍīvam dhanuṣām varam  keśavaḥ sarva bhūtānām cakrāṇām ca sudarśanam
translated: Among those who shoot, Phalguna is the best, and the Gandiva bow is the best among bows.🔽Keshava is the best among all beings, and the Sudarshana discus is the best among weapons.

original: vānaro rocamānaś ca ketuḥ ketumatāṃ varaḥ🔽evam etāni saratho vahañ śvetahayo raṇe
analyzed: vānaraḥ rocamānaḥ ca ketuḥ ketumatām varaḥ  evam etāni sa rathaḥ vaham śveta hayaḥ raṇe
translated: The monkey standard is the best among standards.🔽Thus, carrying these, the white horses will destroy us in battle,

analyzed: kṣapayiṣyati naḥ rājan kālacakram iva udyatam
translated: like the raised wheel of time, O king.

analyzed: tasya adya vasudhā rājan nikhilā bharata ṛṣabha
translated: Today, O king, the entire earth, O bull among the Bharata lineage,

original: yasya bhīmārjunau yodhau sa rājā rājasattama
analyzed: yasya bhīma arjunau yodhau sa rājā rāja sattama
translated: belongs to the one who has Bhima and Arjuna as his warriors. He is the best of kings, O best of kings.

analyzed: tathā bhīma hata prāyām majjantīm tava vāhinīm
translated: Similarly, seeing your army almost destroyed by Bhima, sinking,

analyzed: duryodhana mukhāḥ dṛṣṭvā kṣayam yāsyanti kauravāḥ
translated: the Kauravas headed by Duryodhana will perish.

original: na hi bhīmabhayād bhītā lapsyante vijayaṃ vibho
analyzed: na hi bhīma bhayāt bhītāḥ lapsyante vijayam vibho
translated: O lord, they will not attain victory, frightened by the fear of Bhima.

analyzed: tava putrāḥ mahā rāja rājānaḥ ca anusāriṇaḥ
translated: Your sons, O great king, and the kings who follow them,

original: matsyās tvām adya nārcanti pāñcālāś ca sakekayāḥ
analyzed: matsyāḥ tvām adya na arcanti pāñcālāḥ ca sa kekayāḥ
translated: the Matsyas, the Panchalas, and the Kekayas do not honor you today.

original: śālveyāḥ śūrasenāś ca sarve tvām avajānate
analyzed: śālveyāḥ śūrasenāḥ ca sarve tvām avajānate
translated: All the Shalveyas and Shurasenas despise you.

original: pārthaṃ hy ete gatāḥ sarve vīryajñās tasya dhīmataḥ
analyzed: pārtham hi ete gatāḥ sarve vīrya jñāḥ tasya dhīmataḥ
translated: For all of them have gone to Partha, knowing the valor of that wise one.

original: bhaktyā hy asya virudhyante tava putraiḥ sadaiva te
analyzed: bhaktyā hi asya virudhyante tava putraiḥ sadā eva te
translated: For they have always been opposed to him out of devotion, by your sons.

original: anarhān eva tu vadhe dharmayuktān vikarmaṇā
analyzed: anarhān eva tu vadhe dharma yuktān vikarmaṇā
translated: Those who, though undeserving of death and righteous, were killed by him in a wicked deed,

original: yo 'kleśayat pāṇḍuputrān yo vidveṣṭy adhunāpi vai
analyzed: yaḥ kleśayat pāṇḍu putrān yaḥ vidveṣṭi adhunā api vai
translated: who tormented the sons of Pandu and who still hates them,

analyzed: sarva upāyaiḥ niyantavyaḥ sa anugaḥ pāpa pūruṣaḥ
translated: that sinful man, along with his followers, should be restrained by all means.

original: aparokṣaṃ mahārāja sākṣāc cainaṃ bravīmy aham
analyzed: aparokṣam mahā rāja sākṣāt ca enam bravīmi aham
translated: I am speaking to him directly, O great king, not indirectly.

original: tava putro mahārāja nātra śocitum arhasi
analyzed: tava putraḥ mahā rāja na atra śocitum arhasi
translated: O great king, your son should not be grieved over.

original: dyūtakāle mayā coktaṃ vidureṇa ca dhīmatā
analyzed: dyūta kāle mayā ca uktam vidureṇa ca dhīmatā
translated: At the time of the gambling match, it was said by me and the wise Vidura,

original: yad idaṃ te vilapitaṃ pāṇḍavān prati bhārata
analyzed: yat idam te vilapitam pāṇḍavān prati bhārata
translated: This lamenting of yours towards the Pandavas, O Bharata,

analyzed: anīśena iva rāja indra sarvam etat nirarthakam
translated: is all useless, O lord of kings, as if by one who is powerless.

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

original: na bhetavyaṃ mahārāja na śocyā bhavatā vayam
analyzed: na bhetavyam mahā rāja na śocyāḥ bhavatā vayam
translated: O great king, you should not be afraid, nor should we be grieved by you.

original: samarthāḥ sma parān rājan vijetuṃ samare vibho
analyzed: samarthāḥ sma parān rājan vijetum samare vibho
translated: We are able to conquer the enemies in battle, O king, O lord.

original: vanaṃ pravrājitān pārthān yad āyān madhusūdanaḥ
analyzed: vanam pravrājitān pārthān yat āyāt madhusūdanaḥ
translated: When the Parthas were exiled to the forest, Madhusudana came

analyzed: mahatā bala cakreṇa para rāṣṭra avamardinā
translated: with a great army, crushing the kingdoms of others.🔽 O king, what can we do now?🔽 Duryodhana said: O great king, you should not be afraid, nor should we be grieved by you.

original: kekayā dhṛṣṭaketuś ca dhṛṣṭadyumnaś ca pārṣataḥ
analyzed: kekayāḥ dhṛṣṭaketuḥ ca dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ ca pārṣataḥ
translated: The Kekayas, Dhrishtaketu, and Dhrishtadyumna the son of Prishata,

analyzed: rājānaḥ ca anvayuḥ pārthān bahavaḥ nye nuyāyinaḥ
translated: And many other kings and followers followed the Parthas.

analyzed: indraprasthasya ca adūrāt samājagmuḥ mahā rathāḥ
translated: The mighty warriors assembled not far from Indraprastha,

original: vyagarhayaṃś ca saṃgamya bhavantaṃ kurubhiḥ saha
analyzed: vyagarhayan ca saṃgamya bhavantam kurubhiḥ saha
translated: And having assembled, they reproached you together with the Kurus.

analyzed: te yudhiṣṭhiram āsīnam ajinaiḥ prativāsitam
translated: And they saw Yudhishthira seated, covered with deerskins,

analyzed: kṛṣṇa pradhānāḥ saṃhatya paryupāsanta bhārata
translated: And together with Krishna at the head, they surrounded him, O Bharata.

original: pratyādānaṃ ca rājyasya kāryam ūcur narādhipāḥ
analyzed: pratyādānam ca rājyasya kāryam ūcuḥ narādhipāḥ
translated: And the kings said that the kingdom should be taken back,

analyzed: bhavataḥ sa anubandhasya samucchedam cikīrṣavaḥ
translated: Desiring to destroy you and your followers.

original: śrutvā caitan mayoktās tu bhīṣmadroṇakṛpās tadā
analyzed: śrutvā ca etat mayā uktāḥ tu bhīṣma droṇa kṛpāḥ tadā
translated: And having heard this, Bhishma, Drona, and Kripa were addressed by me,

analyzed: jñāti kṣaya bhayāt rājan bhītena bharata ṛṣabha
translated: Out of fear for the destruction of the relatives, O king, O best of the Bharata race.

original: na te sthāsyanti samaye pāṇḍavā iti me matiḥ
analyzed: na te sthāsyanti samaye pāṇḍavāḥ iti me matiḥ
translated: They said, They will not abide by the agreement, the Pandavas, that is my opinion.

original: samucchedaṃ hi naḥ kṛtsnaṃ vāsudevaś cikīrṣati
analyzed: samucchedam hi naḥ kṛtsnam vāsudevaḥ cikīrṣati
translated: And Vasudeva desires the complete destruction of us all.

original: ṛte ca viduraṃ sarve yūyaṃ vadhyā mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: ṛte ca viduram sarve yūyam vadhyāḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: And except Vidura, all of you are to be slain by the great-souled one.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭraś ca dharmajño na vadhyaḥ kurusattamaḥ
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ ca dharma jñaḥ na vadhyaḥ kuru sattamaḥ
translated: And Dhritarashtra, the righteous one, the best of the Kurus, is not to be slain.

original: samucchedaṃ ca kṛtsnaṃ naḥ kṛtvā tāta janārdanaḥ
analyzed: samucchedam ca kṛtsnam naḥ kṛtvā tāta janārdanaḥ
translated: Having completely destroyed us, O son, Janardana

analyzed: eka rājyam kurūṇām sma cikīrṣati yudhiṣṭhire
translated: wishes to establish Yudhishthira as the sole king of the Kurus.

original: tatra kiṃ prāptakālaṃ naḥ praṇipātaḥ palāyanam
analyzed: tatra kim prāpta kālam naḥ praṇipātaḥ palāyanam
translated: What is the right course for us now - to surrender, to flee,

analyzed: prāṇān vā saṃparityajya pratiyudhyāmahe parān
translated: or to fight the enemy to the death?

original: pratiyuddhe tu niyataḥ syād asmākaṃ parājayaḥ
analyzed: pratiyuddhe tu niyataḥ syāt asmākam parājayaḥ
translated: But if we fight, defeat is certain for us,

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhirasya sarve hi pārthivāḥ vaśa vartinaḥ
translated: for all the kings are under Yudhishthira's control.

original: viraktarāṣṭrāś ca vayaṃ mitrāṇi kupitāni naḥ
analyzed: virakta rāṣṭrāḥ ca vayam mitrāṇi kupitāni naḥ
translated: Our kingdom is disaffected, our allies are angry,

original: dhikkṛtāḥ pārthivaiḥ sarvaiḥ svajanena ca sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: dhikkṛtāḥ pārthivaiḥ sarvaiḥ sva janena ca sarvaśas
translated: and we are despised by all the kings and our own people.

original: praṇipāte tu doṣo 'sti bandhūnāṃ śāśvatīḥ samāḥ
analyzed: praṇipāte tu doṣaḥ sti bandhūnām śāśvatīḥ samāḥ
translated: But there is a fault in surrendering to our relatives for all time.

original: pitaraṃ tv eva śocāmi prajñānetraṃ janeśvaram
analyzed: pitaram tu eva śocāmi prajñā netram janeśvaram
translated: I grieve only for my father, the wise lord of the people,

original: matkṛte duḥkham āpannaṃ kleśaṃ prāptam anantakam
analyzed: mad kṛte duḥkham āpannam kleśam prāptam anantakam
translated: who has fallen into sorrow and obtained endless suffering because of me.

original: kṛtaṃ hi tava putraiś ca pareṣām avarodhanam
analyzed: kṛtam hi tava putraiḥ ca pareṣām avarodhanam
translated: Your sons have already imprisoned the enemy,

original: matpriyārthaṃ puraivaitad viditaṃ te narottama🔽te rājño dhṛtarāṣṭrasya sāmātyasya mahārathāḥ
analyzed: mad priya artham purā eva etat viditam te nara uttama  te rājñaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya sa amātyasya mahā rathāḥ
translated: and O best of men, this was known to you before, for my sake.🔽Those great warriors, the sons of Pandu,

analyzed: vairam pratikariṣyanti kula ucchedena pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: will avenge the enmity by exterminating the family of King Dhritarashtra and his ministers.

original: tato droṇo 'bravīd bhīṣmaḥ kṛpo drauṇiś ca bhārata
analyzed: tatas droṇaḥ bravīt bhīṣmaḥ kṛpaḥ drauṇiḥ ca bhārata
translated: Then Drona, Bhishma, Kripa and Drona's son, O Bharata,

original: matvā māṃ mahatīṃ cintām āsthitaṃ vyathitendriyam🔽abhidrugdhāḥ pare cen no na bhetavyaṃ paraṃtapa
analyzed: matvā mām mahatīm cintām āsthitam vyathita indriyam  abhidrugdhāḥ pare ced naḥ na bhetavyam paraṃtapa
translated: seeing me overwhelmed with great anxiety and my senses distressed,🔽said, 'If the enemy should attack us, O scorcher of enemies, we need not fear.

original: asamarthāḥ pare jetum asmān yudhi janeśvara
analyzed: asamarthāḥ pare jetum asmān yudhi janeśvara
translated: The enemy are incapable of vanquishing us in battle, O lord of men.

analyzed: ekaikaśas samarthāḥ smaḥ vijetum sarva pārthivān
translated: Each one of us is capable of conquering all the kings.

original: āgacchantu vineṣyāmo darpam eṣāṃ śitaiḥ śaraiḥ
analyzed: āgacchantu vineṣyāmaḥ darpam eṣām śitaiḥ śaraiḥ
translated: Let them come! We will destroy their pride with our sharp arrows.

original: puraikena hi bhīṣmeṇa vijitāḥ sarvapārthivāḥ🔽mṛte pitary abhikruddho rathenaikena bhārata
analyzed: purā ekena hi bhīṣmeṇa vijitāḥ sarva pārthivāḥ  mṛte pitari abhikruddhaḥ rathena ekena bhārata
translated: For, in the past, all the kings were conquered by Bhishma alone.🔽When his father died, that best of the Kurus, O Bharata,

analyzed: jaghāna su bahūn teṣām saṃrabdhaḥ kuru sattamaḥ
translated: in anger, on a single chariot, slew many of them.

original: tatas te śaraṇaṃ jagmur devavratam imaṃ bhayāt
analyzed: tatas te śaraṇam jagmuḥ devavratam imam bhayāt
translated: Then, out of fear, they sought refuge with this Devavrata.

original: sa bhīṣmaḥ susamartho 'yam asmābhiḥ sahito raṇe
analyzed: sa bhīṣmaḥ su samarthaḥ yam asmābhiḥ sahitaḥ raṇe
translated: And this Bhishma, united with us, is fully capable in battle

original: parān vijetuṃ tasmāt te vyetu bhīr bharatarṣabha
analyzed: parān vijetum tasmāt te vyetu bhīḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: to conquer the enemy. Therefore, O best of the Bharata race, let your fear be dispelled.

original: ity eṣāṃ niścayo hy āsīt tatkālam amitaujasām
analyzed: iti eṣām niścayaḥ hi āsīt tad kālam amita ojasām
translated: This was the resolve of those of immeasurable prowess at that time.

analyzed: purā pareṣām pṛthivī kṛtsnā āsīt vaśa vartinī
translated: In the past, the entire earth was under the control of the enemy.

original: asmān punar amī nādya samarthā jetum āhave
analyzed: asmān punar amī na adya samarthāḥ jetum āhave
translated: But they are not capable of conquering us in battle today.

original: chinnapakṣāḥ pare hy adya vīryahīnāś ca pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: chinna pakṣāḥ pare hi adya vīrya hīnāḥ ca pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: The other kings are now wingless and the Pāṇḍavas are weak.

analyzed: asmad saṃsthā ca pṛthivī vartate bharata ṛṣabha
translated: The earth is under our control, O best of the Bharatas.

original: ekārthāḥ sukhaduḥkheṣu mayānītāś ca pārthivāḥ🔽apy agniṃ praviśeyus te samudraṃ vā paraṃtapa
analyzed: eka arthāḥ sukha duḥkheṣu mayā ānītāḥ ca pārthivāḥ  api agnim praviśeyuḥ te samudram vā paraṃtapa
translated: The kings have been brought together by me, united in happiness and sorrow.🔽O scorcher of enemies, for my sake, all the kings would enter fire or the ocean.

original: madarthe pārthivāḥ sarve tad viddhi kurusattama
analyzed: mad arthe pārthivāḥ sarve tat viddhi kuru sattama
translated: Know this, O best of the Kurus.

original: unmattam iva cāpi tvāṃ prahasantīha duḥkhitam
analyzed: unmattam iva ca api tvām prahasanti iha duḥkhitam
translated: They laugh at you, as if you were mad, afflicted with grief,

analyzed: vilapantam bahuvidham bhītam para vikatthane
translated: weeping in many ways, frightened by the boasting of others.

original: eṣāṃ hy ekaikaśo rājñāṃ samarthaḥ pāṇḍavān prati
analyzed: eṣām hi ekaikaśas rājñām samarthaḥ pāṇḍavān prati
translated: For each of these kings is capable against the Pāṇḍavas.

original: ātmānaṃ manyate sarvo vyetu te bhayam āgatam
analyzed: ātmānam manyate sarvaḥ vyetu te bhayam āgatam
translated: Each one thinks himself capable. Let your fear be gone.

original: sarvāṃ samagrāṃ senāṃ me vāsavo 'pi na śaknuyāt
analyzed: sarvām samagrām senām me vāsavaḥ pi na śaknuyāt
translated: Even Vāsava himself cannot destroy my entire army,

analyzed: hantum akṣayya rūpā iyam brahmaṇā api svayambhuvā
translated: which is indestructible even to Brahmā himself, the self-existent one.

original: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ puraṃ hitvā pañca grāmān sa yācati
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ puram hitvā pañca grāmān sa yācati
translated: Yudhiṣṭhira, having abandoned the city, asks for five villages.

original: bhīto hi māmakāt sainyāt prabhāvāc caiva me prabho
analyzed: bhītaḥ hi māmakāt sainyāt prabhāvāt ca eva me prabho
translated: For he is afraid of my army and my power, O lord.

original: samarthaṃ manyase yac ca kuntīputraṃ vṛkodaram
analyzed: samartham manyase yat ca kuntī putram vṛkodaram
translated: And as for your thinking that Vṛkodara, the son of Kuntī, is capable,

original: tan mithyā na hi me kṛtsnaṃ prabhāvaṃ vettha bhārata
analyzed: tat mithyā na hi me kṛtsnam prabhāvam vettha bhārata
translated: That is false, for you do not know my full prowess, O Bharata.

original: matsamo hi gadāyuddhe pṛthivyāṃ nāsti kaś cana
analyzed: mad samaḥ hi gadā yuddhe pṛthivyām na asti kaḥ cana
translated: For there is no one on earth equal to me in mace-fighting.

original: nāsīt kaś cid atikrānto bhavitā na ca kaś cana
analyzed: na āsīt kaḥ cit atikrāntaḥ bhavitā na ca kaḥ cana
translated: There has never been anyone who has surpassed me, nor will there ever be.

analyzed: yuktaḥ duḥkha ucitaḥ ca aham vidyāpāra gataḥ tathā
translated: I am skilled, I am accustomed to suffering, and I have mastered knowledge.

original: tasmān na bhīmān nānyebhyo bhayaṃ me vidyate kva cit
analyzed: tasmāt na bhīmāt na anyebhyaḥ bhayam me vidyate kva cit
translated: Therefore, I have no fear from Bhima or anyone else.

analyzed: duryodhana samaḥ nā asti gadāyām iti niścayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that there is no one equal to Duryodhana in the mace.

original: saṃkarṣaṇasya bhadraṃ te yat tadainam upāvasam
analyzed: saṃkarṣaṇasya bhadram te yat tadā enam upāvasam
translated: Blessed are you, O Sanakarsana, that you have come to me.

analyzed: yuddhe saṃkarṣaṇa samaḥ balena abhyadhikaḥ bhuvi
translated: In battle, I am equal to Sanakarsana, and in strength, I am superior on earth.

original: gadāprahāraṃ bhīmo me na jātu viṣahed yudhi
analyzed: gadā prahāram bhīmaḥ me na jātu viṣahet yudhi
translated: Bhima will never be able to withstand the blow of my mace in battle.

original: ekaṃ prahāraṃ yaṃ dadyāṃ bhīmāya ruṣito nṛpa
analyzed: ekam prahāram yam dadyām bhīmāya ruṣitaḥ nṛpa
translated: O king, if I were to angrily give a single blow to Bhima,

original: sa evainaṃ nayed ghoraṃ kṣipraṃ vaivasvatakṣayam
analyzed: saḥ eva enam nayet ghoram kṣipram vaivasvata kṣayam
translated: it would quickly lead him to the terrible abode of Yama.

original: iccheyaṃ ca gadāhastaṃ rājan draṣṭuṃ vṛkodaram
analyzed: iccheyam ca gadā hastam rājan draṣṭum vṛkodaram
translated: O king, I wish to see Vrikodara with a mace in his hand.

original: suciraṃ prārthito hy eṣa mama nityaṃ manorathaḥ
analyzed: su ciram prārthitaḥ hi eṣa mama nityam manorathaḥ
translated: This has always been my cherished desire.

original: gadayā nihato hy ājau mama pārtho vṛkodaraḥ
analyzed: gadayā nihataḥ hi ājau mama pārthaḥ vṛkodaraḥ
translated: Partha Vrikodara will be slain by my mace in battle.

analyzed: viśīrṇa gātraḥ pṛthivīm parāsuḥ prapatiṣyati
translated: With his body shattered, he will fall dead on the ground.

analyzed: gadā prahāra abhihataḥ himavān api parvataḥ
translated: Even the Himalayas, struck by the blows of a mace,

analyzed: sakṛt mayā viśīryeta giriḥ śata sahasradhā
translated: would be shattered by me into a hundred thousand pieces.

original: sa cāpy etad vijānāti vāsudevārjunau tathā
analyzed: sa ca api etat vijānāti vāsudeva arjunau tathā
translated: And he knows this, as well as Vasudeva and Arjuna,

analyzed: duryodhana samaḥ nā asti gadāyām iti niścayaḥ
translated: that there is no doubt that Duryodhana is the equal in mace-fighting.

original: tat te vṛkodaramayaṃ bhayaṃ vyetu mahāhave
analyzed: tat te vṛkodara mayam bhayam vyetu mahā āhave
translated: Therefore, let that fear of yours regarding Vrikodara be dispelled in this great battle.

original: vyapaneṣyāmy ahaṃ hy enaṃ mā rājan vimanā bhava🔽tasmin mayā hate kṣipram arjunaṃ bahavo rathāḥ
analyzed: vyapaneṣyāmi aham hi enam mā rājan vimanāḥ bhava  tasmin mayā hate kṣipram arjunam bahavaḥ rathāḥ
translated: I will indeed destroy him; do not be disheartened, O king.🔽When he is quickly killed by me, many charioteers

analyzed: tulya rūpāḥ viśiṣṭāḥ ca kṣepsyanti bharata ṛṣabha
translated: equal or superior to Arjuna will throw him down, O bull among the Bharata lineage.

original: bhīṣmo droṇaḥ kṛpo drauṇiḥ karṇo bhūriśravās tathā
analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ droṇaḥ kṛpaḥ drauṇiḥ karṇaḥ bhūriśravāḥ tathā
translated: Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, Drona's son, Karna, Bhurishrava,
Shalya the lord of Pragjyotisha, Jayadratha the king of the Sindhus,

original: ekaika eṣāṃ śaktas tu hantuṃ bhārata pāṇḍavān
analyzed: ekaikaḥ eṣām śaktaḥ tu hantum bhārata pāṇḍavān
translated: each one of them is capable of killing the Pandavas, O Bharata.

analyzed: samastāḥ tu kṣaṇena etān neṣyanti yama sādanam
translated: But all of them together will quickly lead them to Yama's abode.

original: samagrā pārthivī senā pārtham ekaṃ dhanaṃjayam
analyzed: samagrā pārthivī senā pārtham ekam dhanaṃjayam
translated: The entire earthly army is incapable of defeating the single Partha Dhananjaya.

original: kasmād aśaktā nirjetum iti hetur na vidyate
analyzed: kasmāt aśaktāḥ nirjetum iti hetuḥ na vidyate
translated: There is no reason why they should be unable to conquer him.

analyzed: śara vrātaiḥ tu bhīṣmeṇa sahasraśas
translated: But Bhishma with his showers of arrows, in hundreds and thousands,

analyzed: droṇa drauṇi kṛpaiḥ ca eva gantā pārthaḥ yama kṣayam
translated: Partha will go to Yama's abode, along with Drona, Drona's son and Kripa.

original: pitāmaho hi gāṅgeyaḥ śaṃtanor adhi bhārata
analyzed: pitāmahaḥ hi gāṅgeyaḥ śaṃtanoḥ adhi bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, the grandfather Gangeya was born to Shantanu,

analyzed: brahmarṣi sadṛśaḥ jajñe devaiḥ api durutsahaḥ
translated: like a brahmin sage, invincible even by the gods.

original: na hantā vidyate cāpi rājan bhīṣmasya kaś cana
analyzed: na hantā vidyate ca api rājan bhīṣmasya kaḥ cana
translated: And O king, there is no one who can kill Bhishma.

original: pitrā hy uktaḥ prasannena nākāmas tvaṃ mariṣyasi🔽brahmarṣeś ca bharadvājād droṇyāṃ droṇo vyajāyata
analyzed: pitrā hi uktaḥ prasannena na akāmaḥ tvam mariṣyasi  brahmarṣeḥ ca bharadvājāt droṇyām droṇaḥ vyajāyata
translated: For his pleased father said, You will not die without attaining your desire.🔽And from the brahmin sage Bharadvaja, Drona was born in a pot.

original: droṇāj jajñe mahārāja drauṇiś ca paramāstravit
analyzed: droṇāt jajñe mahā rāja drauṇiḥ ca parama astra vid
translated: And from Drona, O great king, was born Ashvatthama, who knows the highest weapons.

analyzed: kṛpaḥ ca ācārya mukhyaḥ yam mahā ṛṣeḥ gautamāt api
translated: And this foremost of preceptors, Kripa, was born from the great sage Goutama.

original: śarastambodbhavaḥ śrīmān avadhya iti me matiḥ
analyzed: śara stamba udbhavaḥ śrīmān avadhyaḥ iti me matiḥ
translated: I think that he who was born from a clump of reeds is prosperous and invincible.

original: ayonijaṃ trayaṃ hy etat pitā mātā ca mātulaḥ
analyzed: a yoni jam trayam hi etat pitā mātā ca mātulaḥ
translated: These three were not born from wombs - the father, the mother and the maternal uncle.

original: aśvatthāmno mahārāja sa ca śūraḥ sthito mama
analyzed: aśvatthāmnaḥ mahā rāja sa ca śūraḥ sthitaḥ mama
translated: And that hero Ashvatthama, O great king, is on my side.

analyzed: sarve ete mahā rāja deva kalpāḥ mahā rathāḥ
translated: All of them, O great king, are like gods, great warriors,

analyzed: śakrasya api vyathām kuryuḥ saṃyuge bharata ṛṣabha
translated: who can cause pain even to Shakra in battle, O bull among the Bharata lineage.

original: naiteṣām arjunaḥ śakta ekaikaṃ prati vīkṣitum
analyzed: na eteṣām arjunaḥ śaktaḥ ekaikam prati vīkṣitum
translated: Arjuna is not capable of withstanding even one of them,

analyzed: sahitāḥ tu nara vyāghrāḥ haniṣyanti dhanaṃjayam
translated: but united, those tigers among men will kill Dhananjaya.

original: bhīṣmadroṇakṛpāṇāṃ ca tulyaḥ karṇo mato mama
analyzed: bhīṣma droṇa kṛpāṇām ca tulyaḥ karṇaḥ mataḥ mama
translated: I consider Karna to be equal to Bhishma, Drona and Kripa.

analyzed: anujñātaḥ ca rāmeṇa mad samaḥ sīti bhārata
translated: And he was approved by Rama, O Bharata, as being equal to me.

original: kuṇḍale rucire cāstāṃ karṇasya sahaje śubhe
analyzed: kuṇḍale rucire ca āstām karṇasya sahaje śubhe
translated: And Karna had two beautiful and auspicious earrings, born with him.

original: te śacyarthe mahendreṇa yācitaḥ sa paraṃtapaḥ
analyzed: te śacī arthe mahā indreṇa yācitaḥ sa paraṃtapaḥ
translated: For Shachi's sake, the great Indra asked that slayer of foes.

analyzed: amoghayā mahā rāja śaktyā parama bhīmayā
translated: With an unfailing spear, O great king, which was extremely terrible.

analyzed: tasya śaktyā upagūḍhasya kasmāt jīvet dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: How can Dhananjaya live, O king, when he is embraced by that spear?

original: vijayo me dhruvaṃ rājan phalaṃ pāṇāv ivāhitam
analyzed: vijayaḥ me dhruvam rājan phalam pāṇau iva āhitam
translated: Victory is certain for me, O king, as if it were placed in my hand.

original: abhivyaktaḥ pareṣāṃ ca kṛtsno bhuvi parājayaḥ
analyzed: abhivyaktaḥ pareṣām ca kṛtsnaḥ bhuvi parājayaḥ

original: ahnā hy ekena bhīṣmo 'yam ayutaṃ hanti bhārata
analyzed: ahnā hi ekena bhīṣmaḥ yam ayutam hanti bhārata
translated: For in a single day, O Bharata, this Bhishma kills ten thousand.

original: tat samāś ca maheṣvāsā droṇadrauṇikṛpā api
analyzed: tat samāḥ ca mahā iṣvāsāḥ droṇa drauṇi kṛpāḥ api
translated: And the great archers Drona, Drona's son and Kripa are equal to him.

analyzed: saṃśaptāni ca vṛndāni kṣatriyāṇām paraṃtapa
translated: And the assembled troops of the Kshatriyas are sworn to revenge, O scorcher of enemies.

original: arjunaṃ vayam asmān vā dhanaṃjaya iti sma ha
analyzed: arjunam vayam asmān vā dhanaṃjaya iti sma ha
translated: Either we will kill Arjuna, or Dhananjaya will kill us.

original: tāṃś cālam iti manyante savyasācivadhe vibho
analyzed: tān ca alam iti manyante savyasāci vadhe vibho
translated: And they consider Savyasachi's death to be certain, O lord.

original: pārthivāḥ sa bhavān rājann akasmād vyathate katham
analyzed: pārthivāḥ sa bhavān rājan akasmāt vyathate katham
translated: How then, O king, are you suddenly distressed?

original: bhīmasene ca nihate ko 'nyo yudhyeta bhārata
analyzed: bhīmasene ca nihate kaḥ nyaḥ yudhyeta bhārata
translated: And if Bhimasena is killed, who else will fight, O Bharata?

original: pareṣāṃ tan mamācakṣva yadi vettha paraṃtapa
analyzed: pareṣām tat mama ācakṣva yadi vettha paraṃtapa
translated: Tell me that, O scorcher of enemies, if you know it.

original: pāñcāleṣu ca bhagneṣu ko 'nyaḥ sthātum ihārhati
analyzed: pāñcāleṣu ca bhagneṣu kaḥ nyaḥ sthātum iha arhati
translated: When the Panchalas are shattered, who else is fit to stand here?

original: pañca te bhrātaraḥ sarve dhṛṣṭadyumno 'tha sātyakiḥ
analyzed: pañca te bhrātaraḥ sarve
translated: Your five brothers, all of them, and Dhrishtadyumna, and Satyaki,

original: pareṣāṃ sapta ye rājan yodhāḥ paramakaṃ balam
analyzed: pareṣām sapta ye rājan yodhāḥ paramakam balam
translated: And the seven on the other side, O king, who are the greatest strength of the enemy.

analyzed: asmākam tu viśiṣṭāḥ ye bhīṣma droṇa kṛpa ādayaḥ
translated: But those who are superior to us are Bhishma, Drona, Kripa and others.

analyzed: drauṇiḥ vaikartanaḥ karṇaḥ somadattaḥ tha bāhlikaḥ
translated: The son of Drona, Karna Vaikartana, Somadatta, Bahlika,

analyzed: prāgjyotiṣa adhipaḥ śalyaḥ āvantyaḥ tha jayadrathaḥ
translated: Shalya the lord of Pragjyotisha, Jayadratha of Avanti,

original: duḥśāsano durmukhaś ca duḥsahaś ca viśāṃ pate
analyzed: duḥśāsanaḥ durmukhaḥ ca duḥsahaḥ ca viśām pate
translated: Duhshasana, Durmukha, and Duhshala, O lord of the people,

analyzed: śrutāyuḥ citrasenaḥ ca purumitraḥ viviṃśatiḥ
translated: Shrutayu, Chitrasena, Purumitra, Vivimshati,

original: śalo bhūriśravāś cobhau vikarṇaś ca tavātmajaḥ
analyzed: śalaḥ bhūriśravāḥ ca ubhau vikarṇaḥ ca tava ātmajaḥ
translated: Shalya, Bhurishrava, both of them, and Vikarna, your son,

original: akṣauhiṇyo hi me rājan daśaikā ca samāhṛtāḥ
analyzed: akṣauhiṇyaḥ hi me rājan daśa ekā ca samāhṛtāḥ
translated: I have assembled eleven and a half Akshauhinis, O king,

original: nyūnāḥ pareṣāṃ saptaiva kasmān me syāt parājayaḥ
analyzed: nyūnāḥ pareṣām sapta eva kasmāt me syāt parājayaḥ
translated: The enemy has only seven, less than mine. How can I be defeated?

original: balaṃ triguṇato hīnaṃ yodhyaṃ prāha bṛhaspatiḥ
analyzed: balam triguṇataḥ hīnam yodhyam prāha bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Brihaspati has said that an army which is one-third less should be fought.

original: parebhyas triguṇā ceyaṃ mama rājann anīkinī
analyzed: parebhyaḥ triguṇā ca iyam mama rājan anīkinī
translated: O king, this army of mine is three times greater than the enemy's.

original: guṇahīnaṃ pareṣāṃ ca bahu paśyāmi bhārata
analyzed: guṇa hīnam pareṣām ca bahu paśyāmi bhārata
translated: I see that the enemy's army is inferior in many ways, O descendant of Bharata.

original: guṇodayaṃ bahuguṇam ātmanaś ca viśāṃ pate
analyzed: guṇa udayam bahuguṇam ātmanaḥ ca viśām pate
translated: The rise of qualities, the many qualities of oneself, O lord of the people.

original: etat sarvaṃ samājñāya balāgryaṃ mama bhārata
analyzed: etat sarvam samājñāya bala agryam mama bhārata
translated: Having understood all this, O descendant of Bharata, the foremost of my army,

original: nyūnatāṃ pāṇḍavānāṃ ca na mohaṃ gantum arhasi
analyzed: nyūna tām pāṇḍavānām ca na moham gantum arhasi
translated: The inferiority of the Pandavas, you should not fall into delusion.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: ity uktvā saṃjayaṃ bhūyaḥ paryapṛcchata bhārata
analyzed: iti uktvā saṃjayam bhūyas paryapṛcchata bhārata
translated: Having said this, he again asked Sanjaya, O descendant of Bharata,

analyzed: vidhitsuḥ prāpta kālāni jñātvā parapuraṃjayaḥ
translated: Desiring to do what was timely, knowing the conqueror of enemy cities,

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

original: akṣauhiṇīḥ sapta labdhvā rājabhiḥ saha saṃjaya
analyzed: akṣauhiṇīḥ sapta labdhvā rājabhiḥ saha saṃjaya
translated: Having obtained seven akshouhinis, O Sanjaya, along with the kings,

analyzed: su cetasaḥ mahā iṣvāsān indraḥ pi sahitaḥ maraiḥ

original: aśaktaḥ samare jetuṃ kiṃ punas tāta pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: aśaktaḥ samare jetum kim punar tāta pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: Is incapable of defeating them in battle, how much more so the Pandavas, O father?

original: sarvā ca pṛthivī sṛṣṭā madarthe tāta pāṇḍavān
analyzed: sarvā ca pṛthivī sṛṣṭā mad arthe tāta pāṇḍavān
translated: The entire earth has been created for my sake, O father, to restrain the Pandavas,

analyzed: āryān dhṛtimataḥ śūrān agni kalpān prabādhitum
translated: Those noble, patient, heroic ones, equal to the fire.

original: na māmakān pāṇḍavās te samarthāḥ prativīkṣitum
analyzed: na māmakān pāṇḍavāḥ te samarthāḥ prativīkṣitum
translated: The Pandavas are not capable of even looking at my troops,

original: parākrānto hy ahaṃ pāṇḍūn saputrān yoddhum āhave
analyzed: parākrāntaḥ hi aham pāṇḍūn sa putrān yoddhum āhave
translated: For I am ready to fight the Pandavas with their sons in battle.

original: matpriyaṃ pārthivāḥ sarve ye cikīrṣanti bhārata
analyzed: mad priyam pārthivāḥ sarve ye cikīrṣanti bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, all those kings who wish to do what is pleasing to me,

original: te tān āvārayiṣyanti aiṇeyān iva tantunā
analyzed: te tān āvārayiṣyanti aiṇeyān iva tantunā
translated: They will restrain them like deer with a net.

analyzed: mahatā ratha vaṃśena śara jālaiḥ ca māmakaiḥ
translated: With a large array of chariots and nets of arrows from my side,

analyzed: abhidrutāḥ bhaviṣyanti pāñcālāḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ saha
translated: The Panchalas and Pandavas will be pursued.

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: unmatta iva me putro vilapaty eṣa saṃjaya
analyzed: unmattaḥ iva me putraḥ vilapati eṣa saṃjaya
translated: O Sanjaya, my son is lamenting like a madman,

original: na hi śakto yudhā jetuṃ dharmarājaṃ yudhiṣṭhiram
analyzed: na hi śaktaḥ yudhā jetum dharmarājam yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: For he is not able to conquer Yudhishthira, the king of Dharma, in battle.

original: jānāti hi sadā bhīṣmaḥ pāṇḍavānāṃ yaśasvinām
analyzed: jānāti hi sadā bhīṣmaḥ pāṇḍavānām yaśasvinām
translated: Bhishma always knows the power of the illustrious Pandavas,

analyzed: balavat tām sa putrāṇām dharma jñānām mahātmanām
translated: The great-souled ones who know Dharma, along with their sons.

original: yato nārocayam ahaṃ vigrahaṃ tair mahātmabhiḥ
analyzed: yatas na arocayam aham vigraham taiḥ mahātmabhiḥ
translated: Therefore, I did not approve of a war with those great souls.

original: kiṃ tu saṃjaya me brūhi punas teṣāṃ viceṣṭitam🔽kas tāṃs tarasvino bhūyaḥ saṃdīpayati pāṇḍavān
analyzed: kim tu saṃjaya me brūhi punar teṣām viceṣṭitam  kaḥ tān tarasvinaḥ bhūyas saṃdīpayati pāṇḍavān
translated: But tell me again, O Sanjaya, what they are doing.🔽Who is again inflaming those swift Pandavas,

analyzed: arciṣmataḥ mahā iṣvāsān haviṣā pāvakān iva
translated: Those illustrious great archers, like oblations into a fire?

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ sadā eva etān saṃdīpayati bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, Dhrishtadyumna always inflames them,

original: yudhyadhvam iti mā bhaiṣṭa yuddhād bharatasattamāḥ
analyzed: yudhyadhvam iti mā bhaiṣṭa yuddhāt bharata sattamāḥ
translated: Saying 'Fight! Do not be afraid of battle, best of the Bharata race!'

original: ye ke cit pārthivās tatra dhārtarāṣṭreṇa saṃvṛtāḥ
analyzed: ye ke cit pārthivāḥ tatra dhārtarāṣṭreṇa saṃvṛtāḥ
translated: Those kings who were surrounded by Dhritarashtra's son,

analyzed: yuddhe samāgamiṣyanti tumule kavaca hrade
translated: Will come to fight in that tumultuous lake of armor.

original: tān sarvān āhave kruddhān sānubandhān samāgatān
analyzed: tān sarvān āhave kruddhān sa anubandhān samāgatān
translated: I alone will receive all those angry ones who have assembled with their followers

original: aham ekaḥ samādāsye timir matsyān ivaudakān
analyzed: aham ekaḥ samādāsye timiḥ matsyān iva audakān
translated: in battle, like the ocean receives the rivers.

original: bhīṣmaṃ droṇaṃ kṛpaṃ karṇaṃ drauṇiṃ śalyaṃ suyodhanam
analyzed: bhīṣmam droṇam kṛpam karṇam drauṇim śalyam suyodhanam
translated: Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, Karna, Ashvatthama, Shalya, and Suyodhana

analyzed: etān ca api nirotsyāmi velā iva makara ālayam
translated: I will restrain all of them, like the shore restrains the abode of makaras.

original: tathā bruvāṇaṃ dharmātmā prāha rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: tathā bruvāṇam dharma ātmā prāha rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: To him who spoke thus, the righteous king Yudhishthira said:

original: tava dhairyaṃ ca vīryaṃ ca pāñcālāḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ saha
analyzed: tava dhairyam ca vīryam ca pāñcālāḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ saha
translated: The Panchalas and the Pandavas all rely on your patience and valor.

original: sarve samadhirūḍhāḥ sma saṃgrāmān naḥ samuddhara
analyzed: sarve samadhirūḍhāḥ sma saṃgrāmāt naḥ samuddhara
translated: Help us to rise above this battle.

analyzed: jānāmi tvām mahā bāho kṣatra dharme vyavasthitam
translated: I know you, O mighty-armed one, who are established in the duty of a kshatriya.

analyzed: samartham ekam paryāptam kauravāṇām yuyutsatām
translated: You alone are capable and sufficient for the Kauravas who desire to fight.

original: bhavatā yad vidhātavyaṃ tan naḥ śreyaḥ paraṃtapa
analyzed: bhavatā yat vidhātavyam tat naḥ śreyaḥ paraṃtapa
translated: O scorcher of enemies, whatever you decide will be for our welfare.

analyzed: kauravāṇām vinigrahe
translated: In restraining the Kauravas

analyzed: purastāt upayātānām
translated: who have come before us

analyzed: saṃgrāmāt apayātānām bhagnānām śaraṇa eṣiṇām
translated: and who have retreated from the battle, who are defeated and seeking refuge,

original: pauruṣaṃ darśayañ śūro yas tiṣṭhed agrataḥ pumān
analyzed: pauruṣam śūraḥ yaḥ tiṣṭhet agratas pumān
translated: the hero who displays his manliness and stands at the forefront,

original: krīṇīyāt taṃ sahasreṇa nītiman nāma tat padam
analyzed: krīṇīyāt tam sahasreṇa nītimat nāma tat padam
translated: he can be bought for a thousand, that is the meaning of the word 'netimant'.

original: sa tvaṃ śūraś ca vīraś ca vikrāntaś ca nararṣabha
analyzed: sa tvam śūraḥ ca vīraḥ ca vikrāntaḥ ca nara ṛṣabha
translated: You are a hero, a warrior, and a valiant one, O bull among men,

analyzed: bhaya ārtānām paritrātā saṃyugeṣu na saṃśayaḥ
translated: there is no doubt that you are the protector of those who are frightened in battles.

analyzed: evam bruvati kaunteye dharma ātmani yudhiṣṭhire
translated: When the Dharma-minded Kounteya Yudhishthira was speaking thus,

analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ uvāca idam mām vacaḥ gata sādhvasaḥ
translated: Dhrishtadyumna, free from fear, spoke these words to me:

original: sarvāñ janapadān sūta yodhā duryodhanasya ye
analyzed: sarvām janapadān sūta yodhāḥ duryodhanasya ye
translated: O charioteer, tell all the people, the warriors who are on Duryodhana's side,

analyzed: sa vāhlīkān kurūn brūyāḥ prātipeyām śaradvataḥ
translated: the Bahlikas, the Kurus, the descendants of Pratipa and Sharadvata,

analyzed: sūtaputram tathā droṇam saha putram jayadratham
translated: the son of the charioteer, Drona, with his son, Jayadratha,

original: duḥśāsanaṃ vikarṇaṃ ca tathā duryodhanaṃ nṛpam
analyzed: duḥśāsanam vikarṇam ca tathā duryodhanam nṛpam
translated: Dushasana, Vikarna, and also King Duryodhana,

original: bhīṣmaṃ caiva brūhi gatvā tvam āśu /
analyzed: bhīṣmam ca eva brūhi gatvā tvam āśu
translated: and also Bhishma, having gone to them quickly.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiram sādhunā eva abhyupeta
translated: Approach Yudhishthira with good intentions.

analyzed: mā vaḥ vadhīt arjunaḥ deva guptaḥ
translated: Let not Arjuna, protected by the gods, slay you.

analyzed: kṣipram yācadhvam pāṇḍavam loka vīram
translated: Quickly beg the Pāṇḍava, the hero of the world,

analyzed: rājyam daddhvam dharmarājasya tūrṇam
translated: quickly give back the kingdom to King Yudhishthira.

original: naitādṛśo hi yodho 'sti pṛthivyām iha kaś cana
analyzed: na etādṛśaḥ hi yodhaḥ sti pṛthivyām iha kaḥ cana
translated: For there is no warrior on this earth like him,

analyzed: yathāvidhaḥ savyasācī pāṇḍavaḥ śastra vittamaḥ
translated: as Savyasachin, the Pāṇḍava, is the best among those who know weapons.

original: devair hi saṃbhṛto divyo ratho gāṇḍīvadhanvanaḥ
analyzed: devaiḥ hi saṃbhṛtaḥ divyaḥ rathaḥ gāṇḍīvadhanvanaḥ
translated: For the divine chariot of the wielder of the Gāṇḍīva bow was assembled by the gods,

original: na sa jeyo manuṣyeṇa mā sma kṛdhvaṃ mano yudhi
analyzed: na sa jeyaḥ manuṣyeṇa mā sma kṛdhvam manaḥ yudhi
translated: He cannot be conquered by a man. Do not set your mind on fighting.

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

analyzed: kṣatra tejāḥ brahmacārī kaumārāt api pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: The Pandava is a brahmachari, with the splendor of a Kshatriya, and has been so since his youth.

original: tena saṃyugam eṣyanti mandā vilapato mama
analyzed: tena saṃyugam eṣyanti mandāḥ vilapataḥ mama
translated: The foolish ones will go to fight with him, even though I lament.

analyzed: duryodhana nivartasva yuddhāt bharata sattama
translated: O Duryodhana, turn back from this war, O best of the Bharata lineage!

original: na hi yuddhaṃ praśaṃsanti sarvāvastham ariṃdama
analyzed: na hi yuddham praśaṃsanti sarva avastham ariṃdama
translated: For war is not praised in any situation, O destroyer of enemies.

original: alam ardhaṃ pṛthivyās te sahāmātyasya jīvitum
analyzed: alam ardham pṛthivyāḥ te saha amātyasya jīvitum
translated: It is enough for you and your ministers to live on half of the earth.

analyzed: prayaccha pāṇḍu putrāṇām yathocitam ariṃdama
translated: Give to the sons of Pandu what is rightfully theirs, O destroyer of enemies.

original: etad dhi kuravaḥ sarve manyante dharmasaṃhitam
analyzed: etat hi kuravaḥ sarve manyante dharma saṃhitam
translated: For this is what all the Kurus consider to be in accordance with dharma,

original: yat tvaṃ praśāntim icchethāḥ pāṇḍuputrair mahātmabhiḥ
analyzed: yat tvam praśāntim icchethāḥ pāṇḍu putraiḥ mahātmabhiḥ
translated: that you should seek peace with the great-souled sons of Pandu.

original: aṅgemāṃ samavekṣasva putra svām eva vāhinīm🔽jāta eva tava srāvas tvaṃ tu mohān na budhyase
analyzed: aṅga imām samavekṣasva putra svām eva vāhinīm  jātaḥ eva tava srāvaḥ tvam tu mohāt na budhyase
translated: Look at this army of your own sons, O king.🔽Your own destruction has already taken place, but you do not understand due to delusion.

original: na hy ahaṃ yuddham icchāmi naitad icchati bāhlikaḥ🔽na ca bhīṣmo na ca droṇo nāśvatthāmā na saṃjayaḥ
analyzed: na hi aham yuddham icchāmi na etat icchati bāhlikaḥ  na ca bhīṣmaḥ na ca droṇaḥ na aśvatthāmā na saṃjayaḥ
translated: For I do not desire war, nor does Bahlika,🔽nor Bhishma, nor Drona, nor Ashvatthama, nor Sanjaya,

original: na somadatto na śalyo na kṛpo yuddham icchati
analyzed: na somadattaḥ na śalyaḥ na kṛpaḥ yuddham icchati
translated: nor Somadatta, nor Shalya, nor Kripa desire war.

analyzed: satyavrataḥ purumitraḥ jayaḥ bhūriśravāḥ tathā
translated: Satyavrata, Purumitra, Jaya, Bhurishrava,

analyzed: yeṣu saṃpratitiṣṭheyuḥ kuravaḥ pīḍitāḥ paraiḥ
translated: In whom the Kurus, afflicted by the enemy, may find support,

original: te yuddhaṃ nābhinandanti tat tubhyaṃ tāta rocatām
analyzed: te yuddham na abhinandanti tat tubhyam tāta rocatām
translated: They do not delight in war, but that is pleasing to you, dear.

original: na tvaṃ karoṣi kāmena karṇaḥ kārayitā tava
analyzed: na tvam karoṣi kāmena karṇaḥ kārayitā tava
translated: You do not act out of desire, Karna will make you act.

original: duḥśāsanaś ca pāpātmā śakuniś cāpi saubalaḥ
analyzed: duḥśāsanaḥ ca pāpa ātmā śakuniḥ ca api saubalaḥ
translated: And Duhshasana of wicked soul, and Shakuni the son of Subala,

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

original: nāhaṃ bhavati na droṇe nāśvatthāmni na saṃjaye
analyzed: na aham bhavati na droṇe na aśvatthāmni na saṃjaye
translated: I do not place the burden on Drona, nor on Ashvatthama, nor on Sanjaya,

original: na vikarṇe na kāmboje na kṛpe na ca bāhlike
analyzed: na vikarṇe na kāmboje na kṛpe na ca bāhlike
translated: Nor on Vikarna, nor on the Kamboja, nor on Kripa, nor on Bahlika,

analyzed: satyavrate purumitre bhūriśravasi vā punar
translated: Nor on Satyavrata, nor on Purumitra, nor on Bhurishrava,

original: anyeṣu vā tāvakeṣu bhāraṃ kṛtvā samāhvaye
analyzed: anyeṣu vā tāvakeṣu bhāram kṛtvā samāhvaye
translated: Nor on any of your own people, I challenge them all.

original: ahaṃ ca tāta karṇaś ca raṇayajñaṃ vitatya vai
analyzed: aham ca tāta karṇaḥ ca raṇa yajñam vitatya vai
translated: And I, dear, and Karna, having spread out the sacrifice of war,

original: yudhiṣṭhiraṃ paśuṃ kṛtvā dīkṣitau bharatarṣabha🔽ratho vedī sruvaḥ khaḍgo gadā sruk kavacaṃ sadaḥ
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiram paśum kṛtvā dīkṣitau bharata ṛṣabha  rathaḥ vediḥ sruvaḥ khaḍgaḥ gadā sruc kavacam sadaḥ
translated: Having made Yudhishthira the sacrificial animal, we are consecrated, O bull of the Bharata race.🔽The chariot is the altar, the sword is the sacrificial ladle, the mace is the sacrificial spoon, the armor is the sacrificial enclosure,

original: cāturhotraṃ ca dhuryā me śarā darbhā havir yaśaḥ🔽ātmayajñena nṛpate iṣṭvā vaivasvataṃ raṇe
analyzed: cāturhotram ca dhuryāḥ me śarāḥ darbhāḥ haviḥ yaśaḥ  ātma yajñena nṛpate iṣṭvā vaivasvatam raṇe
translated: The four Vedas are my draft animals, the arrows are the darbha grass, the oblation is fame,🔽Having worshipped Yama, the god of death, in battle with the sacrifice of the self,

original: vijitya svayam eṣyāvo hatāmitrau śriyā vṛtau
analyzed: vijitya svayam eṣyāvaḥ hata amitrau śriyā vṛtau
translated: Having conquered, we will return ourselves, our enemies slain, surrounded by prosperity.

original: ahaṃ ca tāta karṇaś ca bhrātā duḥśāsanaś ca me
analyzed: aham ca tāta karṇaḥ ca bhrātā duḥśāsanaḥ ca me
translated: O father, Karna, and my brother Duhshasana,

original: ete vayaṃ haniṣyāmaḥ pāṇḍavān samare trayaḥ🔽ahaṃ hi pāṇḍavān hatvā praśāstā pṛthivīm imām
analyzed: ete vayam haniṣyāmaḥ pāṇḍavān samare trayaḥ  aham hi pāṇḍavān hatvā praśāstā pṛthivīm imām
translated: these three of us will kill the Pandavas in battle.🔽For I will rule this earth after killing the Pandavas,

original: māṃ vā hatvā pāṇḍuputrā bhoktāraḥ pṛthivīm imām
analyzed: mām vā hatvā pāṇḍu putrāḥ bhoktāraḥ pṛthivīm imām
translated: or the sons of Pandu will enjoy this earth after killing me.

original: tyaktaṃ me jīvitaṃ rājan dhanaṃ rājyaṃ ca pārthiva
analyzed: tyaktam me jīvitam rājan dhanam rājyam ca pārthiva
translated: I have given up my life, wealth, and kingdom, O king.

original: na jātu pāṇḍavaiḥ sārdhaṃ vaseyam aham acyuta
analyzed: na jātu pāṇḍavaiḥ sārdham vaseyam aham acyuta
translated: I will not live with the Pandavas, O Achyuta.

original: yāvad dhi sūcyās tīkṣṇāyā vidhyed agreṇa māriṣa
analyzed: yāvat hi sūcyāḥ tīkṣṇāyāḥ vidhyet agreṇa māriṣa
translated: For as long as one can pierce with the tip of a sharp needle,

original: tāvad apy aparityājyaṃ bhūmer naḥ pāṇḍavān prati
analyzed: tāvat api a parityājyam bhūmeḥ naḥ pāṇḍavān prati
translated: for that long we cannot abandon even a bit of land to the Pandavas.

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: sarvān vas tāta śocāmi tyakto duryodhano mayā
analyzed: sarvān vaḥ tāta śocāmi tyaktaḥ duryodhanaḥ mayā
translated: O son, I grieve for all of you, Duryodhana has been abandoned by me,

analyzed: ye mandam anuyāsyadhvam yāntam vaivasvata kṣayam
translated: who will follow the slow one to the abode of Yama.

original: rurūṇām iva yūtheṣu vyāghrāḥ praharatāṃ varāḥ
analyzed: rurūṇām iva yūtheṣu vyāghrāḥ praharatām varāḥ
translated: Like tigers among herds of deer, the best among strikers,

original: varān varān haniṣyanti sametā yudhi pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: varān varān haniṣyanti sametāḥ yudhi pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: the assembled Pandavas will kill the best among the best.

original: pratīpam iva me bhāti yuyudhānena bhāratī
analyzed: pratīpam iva me bhāti yuyudhānena bhāratī
translated: The Bharata army seems to me to be going against Yuyudhana,

analyzed: vyastā sīmantinī trastā pramṛṣṭā dīrgha bāhunā
translated: scattered, frightened, crushed by the long-armed one.

original: saṃpūrṇaṃ pūrayan bhūyo balaṃ pārthasya mādhavaḥ
analyzed: saṃpūrṇam pūrayan bhūyas balam pārthasya mādhavaḥ
translated: And Madhava will further increase the strength of Partha, filling it completely.

original: śaineyaḥ samare sthātā bījavat pravapañ śarān
analyzed: śaineyaḥ samare sthātā bīja vat pravapam śarān
translated: The grandson of Shini will stand in battle, sowing arrows like seeds.

analyzed: senā mukhe prayuddhānām bhīmasenaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the forefront of the army, Bhimasena will be engaged in battle.

analyzed: tam sarve saṃśrayiṣyanti prākāram akutobhayam
translated: All will take refuge in him, fearless like a fortress.

analyzed: yadā drakṣyasi bhīmena kuñjarān vinipātitān
translated: When you see elephants brought down by Bhima,

analyzed: viśīrṇa dantān giri ābhān bhinna kumbhān sa śoṇitān
translated: with shattered tusks, mountain-like, with broken temples and bleeding,

original: tān abhiprekṣya saṃgrāme viśīrṇān iva parvatān
analyzed: tān abhiprekṣya saṃgrāme viśīrṇān iva parvatān
translated: and when you see them in battle, like shattered mountains,

original: bhīto bhīmasya saṃsparśāt smartāsi vacanasya me
analyzed: bhītaḥ bhīmasya saṃsparśāt smartāsi vacanasya me
translated: frightened by the touch of Bhima, you will remember my words.

analyzed: nirdagdham bhīmasenena sainyam hata ratha dvipam
translated: When you see the army scorched by Bhimasena, with its chariots and elephants destroyed,

original: gatim agner iva prekṣya smartāsi vacanasya me
analyzed: gatim agneḥ iva prekṣya smartāsi vacanasya me
translated: like the course of a fire, you will remember my words.

original: mahad vo bhayam āgāmi na cec chāmyatha pāṇḍavaiḥ
analyzed: mahat vaḥ bhayam āgāmi na ced śāmyatha pāṇḍavaiḥ
translated: If you do not make peace with the Pandavas, a great fear will come upon you.

original: gadayā bhīmasenena hatāḥ śamam upaiṣyatha🔽mahāvanam iva chinnaṃ yadā drakṣyasi pātitam
analyzed: gadayā bhīmasenena hatāḥ śamam upaiṣyatha  mahā vanam iva chinnam yadā drakṣyasi pātitam
translated: Struck down by Bhimasena with his club, you will attain peace.🔽When you see the army of the Kurus fallen in battle,

original: balaṃ kurūṇāṃ saṃgrāme tadā smartāsi me vacaḥ
analyzed: balam kurūṇām saṃgrāme tadā smartāsi me vacaḥ
translated: like a great forest cut down, then you will remember my words.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: etāvad uktvā rājā tu sa sarvān pṛthivīpatīn

analyzed: tadā eva dharmaḥ ca tapaḥ ca naṣṭam  vaikartanasya adhama pūruṣasya

analyzed: atha ukta vākye nṛpatau tu bhīṣme

analyzed: nikṣipya śastrāṇi gate ca karṇe

analyzed: vaicitravīryasya sutaḥ lpabuddhiḥ
translated: The son of Vichitravirya, of little intelligence,

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ śāṃtanavam babhāṣe
translated: Duryodhana, spoke to Shantanu's son.

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

analyzed: sadṛśānām manuṣyeṣu sarveṣām tulya janmanām
translated: Among men who are equal in every way, of the same birth,

analyzed: vayam ca te pi tulyāḥ vai vīryeṇa ca parākramaiḥ
translated: We are equal to them in valor and prowess,

original: samena vayasā caiva prātibhena śrutena ca
analyzed: samena vayasā ca eva prātibhena śrutena ca
translated: Equal in age, in intelligence, and in learning,

translated: In weapons, in speed, and in skill in battle,

analyzed: pitāmaha vijānīṣe pārtheṣu vijayam katham

original: nāhaṃ bhavati na droṇe na kṛpe na ca bāhlike
analyzed: na aham bhavati na droṇe na kṛpe na ca bāhlike

analyzed: anyeṣu ca narendreṣu parākramya samārabhe
translated: Nor on the other kings, I rely on myself alone.

analyzed: aham vaikartanaḥ karṇaḥ bhrātā duḥśāsanaḥ ca me
translated: I, Vaikartana Karna, and my brother Duhshasana,

analyzed: pāṇḍavān samare pañca haniṣyāmaḥ śitaiḥ śaraiḥ
translated: Will kill the five Pandavas in battle with sharp arrows.

analyzed: tatas rājan mahā yajñaiḥ vividhaiḥ bhūri dakṣiṇaiḥ
translated: Then, O king, with great sacrifices of various kinds, with abundant gifts,

original: brāhmaṇāṃs tarpayiṣyāmi gobhir aśvair dhanena ca
analyzed: brāhmaṇān tarpayiṣyāmi gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ dhanena ca
translated: I will satisfy the Brahmins with cows, horses, and wealth.

original: sukhāny avāpya sahitāḥ kṛtvā karma suduṣkaram
analyzed: sukhāni avāpya sahitāḥ kṛtvā karma su duṣkaram
translated: Having obtained happiness together and performed extremely difficult deeds,

original: visrabdhāḥ svargam eṣyāmaḥ kāle prāpte gatajvarāḥ
analyzed: visrabdhāḥ svargam eṣyāmaḥ kāle prāpte gata jvarāḥ
translated: we will fearlessly go to heaven when the time comes, free from anxiety.

analyzed: atha abravīt mahā rājaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ su durmanāḥ
translated: Then the great king Dhritarashtra, deeply distressed,

analyzed: viduram viduṣām śreṣṭham sarva pārthiva saṃnidhau
translated: spoke to Vidura, the best among the wise, in the presence of all the kings:

analyzed: mohitaḥ mṛtyu pāśena kālasya vaśam āgataḥ
translated: Deluded by the noose of death, under the control of time,

original: tāta karṇena sahitaḥ putro duryodhano mama
analyzed: tāta karṇena sahitaḥ putraḥ duryodhanaḥ mama

analyzed: yadā parikariṣyanti aiṇeyān iva tantunā
translated: when they will be surrounded like deer by a net,

original: ataritrān iva jale bāhubhir māmakā raṇe
analyzed: a taritrān iva jale bāhubhiḥ māmakāḥ raṇe
translated: and my men will fight with their arms in the battle like those without a boat in the water,

analyzed: paśyantaḥ te parān tatra ratha nāga samākulān
translated: seeing those enemies there crowded with chariots and elephants,

analyzed: viduraḥ uvāca
translated: Vidura said:

analyzed: tadā darpam vimokṣyanti pāṇḍavāḥ sa ca keśavaḥ
translated: then the Pandavas and Keshava will give up their pride.

analyzed: iha niḥśreyasam prāhuḥ vṛddhāḥ niścita darśinaḥ
translated: The elders, who have seen the truth, say that self-control is the highest good in this world,

analyzed: brāhmaṇasya viśeṣeṇa damaḥ dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: especially for a brahmin, self-control is the eternal dharma.

original: tasya dānaṃ kṣamā siddhir yathāvad upapadyate
analyzed: tasya dānam kṣamā siddhiḥ yathāvat upapadyate
translated: For him, giving, forgiveness and success are properly obtained.

original: damo dānaṃ tapo jñānam adhītaṃ cānuvartate
analyzed: damaḥ dānam tapaḥ jñānam adhītam ca anuvartate
translated: Self-control, giving, austerity, knowledge and learning follow.

original: damas tejo vardhayati pavitraṃ dama uttamam
analyzed: damaḥ tejaḥ vardhayati pavitram damaḥ uttamam
translated: Self-control increases energy, self-control is the best purifier,

analyzed: vipāpmā vṛddha tejāḥ tu puruṣaḥ vindate mahat
translated: A person who is free from sin and has increased energy obtains greatness.

original: kravyādbhya iva bhūtānām adāntebhyaḥ sadā bhayam
analyzed: kravyādbhyaḥ iva bhūtānām a dāntebhyaḥ sadā bhayam

analyzed: teṣām ca pratiṣedha artham kṣatram sṛṣṭam svayaṃbhuvā

analyzed: indriya abhijayaḥ dhairyam mārdavam hrīḥ acāpalam
translated: Control of the senses, courage, gentleness, modesty, steadiness,

analyzed: akārpaṇyam asaṃrambhaḥ saṃtoṣaḥ śraddadhāna tā
translated: Non-stinginess, non-anger, contentment, faith,

original: etāni yasya rājendra sa dāntaḥ puruṣaḥ smṛtaḥ
analyzed: etāni yasya rāja indra sa dāntaḥ puruṣaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: O king of men, he who has these is said to be self-controlled.

original: kāmo lobhaś ca darpaś ca manyur nidrā vikatthanam
analyzed: kāmaḥ lobhaḥ ca darpaḥ ca manyuḥ nidrā vikatthanam
translated: Desire, greed, pride, anger, sleep, boasting,

analyzed: mānaḥ īrṣyā ca śokaḥ ca na etat dāntaḥ niṣevate
translated: Arrogance, envy, and sorrow - the self-controlled one does not resort to these.

original: ajihmam aśaṭhaṃ śuddham etad dāntasya lakṣaṇam
analyzed: a jihmam a śaṭham śuddham etat dāntasya lakṣaṇam
translated: Straightforwardness, honesty, and purity - these are the characteristics of the self-controlled one.

analyzed: a lolupaḥ tathā alpa īpsuḥ kāmānām a vicintitā  samudra kalpaḥ puruṣaḥ sa dāntaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: Likewise, one who is not greedy, who desires little, who does not think of sensual pleasures,🔽Such a man is said to be self-controlled, like the ocean.

analyzed: su vṛttaḥ śīla saṃpannaḥ prasanna ātmā ātma vid budhaḥ
translated: Well-behaved, endowed with good conduct, with a cheerful mind, knowing the self, wise,

original: prāpyeha loke saṃmānaṃ sugatiṃ pretya gacchati
analyzed: prāpya iha loke saṃmānam sugatim pretya gacchati
translated: Having attained honor in this world, he goes to a good state after death.

original: abhayaṃ yasya bhūtebhyaḥ sarveṣām abhayaṃ yataḥ
analyzed: abhayam yasya bhūtebhyaḥ sarveṣām abhayam yatas
translated: He who has fearlessness from all beings, and fearlessness comes from all,

analyzed: sa vai pariṇata prajñaḥ prakhyātaḥ manuja uttamaḥ

analyzed: sarva bhūta hitaḥ maitraḥ tasmāt na udvijate janaḥ
translated: He is benevolent to all beings, friendly, therefore people are not disturbed by him.

analyzed: samudraḥ iva gambhīraḥ prajñā tṛptaḥ praśāmyati

original: karmaṇācaritaṃ pūrvaṃ sadbhir ācaritaṃ ca yat
analyzed: karmaṇā ācaritam pūrvam sadbhiḥ ācaritam ca yat

analyzed: tat eva āsthāya modante dāntāḥ śama parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Dwelling in that alone, the self-controlled ones rejoice, devoted to tranquility.

analyzed: naiṣkarmyam vā samāsthāya jñāna tṛptaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: Or resorting to non-action, content with knowledge, with senses controlled,

analyzed: kāla ākāṅkṣī caran loke brahma bhūyāya kalpate
translated: Waiting for the right time, wandering in the world, he becomes fit for union with Brahman.

analyzed: śakunīnām iva ākāśe padam na eva upalabhyate
translated: Just as the footprint of birds in the sky cannot be found,

original: evaṃ prajñānatṛptasya muner vartma na dṛśyate
analyzed: evam prajñāna tṛptasya muneḥ vartma na dṛśyate

translated: But one who renounces the household life and is solely devoted to liberation,

analyzed: lokāḥ tejaḥ mayāḥ tasya kalpante śāśvatāḥ divi
translated: For him the worlds of light exist eternally in heaven.

analyzed: viduraḥ uvāca
translated: Vidura said:

analyzed: śakunīnām iha arthāya pāśam bhūmau ayojayat 🔽kaḥ cit śākunikaḥ tāta pūrveṣām iti śuśruma

analyzed: tasmin dvau śakunau baddhau yugapad sama pauruṣau
translated: In that net, two birds were caught simultaneously, both of equal strength.

analyzed: tau upādāya tam pāśam jagmatuḥ khacarau ubhau

analyzed: tau vihāyasam ākrāntau dṛṣṭvā śākunikaḥ tadā
translated: Seeing them flying in the sky, the fowler

analyzed: anvadhāvat anirviṇṇaḥ yena yena sma gacchataḥ

analyzed: tathā tam anudhāvantam mṛgayum śakuna arthinam
translated: Thus, the fowler, who was pursuing the birds,

analyzed: plavamānau hi kha carau padātiḥ anudhāvasi

analyzed: śākunikaḥ uvāca

analyzed: pāśam ekam ubhau etau sahitau harataḥ mama

analyzed: yatra vai vivadiṣyete tatra me vaśam eṣyataḥ

analyzed: vigṛhya ca su durbuddhī pṛthivyām saṃnipetatuḥ

analyzed: tau yudhyamānau saṃrabdhau mṛtyu pāśa vaśa anugau
translated: Those two, fighting fiercely, following the noose of death,

analyzed: upasṛtya a parijñātaḥ jagrāha mṛgayuḥ tadā  evam ye jñātayaḥ rtheṣu mithas gacchanti vigraham

analyzed: saṃbhojanam saṃkathanam saṃpraśnaḥ samāgamaḥ

analyzed: etāni jñāti kāryāṇi na virodhaḥ kadā cana

analyzed: dhūmāyante vyapetāni jvalanti sahitāni ca

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭra ulmukāni iva jñātayaḥ bharata ṛṣabha

original: śrutvā tad api kauravya yathā śreyas tathā kuru
analyzed: śrutvā tat api kauravya yathā śreyaḥ tathā kuru
translated: Having heard that too, O descendant of Kuru, do what is best.

analyzed: vayam kirātaiḥ sahitāḥ gacchāmaḥ girim uttaram

analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ deva kalpaiḥ ca vidyā jambhaka vātikaiḥ
translated: And with Brahmanas who are like gods, who are skilled in the use of knowledge, spells and magic,

analyzed: kuñja bhūtam girim sarvam abhitas gandhamādanam

analyzed: dīpyamāna oṣadhi gaṇam siddha gandharva sevitam
translated: With shining herbs and frequented by Siddhas and Gandharvas.

analyzed: tatra paśyāmahe sarve madhu pītam a mākṣikam  maru prapāte viṣame niviṣṭam kumbha saṃmitam

analyzed: āśīviṣaiḥ rakṣyamāṇam kubera dayitam bhṛśam
translated: Guarded by venomous snakes, greatly loved by Kubera.

original: yat prāśya puruṣo martyo amaratvaṃ nigacchati
analyzed: yat prāśya puruṣaḥ martyaḥ amara tvam nigacchati
translated: Having tasted it, a mortal man attains immortality.

original: acakṣur labhate cakṣur vṛddho bhavati vai yuvā
analyzed: a cakṣuḥ labhate cakṣuḥ vṛddhaḥ bhavati vai yuvā
translated: One who is blind obtains sight, and an old man becomes young again.

analyzed: iti te kathayanti sma brāhmaṇāḥ jambha sādhakāḥ

original: tataḥ kirātās tad dṛṣṭvā prārthayanto mahīpate
analyzed: tatas kirātāḥ tat dṛṣṭvā prārthayantaḥ mahīpate

original: āśābaddhāḥ patanti sma sarva eva gatāsavaḥ
analyzed: āśā baddhāḥ patanti sma sarve eva gatāsavaḥ
translated: All of them fell, bound by hope, their lives gone.

analyzed: tathā eva tava putraḥ yam pṛthivīm ekaḥ icchati
translated: In the same way, this son of yours desires the earth alone,

analyzed: madhu paśyati saṃmohāt prapātam na anupaśyati

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ yoddhu manāḥ samare savyasācinā
translated: Duryodhana is eager to fight Savyasachi in battle.

original: na ca paśyāmi tejo 'sya vikramaṃ vā tathāvidham
analyzed: na ca paśyāmi tejaḥ sya vikramam vā tathāvidham

original: ekena ratham āsthāya pṛthivī yena nirjitā
analyzed: ekena ratham āsthāya pṛthivī yena nirjitā
translated: By whom the earth was conquered alone, mounted on a chariot,

original: bhīṣmadroṇaprabhṛtayaḥ saṃtrastāḥ sādhuyāyinaḥ🔽virāṭanagare bhagnāḥ kiṃ tatra tava dṛśyatām
analyzed: bhīṣma droṇa prabhṛtayaḥ saṃtrastāḥ sādhu yāyinaḥ  virāṭa nagare bhagnāḥ kim tatra tava dṛśyatām
translated: Bhishma, Drona and others, who were well-behaved, were terrified.🔽What was seen by you there, when they were defeated in the city of Virata?

original: pratīkṣamāṇo yo vīraḥ kṣamate vīkṣitaṃ tava
analyzed: pratīkṣamāṇaḥ yaḥ vīraḥ kṣamate vīkṣitam tava
translated: The hero who waits and endures your glance,

original: drupado matsyarājaś ca saṃkruddhaś ca dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: drupadaḥ matsya rājaḥ ca saṃkruddhaḥ ca dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: Drupada, the king of Matsya, and the enraged Dhananjaya,

analyzed: na śeṣayeyuḥ samare vāyu yuktāḥ iva agnayaḥ
translated: Would not leave a remnant in battle, like fires aided by the wind.

analyzed: aṅke kuruṣva rājānam dhṛtarāṣṭra yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: O Dhritarashtra, place King Yudhishthira on your lap.

original: yudhyator hi dvayor yuddhe naikāntena bhavej jayaḥ
analyzed: yudhyatoḥ hi dvayoḥ yuddhe na ekāntena bhavet jayaḥ
translated: For in a battle between two, victory cannot be one-sided.

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: duryodhana vijānīhi yat tvāṃ vakṣyāmi putraka
analyzed: duryodhana vijānīhi yat tvām vakṣyāmi putraka
translated: O Duryodhana, know what I tell you, O son!
