translated: Having said this, with happy minds they approached Janardana,

analyzed: pāṇḍavaiḥ saha rājānaḥ marutvantam iva amarāḥ
translated: the kings together with the Pandavas, like the immortals approaching Marutvanta (Indra).

original: tathā ca duḥsahāḥ sarve sadasyaiś ca nararṣabhāḥ
analyzed: tathā ca duḥsahāḥ sarve sadasyaiḥ ca nara ṛṣabhāḥ
translated: And thus all the unbearable ones, along with the assembly members, those bulls among men,

analyzed: janārdanam samāsādya kuntī putraḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Kunti's son Yudhishthira, having approached Janardana,

analyzed: tatas yudhiṣṭhiraḥ rājan upagamya nara ṛṣabham
translated: Then, O king, Yudhishthira, having approached that bull among men,

analyzed: abhyabhāṣata dāśārham ṛṣabham sarva sātvatām
translated: that bull of all the Satvatas, spoke to Dasharha,

original: ayaṃ sa kālaḥ saṃprāpto mitrāṇāṃ me janārdana
analyzed: ayam sa kālaḥ saṃprāptaḥ mitrāṇām me janārdana
translated: This is the time that has come for my friends, O Janardana,

original: na ca tvad anyaṃ paśyāmi yo na āpatsu tārayet
analyzed: na ca tvat anyam paśyāmi yaḥ naḥ āpatsu tārayet
translated: and I do not see anyone other than you who can save us in this calamity.

original: tvāṃ hi mādhava saṃśritya nirbhayā mohadarpitam
analyzed: tvām hi mādhava saṃśritya nirbhayāḥ moha darpitam
translated: For, O Madhava, having taken refuge in you, we are fearless, though intoxicated with delusion,

analyzed: dhārtarāṣṭram saha amātyam svam aṃśam anuyuñjmahe
translated: we seek our own share, the son of Dhritarashtra with his ministers.

original: yathā hi sarvāsv āpatsu pāsi vṛṣṇīn ariṃdama
analyzed: yathā hi sarvāsu āpatsu pāsi vṛṣṇīn ariṃdama
translated: For, O chastiser of foes, just as you protect the Vrishnis in all calamities,

original: tathā te pāṇḍavā rakṣyāḥ pāhy asmān mahato bhayāt
analyzed: tathā te pāṇḍavāḥ rakṣyāḥ pāhi asmān mahataḥ bhayāt
translated: in the same way, you should protect the Pandavas, save us from this great fear.

analyzed: bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: ayam asmi mahābāho brūhi yat te vivakṣitam
analyzed: ayam asmi mahā bāho brūhi yat te vivakṣitam
translated: Here I am, O mighty-armed one, speak what you wish to say.

original: kariṣyāmi hi tat sarvaṃ yat tvaṃ vakṣyasi bhārata
analyzed: kariṣyāmi hi tat sarvam yat tvam vakṣyasi bhārata
translated: For I will do all that you will say, O Bharata.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhishthira said:

original: mṛdupūrvaṃ sāmamiśraṃ sāntvam ugraṃ ca mādhava
analyzed: mṛdu pūrvam sāma miśram sāntvam ugram ca mādhava
translated: O Madhava, speak to the son of Dhritarashtra in a conciliatory manner, first mildly, then mixed with conciliation, and finally harshly,

original: na tu tan nyāyam āsthāya garhitāś ca tato vayam
analyzed: na tu tat nyāyam āsthāya garhitāḥ ca tatas vayam
translated: but not resorting to what is just, for then we will be condemned.

analyzed: śrutam te dhṛtarāṣṭrasya sa putrasya cikīrṣitam
translated: You have heard what Dhritarashtra and his sons desire.

original: etad dhi sakalaṃ kṛṣṇa saṃjayo māṃ yad abravīt
analyzed: etat hi sakalam kṛṣṇa saṃjayaḥ mām yat abravīt
translated: O Krishna, all this is what Sanjaya told me.

analyzed: tat matam dhṛtarāṣṭrasya saḥ sya ātmā vivṛta antaraḥ
translated: That is Dhritarashtra's opinion, his soul is open to us.

original: yathoktaṃ dūta ācaṣṭe vadhyaḥ syād anyathā bruvan
analyzed: yathoktam dūtaḥ ācaṣṭe vadhyaḥ syāt anyathā bruvan
translated: A messenger should speak as he is told, otherwise he should be killed.

analyzed: apradānena rājyasya śāntim asmāsu mārgati
translated: He seeks peace with us by not giving up the kingdom.

original: lubdhaḥ pāpena manasā carann asamam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: lubdhaḥ pāpena manasā caran asamam ātmanaḥ
translated: Greedy, with an evil mind, acting unequally towards himself,

original: yat tad dvādaśa varṣāṇi vane nirvyuṣitā vayam
analyzed: yat tat dvādaśa varṣāṇi vane nirvyuṣitāḥ vayam
translated: Those twelve years we spent in the forest,

analyzed: chadmanā śaradam ca ekām dhṛtarāṣṭrasya śāsanāt
translated: And that one autumn season deceitfully, by the command of Dhritarashtra.

original: sthātā naḥ samaye tasmin dhṛtarāṣṭra iti prabho
analyzed: sthātā naḥ samaye tasmin dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ iti prabho
translated: O lord, Dhritarashtra will abide by that agreement of ours.

original: nāhāsma samayaṃ kṛṣṇa tad dhi no brāhmaṇā viduḥ
analyzed: na ahāsma samayam kṛṣṇa tat hi naḥ brāhmaṇāḥ viduḥ
translated: We did not break that agreement, O Krishna, the Brahmanas know it.

analyzed: vṛddhaḥ rājā dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ svadharmam na anupaśyati
translated: The old king Dhritarashtra does not see his own duty.

analyzed: paśyan vā putra gṛddhi tvāt mandasya anveti śāsanam
translated: Or, seeing it, he follows the command of the wicked out of affection for his son.

analyzed: suyodhana mate tiṣṭhan rājā asmāsu janārdana
translated: O Janardana, the king, abiding by the opinion of Suyodhana,

original: mithyā carati lubdhaḥ saṃś caran priyam ivātmanaḥ
analyzed: mithyā carati lubdhaḥ san caran priyam iva ātmanaḥ
translated: Acts falsely, greedy, as if it were his own good.

original: ito duḥkhataraṃ kiṃ nu yatrāhaṃ mātaraṃ tataḥ
analyzed: itas duḥkhataram kim nu yatra aham mātaram tatas
translated: What can be more painful than that I am unable to console my mother,

original: saṃvidhātuṃ na śaknomi mitrāṇāṃ vā janārdana
analyzed: saṃvidhātum na śaknomi mitrāṇām vā janārdana
translated: or my friends, O Janardana?

analyzed: kāśibhiḥ cedi pāñcālaiḥ matsyaiḥ ca madhusūdana
translated: O Madhusudana, with the Kasis, Chedis, Panchalas, and Matsyas,

original: bhavatā caiva nāthena pañca grāmā vṛtā mayā
analyzed: bhavatā ca eva nāthena pañca grāmāḥ vṛtāḥ mayā
translated: and with you as my protector, I have chosen five villages.

analyzed: kuśasthalam vṛkasthalam āsandī vāraṇāvatam
translated: Kushasthala, Vrikasthala, Asandi, Varanavata,

original: avasānaṃ ca govinda kiṃ cid evātra pañcamam
analyzed: avasānam ca govinda kim cit evā atra pañcamam
translated: and O Govinda, some other fifth place.

original: pañca nas tāta dīyantāṃ grāmā vā nagarāṇi vā
analyzed: pañca naḥ tāta dīyantām grāmāḥ vā nagarāṇi vā
translated: O father, let these five villages or towns be given to us.

original: vasema sahitā yeṣu mā ca no bharatā naśan
analyzed: vasema sahitāḥ yeṣu mā ca naḥ bharatāḥ naśan
translated: Let us live together in them, and let not the Bharatas perish.

original: na ca tān api duṣṭātmā dhārtarāṣṭro 'numanyate
analyzed: na ca tān api duṣṭa ātmā dhārtarāṣṭraḥ numanyate
translated: But that evil-souled son of Dhritarashtra does not approve of it.

original: svāmyam ātmani matvāsāv ato duḥkhataraṃ nu kim
analyzed: svāmyam ātmani matvā asau atas duḥkhataram nu kim
translated: What can be more painful than that?

analyzed: kule jātasya vṛddhasya para vitteṣu gṛdhyataḥ
translated: For one born in a noble family, grown old, and greedy for the wealth of others,

original: lobhaḥ prajñānam āhanti prajñā hanti hatā hriyam
analyzed: lobhaḥ prajñānam āhanti prajñā hanti hatā hriyam
translated: greed destroys wisdom, and destroyed wisdom destroys shame.

original: hrīr hatā bādhate dharmaṃ dharmo hanti hataḥ śriyam
analyzed: hrīḥ hatā bādhate dharmam dharmaḥ hanti hataḥ śriyam
translated: Destroyed shame destroys dharma, and destroyed dharma destroys prosperity.

original: śrīr hatā puruṣaṃ hanti puruṣasyāsvatā vadhaḥ
analyzed: śrīḥ hatā puruṣam hanti puruṣasya asva tā vadhaḥ
translated: Destroyed prosperity destroys a man, and the destruction of a man's property is his death.

analyzed: asvataḥ hi nivartante jñātayaḥ suhṛda ṛtvijaḥ
translated: For relatives, friends, and priests turn away from one whose property is destroyed.

original: apuṣpād aphalād vṛkṣād yathā tāta patatriṇaḥ
analyzed: apuṣpāt aphalāt vṛkṣāt yathā tāta patatriṇaḥ
translated: As birds, father, from a tree without flowers or fruit,

original: etac ca maraṇaṃ tāta yad asmāt patitād iva
analyzed: etat ca maraṇam tāta yat asmāt patitāt iva
translated: And this death, father, is as if we have fallen from that,

analyzed: jñātayaḥ vinivartante preta sattvāt iva asavaḥ
translated: As life from a ghost, relatives turn away.

original: nātaḥ pāpīyasīṃ kāṃ cid avasthāṃ śambaro 'bravīt
analyzed: na atas pāpīyasīm kām cit avasthām śambaraḥ bravīt
translated: Śambara said there is no more wretched state

original: yatra naivādya na prātar bhojanaṃ pratidṛśyate
analyzed: yatra na eva adya na prātar bhojanam pratidṛśyate
translated: Than where neither today nor tomorrow is food to be seen.

original: dhanam āhuḥ paraṃ dharmaṃ dhane sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitam
analyzed: dhanam āhuḥ param dharmam dhane sarvam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: They say wealth is supreme dharma, everything is established in wealth.

original: jīvanti dhanino loke mṛtā ye tv adhanā narāḥ
analyzed: jīvanti dhaninaḥ loke mṛtāḥ ye tu adhanāḥ narāḥ
translated: The wealthy live in the world, those without wealth are dead men.

original: ye dhanād apakarṣanti naraṃ svabalam āśritāḥ
analyzed: ye dhanāt apakarṣanti naram sva balam āśritāḥ
translated: Those who, relying on their own strength, take away wealth from a man,

original: te dharmam arthaṃ kāmaṃ ca pramathnanti naraṃ ca tam
analyzed: te dharmam artham kāmam ca pramathnanti naram ca tam
translated: They destroy his dharma, artha, kāma, and that man.

original: etām avasthāṃ prāpyaike maraṇaṃ vavrire janāḥ
analyzed: etām avasthām prāpya eke maraṇam vavrire janāḥ
translated: Having reached this state, some people chose death,

original: grāmāyaike vanāyaike nāśāyaike pravavrajuḥ🔽unmādam eke puṣyanti yānty anye dviṣatāṃ vaśam
analyzed: grāmāya eke vanāya eke nāśāya eke pravavrajuḥ  unmādam eke puṣyanti yānti anye dviṣatām vaśam
translated: Some went to the village, some to the forest, some to destruction.🔽Some go mad, others come under the control of enemies,

analyzed: dāsyam eke nigacchanti pareṣām artha hetunā
translated: Some become slaves for the sake of others' wealth.

analyzed: āpad eva asya maraṇāt puruṣasya garīyasī
translated: A man's calamity is worse than death,

original: śriyo vināśas tad dhy asya nimittaṃ dharmakāmayoḥ
analyzed: śriyaḥ vināśaḥ tat hi asya nimittam dharma kāmayoḥ
translated: For it is the cause of the destruction of his wealth, dharma, and love.

original: yad asya dharmyaṃ maraṇaṃ śāśvataṃ lokavartma tat
analyzed: yat asya dharmyam maraṇam śāśvatam loka vartma tat
translated: That which is his eternal death according to the eternal path of the world,

original: samantāt sarvabhūtānāṃ na tad atyeti kaś cana
analyzed: samantāt sarva bhūtānām na tat atyeti kaḥ cana
translated: which is all around for all beings, no one can go beyond.

original: na tathā bādhyate kṛṣṇa prakṛtyā nirdhano janaḥ
analyzed: na tathā bādhyate kṛṣṇa prakṛtyā nirdhanaḥ janaḥ
translated: The naturally poor person is not afflicted as much by Krishna,

original: yathā bhadrāṃ śriyaṃ prāpya tayā hīnaḥ sukhaidhitaḥ
analyzed: yathā bhadrām śriyam prāpya tayā hīnaḥ sukha edhitaḥ
translated: as one who, having obtained good fortune, is deprived of it, being well-nourished.

analyzed: sa tad ātma aparādhena saṃprāptaḥ vyasanam mahat
translated: He, by his own fault, has attained this great calamity.

original: sendrān garhayate devān nātmānaṃ ca kathaṃ cana
analyzed: sa indrān garhayate devān na ātmānam ca katham cana
translated: He never blames himself, but reproaches the gods along with Indra.

analyzed: na ca asmin sarva śāstrāṇi prataranti nigarhaṇām
translated: And all the scriptures do not overcome the blame in this case.

original: so 'bhikrudhyati bhṛtyānāṃ suhṛdaś cābhyasūyati🔽taṃ tadā manyur evaiti sa bhūyaḥ saṃpramuhyati
analyzed: saḥ bhikrudhyati bhṛtyānām suhṛdaḥ ca abhyasūyati  tam tadā manyuḥ eva eti sa bhūyas saṃpramuhyati
translated: He becomes angry with his servants and envies his friends.🔽Then anger comes to him, and he becomes confused again.

original: sa mohavaśam āpannaḥ krūraṃ karma niṣevate
analyzed: sa moha vaśam āpannaḥ krūram karma niṣevate
translated: Having fallen under the sway of delusion, he resorts to cruel actions.

analyzed: pāpa karma atyayāya eva saṃkaram tena puṣyati
translated: For the sake of transgressing sinful deeds, he cultivates a mixture.

analyzed: saṃkaraḥ narakāya eva sā kāṣṭhā pāpa karmaṇām
translated: That mixture is for hell alone, that is the limit of sinful deeds.

original: na cet prabudhyate kṛṣṇa narakāyaiva gacchati
analyzed: na ced prabudhyate kṛṣṇa narakāya eva gacchati
translated: If he does not awaken, O Krishna, he goes to hell alone.

original: tasya prabodhaḥ prajñaiva prajñācakṣur na riṣyati
analyzed: tasya prabodhaḥ prajñā eva prajñācakṣuḥ na riṣyati
translated: His awakening is wisdom itself, the eye of wisdom is not destroyed.

analyzed: prajñā lābhe hi puruṣaḥ śāstrāṇi eva anvavekṣate
translated: For when a person attains wisdom, he looks into the scriptures.

original: śāstranityaḥ punar dharmaṃ tasya hrīr aṅgam uttamam
analyzed: śāstra nityaḥ punar dharmam tasya hrīḥ aṅgam uttamam
translated: He who is ever devoted to the scriptures, has modesty as his best limb.

original: hrīmān hi pāpaṃ pradveṣṭi tasya śrīr abhivardhate
analyzed: hrīmān hi pāpam pradveṣṭi tasya śrīḥ abhivardhate
translated: For the modest one hates sin, and his glory increases.

original: śrīmān sa yāvad bhavati tāvad bhavati pūruṣaḥ
analyzed: śrīmān sa yāvat bhavati tāvat bhavati pūruṣaḥ
translated: As long as he is glorious, he is a man.

analyzed: dharma nityaḥ praśānta ātmā kārya yoga vahaḥ sadā
translated: He who is ever devoted to dharma, whose soul is tranquil, and who is always engaged in his duties,

original: nādharme kurute buddhiṃ na ca pāpeṣu vartate
analyzed: na adharme kurute buddhim na ca pāpeṣu vartate
translated: does not set his mind on unrighteousness, nor does he engage in sinful acts.

original: ahrīko vā vimūḍho vā naiva strī na punaḥ pumān
analyzed: ahrīkaḥ vā vimūḍhaḥ vā nā eva strī na punar pumān
translated: One who is shameless or deluded is neither a woman nor a man.

original: nāsyādhikāro dharme 'sti yathā śūdras tathaiva saḥ
analyzed: na asya adhikāraḥ dharme sti yathā śūdraḥ tathā eva saḥ
translated: He has no right to dharma, just as a Shudra.

original: hrīmān avati devāṃś ca pitṝn ātmānam eva ca
analyzed: hrīmān avati devān ca pitṝn ātmānam eva ca
translated: The modest one protects the gods, the ancestors, and himself.

analyzed: tena amṛta tvam vrajati sā kāṣṭhā puṇya karmaṇām
translated: By him one goes to immortality, that is the limit of the meritorious.

original: tad idaṃ mayi te dṛṣṭaṃ pratyakṣaṃ madhusūdana
analyzed: tat idam mayi te dṛṣṭam pratyakṣam madhusūdana
translated: O Madhusudana, you have seen this directly in me,

original: yathā rājyāt paribhraṣṭo vasāmi vasatīr imāḥ🔽te vayaṃ na śriyaṃ hātum alaṃ nyāyena kena cit
analyzed: yathā rājyāt paribhraṣṭaḥ vasāmi vasatīḥ imāḥ  te vayam na śriyam hātum alam nyāyena kena cit
translated: how, fallen from the kingdom, I am living these days.🔽We are not able to give up our glory by any means.

original: atra no yatamānānāṃ vadhaś ced api sādhu tat
analyzed: atra naḥ yatamānānām vadhaḥ ced api sādhu tat
translated: If it is right for us to be killed while striving in this,

original: tatra naḥ prathamaḥ kalpo yad vayaṃ te ca mādhava
analyzed: tatra naḥ prathamaḥ kalpaḥ yat vayam te ca mādhava
translated: then our first wish is that we and you, O Madhava,

original: praśāntāḥ samabhūtāś ca śriyaṃ tān aśnuvīmahi
analyzed: praśāntāḥ sama bhūtāḥ ca śriyam tān aśnuvīmahi
translated: May we enjoy prosperity with them, who are peaceful and impartial.

analyzed: tatra eṣā paramā kāṣṭhā raudra karma kṣaya udayā
translated: This is the highest point of cruelty, the destruction and rise of terrible deeds,

original: yad vayaṃ kauravān hatvā tāni rāṣṭrāṇy aśīmahi
analyzed: yat vayam kauravān hatvā tāni rāṣṭrāṇi aśīmahi
translated: That we should kill the Kauravas and take possession of their kingdoms.

original: ye punaḥ syur asaṃbaddhā anāryāḥ kṛṣṇa śatravaḥ
analyzed: ye punar syuḥ asaṃbaddhāḥ anāryāḥ kṛṣṇa śatravaḥ
translated: O Krishna! Even those who are unrelated, ignoble enemies,

original: teṣām apy avadhaḥ kāryaḥ kiṃ punar ye syur īdṛśāḥ
analyzed: teṣām api avadhaḥ kāryaḥ kim punar ye syuḥ īdṛśāḥ
translated: Their killing should be done, let alone those who are like this.

original: jñātayaś ca hi bhūyiṣṭhāḥ sahāyā guravaś ca naḥ
analyzed: jñātayaḥ ca hi bhūyiṣṭhāḥ sahāyāḥ guravaḥ ca naḥ
translated: They are our relatives, allies, and elders.

original: teṣāṃ vadho 'tipāpīyān kiṃ nu yuddhe 'sti śobhanam
analyzed: teṣām vadho ti pāpīyān kim nu yuddhe sti śobhanam
translated: Their killing is extremely sinful. What is good in battle?

analyzed: pāpaḥ kṣatriya dharmaḥ yam vayam ca kṣatra bāndhavāḥ
translated: This is the sinful duty of kshatriyas, and we are related to kshatriyas.

original: sa naḥ svadharmo 'dharmo vā vṛttir anyā vigarhitā
analyzed: sa naḥ svadharmaḥ dharmaḥ vā vṛttiḥ anyā vigarhitā
translated: That is our duty, whether it is right or wrong, and any other livelihood is condemned.

analyzed: śūdraḥ karoti śuśrūṣām vaiśyāḥ vipaṇi jīvinaḥ
translated: A shudra serves, a vaishya lives by trade,

original: vayaṃ vadhena jīvāmaḥ kapālaṃ brāhmaṇair vṛtam
analyzed: vayam vadhena jīvāmaḥ kapālam brāhmaṇaiḥ vṛtam
translated: We live by killing, and a brahmin's livelihood is begging.

original: kṣatriyaḥ kṣatriyaṃ hanti matsyo matsyena jīvati
analyzed: kṣatriyaḥ kṣatriyam hanti matsyaḥ matsyena jīvati
translated: A kshatriya kills a kshatriya, a fish lives on fish,

original: śvā śvānaṃ hanti dāśārha paśya dharmo yathāgataḥ
analyzed: śvā śvānam hanti dāśārha paśya dharmaḥ yathāgataḥ
translated: A dog kills a dog, O Dasharha! See how dharma has degenerated.

original: yuddhe kṛṣṇa kalir nityaṃ prāṇāḥ sīdanti saṃyuge
analyzed: yuddhe kṛṣṇa kaliḥ nityam prāṇāḥ sīdanti saṃyuge
translated: O Krishna! In battle, there is always strife, and in battle, life is at stake.

analyzed: balam tu nīti mātrāya haṭhe jaya parājayau
translated: But strength is only for policy; in violence there is victory and defeat.

analyzed: na ātma chandena bhūtānām jīvitam maraṇam tathā
translated: The life and death of beings is not by their own will,

original: nāpy akāle sukhaṃ prāpyaṃ duḥkhaṃ vāpi yadūttama
analyzed: nā api akāle sukham prāpyam duḥkham vā api yadu uttama
translated: Nor is happiness or misery to be obtained out of season, O best of the Yadus.

original: eko hy api bahūn hanti ghnanty ekaṃ bahavo 'py uta
analyzed: ekaḥ hi api bahūn hanti ghnanti ekam bahavaḥ pi uta
translated: For one alone kills many, and many also kill one.

analyzed: śūram kāpuruṣaḥ hanti ayaśasvī yaśasvinam
translated: A coward kills a hero, and one without fame kills one with fame.

original: jayaś caivobhayor dṛṣṭa ubhayoś ca parājayaḥ
analyzed: jayaḥ ca eva ubhayoḥ dṛṣṭaḥ ubhayoḥ ca parājayaḥ
translated: Victory is seen for both, and defeat for both.

analyzed: tathā eva apacayaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ vyapayāne kṣaya vyayau
translated: Similarly, decrease is seen, and loss and destruction in retreat.

original: sarvathā vṛjinaṃ yuddhaṃ ko ghnan na pratihanyate
analyzed: sarvathā vṛjinam yuddham kaḥ ghnan na pratihanyate
translated: In every way, war is a calamity. Who, killing, is not struck back?

analyzed: hatasya ca hṛṣīkeśa samau jaya parājayau
translated: For one who is killed, O Hrishikesha, victory and defeat are the same.

original: parājayaś ca maraṇān manye naiva viśiṣyate
analyzed: parājayaḥ ca maraṇāt manye na eva viśiṣyate
translated: And defeat, I think, is not distinguished from death.

original: yasya syād vijayaḥ kṛṣṇa tasyāpy apacayo dhruvam
analyzed: yasya syāt vijayaḥ kṛṣṇa tasya api apacayaḥ dhruvam
translated: For whom there would be victory, O Krishna, for him also there is certainly decrease.

original: antato dayitaṃ ghnanti ke cid apy apare janāḥ
analyzed: antatas dayitam ghnanti ke cid api apare janāḥ
translated: Some people, at the end, kill even their beloved ones.

analyzed: tasya aṅga bala hīnasya putrān bhrātṝn a paśyataḥ
translated: Of him, whose limbs are weak, who does not see his sons and brothers,

analyzed: nirvedaḥ jīvite kṛṣṇa sarvatas ca upajāyate
translated: Disgust arises towards life, O Krishna, from all sides.

original: ye hy eva vīrā hrīmanta āryāḥ karuṇavedinaḥ
analyzed: ye hi eva vīrāḥ hrīmantaḥ āryāḥ karuṇa vedinaḥ
translated: Those who are brave, modest, noble, and compassionate,

original: ta eva yuddhe hanyante yavīyān mucyate janaḥ
analyzed: te eva yuddhe hanyante yavīyān mucyate janaḥ
translated: They alone are killed in battle, while the younger people escape.

original: hatvāpy anuśayo nityaṃ parān api janārdana
analyzed: hatvā api anuśayaḥ nityam parān api janārdana
translated: Even after defeating the enemies, O Janardana, there is always a sense of incompleteness.

original: anubandhaś ca pāpo 'tra śeṣaś cāpy avaśiṣyate
analyzed: anubandhaḥ ca śeṣaḥ ca api avaśiṣyate
translated: There is a sense of guilt and a feeling of incompleteness remains.

original: śeṣo hi balam āsādya na śeṣam avaśeṣayet
analyzed: śeṣaḥ hi balam āsādya na śeṣam avaśeṣayet
translated: The remainder, having obtained strength, does not leave the remainder.

analyzed: sarva ucchede ca yatate vairasya anta vidhitsayā
translated: He strives for complete destruction, desiring to end the enmity.

original: jayo vairaṃ prasṛjati duḥkham āste parājitaḥ
analyzed: jayaḥ vairam prasṛjati duḥkham āste parājitaḥ
translated: Victory gives rise to enmity; the defeated one remains in sorrow.

analyzed: sukham praśāntaḥ svapiti hitvā jaya parājayau
translated: One who has given up victory and defeat sleeps peacefully in tranquility.

original: jātavairaś ca puruṣo duḥkhaṃ svapiti nityadā
analyzed: jāta vairaḥ ca puruṣaḥ duḥkham svapiti nityadā
translated: A person who has created enmity always sleeps in constant sorrow.

analyzed: anirvṛtena manasā sa sarpe iva veśmani
translated: Like a person in a house with a snake, with an unsatisfied mind.

original: utsādayati yaḥ sarvaṃ yaśasā sa viyujyate
analyzed: utsādayati yaḥ sarvam yaśasā sa viyujyate
translated: One who destroys everything becomes separated from fame.

analyzed: akīrtim sarva bhūteṣu śāśvatīm sa niyacchati
translated: He imposes eternal infamy on all beings.

original: na hi vairāṇi śāmyanti dīrghakālakṛtāny api
analyzed: na hi vairāṇi śāmyanti dīrgha kāla kṛtāni api
translated: Enmities are not pacified, even if created for a long time.

original: ākhyātāraś ca vidyante pumāṃś cotpadyate kule
analyzed: ākhyātāraḥ ca vidyante pumān ca utpadyate kule
translated: There are people who proclaim it, and a man is born in a family.

original: na cāpi vairaṃ vaireṇa keśava vyupaśāmyati
analyzed: na ca api vairam vaireṇa keśava vyupaśāmyati
translated: And enmity is not pacified by enmity, O Keshava.

analyzed: haviṣā agniḥ yathā kṛṣṇa bhūyas eva abhivardhate
translated: Like a fire with oblations, O Krishna, it only increases further.

original: ato 'nyathā nāsti śāntir nityam antaram antataḥ
analyzed: atas nyathā nā asti śāntiḥ nityam antaram antatas
translated: There is no peace in any other way, not even in the end of the world.

analyzed: antaram lipsamānānām ayam doṣaḥ nirantaraḥ
translated: This is the continuous fault of those who seek an end.

analyzed: pauruṣeyaḥ hi balavān ādhiḥ hṛdaya bādhanaḥ
translated: For the powerful mental affliction born of human effort afflicts the heart.

original: tasya tyāgena vā śāntir nivṛttyā manaso 'pi vā
analyzed: tasya tyāgena vā śāntiḥ vā
translated: There is peace either through abandoning it or through the cessation of the mind.

analyzed: atha vā mūla ghātena dviṣatām madhusūdana
translated: Or, O slayer of Madhu, if the root of the enemies is destroyed,

original: phalanirvṛttir iddhā syāt tan nṛśaṃsataraṃ bhavet
analyzed: phala nirvṛttiḥ iddhā syāt tat nṛśaṃsataram bhavet
translated: the fruition of the fruit would be accomplished, that would be more cruel.

original: yā tu tyāgena śāntiḥ syāt tad ṛte vadha eva saḥ
analyzed: yā tu tyāgena śāntiḥ syāt tat ṛte vadhaḥ eva saḥ
translated: But if there is peace through abandoning it, then that is like killing them.

original: saṃśayāc ca samucchedād dviṣatām ātmanas tathā
analyzed: saṃśayāt ca samucchedāt dviṣatām ātmanaḥ tathā
translated: And because of doubt and the destruction of the enemies and oneself,

original: na ca tyaktuṃ tad icchāmo na cecchāmaḥ kulakṣayam
analyzed: na ca tyaktum tat icchāmaḥ na ca icchāmaḥ kula kṣayam
translated: we do not wish to abandon it, nor do we wish for the destruction of the family.

original: atra yā praṇipātena śāntiḥ saiva garīyasī
analyzed: atra yā praṇipātena śāntiḥ sā eva garīyasī
translated: In this case, that peace which is through submission is indeed greater.

original: sarvathā yatamānānām ayuddham abhikāṅkṣatām🔽sāntve pratihate yuddhaṃ prasiddham aparākramam
analyzed: sarvathā yatamānānām ayuddham abhikāṅkṣatām  sāntve pratihate yuddham prasiddham a parākramam
translated: For those striving in every way, desiring peace without war,🔽when conciliation is rejected, war is well-known as the next step.

analyzed: pratighātena sāntvasya dāruṇam saṃpravartate
translated: When conciliation is rejected, something terrible begins.

original: tac chunām iva gopāde paṇḍitair upalakṣitam
analyzed: tat śunām iva go pāde paṇḍitaiḥ upalakṣitam
translated: This is observed by the wise in dogs and cowherds.

analyzed: lāṅgūla cālanam kṣveḍaḥ pratirāvaḥ vivartanam
translated: Wagging the tail, barking, growling, turning back,

analyzed: danta darśanam ārāvaḥ tatas yuddham pravartate
translated: The showing of teeth, the howling, then the battle begins.

original: tatra yo balavān kṛṣṇa jitvā so 'tti tad āmiṣam
analyzed: tatra yaḥ balavān kṛṣṇa jitvā saḥ tti tat āmiṣam
translated: O Krishna, the strong one wins there and eats the flesh.

original: evam eva manuṣyeṣu viśeṣo nāsti kaś cana
analyzed: evam eva manuṣyeṣu viśeṣaḥ na asti kaḥ cana
translated: In the same way, there is no difference at all among men.

original: sarvathā tv etad ucitaṃ durbaleṣu balīyasām
analyzed: sarvathā tu etat ucitam durbaleṣu balīyasām
translated: In every way, this is proper for the strong towards the weak:

original: anādaro virodhaś ca praṇipātī hi durbalaḥ
analyzed: anādaraḥ virodhaḥ ca praṇipātī hi durbalaḥ
translated: Disdain, hostility, for the weak one is prone to bowing down.

original: pitā rājā ca vṛddhaś ca sarvathā mānam arhati
analyzed: pitā rājā ca vṛddhaḥ ca sarvathā mānam arhati
translated: The father, the king, and the old one all deserve respect.

original: tasmān mānyaś ca pūjyaś ca dhṛtarāṣṭro janārdana
analyzed: tasmāt mānyaḥ ca pūjyaḥ ca dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ janārdana
translated: Therefore, O Janardana, Dhritarashtra deserves honor and worship.

analyzed: putra snehaḥ tu balavān dhṛtarāṣṭrasya mādhava
translated: O Madhava, but the love for his son is strong in Dhritarashtra.

analyzed: sa putra vaśam āpannaḥ praṇipātam prahāsyati
translated: Having come under the sway of his son, he will laugh off the bowing down.

original: tatra kiṃ manyase kṛṣṇa prāptakālam anantaram
analyzed: tatra kim manyase kṛṣṇa prāpta kālam anantaram
translated: O Krishna, what do you think is proper to be done next?

original: katham arthāc ca dharmāc ca na hīyemahi mādhava🔽īdṛśe hy arthakṛcchre 'smin kam anyaṃ madhusūdana
analyzed: katham arthāt ca dharmāt ca na hīyemahi mādhava  īdṛśe hi artha kṛcchre smin kam anyam madhusūdana
translated: O Madhava, how can we not be deprived of artha and dharma?🔽O Madhusudana, in such a difficult situation of artha,

analyzed: upasaṃpraṣṭum arhāmi tvām ṛte puruṣottama
translated: whom else can I ask except you, O best of men?

original: priyaś ca priyakāmaś ca gatijñaḥ sarvakarmaṇām
analyzed: priyaḥ ca priya kāmaḥ ca gati jñaḥ sarva karmaṇām
translated: You are dear to us, you desire our welfare, you know the end of all actions.

original: ko hi kṛṣṇāsti nas tvādṛk sarvaniścayavit suhṛt
analyzed: kaḥ hi kṛṣṇa asti naḥ tvādṛś sarva niścaya vid suhṛd
translated: O Krishna, who else is there like you, a well-wisher who knows all the certainties?

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: evam uktaḥ pratyuvāca dharmarājam janārdanaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Janardana replied to Dharmaraja:

original: ubhayor eva vām arthe yāsyāmi kurusaṃsadam
analyzed: ubhayoḥ eva vām arthe yāsyāmi kuru saṃsadam
translated: For the sake of both of you, I will go to the assembly of the Kurus.

original: śamaṃ tatra labheyaṃ ced yuṣmadartham ahāpayan
analyzed: śamam tatra labheyam ced yuṣmad artham ahāpayan
translated: If I can obtain peace there without compromising your interests,

original: puṇyaṃ me sumahad rājaṃś caritaṃ syān mahāphalam
analyzed: puṇyam me su mahat rājan caritam syāt mahā phalam
translated: then, O king, it will be a greatly meritorious and greatly fruitful act for me.

analyzed: mocayeyam mṛtyu pāśāt saṃrabdhān kuru sṛñjayān
translated: I will free the angry Kurus and Srinjayas from the noose of death,

original: pāṇḍavān dhārtarāṣṭrāṃś ca sarvāṃ ca pṛthivīm imām
analyzed: pāṇḍavān dhārtarāṣṭrān ca sarvām ca pṛthivīm imām
translated: the Pandavas, the sons of Dhritarashtra, and all this earth.

analyzed: evam uktaḥ pratyuvāca dharmarājaḥ janārdanam
translated: Thus addressed, Dharmaraja replied to Janardana:

analyzed: bhrātṝṇām samavetānām sa kāle puruṣottamam
translated: At the time when all the brothers were assembled, that best of men (Krishna) said to him (Yudhishthira):

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhishthira said:

original: na mamaitan mataṃ kṛṣṇa yat tvaṃ yāyāḥ kurūn prati
analyzed: na mama etat matam kṛṣṇa yat tvam yāyāḥ kurūn prati
translated: O Krishna, it is not my view that you should go to the Kurus.

original: suyodhanaḥ sūktam api na kariṣyati te vacaḥ
analyzed: suyodhanaḥ su uktam api na kariṣyati te vacaḥ
translated: Suyodhana will not heed your well-spoken words.

original: suyodhanaś ca duṣṭātmā karṇaś ca sahasaubalaḥ
analyzed: suyodhanaḥ ca duṣṭa ātmā karṇaḥ ca saha saubalaḥ
translated: The evil-minded Suyodhana, Karna, and Subala's son (Shakuni),

analyzed: sametam pārthivam kṣatram suyodhana vaśa anugam
translated: together with the assembled Kshatriya kings who follow Suyodhana's lead,

original: teṣāṃ madhyāvataraṇaṃ tava kṛṣṇa na rocaye
analyzed: teṣām madhya avataraṇam tava kṛṣṇa na rocaye
translated: I do not approve of your entering into their midst, O Krishna.

original: na hi naḥ prīṇayed dravyaṃ na devatvaṃ kutaḥ sukham
analyzed: na hi naḥ prīṇayet dravyam na deva tvam kutas sukham
translated: For us, wealth would not bring satisfaction, nor godhood, much less happiness.

original: na ca sarvāmaraiśvaryaṃ tava rodhena mādhava
analyzed: na ca sarva amara aiśvaryam tava rodhena mādhava
translated: Nor is it proper for you to obstruct the sovereignty of all the immortals, O Mādhava.

analyzed: bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Lord said:

analyzed: jānāmi etām mahā rāja dhārtarāṣṭrasya pāpa tām
translated: I know this wickedness of Dhṛtarāṣṭra's son, O great king.

analyzed: avācyāḥ tu bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarva loke mahīkṣitām
translated: But we shall become objects of contempt to all the kings of the world.

original: na cāpi mama paryāptāḥ sahitāḥ sarvapārthivāḥ
analyzed: na ca api mama paryāptāḥ sahitāḥ sarva pārthivāḥ
translated: And all the kings together are not enough to stand before me in anger,

analyzed: kruddhasya pramukhe sthātum siṃhasya iva itare mṛgāḥ
translated: like other deer before a lion.

original: atha cet te pravarteran mayi kiṃ cid asāṃpratam
analyzed: atha ced te pravarteran mayi kim cit asāṃpratam
translated: But if they should do anything improper towards me,

original: nirdaheyaṃ kurūn sarvān iti me dhīyate matiḥ
analyzed: nirdaheyam kurūn sarvān iti me dhīyate matiḥ
translated: I have it in my mind to burn up all the Kurus.

original: na jātu gamanaṃ tatra bhavet pārtha nirarthakam
analyzed: na jātu gamanam tatra bhavet pārtha nirarthakam
translated: O son of Pritha, my going there will never be fruitless.

original: arthaprāptiḥ kadā cit syād antato vāpy avācyatā
analyzed: artha prāptiḥ kadā cit syāt antatas vā api avācya tā
translated: There may be gain of wealth, or at the end even disgrace.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhiṣṭhira said:

original: yat tubhyaṃ rocate kṛṣṇa svasti prāpnuhi kauravān
analyzed: yat tubhyam rocate kṛṣṇa svasti prāpnuhi kauravān
translated: O Kṛṣṇa, if it pleases you, go in peace to the Kauravas.

analyzed: kṛtārtham svastimantam tvām drakṣyāmi punar āgatam
translated: I shall see you again, having accomplished your purpose and returned in safety.

original: viṣvaksena kurūn gatvā bhāratāñ śamayeḥ prabho
analyzed: viṣvaksena kurūn gatvā bhāratām śamayeḥ prabho
translated: O Viṣvaksena, having gone to the Kurus, O lord, you pacify the Bharatas.

original: yathā sarve sumanasaḥ saha syāmaḥ sucetasaḥ
analyzed: yathā sarve sumanasaḥ saha syāmaḥ su cetasaḥ
translated: So that we may all be together, well-disposed and of good cheer.

original: bhrātā cāsi sakhā cāsi bībhatsor mama ca priyaḥ
analyzed: bhrātā ca asi sakhā ca asi bībhatsoḥ mama ca priyaḥ
translated: You are a brother and a friend, and dear to me, O Bibhātsu.

analyzed: sauhṛdena a viśaṅkyaḥ si svasti prāpnuhi bhūtaye
translated: You are trusted by us with friendship. May you attain welfare for your own good.

original: asmān vettha parān vettha vetthārthaṃ vettha bhāṣitam
analyzed: asmān vettha parān vettha vettha artham vettha bhāṣitam
translated: You know us, you know the others, you know the purpose, you know what is said.

original: yad yad asmaddhitaṃ kṛṣṇa tat tad vācyaḥ suyodhanaḥ
analyzed: yat yat asmad hitam kṛṣṇa tat tat vācyaḥ suyodhanaḥ
translated: Whatever is beneficial for us, O Krishna, that should be told to Suyodhana.

original: yad yad dharmeṇa saṃyuktam upapadyed dhitaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: yat yat dharmeṇa saṃyuktam upapadyet hitam vacaḥ
translated: Whatever words are connected with dharma and are appropriate for our welfare,

original: tat tat keśava bhāṣethāḥ sāntvaṃ vā yadi vetarat
analyzed: tat tat keśava bhāṣethāḥ sāntvam vā yadi vā itarat
translated: those you should speak, O Keshava, whether they are conciliatory or otherwise.

analyzed: bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: saṃjayasya śrutaṃ vākyaṃ bhavataś ca śrutaṃ mayā
analyzed: saṃjayasya śrutam vākyam bhavataḥ ca śrutam mayā
translated: I have heard the words of Sanjaya and I have heard yours.

original: sarvaṃ jānāmy abhiprāyaṃ teṣāṃ ca bhavataś ca yaḥ
analyzed: sarvam jānāmi abhiprāyam teṣām ca bhavataḥ ca yaḥ
translated: I know all the intentions of them and of you.

original: tava dharmāśritā buddhis teṣāṃ vairāśritā matiḥ
analyzed: tava dharma āśritā buddhiḥ teṣām vaira āśritā matiḥ
translated: Your mind is inclined towards dharma, while theirs is inclined towards enmity.

original: yad ayuddhena labhyeta tat te bahumataṃ bhavet
analyzed: yat ayuddhena labhyeta tat te bahu matam bhavet
translated: If it could be obtained without war, that would be highly regarded by you.

original: na ca tan naiṣṭhikaṃ karma kṣatriyasya viśāṃ pate
analyzed: na ca tat naiṣṭhikam karma kṣatriyasya viśām pate
translated: But that is not the ultimate duty of a kshatriya, O lord of the people.

original: āhur āśramiṇaḥ sarve yad bhaikṣaṃ kṣatriyaś caret
analyzed: āhuḥ āśramiṇaḥ sarve yat bhaikṣam kṣatriyaḥ caret
translated: All the hermits say that a kshatriya should not live on alms.

original: jayo vadho vā saṃgrāme dhātrā diṣṭaḥ sanātanaḥ
analyzed: jayaḥ vadhaḥ vā saṃgrāme dhātrā diṣṭaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: Victory or death in battle is ordained by the eternal creator.

analyzed: svadharmaḥ kṣatriyasya eṣa kārpaṇyam na praśasyate
translated: This is the inherent duty of a kshatriya. Dejection is not praised.

original: na hi kārpaṇyam āsthāya śakyā vṛttir yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: na hi kārpaṇyam āsthāya śakyā vṛttiḥ yudhiṣṭhira
translated: For, Yudhishthira, one cannot maintain oneself by resorting to meanness.

analyzed: vikramasva mahā bāho jahi śatrūn ariṃdama
translated: Be valorous, O mighty-armed one! Slay the enemies, O chastiser of foes!

analyzed: ati gṛddhāḥ kṛta snehāḥ dīrgha kālam saha uṣitāḥ
translated: They are excessively greedy, attached, and have lived together for a long time.

analyzed: kṛta mitrāḥ kṛta balāḥ dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ paraṃtapa
translated: The sons of Dhritarashtra, O scorcher of enemies, have made friends and formed alliances.

original: na paryāyo 'sti yat sāmyaṃ tvayi kuryur viśāṃ pate
analyzed: na paryāyaḥ asti yat sāmyam tvayi kuryuḥ viśām pate
translated: There is no way, O lord of the people, that they will treat you as an equal.

analyzed: balavat tām hi manyante bhīṣma droṇa kṛpa ādibhiḥ
translated: They consider themselves strong because of Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, and others.

analyzed: yāvat ca mārdavena etān rājan upacariṣyasi
translated: As long as you treat them with gentleness, O king,

original: tāvad ete hariṣyanti tava rājyam ariṃdama
analyzed: tāvat ete hariṣyanti tava rājyam ariṃdama
translated: they will take away your kingdom, O chastiser of enemies.🔽The sons of Dhritarashtra are not capable of fulfilling your desire, O chastiser of enemies,

original: nānukrośān na kārpaṇyān na ca dharmārthakāraṇāt🔽alaṃ kartuṃ dhārtarāṣṭrās tava kāmam ariṃdama🔽etad eva nimittaṃ te pāṇḍavās tu yathā tvayi
analyzed: na anukrośāt na kārpaṇyāt na ca dharma artha kāraṇāt  alam kartum dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ tava kāmam ariṃdama  etat eva nimittam te pāṇḍavāḥ tu yathā tvayi
translated: not out of compassion, not out of meanness, nor for the sake of righteousness or wealth.🔽This is the very reason why the Pandavas, even though they have done what is difficult to do,

analyzed: na anvatapyanta kaupīnam tāvat kṛtvā api duṣkaram
translated: do not regret it, as if they had only made a loincloth.

analyzed: pitāmahasya droṇasya vidurasya ca dhīmataḥ
translated: Of the grandfather, of Drona, of the wise Vidura,

original: brāhmaṇānāṃ ca sādhūnāṃ rājñaś ca nagarasya ca
analyzed: brāhmaṇānām ca sādhūnām rājñaḥ ca nagarasya ca
translated: of the virtuous Brahmanas, of the king, and of the city,

analyzed: paśyatām kuru mukhyānām sarveṣām eva tattvataḥ
translated: while all the chief Kurus looked on, and of all of them truly,

analyzed: dāna śīlam mṛdum dāntam dharma kāmam anuvratam
translated: You were generous, disciplined, self-controlled, devoted to dharma, and always followed dharma.

original: yat tvām upadhinā rājan dyūtenāvañcayat tadā
analyzed: yat tvām upadhinā rājan dyūtena avañcayat tadā
translated: O king, when you were deceitfully defeated by him in the game of dice,

original: na cāpatrapate pāpo nṛśaṃsas tena karmaṇā
analyzed: na ca apatrapate pāpaḥ nṛśaṃsaḥ tena karmaṇā
translated: that sinful and cruel one was not ashamed of that act.

original: tathāśīlasamācāre rājan mā praṇayaṃ kṛthāḥ🔽vadhyās te sarvalokasya kiṃ punas tava bhārata

analyzed: vāgbhiḥ tu apratirūpābhiḥ atudat sa kanīyasam

original: ślāghamānaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ san bhāṣate bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
analyzed: ślāghamānaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ san bhāṣate bhrātṛbhiḥ saha

analyzed: etāvat pāṇḍavānām hi nā asti kim cit iha svakam

analyzed: nāmadheyam ca gotram ca tat api eṣām na śiṣyate

analyzed: kālena mahatā ca eṣām bhaviṣyati parābhavaḥ

analyzed: prakṛtim te bhajiṣyanti naṣṭa prakṛtayaḥ janāḥ
translated: and people with lost fortunes will return to their original state.

analyzed: duḥśāsanena pāpena tadā dyūte pravartite

analyzed: ākṛṣya keśe rudatī sabhāyām rāja saṃsadi
translated: weeping, by her hair in the assembly hall of kings,

analyzed: bhīṣma droṇa pramukhatas gauḥ iti vyāhṛtā muhur
translated: and repeatedly called a cow by those led by Bhishma and Drona.

analyzed: bhavatā vāritāḥ sarve bhrātaraḥ bhīma vikramāḥ

original: dharmapāśanibaddhāś ca na kiṃ cit pratipedire🔽etāś cānyāś ca paruṣā vācaḥ sa samudīrayan
analyzed: dharma pāśa nibaddhāḥ ca na kim cit pratipedire  etāḥ ca anyāḥ ca paruṣāḥ vācaḥ sa samudīrayan
translated: Bound by the noose of dharma, they did not do anything.🔽 Uttering these and other harsh words,

original: ślāghate jñātimadhye sma tvayi pravrajite vanam
analyzed: ślāghate jñāti madhye sma tvayi pravrajite vanam
translated: he boasted in the midst of his relatives when you left for the forest.

analyzed: ye tatra āsan samānītāḥ te dṛṣṭvā tvām anāgasam
translated: Those who were assembled there, seeing you innocent,

analyzed: aśru kaṇṭhāḥ rudantaḥ ca sabhāyām āsate tadā

analyzed: sarve duryodhanam tatra nindanti sma sabhāsadaḥ

original: kulīnasya ca yā nindā vadhaś cāmitrakarśana
analyzed: kulīnasya ca yā nindā vadhaḥ ca amitra karśana
translated: O tormentor of enemies, the censure of a noble person and his death

analyzed: mahā guṇaḥ vadhaḥ rājan na tu nindā kujīvikā
translated: are great virtues, O king, not the censure of a bad life.

analyzed: tadā eva nihataḥ rājan yadā eva nirapatrapaḥ

analyzed: ninditaḥ ca mahā rāja pṛthivyām sarva rājasu

analyzed: īṣat kāryaḥ vadhaḥ tasya yasya cāritram īdṛśam

analyzed: vadhyaḥ sarpaḥ iva anāryaḥ sarva lokasya durmatiḥ

analyzed: garhayiṣyāmi ca eva enam paura jānapadeṣu api

analyzed: tasmin loka parityakte kim kāryam avaśiṣyate

analyzed: manuṣya loka kṣapaṇaḥ tha ghoraḥ

analyzed: nāgān dhvajān ca pratipādayitvā

analyzed: yodhāḥ ca sarve kṛta niśramāḥ te

analyzed: bhavantu hasti aśva ratheṣu yattāḥ

analyzed: sāṃgrāmikam te yat upārjanīyam
translated: Whatever you have to collect for the war,

translated: What prosperity you had before,

analyzed: dyūte hṛtam pāṇḍava mukhya rājyam
translated: The kingdom of the Pāṇḍavas won at dice,

translated: O Madhusudana, because of Duryodhana's anger,

analyzed: dhāraṇaḥ ca indra vatsānām mukuṭānām vigāhanaḥ

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ kulāṅgāraḥ jaghanyaḥ pāpa pūruṣaḥ

analyzed: uvāca bhīmam āsīnam kṛpayā abhipariplutam

original: tvam anyadā bhīmasena yuddham eva praśaṃsasi
analyzed: tvam anyadā bhīmasena yuddham eva praśaṃsasi
translated: You always praise war, O Bhimasena,

analyzed: vadha abhinandinaḥ krūrān dhārtarāṣṭrān mimardiṣuḥ

analyzed: ghorām aśāntām ruśatīm sadā vācam prabhāṣase
