analyzed: labhantām bhavataḥ kāmāt kāmam etam yathā īpsitam
translated: may they obtain from you, as they desire, this desired object.

analyzed: puraṃdaraḥ tha saṃcintya vainateya parākramam
translated: Then Purandara, having reflected on the prowess of Vinata's son,

analyzed: viṣṇum eva abravīt enam bhavān eva dadātu iti
translated: spoke to Vishnu alone: You yourself give it (to him).

analyzed: viṣṇuḥ uvāca

analyzed: īśaḥ tvam asi lokānām carāṇām acarāḥ ca ye
translated: You are the lord of the worlds, of the moving and the unmoving.

analyzed: tvayā dattam adattam kaḥ kartum utsahate vibho
translated: O lord, who can dare to take away what has been given by you?

analyzed: kaṇvaḥ uvāca  prādāt śakraḥ tatas tasmai pannagāya āyuḥ uttamam
translated: Kanva said:🔽Then Shakra gave to that serpent excellent life,

analyzed: na tu enam amṛta prāśam cakāra bala vṛtra hā

analyzed: labdhvā varam tu sumukhaḥ su mukhaḥ saṃbabhūva ha
translated: Having obtained the boon, Sumukha became even more cheerful.

analyzed: kṛtadāraḥ yathākāmam jagāma ca gṛhān prati

analyzed: pratijagmatuḥ abhyarcya devarājam mahā dyutim

analyzed: suparṇaḥ parama kruddhaḥ vāsavam samupādravat

analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

analyzed: bhagavan kim avajñānāt kṣudhām prati bhaye mama

analyzed: kāmakāra varam dattvā punar calitavān asi  nisargāt sarva bhūtānām sarva bhūta īśvareṇa me

analyzed: āhāraḥ vihitaḥ dhātrā kimartham vāryate tvayā
translated: By nature, food has been ordained for me by the Creator, the Lord of all beings. Why do you obstruct it?

analyzed: vṛtaḥ ca eṣa mahā nāgaḥ sthāpitaḥ samayaḥ ca me

analyzed: anena ca mayā deva bhartavyaḥ prasavaḥ mahān

analyzed: etasmin tu anyathā bhūte na anyam hiṃsitum utsahe

analyzed: krīḍase kāmakāreṇa devarāja yathecchakam

original: so 'haṃ prāṇān vimokṣyāmi tathā parijano mama
analyzed: saḥ ham prāṇān vimokṣyāmi tathā parijanaḥ mama

analyzed: ye ca bhṛtyāḥ mama gṛhe prītimān bhava vāsava

analyzed: kaṇvaḥ uvāca
translated: Kanva said:

analyzed: śrutvā suparṇa vacanam su mukhaḥ durmukhaḥ tadā
translated: Having heard Suparna's words, Sumukha and Durmukha

analyzed: tyaktvā rūpam vivarṇaḥ tu sarpa rūpa dharaḥ bhavat
translated: abandoned their forms and became serpents.

analyzed: indraḥ uvāca
translated: Indra said:

analyzed: gatvā viṣṇu samīpam tu pāda pīṭham samāśliṣat

analyzed: na mayā kṛtam vainateya na mām kroddhum tvam arhasi

analyzed: datta abhayaḥ sa su mukhaḥ viṣṇunā prabhaviṣṇunā
translated: Sumukha, who had been granted protection by the powerful Vishnu,

analyzed: śrutvā puraṃdareṇa uktam uvāca vinatā sutaḥ
translated: having heard what Purandara had said, spoke to him.

original: tataḥ puraṃdaro vākyam uvāca garuḍaṃ prati
analyzed: tatas puraṃdaraḥ vākyam uvāca garuḍam prati

analyzed: etat ca eva aham arhāmi bhūyas ca bala vṛtra han
translated: This is what I deserve, and more, O slayer of Bala and Vritra.

analyzed: trailokyasya īśvaraḥ yaḥ ham para bhṛtya tvam āgataḥ

original: tvayi tiṣṭhati deveśa na viṣṇuḥ kāraṇaṃ mama

analyzed: trailokya rāja rājyam hi tvayi vāsava śāśvatam

analyzed: mama api dakṣasya sutā jananī kaśyapaḥ pitā

analyzed: aham api utsahe lokān samastān voḍhum añjasā
translated: I too am capable of bearing all the worlds at once.

analyzed: asahyam sarva bhūtānām mama api vipulam balam

analyzed: mayā api su mahat karma kṛtam daiteya vigrahe
translated: I too have performed great deeds in the battle with the Daityas.

analyzed: śrutaśrīḥ śrutasenaḥ ca vivasvān rocanāmukhaḥ

analyzed: prasabhaḥ kālakākṣaḥ ca mayā api ditijāḥ hatāḥ
translated: Prasabha, Kala-aksha, I too have slain the sons of Diti.

analyzed: yat tu dhvaja sthāna gataḥ yatnāt paricarāmi aham

analyzed: vahāmi ca eva anujam te tena mām avamanyase

analyzed: mayā yaḥ ham viśiṣṭaḥ san vahāmi imam sa bāndhavam

analyzed: avajñāya tu yat te ham bhojanāt vyaparopitaḥ
translated: But because you disregarded me and turned me away from food,

analyzed: tena me gauravam naṣṭam tvattaḥ ca asmāt ca vāsava
translated: my respect for you and for this one, O Vasava, is lost.

analyzed: adityām ye ime jātāḥ bala vikrama śālinaḥ

analyzed: tvam eṣām kila sarveṣām viśeṣāt balavattaraḥ
translated: You are indeed stronger than all of them, especially.

analyzed: saḥ ham pakṣa eka deśena vahāmi tvām gata klamaḥ
translated: So, without fatigue, I carry you with just a part of my wing.

original: vimṛśa tvaṃ śanais tāta ko nv atra balavān iti
analyzed: vimṛśa tvam śanais tāta kaḥ nu atra balavān iti

analyzed: kaṇvaḥ uvāca
translated: Kanva said:

analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā khagasya udarka dāruṇam
translated: Having heard those words of the bird, terrible in their consequences,

analyzed: akṣobhyam kṣobhayan tārkṣyam uvāca ratha cakra bhṛt

analyzed: garutmat manyase tmānam balavantam su durbalam

analyzed: alam asmad samakṣam te stotum ātmānam aṇḍaja

analyzed: tatas sa bhagavān tasya skandhe bāhum samāsajat

analyzed: spṛṣṭa mātraḥ nakha agreṇa garutmān kaśyapa ātmajaḥ

original: āropitaṃ samudvoḍhuṃ bhāraṃ taṃ nāśakad balāt
analyzed: āropitam samudvoḍhum bhāram tam nā aśakat balāt
translated: He was unable to forcibly lift that burden that had been placed on him.

analyzed: nipapāta sa bhāra ārtaḥ vihvalaḥ naṣṭa cetanaḥ

original: yāvān hi bhāraḥ kṛtsnāyāḥ pṛthivyāḥ parvataiḥ saha
analyzed: yāvān hi bhāraḥ kṛtsnāyāḥ pṛthivyāḥ parvataiḥ saha

analyzed: na tu enam pīḍayām āsa balena balavattaraḥ

analyzed: tatas hi jīvitam tasya na vyanīnaśat acyutaḥ

analyzed: vipakṣaḥ srasta kāyaḥ ca vicetāḥ vihvalaḥ khagaḥ

analyzed: vicetāḥ vihvalaḥ dīnaḥ kim cit vacanam abravīt  bhagavan loka sārasya sadṛśena vapuṣmatā

analyzed: bhujena svaira muktena niṣpiṣṭaḥ smi mahī tale
translated: released by itself.

analyzed: kṣantum arhasi me deva vihvalasya alpa cetasaḥ
translated: You should forgive me, O God, who am confused, of little understanding,

analyzed: bala dāha vidagdhasya pakṣiṇaḥ dhvaja vāsinaḥ
translated: and whose wings are scorched by the fire of strength, O bird dwelling on the flag.

original: na vijñātaṃ balaṃ deva mayā te paramaṃ vibho
analyzed: na vijñātam balam deva mayā te paramam vibho
translated: O God, O Lord, I have not known your supreme power

analyzed: tena manyāmi aham vīryam ātmanaḥ sadṛśam paraiḥ
translated: Therefore, I consider my own valor to be unequalled by others

original: tataś cakre sa bhagavān prasādaṃ vai garutmataḥ
analyzed: tatas cakre sa bhagavān prasādam vai garutmataḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One showed favor to Garuḍa

analyzed: mā evam bhūyas iti snehāt tadā ca enam uvāca ha

analyzed: tatas prabhṛti rāja indra saha sarpeṇa vartate
translated: From that time onward, O lord of kings, he lived with the serpent

translated: Thus, having been overpowered by Viṣṇu's strength, he became humbled

analyzed: garuḍaḥ balavān rājan vainateyaḥ mahā yaśāḥ  tathā tvam api gāndhāre yāvat pāṇḍu sutān raṇe
translated: O king, the powerful Garuḍa, the son of Vinatā, of great fame🔽In the same way, O son of Gandhāri, as long as you do not find those heroes, the sons of Pāṇḍu, in battle,

original: nāsādayasi tān vīrāṃs tāvaj jīvasi putraka
analyzed: na āsādayasi tān vīrān tāvat jīvasi putraka
translated: O son, for that long you live

analyzed: bhīmaḥ praharatām śreṣṭhaḥ vāyuputraḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: Bhima, the best of strikers, the greatly powerful son of Vāyu,

analyzed: dhanaṃjayaḥ ca indra sutaḥ na hanyātām tu kam raṇe

analyzed: viṣṇuḥ vāyuḥ ca śakraḥ ca dharmaḥ tau ca aśvinau ubhau

analyzed: ete devāḥ tvayā kena hetunā śakyam īkṣitum

analyzed: viṣṇum gacchāmi aham kṛṣṇam gatim gatimatām varam

analyzed: evam ukte sakhā tasya garuḍaḥ vinatā ātmajaḥ

analyzed: anuśiṣṭaḥ smi devena gālava ajñāta yoninā

analyzed: yasyām pūrvam matiḥ jātā yayā vyāptam idam jagat
translated: in which direction the idea was first generated, by which this world is pervaded,

original: cakṣuṣī yatra dharmasya yatra caiṣa pratiṣṭhitaḥ
analyzed: cakṣuṣī yatra dharmasya yatra ca eṣa pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: where the eyes of Dharma are, and where he is established,

analyzed: hutam yatas mukhaiḥ havyam sarpate sarvatodiśam
translated: from where the oblations offered with the mouth spread in all directions,

original: etad dvāraṃ dvijaśreṣṭha divasasya tathādhvanaḥ🔽yatra pūrvaṃ prasūtā vai dākṣāyaṇyaḥ prajāḥ striyaḥ🔽yasyāṃ diśi pravṛddhāś ca kaśyapasyātmasaṃbhavāḥ
analyzed: etat dvāram dvijaśreṣṭha divasasya tathā adhvanaḥ  yatra pūrvam prasūtāḥ vai dākṣāyaṇyaḥ prajāḥ striyaḥ  yasyām diśi pravṛddhāḥ ca kaśyapasya ātmasaṃbhavāḥ
translated: this is the door, O best of Brahmins, of the day and of the path,🔽in which direction the daughters of Daksha, the women, were first created,🔽in which direction the offspring of Kashyapa have grown,

analyzed: yatomūlā surāṇām śrīḥ yatra śakraḥ bhyaṣicyata
translated: from which the prosperity of the gods has its root, where Shakra was consecrated,

original: surarājyena viprarṣe devaiś cātra tapaś citam
analyzed: sura rājyena viprarṣe devaiḥ ca atra tapaḥ citam
translated: O Brahmin Rishi, the gods and the king of the gods have performed austerities here.

original: etasmāt kāraṇād brahman pūrvety eṣā dig ucyate
analyzed: etasmāt kāraṇāt brahman pūrvā iti eṣā diś ucyate
translated: For this reason, O Brahmin, this direction is called the East.

original: yasmāt pūrvatare kāle pūrvam eṣāvṛtā suraiḥ
analyzed: yasmāt pūrvatare kāle pūrvam eṣā āvṛtā suraiḥ
translated: Because in the very distant past, this direction was first covered by the gods.

original: ata eva ca pūrveṣāṃ pūrvām āśām avekṣatām
analyzed: atas eva ca pūrveṣām pūrvām āśām avekṣatām
translated: And for this very reason, the ancestors, looking towards the eastern direction,

analyzed: pūrva kāryāṇi kāryāṇi daivāni sukham īpsatā
translated: should perform their eastern duties, desiring happiness from the gods.

original: atra vedāñ jagau pūrvaṃ bhagavāṃl lokabhāvanaḥ
analyzed: atra jagau pūrvam bhagavān loka bhāvanaḥ
translated: Here the Lord, the creator of the world, first chanted the Vedas.

original: atraivoktā savitrāsīt sāvitrī brahmavādiṣu🔽atra dattāni sūryeṇa yajūṃṣi dvijasattama
analyzed: atra eva uktā savitrā āsīt sāvitrī brahma vādiṣu  atra dattāni sūryeṇa yajūṃṣi dvijasattama
translated: Here only Savitri was spoken of by Savita among the expounders of Brahman.🔽Here the Yajur Veda was given by Surya, O best of Brahmins.

original: atra labdhavaraiḥ somaḥ suraiḥ kratuṣu pīyate
analyzed: atra labdha varaiḥ somaḥ suraiḥ kratuṣu pīyate
translated: Here the gods, having obtained boons, drink Soma in sacrifices.

original: atra tṛptā hutavahāḥ svāṃ yonim upabhuñjate
analyzed: atra tṛptāḥ hutavahāḥ svām yonim upabhuñjate
translated: Here the fire-gods, being satisfied, enjoy their own womb.

original: atra pātālam āśritya varuṇaḥ śriyam āpa ca
analyzed: atra pātālam āśritya varuṇaḥ śriyam āpa ca
translated: Here Varuna, having resorted to the nether world, obtained prosperity.

analyzed: atra pūrvam vasiṣṭhasya paurāṇasya dvijarṣabha
translated: Here, in the past, of the ancient Vashishtha, O bull among Brahmins,

original: sūtiś caiva pratiṣṭhā ca nidhanaṃ ca prakāśate
analyzed: sūtiḥ ca eva pratiṣṭhā ca nidhanam ca prakāśate
translated: birth, establishment, and death are manifest.

analyzed: oṃkārasya atra jāyante sūtayaḥ daśatīḥ daśa
translated: Here the ten times ten births of Om arise.

original: pibanti munayo yatra havirdhāne sma somapāḥ
analyzed: pibanti munayaḥ yatra havirdhāne sma somapāḥ
translated: Here the Soma-drinking sages drink the oblations in the sacrificial ladle.

original: prokṣitā yatra bahavo varāhādyā mṛgā vane
analyzed: prokṣitāḥ yatra bahavaḥ varāha ādyāḥ mṛgāḥ vane
translated: Where many deer, boars and others are sprinkled in the forest,

analyzed: śakreṇa yatra bhāga arthe daivateṣu prakalpitāḥ
translated: Where Shakra has appointed them for a share among the gods,

original: atrāhitāḥ kṛtaghnāś ca mānuṣāś cāsurāś ca ye
analyzed: atra ahitāḥ kṛtaghnāḥ ca mānuṣāḥ ca asurāḥ ca ye
translated: Here those who are ungrateful and those who are ungrateful to humans and demons,

original: udayaṃs tān hi sarvān vai krodhād dhanti vibhāvasuḥ
analyzed: udayan tān hi sarvān vai krodhāt hanti vibhāvasuḥ
translated: All of them, as they rise, are destroyed by the angry sun.

original: etad dvāraṃ trilokasya svargasya ca sukhasya ca
analyzed: etat dvāram trilokasya svargasya ca sukhasya ca
translated: This is the door to the three worlds and to the happiness of heaven,

analyzed: eṣa pūrvaḥ diśā bhāgaḥ viśāva enam yadi icchasi
translated: This is the eastern direction, if you wish, enter it.

original: priyaṃ kāryaṃ hi me tasya yasyāsmi vacane sthitaḥ
analyzed: priyam kāryam hi me tasya yasya asmi vacane sthitaḥ
translated: For I must do what is pleasing to him in whose words I stand.

original: brūhi gālava yāsyāmi śṛṇu cāpy aparāṃ diśam
analyzed: brūhi gālava yāsyāmi śṛṇu ca api aparām diśam
translated: Speak, Galava, I will go, and listen to the western direction.

analyzed: suparṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Suparna said:

original: iyaṃ vivasvatā pūrvaṃ śrautena vidhinā kila
analyzed: iyam vivasvatā pūrvam śrautena vidhinā kila
translated: This was formerly given by Vivasvat as a fee to his teacher according to the Vedic injunction,

original: gurave dakṣiṇā dattā dakṣiṇety ucyate 'tha dik
analyzed: gurave dakṣiṇā dattā dakṣiṇā iti ucyate diś
translated: And is called the southern direction.

analyzed: atra lokatrayasya asya pitṛ pakṣaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Here the ancestral side of this triple world is established,

analyzed: atra ūṣmapānām devānām nivāsaḥ śrūyate dvija
translated: Here the abode of the Uṣmapānas gods is heard, O twice-born.

original: atra viśve sadā devāḥ pitṛbhiḥ sārdham āsate
analyzed: atra viśve sadā devāḥ pitṛbhiḥ sārdham āsate
translated: Here the Viśvedevas always dwell together with the ancestors,

analyzed: ijyamānāḥ sma lokeṣu saṃprāptāḥ tulya bhāga tām
translated: Being worshipped in the worlds, they have attained equality of share.

original: etad dvitīyaṃ dharmasya dvāram ācakṣate dvija
analyzed: etat dvitīyam dharmasya dvāram ācakṣate dvija
translated: This is said to be the second door of Dharma, O twice-born.

analyzed: truṭiśas lavaśas ca atra gaṇyate kāla niścayaḥ
translated: Here, the determination of time is calculated in fractions and moments.

analyzed: atra deva ṛṣayaḥ nityam pitṛ loka ṛṣayaḥ tathā
translated: Here, the celestial sages, the sages of the world of the ancestors,

analyzed: tathā rājarṣayaḥ sarve nivasanti gata vyathāḥ
translated: and all the royal sages dwell, free from sorrow.

original: atra dharmaś ca satyaṃ ca karma cātra niśāmyate
analyzed: atra dharmaḥ ca satyam ca karma ca atra niśāmyate
translated: Here, dharma, truth, and action are observed.

analyzed: gatiḥ eṣā dvijaśreṣṭha karmaṇā ātma avasādinaḥ
translated: This is the path, O best of Brahmins, for one whose self is afflicted by action.

original: eṣā dik sā dvijaśreṣṭha yāṃ sarvaḥ pratipadyate
analyzed: eṣā diś sā dvijaśreṣṭha yām sarvaḥ pratipadyate
translated: This is the direction, O best of Brahmins, that everyone enters.

original: vṛtā tv anavabodhena sukhaṃ tena na gamyate
analyzed: vṛtā tu anavabodhena sukham tena na gamyate
translated: But it is not easily reached due to lack of understanding.

analyzed: nairṛtānām sahasrāṇi bahūni atra dvijarṣabha
translated: Here, O bull among Brahmins, there are many thousands of inauspicious things

analyzed: sṛṣṭāni pratikūlāni draṣṭavyāni akṛtātmabhiḥ
translated: that should be seen by those who have not purified their selves.

analyzed: atra mandara kuñjeṣu vipra ṛṣi sadaneṣu ca
translated: Here, in the caves of Mandara and the hermitages of the Brahmin sages,

original: gandharvā gānti gāthā vai cittabuddhiharā dvija
analyzed: gandharvāḥ gānti gāthāḥ vai citta buddhi harāḥ dvija
translated: the Gandharvas sing songs, O Brahmin, that captivate the mind and intellect.

original: atra sāmāni gāthābhiḥ śrutvā gītāni raivataḥ
analyzed: atra sāmāni gāthābhiḥ śrutvā gītāni raivataḥ
translated: Here, having heard the Samans sung in songs by Raivata,

analyzed: gata dāraḥ gata amātyaḥ gata rājyaḥ vanam gataḥ
translated: he went to the forest, leaving behind his wife, ministers, and kingdom.

analyzed: atra sāvarṇinā ca eva yavakrīta ātmajena ca
translated: Here, by Savarni and by the son of Yavakrita,

original: maryādā sthāpitā brahman yāṃ sūryo nātivartate
analyzed: maryādā sthāpitā brahman yām sūryaḥ na ativartate
translated: a boundary was established, O Brahmin, which the sun does not transgress.

analyzed: atra rākṣasa rājena paulastyena mahātmanā
translated: Here, by the great-souled king of the Rakshasas, the son of Pulastya,

analyzed: rāvaṇena tapaḥ cīrtvā surebhyaḥ maratā vṛtā
translated: Ravana, having performed austerities, immortality was obtained from the gods.

analyzed: atra vṛttena vṛtraḥ pi śakra śatru tvam īyivān
translated: Here, by his deeds, Vritra also became the enemy of Shakra.

original: atra sarvāsavaḥ prāptāḥ punar gacchanti pañcadhā
analyzed: atra sarva asavaḥ prāptāḥ punar gacchanti pañcadhā
translated: Here, all beings attain their end and go back to the five elements.

analyzed: atra duṣkṛta karmāṇaḥ narāḥ pacyanti gālava
translated: Here, O Galava, men of evil deeds are cooked.

original: atra vaitaraṇī nāma nadī vitaraṇair vṛtā
analyzed: atra vaitaraṇī nāma nadī vitaraṇaiḥ vṛtā
translated: Here is the river named Vaitarani, surrounded by the Vaitaraṇīs.

analyzed: atra gatvā sukhasya antam duḥkhasya antam prapadyate
translated: Having gone here, one attains the end of happiness and the end of misery.

analyzed: atrā āvṛttaḥ dinakaraḥ kṣarate su rasam payaḥ
translated: Here, the sun, having returned, sheds nectar-like water.

original: kāṣṭhāṃ cāsādya dhāniṣṭhāṃ himam utsṛjate punaḥ
analyzed: kāṣṭhām ca āsādya himam utsṛjate punar
translated: And having reached the constellation Dhanistha, it again releases snow.

analyzed: atrā aham gālava purā kṣudhā ārtaḥ paricintayan
translated: Here, O Galava, I, being afflicted with hunger in the past, thinking,

analyzed: labdhavān yudhyamānau dvau bṛhantau gaja kacchapau
translated: obtained two fighting huge elephants and a tortoise.

original: atra śakradhanur nāma sūryāj jāto mahān ṛṣiḥ
analyzed: atra śakradhanuḥ nāma sūryāt jātaḥ mahān ṛṣiḥ
translated: Here, the great sage named Śakradhanuḥ, born from the sun,

original: vidur yaṃ kapilaṃ devaṃ yenāttāḥ sagarātmajāḥ
analyzed: viduḥ yam kapilam devam yena āttāḥ sagara ātmajāḥ
translated: whom they know as the god Kapila, by whom the sons of Sagara were destroyed.

original: atra siddhāḥ śivā nāma brāhmaṇā vedapāragāḥ
analyzed: atra siddhāḥ śivāḥ nāma brāhmaṇāḥ vedapāragāḥ
translated: Here, the Brahmanas named Śiva, who have mastered the Vedas, have attained perfection.

analyzed: adhītya sa khilān vedān ālabhante yama kṣayam
translated: Having studied the Vedas in their entirety, they attain Yama's abode.

analyzed: atra bhogavatī nāma purī vāsuki pālitā
translated: Here is the city named Bhogavati, ruled by Vasuki,

analyzed: takṣakeṇa ca nāgena tathā eva airāvatena ca
translated: And by the serpent Takshaka, and also by Airavata.

analyzed: atra niryāṇa kāleṣu tamaḥ saṃprāpyate mahat
translated: At the time of departure, great darkness is encountered here,

analyzed: abhedyam bhāskareṇa api svayam vā kṛṣṇavartmanā
translated: Which cannot be penetrated even by the sun, or by the dark path itself.

original: eṣa tasyāpi te mārgaḥ paritāpasya gālava
analyzed: eṣa tasya api te mārgaḥ paritāpasya gālava
translated: This is the path of your grief, O Galava.

original: brūhi me yadi gantavyaṃ pratīcīṃ śṛṇu vā mama
analyzed: brūhi me yadi gantavyam pratīcīm śṛṇu vā mama
translated: Tell me if you want to go, or listen to me about the west.

analyzed: suparṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Suparna said:

original: iyaṃ dig dayitā rājño varuṇasya tu gopateḥ
analyzed: iyam diś dayitā rājñaḥ varuṇasya tu gopateḥ
translated: This direction is dear to King Varuna, the lord of the waters.

original: sadā salilarājasya pratiṣṭhā cādir eva ca
analyzed: sadā salilarājasya pratiṣṭhā ca ādiḥ eva ca
translated: It is always the foundation and beginning of the king of the waters.

original: atra paścād ahaḥ sūryo visarjayati bhāḥ svayam
analyzed: atra paścāt ahar sūryaḥ visarjayati bhās svayam
translated: Here in the west, the sun himself releases his rays at the end of the day.

analyzed: paścimā iti abhivikhyātā diś iyam dvijasattama
translated: This direction is known as the west, O best of the twice-born.

original: yādasām atra rājyena salilasya ca guptaye
analyzed: yādasām atra rājyena salilasya ca guptaye
translated: Here, for the protection of the kingdom of the waters,

analyzed: kaśyapaḥ bhagavān devaḥ varuṇam sma abhyaṣecayat
translated: the blessed god Kashyapa consecrated Varuna.

original: atra pītvā samastān vai varuṇasya rasāṃs tu ṣaṭ
analyzed: atra pītvā samastān vai varuṇasya rasān tu ṣaṭ
translated: Here, having drunk all the six juices of Varuna,

analyzed: jāyate taruṇaḥ somaḥ śuklasya ādau tamisra hā
translated: the young moon, the destroyer of darkness, is born at the beginning of the bright fortnight.

original: atra paścāt kṛtā daityā vāyunā saṃyatās tadā
analyzed: atra paścāt kṛtāḥ daityāḥ vāyunā saṃyatāḥ tadā
translated: Here in the west, the demons were restrained by Vayu at that time.

original: niḥśvasanto mahānāgair arditāḥ suṣupur dvija🔽atra sūryaṃ praṇayinaṃ pratigṛhṇāti parvataḥ
analyzed: niḥśvasantaḥ mahā nāgaiḥ arditāḥ suṣupuḥ dvija  atra sūryam praṇayinam pratigṛhṇāti parvataḥ
translated: The great serpents afflicted them, and they slept, sighing.🔽Here the mountain receives the sun, its lover,

original: asto nāma yataḥ saṃdhyā paścimā pratisarpati
analyzed: astaḥ nāma yatas saṃdhyā paścimā pratisarpati
translated: From where the evening twilight returns, called 'astaka'.

original: ato rātriś ca nidrā ca nirgatā divasakṣaye
analyzed: atas rātriḥ ca nidrā ca nirgatā divasa kṣaye
translated: From here, at the end of the day, night and sleep depart,

analyzed: jāyate jīva lokasya hartum ardham iva āyuṣaḥ
translated: As if to take away half of the life of the world of living beings.

analyzed: atra devīm ditim suptām ātma prasava dhāriṇīm
translated: Here, the goddess Diti, carrying her unborn child, was sleeping,

original: vigarbhām akaroc chakro yatra jāto marudgaṇaḥ
analyzed: vigarbhām akarot śakraḥ yatra jātaḥ marut gaṇaḥ
translated: And Shakra made her childless, where the Marut host was born.

original: atra mūlaṃ himavato mandaraṃ yāti śāśvatam
analyzed: atra mūlam himavataḥ mandaram yāti śāśvatam
translated: Here the root of the Himalayas goes to Mandara forever,

analyzed: api varṣa sahasreṇa na ca asya antaḥ dhigamyate
translated: And even in a thousand years, its end is not reached.

analyzed: atra kāñcana śailasya kāñcana ambu vahasya ca
translated: Here, having reached the shore of the golden mountain and the golden-watered ocean,

original: udadhes tīram āsādya surabhiḥ kṣarate payaḥ
analyzed: udadheḥ tīram āsādya surabhiḥ kṣarate payaḥ
translated: Surabhi (the divine cow) exudes milk.

analyzed: atra madhye samudrasya kabandhaḥ pratidṛśyate
translated: Here, in the middle of the ocean, a headless trunk is seen,

analyzed: svarbhānoḥ sūrya kalpasya soma sūryau jighāṃsataḥ
translated: Of Svarbhanu (Rahu), resembling the sun, desiring to devour the moon and the sun.

analyzed: suvarṇa śirasaḥ pi atra hari romṇaḥ pragāyataḥ
translated: Here, of the golden-headed Harirom (Vayu), singing,

analyzed: adṛśyasya aprameyasya śrūyate vipulaḥ dhvaniḥ
translated: The vast sound is heard of the invisible and immeasurable one.

analyzed: atra dhvajavatī nāma kumārī harimedhasaḥ
translated: Here, by the command of the Sun, a maiden named Dhvajavati of Harimedhas

original: ākāśe tiṣṭha tiṣṭheti tasthau sūryasya śāsanāt
analyzed: ākāśe tiṣṭha tiṣṭha iti tasthau sūryasya śāsanāt
translated: stood in the sky, saying, Stay, stay.

original: atra vāyus tathā vahnir āpaḥ khaṃ caiva gālava
analyzed: atra vāyuḥ tathā vahniḥ āpaḥ kham ca eva gālava
translated: Here, O Galava, the wind, the fire, the water, and the sky

original: āhnikaṃ caiva naiśaṃ ca duḥkhasparśaṃ vimuñcati🔽ataḥ prabhṛti sūryasya tiryag āvartate gatiḥ
analyzed: āhnikam ca eva naiśam ca duḥkha sparśam vimuñcati  atas prabhṛti sūryasya tiryak āvartate gatiḥ
translated: abandon the painful touch of the day and night.🔽From here onwards, the Sun's motion is transverse.

analyzed: atra jyotīṃṣi sarvāṇi viśanti āditya maṇḍalam
translated: Here all the luminaries enter the solar orb.

analyzed: aṣṭāviṃśati rātram ca caṅkramya saha bhānunā
translated: Having wandered for twenty-eight nights with the Sun,

analyzed: niṣpatanti punar sūryāt soma saṃyoga yogataḥ
translated: they again emerge from the Sun due to their connection with the Moon.

analyzed: atra nityam sravantīnām prabhavaḥ sāgara udayaḥ
translated: Here is the constant source of the rivers and the rising of the ocean.

analyzed: atra lokatrayasya āpaḥ tiṣṭhanti varuṇa āśrayāḥ
translated: Here the waters of the three worlds reside, based on Varuna.

analyzed: atra pannaga rājasya api anantasya niveśanam
translated: Here is also the abode of the king of serpents, Ananta.

analyzed: an ādi nidhanasya atra viṣṇoḥ sthānam anuttamam
translated: Here is the unsurpassed abode of Vishnu, who has no beginning or end.

analyzed: atrā anala sakhasya api pavanasya niveśanam
translated: Here is also the abode of the wind, the friend of fire.

analyzed: mahā ṛṣeḥ kaśyapasya atra mārīcasya niveśanam
translated: Here is the abode of the great sage Maricha, the son of Kashyapa.

original: eṣa te paścimo mārgo digdvāreṇa prakīrtitaḥ
analyzed: eṣa te paścimaḥ mārgaḥ diś dvāreṇa prakīrtitaḥ
translated: This is your western path, proclaimed through the door of the directions.

original: brūhi gālava gacchāvo buddhiḥ kā dvijasattama
analyzed: brūhi gālava gacchāvaḥ buddhiḥ kā dvijasattama
translated: Tell us, Galava, where shall we go? What is your opinion, best of Brahmanas?

original: diktrayaṃ te śrutaṃ brahmañ śṛṇu cāpy uttarāṃ diśam
analyzed: diś trayam te śrutam brahmam śṛṇu ca api uttarām diśam
translated: The three directions have been heard by you, O Brahmana, now listen to the northern direction.

analyzed: suparṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Suparna said:

analyzed: yasmāt uttāryate pāpāt yasmāt niḥśreyasaḥ śnute
translated: Because one is liberated from sin and attains the highest good from it,

analyzed: tasmāt uttāraṇa phalāt uttarā iti ucyate budhaiḥ
translated: therefore the wise call it the northern direction, because of the fruit of liberation.

analyzed: uttarasya hiraṇyasya parivāpasya gālava
translated: O Galava, of the northern golden region,

original: mārgaḥ paścimapūrvābhyāṃ digbhyāṃ vai madhyamaḥ smṛtaḥ
analyzed: mārgaḥ paścima pūrvābhyām digbhyām vai madhyamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: the path is said to be in the middle between the western and eastern directions.

analyzed: asyām diśi variṣṭhāyām uttarāyām dvijarṣabha
translated: In this best of directions, the northern one, O bull among Brahmanas,

analyzed: na asaumyaḥ na avidheya ātmā na adharmyaḥ vasate janaḥ
translated: no one dwells who is inauspicious, untamed, or unrighteous.

original: atra nārāyaṇaḥ kṛṣṇo jiṣṇuś caiva narottamaḥ
analyzed: atra nārāyaṇaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ jiṣṇuḥ ca eva narottamaḥ
translated: Here is Narayana Krishna and Jishnu, the best of men,

original: badaryām āśramapade tathā brahmā ca śāśvataḥ
analyzed: badaryām āśrama pade tathā brahmā ca śāśvataḥ
translated: and Brahma, the eternal one, in the hermitage of Badari.

original: atra vai himavatpṛṣṭhe nityam āste maheśvaraḥ
analyzed: atra vai himavat pṛṣṭhe nityam āste maheśvaraḥ
translated: Here on the slopes of the Himalayas, Maheshvara always resides,

analyzed: prakṛtyā puruṣaḥ sārdham yuga anta agni sama prabhaḥ
translated: with Prakriti, the man, equal in radiance to the fire at the end of an aeon.

original: na sa dṛśyo munigaṇais tathā devaiḥ savāsavaiḥ
analyzed: na sa dṛśyaḥ muni gaṇaiḥ tathā devaiḥ sa vāsavaiḥ
translated: He is not seen by the sages, nor by the gods along with Indra,

analyzed: gandharva yakṣa siddhaiḥ vā nara nārāyaṇāt ṛte
translated: nor by the gandharvas, yakshas, or siddhas, except by Nara and Narayana.

analyzed: atra viṣṇuḥ sahasra akṣaḥ sahasra caraṇaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: Here Vishnu, the thousand-eyed, thousand-footed, imperishable one,

analyzed: sahasra śirasaḥ śrīmān ekaḥ paśyati māyayā
translated: the glorious one with a thousand heads, alone sees through Maya.

analyzed: atra rājyena viprāṇām candramāḥ ca abhyaṣicyata
translated: Here the Moon was consecrated with the kingdom of the Brahmanas,

original: atra gaṅgāṃ mahādevaḥ patantīṃ gaganāc cyutām
analyzed: atra gaṅgām mahādevaḥ patantīm gaganāt cyutām
translated: Here Mahadeva, best of those who know Brahman, received the Ganga falling from the sky

analyzed: pratigṛhya dadau loke mānuṣe brahma vittama
translated: and gave her to the human world.

analyzed: atra devyā tapaḥ taptam maheśvara parīpsayā
translated: Here the Goddess performed austerities with the desire for Mahesvara,

original: atra kāmaś ca roṣaś ca śailaś comā ca saṃbabhuḥ🔽atra rākṣasayakṣāṇāṃ gandharvāṇāṃ ca gālava
analyzed: atra kāmaḥ ca roṣaḥ ca śailaḥ ca umā ca saṃbabhuḥ  atra rākṣasa yakṣāṇām gandharvāṇām ca gālava
translated: Here Kama, Rishava, the Mountain and Uma originated.🔽Here, Galava, the Lord of Wealth was consecrated on Kailasa

analyzed: ādhipatyena kailāse dhanadaḥ pi abhiṣecitaḥ
translated: with the overlordship of Rakshasas, Yakshas and Gandharvas.

analyzed: atra caitraratham ramyam atra vaikhānasa āśramaḥ
translated: Here is the delightful Chaitraratha, here is the hermitage of the Vaikhanasas,

original: atra mandākinī caiva mandaraś ca dvijarṣabha
analyzed: atra mandākinī ca eva mandaraḥ ca dvijarṣabha
translated: Here is the Mandakini river and the Mandara mountain, O best of Brahmanas,

original: atra saugandhikavanaṃ nairṛtair abhirakṣyate🔽śāḍvalaṃ kadalīskandham atra saṃtānakā nagāḥ
analyzed: atra saugandhika vanam nairṛtaiḥ abhirakṣyate  śāḍvalam kadalīskandham atra saṃtānakāḥ nagāḥ
translated: Here the Saugandhika forest is guarded by the Rakshasas,🔽Here are the Shadbaras, plantain trees, and Santanaka trees,

analyzed: atra saṃyama nityānām siddhānām svaira cāriṇām
translated: Here, Galava, are the aerial cars of the self-controlled Siddhas, who are free to go wherever they wish,

analyzed: vimānāni anurūpāṇi kāma bhogyāni gālava
translated: suitable for them and enjoyable according to their desires.

original: atra te ṛṣayaḥ sapta devī cārundhatī tathā
analyzed: atra te ṛṣayaḥ sapta devī ca arundhatī tathā
translated: Here are the seven sages and the goddess Arundhati,

original: atra tiṣṭhati vai svātir atrāsyā udayaḥ smṛtaḥ
analyzed: atra tiṣṭhati vai svātiḥ atra asyāḥ udayaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Here is the constellation Swati, and here is said to be its rising,

original: atra yajñaṃ samāruhya dhruvaṃ sthātā pitāmahaḥ
analyzed: atra yajñam samāruhya dhruvam sthātā pitāmahaḥ
translated: Here the grandfather Brahma, having ascended the sacrifice, shall stand firm,

analyzed: jyotīṃṣi candra sūryau ca parivartanti nityaśas
translated: And the luminaries, the moon and the sun, revolve constantly,

analyzed: atra gāyantikā dvāram rakṣanti dvijasattamāḥ
translated: Here the best of Brahmins guard the gate of Gayantika,

analyzed: dhāmāḥ nāma mahātmānaḥ munayaḥ satya vādinaḥ
translated: The great souls named Dhama, sages who speak the truth,

original: na teṣāṃ jñāyate sūtir nākṛtir na tapaś citam
analyzed: na teṣām jñāyate sūtiḥ na ākṛtiḥ na tapaḥ citam
translated: Their birth is not known, nor their form nor their austerity,

analyzed: parivarta sahasrāṇi kāma bhogyāni gālava
translated: For thousands of revolutions, O Galava, they enjoy pleasures as they wish,

original: yathā yathā praviśati tasmāt parataraṃ naraḥ
analyzed: yathā yathā praviśati tasmāt parataram naraḥ
translated: As a man enters higher and higher from there,

analyzed: tathā tathā dvijaśreṣṭha pravilīyati gālava
translated: In the same way, O best of Brahmins, he dissolves away, O Galava,

original: na tat kena cid anyena gatapūrvaṃ dvijarṣabha
analyzed: na tat kena cit anyena gata pūrvam dvijarṣabha
translated: No one else has ever gone there before, O best of Brahmins,

original: ṛte nārāyaṇaṃ devaṃ naraṃ vā jiṣṇum avyayam
analyzed: ṛte nārāyaṇam devam naram vā jiṣṇum avyayam
translated: Except the god Narayana or the imperishable man Jishnu,

original: atra kailāsam ity uktaṃ sthānam ailavilasya tat
analyzed: atra kailāsam iti uktam sthānam ailavilasya tat
translated: Here is said to be the abode of Ailavila, called Kailasa,

analyzed: atra vidyutprabhāḥ nāma jajñire psarasaḥ daśa
translated: Here were born ten celestial nymphs named Vidyutprabha,

original: atra viṣṇupadaṃ nāma kramatā viṣṇunā kṛtam
analyzed: atra viṣṇu padam nāma kramatā viṣṇunā kṛtam
translated: Here was made by Vishnu, as he stepped, what is called Vishnu's foot-print,

analyzed: tri loka vikrame brahman uttarām diśam āśritam
translated: O Brahmana, in the Triloka-vikrama, in the northern direction,

analyzed: atra rājñā maruttena yajñena iṣṭam dvijottama
translated: Here, O best of Brahmanas, King Marutta performed a sacrifice,

analyzed: uśīrabīje viprarṣe yatra jāmbūnadam saraḥ
translated: In Ushira-bija, O Brahmin sage, where there is a golden lake,

analyzed: jīmūtasya atra viprarṣeḥ upatasthe mahātmanaḥ
translated: Here, the great soul of the Brahmin sage Jimuta served,

analyzed: sākṣāt haimavataḥ puṇyaḥ vimalaḥ kamala ākaraḥ
translated: The sacred and pure golden lake, the abode of lotuses,

original: brāhmaṇeṣu ca yat kṛtsnaṃ svantaṃ kṛtvā dhanaṃ mahat
analyzed: brāhmaṇeṣu ca yat kṛtsnam su antam kṛtvā dhanam mahat
translated: And having given away all his great wealth to the Brahmins,

original: vavre vanaṃ maharṣiḥ sa jaimūtaṃ tad vanaṃ tataḥ
analyzed: vavre vanam mahā ṛṣiḥ sa jaimūtam tat vanam tatas
translated: That great sage chose the forest, and that forest became known as Jimuta.

original: atra nityaṃ diśāpālāḥ sāyaṃ prātar dvijarṣabha
analyzed: atra nityam diśā pālāḥ sāyam prātar dvijarṣabha
translated: O best of Brahmins, here the guardians of the directions, in the morning and evening,

original: kasya kāryaṃ kim iti vai parikrośanti gālava
analyzed: kasya kāryam kim iti vai parikrośanti gālava
translated: Shout out, What is to be done? O Galava.

original: evam eṣā dvijaśreṣṭha guṇair anyair dig uttarā
analyzed: evam eṣā dvijaśreṣṭha guṇaiḥ anyaiḥ diś uttarā
translated: Thus, O best of Brahmins, the northern direction is renowned for its qualities,

original: uttareti parikhyātā sarvakarmasu cottarā🔽etā vistaraśas tāta tava saṃkīrtitā diśaḥ
analyzed: uttarā iti parikhyātā sarva karmasu ca uttarā  etāḥ vistaraśaḥ tāta tava saṃkīrtitāḥ diśaḥ
translated: And is known as the northern direction, superior in all actions.🔽O son, these four directions have been described to you in detail,

analyzed: catasraḥ krama yogena kāma āśām gantum icchasi
translated: If you wish to go to the land of Kama.

analyzed: udyataḥ ham dvijaśreṣṭha tava darśayitum diśaḥ
translated: O best of Brahmins, I am ready to show you the directions,

original: pṛthivīṃ cākhilāṃ brahmaṃs tasmād āroha māṃ dvija
analyzed: pṛthivīm ca akhilām brahman tasmāt āroha mām dvija
translated: And the entire earth, O Brahmin, therefore, climb onto me, O Brahmin.

analyzed: gālavaḥ uvāca
translated: Galava said:

analyzed: garutman bhujaga indra are suparṇa vinatā ātmaja
translated: O Garuḍa, enemy of the great serpents, Suparṇa, son of Vinatā,

original: naya māṃ tārkṣya pūrveṇa yatra dharmasya cakṣuṣī
analyzed: naya mām tārkṣya pūrveṇa yatra dharmasya cakṣuṣī
translated: Take me, O Tārkṣya, to the east, where are the eyes of Dharma.

original: pūrvam etāṃ diśaṃ gaccha yā pūrvaṃ parikīrtitā
analyzed: pūrvam etām diśam gaccha yā pūrvam parikīrtitā
translated: Go to that eastern direction which was mentioned first.

original: daivatānāṃ hi sāṃnidhyam atra kīrtitavān asi
analyzed: daivatānām hi sāṃnidhyam atra kīrtitavān asi
translated: For you have declared the presence of the deities there.

original: atra satyaṃ ca dharmaś ca tvayā samyak prakīrtitaḥ
analyzed: atra satyam ca dharmaḥ ca tvayā samyak prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Here truth and righteousness have been rightly proclaimed by you.

original: iccheyaṃ tu samāgantuṃ samastair daivatair aham
analyzed: iccheyam tu samāgantum samastaiḥ daivataiḥ aham
translated: But I wish to meet all the gods together.

original: bhūyaś ca tān surān draṣṭum iccheyam aruṇānuja
analyzed: bhūyas ca tān surān draṣṭum iccheyam aruṇānuja
translated: And again, O younger brother of Aruṇa, I wish to see those gods.

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Nārada said:

original: tam āha vinatāsūnur ārohasveti vai dvijam
analyzed: tam āha vinatā sūnuḥ ārohasva iti vai dvijam
translated: The son of Vinatā said to the twice-born, Mount me.

original: ārurohātha sa munir garuḍaṃ gālavas tadā
analyzed: āruroha atha sa muniḥ garuḍam gālavaḥ tadā
translated: Then the sage Gālava mounted Garuḍa.

analyzed: gālavaḥ uvāca
translated: Gālava said:

analyzed: kramamāṇasya te rūpam dṛśyate pannagāśana
translated: O serpent-eater, the form of you who are moving

original: bhāskarasyeva pūrvāhṇe sahasrāṃśor vivasvataḥ🔽pakṣavātapraṇunnānāṃ vṛkṣāṇām anugāminām
analyzed: bhāskarasya iva pūrvāhṇe sahasrāṃśoḥ vivasvataḥ  pakṣa vāta praṇunnānām vṛkṣāṇām anugāminām
translated: appears like that of the sun in the morning, of the sun with a thousand rays.🔽I see the same speed of the trees that follow,

original: prasthitānām iva samaṃ paśyāmīha gatiṃ khaga🔽sasāgaravanām urvīṃ saśailavanakānanām
analyzed: prasthitānām iva samam paśyāmi iha gatim khaga  sa sāgara vanām urvīm sa śaila vana kānanām
translated: blown by the wind of your wings, as if they were departing together, O bird.

analyzed: ākarṣan iva ca ābhāsi pakṣa vātena khecara
translated: As if drawing with the wind of your wings, O sky-goer,🔽you appear to be drawing the earth with its oceans, forests, mountains, forests and groves.

analyzed: sa mīna nāga nakram ca kham iva āropyate jalam
translated: The water is lifted up as if into the sky, along with the fish, serpents and crocodiles.

original: vāyunā caiva mahatā pakṣavātena cāniśam🔽tulyarūpānanān matsyāṃs timimatsyāṃs timiṃgilān
analyzed: vāyunā ca eva mahatā pakṣa vātena ca aniśam  tulya rūpa ānanān matsyān timi matsyān timiṃgilān
translated: And by the great wind and the wind of the wings, without break,🔽I see fish, whales, and timiṅgila fish, all of the same form and face,

original: nāgāṃś ca naravaktrāṃś ca paśyāmy unmathitān iva
analyzed: nāgān ca nara vaktrān ca paśyāmi unmathitān iva
translated: and serpents with human faces, as if being churned.

original: mahārṇavasya ca ravaiḥ śrotre me badhirīkṛte
analyzed: mahā arṇavasya ca ravaiḥ śrotre me badhirīkṛte
translated: And with the sounds of the great ocean, my ears are deafened.

original: na śṛṇomi na paśyāmi nātmano vedmi kāraṇam
analyzed: na śṛṇomi na paśyāmi na ātmanaḥ vedmi kāraṇam
translated: I do not hear, I do not see, I do not know the reason for myself.

original: śanaiḥ sādhu bhavān yātu brahmahatyām anusmaran
analyzed: śanais sādhu bhavān yātu brahmahatyām anusmaran
translated: Go slowly, good sir, remembering the murder of a brahmin.

original: na dṛśyate ravis tāta na diśo na ca khaṃ khaga
analyzed: na dṛśyate raviḥ tāta na diśaḥ na ca kham khaga
translated: The sun is not seen, father, nor the directions, nor the sky, O bird.

original: tama eva tu paśyāmi śarīraṃ te na lakṣaye
analyzed: tamaḥ eva tu paśyāmi śarīram te na lakṣaye
translated: But I only see darkness, I do not see your body.

original: maṇīva jātyau paśyāmi cakṣuṣī te 'ham aṇḍaja
analyzed: maṇī iva jātyau paśyāmi cakṣuṣī te ham aṇḍaja
translated: I see your eyes, O oviparous one, as if they were jewels.

original: śarīre tu na paśyāmi tava caivātmanaś ca ha
analyzed: śarīre tu na paśyāmi tava ca eva ātmanaḥ ca ha
translated: But I do not see your body, nor my own.

original: pade pade tu paśyāmi salilād agnim utthitam
analyzed: pade pade tu paśyāmi salilāt agnim utthitam
translated: But at every step I see fire rising from the water,

original: sa me nirvāpya sahasā cakṣuṣī śāmyate punaḥ
analyzed: sa me nirvāpya sahasā cakṣuṣī śāmyate punar
translated: and it suddenly extinguishes my eyes and subsides again.

original: tan nivarta mahān kālo gacchato vinatātmaja
analyzed: tat nivarta mahān kālaḥ gacchataḥ vinatā ātmaja
translated: Therefore turn back, O son of Vinata, a great time has passed as you go.

original: na me prayojanaṃ kiṃ cid gamane pannagāśana
analyzed: na me prayojanam kim cit gamane pannagāśana
translated: I have no purpose at all in going, O eater of serpents.

original: saṃnivarta mahāvega na vegaṃ viṣahāmi te
analyzed: saṃnivarta mahā vega na vegam viṣahāmi te
translated: Turn back, O you of great speed, I cannot bear your speed.

original: gurave saṃśrutānīha śatāny aṣṭau hi vājinām
analyzed: gurave saṃśrutāni iha śatāni aṣṭau hi vājinām
translated: Here I have heard of eight hundred horses given to my preceptor,

analyzed: ekatas śyāma karṇānām śubhrāṇām candra varcasām
translated: all of them dark-eared, white, and moon-bright,

analyzed: teṣām ca eva apavargāya mārgam paśyāmi na aṇḍaja
translated: and I see no way of releasing them, O bird.

analyzed: tatas yam jīvita tyāge dṛṣṭaḥ mārgaḥ mayā ātmanaḥ
translated: Therefore, I have seen this way of giving up my life.

original: naiva me 'sti dhanaṃ kiṃ cin na dhanenānvitaḥ suhṛt
analyzed: na eva me sti dhanam kim cit na dhanena anvitaḥ suhṛd
translated: I have no wealth at all, nor do I have a friend endowed with wealth,

original: na cārthenāpi mahatā śakyam etad vyapohitum
analyzed: na ca arthena api mahatā śakyam etat vyapohitum
translated: and this cannot be averted even with great wealth.

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

original: evaṃ bahu ca dīnaṃ ca bruvāṇaṃ gālavaṃ tadā🔽pratyuvāca vrajann eva prahasan vinatātmajaḥ
analyzed: evam bahu ca dīnam ca bruvāṇam gālavam tadā  pratyuvāca vrajan eva prahasan vinatā ātmajaḥ
translated: Thus, when Galava was speaking in this way, full of sorrow,🔽the son of Vinata, flying along, replied with a smile:

analyzed: na ati prajñaḥ si viprarṣe yaḥ tmānam tyaktum icchasi
translated: You are not very wise, O brahmin sage, in wanting to give up your own self.

original: na cāpi kṛtrimaḥ kālaḥ kālo hi parameśvaraḥ
analyzed: na ca api kṛtrimaḥ kālaḥ kālaḥ hi parama īśvaraḥ
translated: And time is not artificial; time is indeed the supreme lord.

original: kim ahaṃ pūrvam eveha bhavatā nābhicoditaḥ
analyzed: kim aham pūrvam eva iha bhavatā na abhicoditaḥ
translated: Why did you not urge me earlier?

analyzed: upāyaḥ u tra mahān asti yena etat upapadyate
translated: There is a great means here by which this can be accomplished.

original: tad eṣa ṛṣabho nāma parvataḥ sāgarorasi
analyzed: tat eṣaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ nāma parvataḥ sāgara urasi
translated: That is, this mountain named Rishabha is on the ocean shore.

original: atra viśramya bhuktvā ca nivartiṣyāva gālava
analyzed: atra viśramya bhuktvā ca nivartiṣyāva gālava
translated: Having rested and eaten here, we will return, O Galava.

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

analyzed: ṛṣabhasya tatas śṛṅge nipatya dvija pakṣiṇau
translated: Then, alighting on the horn of the bull, the bird and the brahmin

analyzed: śāṇḍilīm brāhmaṇīm tatra dadṛśāte tapaḥ nvitām
translated: saw there the brahmin woman Śāṇḍilī, endowed with austerities.

original: abhivādya suparṇas tu gālavaś cābhipūjya tām
analyzed: abhivādya suparṇaḥ tu gālavaḥ ca abhipūjya tām
translated: Having saluted her, Suparṇa and Gālava honored her,

analyzed: tayā ca svāgatena uktau viṣṭare saṃniṣīdatuḥ
translated: and having been welcomed by her, they sat down on a seat.

analyzed: siddham annam tayā kṣipram bali mantra upabṛṃhitam
translated: The food that was prepared by her was quickly enhanced by the power of the offering mantra.

original: bhuktvā tṛptāv ubhau bhūmau suptau tāv annamohitau
analyzed: bhuktvā tṛptau ubhau bhūmau suptau tau anna mohitau
translated: Having eaten and become satisfied, both of them fell asleep on the ground, deluded by the food.

analyzed: muhūrtāt pratibuddhaḥ tu suparṇaḥ gamana īpsayā
translated: After a moment, Suparṇa awoke with a desire to depart.

analyzed: tām dṛṣṭvā cāru sarva aṅgīm tāpasīm brahmacāriṇīm
translated: Seeing that ascetic woman, whose limbs were beautiful in every way,

original: grahītuṃ hi manaś cakre rūpāt sākṣād iva śriyam
analyzed: grahītum hi manaḥ cakre rūpāt sākṣāt iva śriyam
translated: he made up his mind to seize her, as if she were Śrī herself in person.

analyzed: atha bhraṣṭa tanūja aṅgam ātmānam dadṛśe khagaḥ
translated: Then the bird saw himself with his body and limbs fallen off.

analyzed: māṃsa piṇḍa upamaḥ bhūt sa mukha pāda anvitaḥ khagaḥ
translated: He became like a lump of flesh, with a mouth and feet.

original: gālavas taṃ tathā dṛṣṭvā viṣaṇṇaḥ paryapṛcchata
analyzed: gālavaḥ tam tathā dṛṣṭvā viṣaṇṇaḥ paryapṛcchata
translated: Gālava, having seen him in that state, distressed, asked:

original: kim idaṃ bhavatā prāptam ihāgamanajaṃ phalam
analyzed: kim idam bhavatā prāptam iha āgamana jam phalam
translated: What is this fruit that you have obtained from coming here?

original: vāso 'yam iha kālaṃ tu kiyantaṃ nau bhaviṣyati
analyzed: vāsaḥ yam iha kālam tu kiyantam nau bhaviṣyati
translated: How long will this stay here be for us?

original: kiṃ nu te manasā dhyātam aśubhaṃ dharmadūṣaṇam
analyzed: kim nu te manasā dhyātam aśubham dharma dūṣaṇam
translated: What inauspicious thought, defiling dharma, has been conceived by you?

original: na hy ayaṃ bhavataḥ svalpo vyabhicāro bhaviṣyati
analyzed: na hi ayam bhavataḥ su alpaḥ vyabhicāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: This slight transgression of yours will not be a great one.

original: suparṇo 'thābravīd vipraṃ pradhyātaṃ vai mayā dvija
analyzed: suparṇaḥ thā bravīt vipram pradhyātam vai mayā dvija
translated: Then Suparna said to the brahmin: 'O brahmin, I have indeed meditated on this.

original: imāṃ siddhām ito netuṃ tatra yatra prajāpatiḥ
analyzed: imām siddhām itas netum tatra yatra prajāpatiḥ
translated: To take this accomplished one from here to where Prajapati is,

original: yatra devo mahādevo yatra viṣṇuḥ sanātanaḥ
analyzed: yatra devaḥ mahādevaḥ yatra viṣṇuḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: where the god Mahadeva is, where the eternal Vishnu is,

original: yatra dharmaś ca yajñaś ca tatreyaṃ nivased iti
analyzed: yatra dharmaḥ ca yajñaḥ ca tatra iyam nivaset iti
translated: where Dharma and Yajna are, let her dwell there.'

analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavatīm yāce praṇataḥ priya kāmyayā
translated: I, being devoted, ask the illustrious one, desiring what is dear.

original: mayaitan nāma pradhyātaṃ manasā śocatā kila
analyzed: mayā etat nāma pradhyātam manasā śocatā kila
translated: This name was indeed meditated upon by me, grieving in my mind.

original: tad evaṃ bahumānāt te mayehānīpsitaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: tat evam bahu mānāt te mayā iha anīpsitam kṛtam
translated: Thus, out of great respect for you, I have done this undesirable act here.

original: sukṛtaṃ duṣkṛtaṃ vā tvaṃ māhātmyāt kṣantum arhasi
analyzed: sukṛtam duṣkṛtam vā tvam māhātmyāt kṣantum arhasi
translated: Whether it is good or bad, you should forgive it out of your greatness.

analyzed: sā tau tadā bravīt tuṣṭā pataga indra dvijarṣabhau
translated: Then she, being pleased, said to those two, the best of birds and brahmins:

original: na bhetavyaṃ suparṇo 'si suparṇa tyaja saṃbhramam
analyzed: na bhetavyam suparṇaḥ si suparṇa tyaja saṃbhramam
translated: 'You should not be afraid. You are Suparna, O Suparna, give up your confusion.

original: ninditāsmi tvayā vatsa na ca nindāṃ kṣamāmy aham
analyzed: ninditā asmi tvayā vatsa na ca nindām kṣamāmi aham
translated: O child, you have censured me, but I do not forgive censure.

original: lokebhyaḥ sa paribhraśyed yo māṃ nindeta pāpakṛt
analyzed: lokebhyaḥ sa paribhraśyet yaḥ mām nindeta pāpa kṛt
translated: The sinner who would censure me would fall from the worlds.

analyzed: hīnayā alakṣaṇaiḥ sarvaiḥ tathā aninditayā mayā
translated: By me, who is inferior in all characteristics and yet uncensured,

analyzed: ācāram pratigṛhṇantyā siddhiḥ prāptā iyam uttamā
translated: By accepting good conduct, this supreme accomplishment has been attained.

original: ācārāl labhate dharmam ācārāl labhate dhanam
analyzed: ācārāt labhate dharmam ācārāt labhate dhanam
translated: From good conduct one obtains Dharma, from good conduct one obtains wealth.

original: ācārāc chriyam āpnoti ācāro hanty alakṣaṇam
analyzed: ācārāt śriyam āpnoti ācāraḥ hanti alakṣaṇam
translated: From good conduct one attains prosperity, good conduct destroys bad characteristics.

analyzed: tadā āyuṣman khaga pate yatheṣṭam gamyatām itas
translated: Therefore, O long-lived one, O lord of birds, go as you please from here.

original: na ca te garhaṇīyāpi garhitavyāḥ striyaḥ kva cit
analyzed: na ca te garhaṇīyā api garhitavyāḥ striyaḥ kva cit
translated: And you should never blame or condemn women anywhere.

original: yadi tvam ātmano hy arthair māṃ caivādātum icchasi
analyzed: yadi tvam ātmanaḥ hi arthaiḥ mām ca eva ādātum icchasi
translated: If you wish to take me for your own sake,

original: tadaiva naṣṭadehas tu yad vai tvaṃ pannagāśana
analyzed: tadā eva naṣṭa dehaḥ tu yat vai tvam pannagāśana
translated: then you will have lost your body, for you are the eater of serpents.

analyzed: tasya eva hi prasādena devadevasya cintanāt
translated: By the grace of that very one, by the thought of the god of gods,

original: tvaṃ tu sāṅgas tu saṃjātaḥ punar eva bhaviṣyasi
analyzed: tvam tu sa aṅgaḥ tu saṃjātaḥ punar eva bhaviṣyasi
translated: you will be born again, with all your limbs.

analyzed: bhavitāsi yathāpūrvam bala vīrya samanvitaḥ
translated: You will be as you were before, endowed with strength and vigor.

analyzed: babhūvatuḥ tatas tasya pakṣau draviṇavattarau
translated: Then his wings became even more powerful.

analyzed: anujñātaḥ ca śāṇḍilyā yathāgatam upāgamat
translated: And having been permitted by Śāṇḍilī, he returned as he had come.

analyzed: na eva ca āsādayām āsa tathārūpān turaṃgamān
translated: But he could not find horses of such a form.

original: viśvāmitro 'tha taṃ dṛṣṭvā gālavaṃ cādhvani sthitam
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ tha tam dṛṣṭvā gālavam ca adhvani sthitam
translated: Then Viśvāmitra, seeing Gālava standing on the road,

analyzed: uvāca vadatām śreṣṭhaḥ vainateyasya saṃnidhau
translated: the best of speakers, spoke in the presence of Garuḍa:

original: yas tvayā svayam evārthaḥ pratijñāto mama dvija
analyzed: yaḥ tvayā svayam evā arthaḥ pratijñātaḥ mama dvija
translated: O Brahmin! The matter that you yourself have promised to me,

original: tasya kālo 'pavargasya yathā vā manyate bhavān
analyzed: tasya kālo pavargasya yathā vā manyate bhavān
translated: The time for its completion, or whatever you think,

original: pratīkṣiṣyāmy ahaṃ kālam etāvantaṃ tathā param
analyzed: pratīkṣiṣyāmi aham kālam etāvantam tathā param
translated: I will wait for that much time, and then more,

original: yathā saṃsidhyate vipra sa mārgas tu niśamyatām
analyzed: yathā saṃsidhyate vipra sa mārgaḥ tu niśamyatām
translated: Listen to that path by which, O Brahmin, it may be accomplished.

analyzed: suparṇaḥ thā bravīt dīnam gālavam bhṛśa duḥkhitam
translated: Then Suparna spoke to the distressed Galava, who was extremely sorrowful,

original: pratyakṣaṃ khalv idānīṃ me viśvāmitro yad uktavān
analyzed: pratyakṣam khalu idānīm me viśvāmitraḥ yat uktavān
translated: What Vishvamitra has said is now directly evident to me.

analyzed: tat āgaccha dvijaśreṣṭha mantrayiṣyāva gālava
translated: Therefore, O best of Brahmins, come, let us consult, O Galava.

original: nādattvā gurave śakyaṃ kṛtsnam arthaṃ tvayāsitum
analyzed: na a dattvā gurave śakyam kṛtsnam artham tvayā āsitum
translated: Without giving the entire wealth to the Guru, you are not able to go.

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

original: athāha gālavaṃ dīnaṃ suparṇaḥ patatāṃ varaḥ
analyzed: atha āha gālavam dīnam suparṇaḥ patatām varaḥ
translated: Then Suparna, the best of fliers, said to the distressed Galava,

original: nirmitaṃ vahninā bhūmau vāyunā vaidhitaṃ tathā🔽yasmād dhiraṇmayaṃ sarvaṃ hiraṇyaṃ tena cocyate
analyzed: nirmitam vahninā bhūmau vāyunā vā edhitam tathā  yasmāt hiraṇmayam sarvam hiraṇyam tena ca ucyate
translated: What is created on the ground by fire and measured by wind,🔽Since everything is golden, it is called gold.

original: dhatte dhārayate cedam etasmāt kāraṇād dhanam
analyzed: dhatte dhārayate ca idam etasmāt kāraṇāt dhanam
translated: It supports and holds this, therefore it is wealth.

original: tad etat triṣu lokeṣu dhanaṃ tiṣṭhati śāśvatam
analyzed: tat etat triṣu lokeṣu dhanam tiṣṭhati śāśvatam
translated: That is the eternal wealth that exists in the three worlds,

original: nityaṃ proṣṭhapadābhyāṃ ca śukre dhanapatau tathā
analyzed: nityam proṣṭhapadābhyām ca śukre dhanapatau tathā
translated: Always with the two Proshthapadas and Shukra, the lord of wealth.

analyzed: manuṣyebhyaḥ samādatte śukraḥ citta arjitam dhanam
translated: Shukra takes away the wealth earned by the mind from humans.

analyzed: ajaikapād ahirbudhnyaiḥ rakṣyate dhanadena ca
translated: He is protected by Aja-Ekapada, Hiranyagarbha, and Kubera.

original: evaṃ na śakyate labdhum alabdhavyaṃ dvijarṣabha
analyzed: evam na śakyate labdhum a labdhavyam dvijarṣabha
translated: O best of the twice-born! It is not possible to obtain what cannot be obtained.

original: ṛte ca dhanam aśvānāṃ nāvāptir vidyate tava
analyzed: ṛte ca dhanam aśvānām na avāptiḥ vidyate tava
translated: Without wealth, there is no way for you to obtain the horses.

original: arthaṃ yācātra rājānaṃ kaṃ cid rājarṣivaṃśajam
analyzed: artham yāca atra rājānam kam cit rājarṣi vaṃśa jam
translated: Here, ask for wealth from a king born in the lineage of rajarshis.

original: apīḍya rājā paurān hi yo nau kuryāt kṛtārthinau
analyzed: a pīḍya rājā paurān hi yaḥ nau kuryāt kṛta arthinau
translated: A king who does not oppress the citizens and makes us successful.

original: asti somānvavāye me jātaḥ kaś cin nṛpaḥ sakhā
analyzed: asti soma anvavāye me jātaḥ kaḥ cit nṛpaḥ sakhā
translated: I have a friend born in the lunar dynasty.

original: abhigacchāvahe taṃ vai tasyāsti vibhavo bhuvi
analyzed: abhigacchāvahe tam vai tasya asti vibhavaḥ bhuvi
translated: Let us approach him. He has wealth on earth.

analyzed: yayātiḥ nāma rājarṣiḥ nāhuṣaḥ satya vikramaḥ
translated: There is a rajarshi named Yayati, the son of Nahusha, whose prowess is truth.

original: sa dāsyati mayā cokto bhavatā cārthitaḥ svayam
analyzed: sa dāsyati mayā ca uktaḥ bhavatā ca arthitaḥ svayam
translated: He will give it, if requested by me and by you himself.

original: vibhavaś cāsya sumahān āsīd dhanapater iva
analyzed: vibhavaḥ ca asya su mahān āsīt dhanapateḥ iva
translated: His wealth was very great, like that of the lord of wealth (Kubera).

original: evaṃ sa tu dhanaṃ vidvān dānenaiva vyaśodhayat
analyzed: evam sa tu dhanam vidvān dānena eva vyaśodhayat
translated: Thus, the learned one purified his wealth only through charity.

original: tathā tau kathayantau ca cintayantau ca yat kṣamam
analyzed: tathā tau kathayantau ca cintayantau ca yat kṣamam
translated: And as they were conversing and thinking about what was possible,

analyzed: pratiṣṭhāne narapatim yayātim pratyupasthitau
translated: they approached King Yayati in Pratiṣṭhāna.

original: pratigṛhya ca satkāram arghādiṃ bhojanaṃ varam
analyzed: pratigṛhya ca satkāram argha ādim bhojanam varam
translated: And having accepted the hospitality, the Arghya and other offerings, and the excellent food,

analyzed: pṛṣṭaḥ ca āgamane hetum uvāca vinatā sutaḥ
translated: And when asked about the reason for his visit, Vinata's son said:

original: ayaṃ me nāhuṣa sakhā gālavas tapaso nidhiḥ
analyzed: ayam me nāhuṣa sakhā gālavaḥ tapasaḥ nidhiḥ
translated: O son of Nahusha, this Galava, my friend, is a treasure of austerities.

analyzed: viśvāmitrasya śiṣyaḥ bhūt varṣāṇi ayutaśas nṛpa
translated: He was Vishvamitra's disciple for many thousands of years, O king.

analyzed: saḥ yam tena abhyanujñātaḥ upakāra īpsayā dvijaḥ
translated: With his permission, this brahmin, desiring to repay the favor,

original: tam āha bhagavān kāṃ te dadāni gurudakṣiṇām
analyzed: tam āha bhagavān kām te dadāni guru dakṣiṇām
translated: said to him, 'What fee shall I give you for the guru?'

original: asakṛt tena coktena kiṃ cid āgatamanyunā
analyzed: asakṛt tena ca uktena kim cit āgata manyunā
translated: Though repeatedly told, he was somewhat displeased.

original: ayam uktaḥ prayaccheti jānatā vibhavaṃ laghu🔽ekataḥśyāmakarṇānāṃ śubhrāṇāṃ śuddhajanmanām
analyzed: ayam uktaḥ prayaccha iti jānatā vibhavam laghu  ekatas śyāma karṇānām śubhrāṇām śuddha janmanām
translated: Knowing his wealth to be small, he was told, 'Give this.'🔽'Give me eight hundred horses, white, with one black ear,

original: aṣṭau śatāni me dehi hayānāṃ candravarcasām
analyzed: aṣṭau śatāni me dehi hayānām candra varcasām
translated: born of pure lineage, with the luster of the moon.'

original: gurvartho dīyatām eṣa yadi gālava manyase
analyzed: gurvarthaḥ dīyatām eṣa yadi gālava manyase
translated: 'If you think so, Galava, let this be given as the guru's fee.'

original: ity evam āha sakrodho viśvāmitras tapodhanaḥ
analyzed: iti evam āha sa krodhaḥ viśvāmitraḥ tapodhanaḥ
translated: Thus spoke Vishvamitra, the ascetic, with anger.

original: so 'yaṃ śokena mahatā tapyamāno dvijarṣabhaḥ🔽aśaktaḥ pratikartuṃ tad bhavantaṃ śaraṇaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: saḥ yam śokena mahatā tapyamānaḥ dvijarṣabhaḥ  aśaktaḥ pratikartum tat bhavantam śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: That bull among brahmins, tormented by great grief,🔽unable to repay it, has come to you for refuge.

analyzed: pratigṛhya nara vyāghra tvattaḥ bhikṣām gata vyathaḥ
translated: O tiger among men, having accepted alms from you, free from pain,

analyzed: kṛtvā apavargam gurave cariṣyati mahat tapaḥ
translated: having made the guru's departure, he will practice great austerities.

analyzed: tapasaḥ saṃvibhāgena bhavantam api yokṣyate
translated: By sharing his austerities, he will also connect with you.

original: svena rājarṣitapasā pūrṇaṃ tvāṃ pūrayiṣyati🔽yāvanti romāṇi haye bhavanti hi nareśvara
analyzed: svena rājarṣi tapasā pūrṇam tvām pūrayiṣyati  yāvanti romāṇi haye bhavanti hi nareśvara
translated: He will fill you, who are already full with your own austerities as a royal sage.

analyzed: tāvataḥ vāji dāḥ lokān prāpnuvanti mahīpate
translated: O lord of men! A horse-donor obtains as many worlds as there are hairs on the horse's body.

original: pātraṃ pratigrahasyāyaṃ dātuṃ pātraṃ tathā bhavān
analyzed: pātram pratigrahasya ayam dātum pātram tathā bhavān
translated: This is a worthy recipient for accepting gifts, and you are a worthy donor.

original: śaṅkhe kṣīram ivāsaktaṃ bhavatv etat tathopamam
analyzed: śaṅkhe kṣīram iva āsaktam bhavatu etat tathā upamam
translated: Let this be like milk poured into a conch shell.

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

original: evam uktaḥ suparṇena tathyaṃ vacanam uttamam
analyzed: evam uktaḥ suparṇena tathyam vacanam uttamam
translated: Thus addressed by Suparna with excellent and truthful words,

original: vimṛśyāvahito rājā niścitya ca punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: vimṛśya avahitaḥ rājā niścitya ca punar punar
translated: the king, after careful consideration and repeated reflection,

analyzed: yaṣṭā kratu sahasrāṇām dātā dāna patiḥ prabhuḥ
translated: the performer of thousands of sacrifices, the giver, the lord of gifts,

original: yayātir vatsakāśīśa idaṃ vacanam abravīt🔽dṛṣṭvā priyasakhaṃ tārkṣyaṃ gālavaṃ ca dvijarṣabham
analyzed: yayātiḥ vatsa kāsīśe idam vacanam abravīt  dṛṣṭvā priya sakham tārkṣyam gālavam ca dvijarṣabham
translated: Yayati, the lord of Vatsa and Kashi, spoke these words.🔽Seeing his dear friend Tarkshya and the bull among Brahmins Galava,

original: nidarśanaṃ ca tapaso bhikṣāṃ ślāghyāṃ ca kīrtitām
analyzed: nidarśanam ca tapasaḥ bhikṣām ślāghyām ca kīrtitām
translated: the example of austerities, the praiseworthy alms, and the famous (gifts),

analyzed: atītya ca nṛpān anyān āditya kula saṃbhavān
translated: having surpassed other kings born in the solar dynasty,

original: matsakāśam anuprāptāv etau buddhim avekṣya ca
analyzed: mad sakāśam anuprāptau etau buddhim avekṣya ca
translated: these two have come to me, having considered and reflected on their intelligence.

original: adya me saphalaṃ janma tāritaṃ cādya me kulam
analyzed: adya me saphalam janma tāritam ca adya me kulam
translated: Today my birth has become fruitful, today my family has been saved.

original: adyāyaṃ tārito deśo mama tārkṣya tvayānagha🔽vaktum icchāmi tu sakhe yathā jānāsi māṃ purā🔽na tathā vittavān asmi kṣīṇaṃ vittaṃ hi me sakhe
analyzed: adya ayam tāritaḥ deśaḥ mama tārkṣya tvayā anagha  vaktum icchāmi tu sakhe yathā jānāsi mām purā  na tathā vittavān asmi kṣīṇam vittam hi me sakhe
translated: O Tarkshya, O sinless one, today this country has been saved by you.🔽But, O friend, I wish to tell you that I am not as wealthy as you knew me before.

original: na ca śakto 'smi te kartuṃ mogham āgamanaṃ khaga
analyzed: na ca śaktaḥ smi te kartum mogham āgamanam khaga
translated: My wealth has dwindled, O friend. I am not able to make your arrival fruitless, O bird.

original: na cāśām asya viprarṣer vitathāṃ kartum utsahe
analyzed: na ca āśām asya viprarṣeḥ vitathām kartum utsahe
translated: And I do not dare to disappoint the hope of this brahmin sage.

original: tat tu dāsyāmi yat kāryam idaṃ saṃpādayiṣyati
analyzed: tat tu dāsyāmi yat kāryam idam saṃpādayiṣyati
translated: But I will give what will accomplish this task.

original: abhigamya hatāśo hi nivṛtto dahate kulam
analyzed: abhigamya hata āśaḥ hi nivṛttaḥ dahate kulam
translated: For, returning with dashed hopes, one burns one's family.

original: nātaḥ paraṃ vainateya kiṃ cit pāpiṣṭham ucyate
analyzed: na atas param vainateya kim cit pāpiṣṭham ucyate
translated: There is nothing more sinful than this, O son of Vinata,

original: yathāśānāśanaṃ loke dehi nāstīti vā vacaḥ
analyzed: yathā āśā nāśanam loke dehi na asti iti vā vacaḥ
translated: In the world, to say to a supplicant, I have nothing.

original: hatāśo hy akṛtārthaḥ san hataḥ saṃbhāvito naraḥ
analyzed: hata āśaḥ hi akṛtārthaḥ san hataḥ saṃbhāvitaḥ naraḥ
translated: For, a man who dies with dashed hopes, his purpose unfulfilled, is considered dead.

original: hinasti tasya putrāṃś ca pautrāṃś cākurvato 'rthinām
analyzed: hinasti tasya putrān ca pautrān ca a kurvataḥ ṛthinām
translated: He destroys the sons and grandsons of those who do not fulfill the hopes of supplicants.

original: tasmāc caturṇāṃ vaṃśānāṃ sthāpayitrī sutā mama
analyzed: tasmāt caturṇām vaṃśānām sthāpayitrī sutā mama
translated: Therefore, my daughter, who is the establisher of four lineages,

analyzed: mādhavī nāma tārkṣya iyam sarva dharma pravādinī
translated: This Tarkshya named Madhavi, who proclaims all duties,

analyzed: iyam sura suta prakhyā sarva dharma upacāyinī
translated: She, who is like the daughter of a god, who accumulates all virtues,

analyzed: sadā deva manuṣyāṇām asurāṇām ca gālava
translated: Always of gods, humans, and asuras, O Galava,

original: kāṅkṣitā rūpato bālā sutā me pratigṛhyatām
analyzed: kāṅkṣitā rūpataḥ bālā sutā me pratigṛhyatām
translated: Take this daughter of mine, who is desired in beauty, O child.

original: asyāḥ śulkaṃ pradāsyanti nṛpā rājyam api dhruvam
analyzed: asyāḥ śulkam pradāsyanti nṛpāḥ rājyam api dhruvam
translated: For her, the kings will certainly give their kingdoms as dowry.

original: kiṃ punaḥ śyāmakarṇānāṃ hayānāṃ dve catuḥśate
analyzed: kim punar śyāma karṇānām hayānām dve catuḥśate
translated: What to speak of two hundred horses with black ears?

original: sa bhavān pratigṛhṇātu mamemāṃ mādhavīṃ sutām
analyzed: sa bhavān pratigṛhṇātu mama imām mādhavīm sutām
translated: Therefore, O lord, accept this daughter of mine, Madhavi.

original: ahaṃ dauhitravān syāṃ vai vara eṣa mama prabho
analyzed: aham dauhitravān syām vai varaḥ eṣa mama prabho
translated: Let me have a son-in-law, this is my boon, O lord.

original: tasya tad vacanaṃ śrutvā brāhmaṇaḥ saṃśitavrataḥ
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā brāhmaṇaḥ saṃśita vrataḥ
translated: Hearing his words, the brahmin of rigid vows,

original: pratigṛhya ca tāṃ kanyāṃ gālavaḥ saha pakṣiṇā
analyzed: pratigṛhya ca tām kanyām gālavaḥ saha pakṣiṇā
translated: Accepting the maiden, Galava with the bird,

original: punar drakṣyāva ity uktvā pratasthe saha kanyayā
analyzed: punar drakṣyāvaḥ iti uktvā pratasthe saha kanyayā
translated: Saying, We will see again, departed with the maiden.

original: upalabdham idaṃ dvāram aśvānām iti cāṇḍajaḥ🔽uktvā gālavam āpṛcchya jagāma bhavanaṃ svakam
analyzed: upalabdham idam dvāram aśvānām iti ca aṇḍajaḥ  uktvā gālavam āpṛcchya jagāma bhavanam svakam
translated: The bird said, This is the gate for the horses.🔽 Having said this, he took leave of Galava and went to his own abode.

original: gate patagarāje tu gālavaḥ saha kanyayā
analyzed: gate pataga rāje tu gālavaḥ saha kanyayā
translated: When the king of birds had gone, Galava with the maiden,

original: cintayānaḥ kṣamaṃ dāne rājñāṃ vai śulkato 'gamat
analyzed: cintayānaḥ kṣamam dāne rājñām vai śulkataḥ gamat
translated: Thinking of a suitable recipient for the gift, went to kings for a dowry.

analyzed: saḥ gacchan manasā ikṣvākum haryaśvam rāja sattamam
translated: He went to the mind of Haryashva, the best of kings,

analyzed: ayodhyāyām mahā vīryam catur aṅga bala anvitam
