analyzed: akṣa dyūtam mahā prājña satām arati nāśanam
translated: O greatly wise one, gambling with dice destroys the pleasure of the virtuous,

original: asatāṃ tatra jāyante bhedāś ca vyasanāni ca
analyzed: asatām tatra jāyante bhedāḥ ca vyasanāni ca
translated: and there arise dissensions and calamities among the wicked.

original: tad idaṃ vyasanaṃ ghoraṃ tvayā dyūtamukhaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: tat idam vyasanam ghoram tvayā dyūta mukham kṛtam
translated: This terrible calamity has been brought about by you, with gambling as its cause.

analyzed: a samīkṣya sat ācāraiḥ sārdham pāpa anubandhanaiḥ
translated: Without considering the conduct of those who are always sinful,

original: kaś cānyo jñātibhāryāṃ vai viprakartuṃ tathārhati
analyzed: kaḥ ca anyaḥ jñāti bhāryām vai viprakartum tathā arhati
translated: and who else is capable of treating the wife of a kinsman in this way?

original: ānīya ca sabhāṃ vaktuṃ yathoktā draupadī tvayā
analyzed: ānīya ca sabhām vaktum yathā uktā draupadī tvayā
translated: And having brought her to the assembly hall, to speak as you have spoken to Droupadi,

analyzed: kulīnā śīla saṃpannā prāṇebhyaḥ pi garīyasī
translated: born in a noble family, endowed with good character, dearer than life itself,

analyzed: mahiṣī pāṇḍu putrāṇām tathā vinikṛtā tvayā
translated: the queen of the sons of Pandu, thus insulted by you.

analyzed: jānanti kuravaḥ sarve yathā uktāḥ kuru saṃsadi
translated: All the Kurus know how you spoke in the assembly of the Kurus,

analyzed: duḥśāsanena kaunteyāḥ pravrajantaḥ paraṃtapāḥ
translated: when the Kounteyas, the scorchers of enemies, were being exiled,

analyzed: samyak vṛtteṣu alubdheṣu satatam dharma cāriṣu
translated: to those who were of good conduct, not greedy, always following dharma,

original: sveṣu bandhuṣu kaḥ sādhuś cared evam asāṃpratam🔽nṛśaṃsānām anāryāṇāṃ paruṣāṇāṃ ca bhāṣaṇam
analyzed: sveṣu bandhuṣu kaḥ sādhuḥ caret evam asāṃpratam  nṛśaṃsānām anāryāṇām paruṣāṇām ca bhāṣaṇam
translated: to their own relatives, what good man would act so improperly?

original: karṇaduḥśāsanābhyāṃ ca tvayā ca bahuśaḥ kṛtam
analyzed: karṇa duḥśāsanābhyām ca tvayā ca bahuśas kṛtam
translated: The harsh and cruel words spoken by you, Karna and Duhshasana,

original: saha mātrā pradagdhuṃ tān bālakān vāraṇāvate
analyzed: saha mātrā pradagdhum tān bālakān vāraṇāvate
translated: and the attempt to burn those children, along with their mother, in Varanavata,

original: āsthitaḥ paramaṃ yatnaṃ na samṛddhaṃ ca tat tava
analyzed: āsthitaḥ paramam yatnam na samṛddham ca tat tava
translated: you made great efforts, but it was not successful for you.

original: ūṣuś ca suciraṃ kālaṃ pracchannāḥ pāṇḍavās tadā
analyzed: ūṣuḥ ca su ciram kālam pracchannāḥ pāṇḍavāḥ tadā
translated: And the Pandavas lived for a long time in disguise then,

analyzed: mātrā saha ekacakrāyām brāhmaṇasya niveśane
translated: with their mother, in the house of a brahmin in Ekachakra.

original: viṣeṇa sarpabandhaiś ca yatitāḥ pāṇḍavās tvayā
analyzed: viṣeṇa sarpabandhaiḥ ca yatitāḥ pāṇḍavāḥ tvayā
translated: You have tried to kill the Pandavas with poison and snake-bite,

original: sarvopāyair vināśāya na samṛddhaṃ ca tat tava
analyzed: sarva upāyaiḥ vināśāya na samṛddham ca tat tava
translated: And with every means to destroy them, but that has not succeeded for you.

original: evaṃvṛttaḥ kathaṃ rājye sthātum arhasi pāpakṛt
analyzed: evaṃvṛttaḥ katham rājye sthātum arhasi pāpa kṛt
translated: How can you, who have acted like this, deserve to remain in the kingdom, O sinner?

original: sa rājyāc ca sukhāc caiva hāsyase kulapāṃsana
analyzed: sa rājyāt ca sukhāt ca eva hāsyase kula pāṃsana
translated: You will be deprived of the kingdom and happiness, O defiler of the family.

analyzed: evaṃbuddhiḥ pāṇḍaveṣu mithyā vṛttiḥ sadā bhavān
translated: You have always been deceitful towards the Pandavas, with such a mind.

analyzed: katham te na aparādhaḥ sti pāṇḍaveṣu mahātmasu
translated: How is it that you have no fault towards the great-souled Pandavas?

original: yac caibhyo yācamānebhyaḥ pitryam aṃśaṃ na ditsasi
analyzed: yat ca ebhyaḥ yācamānebhyaḥ pitryam aṃśam na ditsasi
translated: And that you are not willing to give them their paternal share when they ask for it,

original: tac ca pāpa pradātāsi bhraṣṭaiśvaryo nipātitaḥ
analyzed: tat ca pāpa pradātāsi bhraṣṭa aiśvaryaḥ nipātitaḥ
translated: You will be the giver of that sin, O sinner, when you are deprived of your sovereignty and brought down.

analyzed: kṛtvā bahūni akāryāṇi pāṇḍaveṣu nṛśaṃsa vat
translated: Having done many wrong things towards the Pandavas, O cruel one,

analyzed: mithyā vṛttiḥ anāryaḥ san adya vipratipadyase
translated: You are acting contrary now, being deceitful and ignoble.

analyzed: mātā pitṛbhyām bhīṣmeṇa droṇena vidureṇa ca
translated: By your mother, father, Bhishma, Drona and Vidura,

original: śāmyeti muhur ukto 'si na ca śāmyasi pārthiva
analyzed: śāmya iti muhur uktaḥ si na ca śāmyasi pārthiva
translated: You have been repeatedly told to make peace, but you do not make peace, O king.

original: śame hi sumahān arthas tava pārthasya cobhayoḥ🔽na ca rocayase rājan kim anyad buddhilāghavāt
analyzed: śame hi su mahān arthaḥ tava pārthasya ca ubhayoḥ  na ca rocayase rājan kim anyat buddhi lāghavāt
translated: For in peace there is great gain for you and for Partha, both of you.🔽But you do not approve, O king, what else is there but the lightness of your intellect?

original: na śarma prāpsyase rājann utkramya suhṛdāṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: na śarma prāpsyase rājan utkramya suhṛdām vacaḥ
translated: You will not find peace, O king, by transgressing the words of your well-wishers.

original: adharmyam ayaśasyaṃ ca kriyate pārthiva tvayā
analyzed: adharmyam ayaśasyam ca kriyate pārthiva tvayā
translated: O king, you are acting unrighteously and unrighteously.

analyzed: evam bruvati dāśārhe duryodhanam amarṣaṇam
translated: When Dasharha was speaking thus, to the intolerant Duryodhana,

analyzed: duḥśāsanaḥ idam vākyam abravīt kuru saṃsadi
translated: Dushasana spoke these words in the assembly of the Kurus:

original: na cet saṃdhāsyase rājan svena kāmena pāṇḍavaiḥ
analyzed: na ced saṃdhāsyase rājan svena kāmena pāṇḍavaiḥ
translated: If you do not make peace with the Pandavas of your own accord, O king,

original: baddhvā kila tvāṃ dāsyanti kuntīputrāya kauravāḥ
analyzed: baddhvā kila tvām dāsyanti kuntī putrāya kauravāḥ
translated: the Kauravas will bind you and give you to Kunti's son.

original: vaikartanaṃ tvāṃ ca māṃ ca trīn etān manujarṣabha
analyzed: vaikartanam tvām ca mām ca trīn etān manuja ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among men, Vaikartana, you, and me, these three,

original: pāṇḍavebhyaḥ pradāsyanti bhīṣmo droṇaḥ pitā ca te
analyzed: pāṇḍavebhyaḥ pradāsyanti bhīṣmaḥ droṇaḥ pitā ca te
translated: Bhishma, Drona, and your father will give to the Pandavas.

original: bhrātur etad vacaḥ śrutvā dhārtarāṣṭraḥ suyodhanaḥ
analyzed: bhrātuḥ etat vacaḥ śrutvā dhārtarāṣṭraḥ suyodhanaḥ
translated: Hearing these words of his brother, Dhritarashtra's son Suyodhana,

analyzed: kruddhaḥ prātiṣṭhata utthāya mahā nāgaḥ iva śvasan
translated: angry, stood up and departed, sighing like a great serpent.

original: viduraṃ dhṛtarāṣṭraṃ ca mahārājaṃ ca bāhlikam
analyzed: viduram dhṛtarāṣṭram ca mahā rājam ca bāhlikam
translated: Vidura, Dhritarashtra, the great king Bahlika,

original: kṛpaṃ ca somadattaṃ ca bhīṣmaṃ droṇaṃ janārdanam
analyzed: kṛpam ca somadattam ca bhīṣmam droṇam janārdanam
translated: Kripa, Somadatta, Bhishma, Drona, Janardana,

analyzed: sarvān etān an ādṛtya durmatiḥ nirapatrapaḥ
translated: disregarding all of them, the evil-minded one, shameless,

analyzed: aśiṣṭa vat amaryādaḥ mānī mānya avamānitā
translated: like an uncivilized one, without bounds, proud, insulted the respectable ones.

analyzed: tam prasthitam abhiprekṣya bhrātaraḥ manuja ṛṣabham
translated: Seeing that bull among men departing,

analyzed: anujagmuḥ saha amātyāḥ rājānaḥ ca api sarvaśas
translated: his brothers, along with their ministers, and all the kings followed him.

original: sabhāyām utthitaṃ kruddhaṃ prasthitaṃ bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
analyzed: sabhāyām utthitam kruddham prasthitam bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
translated: Seeing Duryodhana rise up in anger in the assembly hall and depart with his brothers,

analyzed: duryodhanam abhiprekṣya bhīṣmaḥ śāṃtanavaḥ bravīt
translated: Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, spoke to him:

analyzed: dharma arthau abhisaṃtyajya saṃrambham yaḥ numanyate
translated: He who abandons righteousness and worldly profit and indulges in anger,

original: hasanti vyasane tasya durhṛdo nacirād iva
analyzed: hasanti vyasane tasya durhṛdaḥ nacirāt iva
translated: his wicked-hearted enemies soon laugh at his misfortune.

analyzed: durātmā rāja putraḥ yam dhārtarāṣṭraḥ nu pāya vid
translated: This evil-souled prince of the sons of Dhritarashtra knows no means,

analyzed: mithyā abhimānī rājyasya krodha lobha vaśa anugaḥ
translated: falsely proud of his kingdom, under the sway of anger and greed.

analyzed: kāla pakvam idam manye sarva kṣatram janārdana
translated: O Janardana, I think this entire Kshatriya race is ripe for destruction by Time,

original: sarve hy anusṛtā mohāt pārthivāḥ saha mantribhiḥ
analyzed: sarve hi anusṛtāḥ mohāt pārthivāḥ saha mantribhiḥ
translated: for all the kings, along with their ministers, have been led astray by delusion.

analyzed: bhīṣmasya atha vacaḥ śrutvā dāśārhaḥ puṣkarekṣaṇaḥ
translated: Having heard these words of Bhishma, the Dasharha Krishna, the lotus-eyed one,

analyzed: bhīṣma droṇa mukhān sarvān abhyabhāṣata vīryavān
translated: the powerful one, spoke to all those headed by Bhishma and Drona:

analyzed: sarveṣām kuru vṛddhānām mahān ayam atikramaḥ
translated: This is a great transgression on the part of all the elders of the Kurus,

original: prasahya mandam aiśvarye na niyacchata yan nṛpam
analyzed: prasahya mandam aiśvarye na niyacchata yat nṛpam
translated: that you do not restrain this wicked king from his sovereignty by force.

original: tatra kāryam ahaṃ manye prāptakālam ariṃdamāḥ
analyzed: tatra kāryam aham manye prāpta kālam ariṃdamāḥ
translated: O destroyers of enemies, I think the time has come for action in this matter.

original: kriyamāṇe bhavec chreyas tat sarvaṃ śṛṇutānaghāḥ
analyzed: kriyamāṇe bhavet śreyaḥ tat sarvam śṛṇuta anaghāḥ
translated: If it is done, it will bring welfare. Listen to all that, O sinless ones.

original: pratyakṣam etad bhavatāṃ yad vakṣyāmi hitaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: pratyakṣam etat bhavatām yat vakṣyāmi hitam vacaḥ
translated: I shall speak beneficial words that are directly visible to you all.

original: bhavatām ānukūlyena yadi roceta bhāratāḥ🔽bhojarājasya vṛddhasya durācāro hy anātmavān
analyzed: bhavatām ānukūlyena yadi roceta bhāratāḥ  bhojarājasya vṛddhasya durācāraḥ hi anātmavān
translated: O descendants of Bharata, if it pleases you, out of favor towards you,

original: jīvataḥ pitur aiśvaryaṃ hṛtvā manyuvaśaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: jīvataḥ pituḥ aiśvaryam hṛtvā manyu vaśam gataḥ
translated: The wicked and self-willed one seized the kingdom of his living father and went under the sway of anger.

analyzed: ugrasena sutaḥ kaṃsaḥ parityaktaḥ sa bāndhavaiḥ
translated: Kamsa, the son of Ugrasena, was abandoned by his relatives.

analyzed: jñātīnām hita kāmena mayā śastaḥ mahā mṛdhe
translated: For the welfare of my relatives, I killed him in a great battle.

original: āhukaḥ punar asmābhir jñātibhiś cāpi satkṛtaḥ
analyzed: āhukaḥ punar asmābhiḥ jñātibhiḥ ca api satkṛtaḥ
translated: Ahahuka was again honored by us and our relatives.

analyzed: ugrasenaḥ kṛtaḥ rājā bhoja rājanya vardhanaḥ
translated: Ugrasena was made the king, the enhancer of the Bhoja dynasty.

analyzed: kaṃsam ekam parityajya kula arthe sarva yādavāḥ
translated: For the sake of the family, all the Yadavas, except for Kamsa alone,

analyzed: saṃbhūya sukham edhante bhārata andhaka vṛṣṇayaḥ
translated: United, prosper in happiness, the Andhakas and Vrishnis, O Bharata.

original: api cāpy avadad rājan parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ
analyzed: api ca api avadat rājan parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ
translated: And, O king, Parameshthi Prajapati said,

analyzed: vyūḍhe devāsure yuddhe bhyudyateṣu āyudheṣu ca
translated: When the battle between the gods and asuras was arrayed, and weapons were raised,

analyzed: dvaidhībhūteṣu lokeṣu vinaśyatsu ca bhārata
translated: And the worlds were divided in two, and were being destroyed, O Bharata,

analyzed: abravīt sṛṣṭimān devaḥ bhagavān loka bhāvanaḥ
translated: The creator god, the illustrious upholder of the worlds, said:

analyzed: parābhaviṣyanti asurāḥ daiteyāḥ dānavaiḥ saha
translated: The asuras, the Daityas and the Danavas will be defeated.

analyzed: ādityāḥ vasavaḥ rudrāḥ bhaviṣyanti divaukasaḥ
translated: The Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, and other denizens of heaven,

analyzed: deva asura manuṣyāḥ ca gandharva uraga rākṣasāḥ
translated: The gods, demons, humans, gandharvas, serpents, and rakshasas,

analyzed: asmin yuddhe su saṃyattāḥ haniṣyanti parasparam
translated: United in this battle, will kill each other.

original: vartamānaṃ jagat sarvaṃ muhūrtān na bhaviṣyati
analyzed: vartamānam jagat sarvam muhūrtāt na bhaviṣyati
translated: The entire present world will cease to exist in a moment.

analyzed: anya nāśena jagataḥ lokasya ca paraṃtapa
translated: For the destruction of others, O scorcher of enemies,

analyzed: iti matvā abravīt dharmam parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ
translated: Considering this, the Supreme Lord Prajapati spoke to Dharma:

analyzed: varuṇāya prayaccha etān baddhvā daiteya dānavān
translated: Bind the Daityas and Danavas and give them to Varuna.

original: evam uktas tato dharmo niyogāt parameṣṭhinaḥ
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tatas dharmaḥ niyogāt parameṣṭhinaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Dharma, by the command of the Supreme Lord,

analyzed: varuṇāya dadau sarvān baddhvā daiteya dānavān
translated: Bound all the Daityas and Danavas and gave them to Varuna.

original: tān baddhvā dharmapāśaiś ca svaiś ca pāśair jaleśvaraḥ
analyzed: tān baddhvā dharma pāśaiḥ ca svaiḥ ca pāśaiḥ jaleśvaraḥ
translated: Binding them with Dharma's nooses and his own nooses,

original: varuṇaḥ sāgare yatto nityaṃ rakṣati dānavān
analyzed: varuṇaḥ sāgare yattaḥ nityam rakṣati dānavān
translated: Varuna, the lord of the waters, always carefully protects the Danavas in the ocean.

original: tathā duryodhanaṃ karṇaṃ śakuniṃ cāpi saubalam
analyzed: tathā duryodhanam karṇam śakunim ca api saubalam
translated: Similarly, bind Duryodhana, Karna, Shakuni the son of Subala,

original: baddhvā duḥśāsanaṃ cāpi pāṇḍavebhyaḥ prayacchata🔽tyajet kulārthe puruṣaṃ grāmasyārthe kulaṃ tyajet
analyzed: baddhvā duḥśāsanam ca api pāṇḍavebhyaḥ prayacchata  tyajet kula arthe puruṣam grāmasya arthe kulam tyajet
translated: And Dushasana, and give them to the Pandavas.🔽For the sake of the family, one should abandon a person; for the sake of the village, one should abandon the family;

analyzed: grāmam janapadasya arthe ātma arthe pṛthivīm tyajet
translated: For the sake of the country, one should abandon the village; for one's own sake, one should abandon the earth.

original: rājan duryodhanaṃ baddhvā tataḥ saṃśāmya pāṇḍavaiḥ
analyzed: rājan duryodhanam baddhvā tatas saṃśāmya pāṇḍavaiḥ
translated: O king, having captured Duryodhana, make peace with the Pandavas.

analyzed: tvad kṛte na vinaśyeyuḥ kṣatriyāḥ kṣatriya ṛṣabha
translated: Do not let the Kshatriyas be destroyed on account of you, O bull among the Kshatriyas.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: kṛṣṇasya vacanam śrutvā dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ janeśvaraḥ
translated: Having heard Krishna's words, Dhritarashtra, the lord of people,

analyzed: viduram sarva dharma jñam tvaramāṇaḥ bhyabhāṣata
translated: hurriedly spoke to Vidura, who knew all about dharma:

analyzed: gaccha tāta mahā prājñām gāndhārīm dīrgha darśinīm
translated: Go, my son, to the greatly wise and far-sighted Gandhari,

analyzed: ānaya iha tayā sārdham anuneṣyāmi durmatim
translated: and bring her here. With her I will try to persuade the evil-minded one.

analyzed: yadi sā api durātmānam śamayet duṣṭa cetasam
translated: If she can pacify that evil-minded and wicked-hearted one,

original: api kṛṣṇāya suhṛdas tiṣṭhema vacane vayam
analyzed: api kṛṣṇāya suhṛdaḥ tiṣṭhema vacane vayam
translated: then we will abide by Krishna's words, O friend.

original: api lobhābhibhūtasya panthānam anudarśayet🔽durbuddher duḥsahāyasya samarthaṃ bruvatī vacaḥ
analyzed: api lobha abhibhūtasya panthānam anudarśayet  durbuddheḥ duḥsahāyasya samartham bruvatī vacaḥ
translated: Will she show the path to one overwhelmed by greed?🔽Will she speak words capable of restraining the one of evil intellect and bad company?

original: api no vyasanaṃ ghoraṃ duryodhanakṛtaṃ mahat
analyzed: api naḥ vyasanam ghoram duryodhana kṛtam mahat
translated: Will she pacify our terrible calamity, the great misfortune brought about by Duryodhana,

analyzed: śamayet cira rātrāya yogakṣema vat avyayam
translated: for a long time, with secure and imperishable peace?

original: rājñas tu vacanaṃ śrutvā viduro dīrghadarśinīm
analyzed: rājñaḥ tu vacanam śrutvā viduraḥ dīrghadarśinīm
translated: Having heard the king's words, Vidura,

analyzed: ānayām āsa gāndhārīm dhṛtarāṣṭrasya śāsanāt
translated: brought Gandhari, the far-sighted one, at Dhritarashtra's command.

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: eṣa gāndhāri putras te durātmā śāsanātigaḥ
analyzed: eṣa gāndhāri putraḥ te durātmā śāsana atigaḥ
translated: O son of Gandhari, this wicked son of yours, disobedient to your commands,

analyzed: aiśvarya lobhāt aiśvaryam jīvitam ca prahāsyati
translated: Out of greed for sovereignty, will give up both his sovereignty and his life.

analyzed: aśiṣṭa vat amaryādaḥ pāpaiḥ saha durātmabhiḥ
translated: Uncultured, shameless, sinful, and evil,

analyzed: sabhāyāḥ nirgataḥ mūḍhaḥ vyatikramya suhṛd vacaḥ
translated: The fool has left the assembly, disregarding the words of his well-wishers.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: sā bhartur vacanaṃ śrutvā rājaputrī yaśasvinī
analyzed: sā bhartuḥ vacanam śrutvā rāja putrī yaśasvinī
translated: Having heard her husband's words, the illustrious princess,

original: anvicchantī mahac chreyo gāndhārī vākyam abravīt
analyzed: anvicchantī mahat śreyaḥ gāndhārī vākyam abravīt
translated: Seeking great welfare, Gandhari spoke these words:

analyzed: ānaya iha sutam kṣipram rājya kāmukam āturam
translated: Quickly bring your son here, who is eager for the kingdom and afflicted.

original: na hi rājyam aśiṣṭena śakyaṃ dharmārthalopinā
analyzed: na hi rājyam aśiṣṭena śakyam dharma artha lopinā
translated: For a kingdom cannot be obtained by one who is uncultured, who violates righteousness and material interests,

analyzed: āptum āptam tathā api idam avinītena sarvathā
translated: Or by one who is undisciplined, even if it has been obtained.

original: tvaṃ hy evātra bhṛśaṃ garhyo dhṛtarāṣṭra sutapriyaḥ
analyzed: tvam hi eva atra bhṛśam garhyaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭra suta priyaḥ
translated: You alone are to be severely blamed here, O Dhritarashtra, for your love for your son,

original: yo jānan pāpatām asya tatprajñām anuvartase
analyzed: yaḥ jānan pāpa tām asya tad prajñām anuvartase
translated: For knowing his wickedness, you still follow his wisdom.

original: sa eṣa kāmamanyubhyāṃ pralabdho moham āsthitaḥ🔽aśakyo 'dya tvayā rājan vinivartayituṃ balāt
analyzed: saḥ eṣa kāma manyubhyām pralabdhaḥ moham āsthitaḥ  aśakyaḥ dya tvayā rājan vinivartayitum balāt
translated: He, deluded by desire and anger, has fallen into delusion.🔽He cannot be turned back by force now, O king.

analyzed: rājya pradāne mūḍhasya bāliśasya durātmanaḥ
translated: In bestowing the kingdom on the deluded, foolish and evil-minded one,

analyzed: duḥsahāyasya lubdhasya dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ śnute phalam
translated: Dhritarashtra reaps the fruits of having a greedy son with bad friends.

original: kathaṃ hi svajane bhedam upekṣeta mahāmatiḥ
analyzed: katham hi sva jane bhedam upekṣeta mahāmatiḥ
translated: How can the greatly intelligent one ignore the dissension among his own people?

original: bhinnaṃ hi svajanena tvāṃ prasahiṣyanti śatravaḥ
analyzed: bhinnam hi sva janena tvām prasahiṣyanti śatravaḥ
translated: For when you are divided by your own people, your enemies will overpower you.

original: yā hi śakyā mahārāja sāmnā dānena vā punaḥ
analyzed: yā hi śakyā mahā rāja sāmnā dānena vā punar
translated: O great king! That which can be overcome through conciliation or gifts,

original: nistartum āpadaḥ sveṣu daṇḍaṃ kas tatra pātayet🔽śāsanād dhṛtarāṣṭrasya duryodhanam amarṣaṇam
analyzed: nistartum āpadaḥ sveṣu daṇḍam kaḥ tatra pātayet  śāsanāt dhṛtarāṣṭrasya duryodhanam amarṣaṇam
translated: when faced with a calamity among one's own people, who would use punishment against them?🔽At the command of Dhritarashtra and at the request of his mother,

original: mātuś ca vacanāt kṣattā sabhāṃ prāveśayat punaḥ
analyzed: mātuḥ ca vacanāt kṣattā sabhām prāveśayat punar
translated: Kshatta again brought the intolerant Duryodhana into the assembly hall.

original: sa mātur vacanākāṅkṣī praviveśa sabhāṃ punaḥ
analyzed: sa mātuḥ vacana ākāṅkṣī praviveśa sabhām punar
translated: Desiring to hear his mother's words, he again entered the assembly hall,

analyzed: abhitāmra īkṣaṇaḥ krodhāt niḥśvasan iva pannagaḥ
translated: his eyes red with anger, sighing like a serpent.

original: taṃ praviṣṭam abhiprekṣya putram utpatham āsthitam
analyzed: tam praviṣṭam abhiprekṣya putram utpatham āsthitam
translated: Seeing his son enter, having resorted to a wrong path,

analyzed: vigarhamāṇā gāndhārī samartham vākyam abravīt
translated: Gandhari, reproaching him, spoke these words of wisdom:

analyzed: duryodhana nibodha idam vacanam mama putraka
translated: O Duryodhana, listen to these words of mine, O son!

original: hitaṃ te sānubandhasya tathāyatyāṃ sukhodayam🔽duryodhana yad āha tvāṃ pitā bharatasattama
analyzed: hitam te sa anubandhasya tathā āyatyām sukha udayam  duryodhana yat āha tvām pitā bharata sattama
translated: They are for your welfare and that of your followers, and will bring happiness in the future.🔽O Duryodhana, listen to what your father, the best of the Bharata lineage, says to you.

original: bhīṣmo droṇaḥ kṛpaḥ kṣattā suhṛdāṃ kuru tad vacaḥ
analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ droṇaḥ kṛpaḥ kṣattā suhṛdām kuru tat vacaḥ
translated: O Duryodhana, follow the words of Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, Kshatta and your well-wishers.

original: bhīṣmasya tu pituś caiva mama cāpacitiḥ kṛtā
analyzed: bhīṣmasya tu pituḥ ca eva mama ca apacitiḥ kṛtā
translated: You will have repaid the debt to Bhishma, to your father and to me.

original: bhaved droṇamukhānāṃ ca suhṛdāṃ śāmyatā tvayā🔽na hi rājyaṃ mahāprājña svena kāmena śakyate
analyzed: bhavet droṇa mukhānām ca suhṛdām śāmyatā tvayā  na hi rājyam mahā prājña svena kāmena śakyate
translated: And by your peace, you will have repaid the debt to your friends, headed by Drona.

original: avāptuṃ rakṣituṃ vāpi bhoktuṃ vā bharatarṣabha
analyzed: avāptum rakṣitum vā api bhoktum vā bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O greatly wise one, O best of the Bharata race, it is not possible to obtain, protect or enjoy the kingdom by one's own will.

original: na hy avaśyendriyo rājyam aśnīyād dīrgham antaram
analyzed: na hi avaśya indriyaḥ rājyam aśnīyāt dīrgham antaram

original: vijitātmā tu medhāvī sa rājyam abhipālayet
analyzed: vijita ātmā tu medhāvī sa rājyam abhipālayet

analyzed: kāma krodhau hi puruṣam arthebhyaḥ vyapakarṣataḥ
translated: For lust and anger take a man away from his wealth.

original: tau tu śatrū vinirjitya rājā vijayate mahīm
analyzed: tau tu śatrū vinirjitya rājā vijayate mahīm
translated: But having conquered those two enemies, the king conquers the earth.

analyzed: loka īśvara prabhu tvam hi mahat etat durātmabhiḥ
translated: This great lordship over the world is coveted by the wicked.

original: rājyaṃ nāmepsitaṃ sthānaṃ na śakyam abhirakṣitum
analyzed: rājyam nāma īpsitam sthānam na śakyam abhirakṣitum

analyzed: indriyāṇi mahat prepsuḥ niyacchet artha dharmayoḥ  indriyaiḥ niyataiḥ buddhiḥ vardhate gniḥ iva indhanaiḥ
translated: One who desires the great should control his senses in matters of wealth and dharma.🔽The intellect increases when the senses are controlled, like a fire with fuel.

analyzed: a vidhyeyāni hi imāni vyāpādayitum api alam
translated: These [senses] cannot be pierced, they cannot be destroyed.

analyzed: avidheyāḥ iva adāntāḥ hayāḥ pathi kusārathim
translated: Like uncontrolled horses on the road, a bad charioteer.

analyzed: a vijitya yaḥ ātmānam amātyān vijigīṣate
translated: He who desires to conquer his ministers without conquering his own self,

analyzed: ajita ātmā ajita amātyaḥ saḥ vaśaḥ parihīyate
translated: He who has not conquered his soul and his ministers, is powerless and falls.

original: ātmānam eva prathamaṃ deśarūpeṇa yo jayet
analyzed: ātmānam eva prathamam deśa rūpeṇa yaḥ jayet
translated: He who first conquers himself by the form of the country,

analyzed: tatas mātyān amitrān ca na mogham vijigīṣate
translated: then his ministers and enemies, does not conquer in vain.

analyzed: vaśya indriyam jita amātyam dhṛta daṇḍam vikāriṣu
translated: He who has conquered his senses, his ministers, and holds the rod over the unruly,

original: parīkṣyakāriṇaṃ dhīram atyantaṃ śrīr niṣevate🔽kṣudrākṣeṇeva jālena jhaṣāv apihitāv ubhau
analyzed: parīkṣyakāriṇam dhīram atyantam śrīḥ niṣevate  kṣudra akṣeṇa iva jālena jhaṣau apihitau ubhau

analyzed: kāma krodhau śarīra sthau prajñānam tau vilumpataḥ

translated: By whom the gods closed the door to heaven for one who goes to heaven,

analyzed: bibhyataḥ nu parāgasya kāma krodhau sma vardhitau  kāmam krodham ca lobham ca dambham darpam ca bhūmipaḥ
translated: fearing the attachment of desire and anger, they increased.🔽The king who knows well how to conquer desire, anger, greed, hypocrisy and pride,

original: samyag vijetuṃ yo veda sa mahīm abhijāyate
analyzed: samyak vijetum yaḥ veda sa mahīm abhijāyate
translated: he conquers the earth.

original: satataṃ nigrahe yukta indriyāṇāṃ bhaven nṛpaḥ
analyzed: satatam nigrahe yuktaḥ indriyāṇām bhavet nṛpaḥ
translated: The king should always be engaged in controlling the senses,

original: īpsann arthaṃ ca dharmaṃ ca dviṣatāṃ ca parābhavam
analyzed: īpsan artham ca dharmam ca dviṣatām ca parābhavam

analyzed: kāma abhibhūtaḥ krodhāt vā yaḥ mithyā pratipadyate
translated: He who acts falsely out of the domination of desire or anger,

analyzed: sveṣu ca anyeṣu vā tasya na sahāyāḥ bhavanti uta
translated: his own people and others do not become his allies.

analyzed: ekībhūtaiḥ mahā prājñaiḥ śūraiḥ ari nibarhaṇaiḥ
translated: United with the greatly wise and heroic Pandavas, the destroyers of their enemies,

original: pāṇḍavaiḥ pṛthivīṃ tāta bhokṣyase sahitaḥ sukhī
analyzed: pāṇḍavaiḥ pṛthivīm tāta bhokṣyase sahitaḥ sukhī

analyzed: yathā bhīṣmaḥ śāṃtanavaḥ droṇaḥ ca api mahā rathaḥ
translated: As Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, and the great warrior Drona,

analyzed: āhatuḥ tāta tat satyam ajeyau kṛṣṇa pāṇḍavau

analyzed: suhṛdām vacane tiṣṭhan yaśaḥ prāpsyasi bhārata

analyzed: teṣām pāpam abhiprāyam pāpānām duṣṭa cetasām
translated: The wicked-minded wicked ones had a sinful intention,

analyzed: iṅgita jñaḥ kaviḥ kṣipram anvabudhyata sātyakiḥ
translated: and Sātyaki, who knew the signs and was wise, quickly understood it.

analyzed: tad artham abhiniṣkramya hārdikyena saha āsthitaḥ
translated: For that purpose, he went out and stayed with Hāridīkya,

analyzed: abravīt kṛtavarmāṇam kṣipram yojaya vāhinīm
translated: and said to Kṛtavarman, Quickly prepare the army.

analyzed: vyūḍha anīkaḥ sabhā dvāram upatiṣṭhasva daṃśitaḥ
translated: Stand at the gate of the assembly hall with your troops arranged in battle formation, wearing armor,

analyzed: yāvat ākhyāmi aham ca etat kṛṣṇāya akliṣṭa karmaṇe
translated: while I inform this to Kṛṣṇa, whose deeds are unwearied.

original: sa praviśya sabhāṃ vīraḥ siṃho giriguhām iva
analyzed: sa praviśya sabhām vīraḥ siṃhaḥ giri guhām iva
translated: That hero entered the assembly hall like a lion entering a mountain cave,

analyzed: ācaṣṭa tam abhiprāyam keśavāya mahātmane
translated: and told the great-souled Keśava his intention.

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭram tatas ca eva viduram ca anvabhāṣata
translated: Then he spoke to Dhṛtarāṣṭra and Vidura,

original: teṣām etam abhiprāyam ācacakṣe smayann iva
analyzed: teṣām etam abhiprāyam ācacakṣe smayan iva
translated: and as if smiling, he told them that intention.

original: dharmād apetam arthāc ca karma sādhuvigarhitam
analyzed: dharmāt apetam arthāt ca karma sādhu vigarhitam
translated: Devoid of dharma and artha, that act is condemned by the virtuous.

original: mandāḥ kartum ihecchanti na cāvāpyaṃ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: mandāḥ kartum iha icchanti na ca avāpyam katham cana
translated: The dull-witted ones desire to do it here, but it can never be attained.

analyzed: purā vikurvate mūḍhāḥ pāpa ātmānaḥ samāgatāḥ
translated: In the past, the foolish ones, the sinful ones, assembled together,

analyzed: dharṣitāḥ kāma manyubhyām krodha lobha vaśa anugāḥ
translated: Overcome by lust and anger, following the sway of anger and greed,

analyzed: imam hi puṇḍarīkākṣam jighṛkṣanti alpa cetasaḥ
translated: They seek to seize this Pundarikaksha, the one of little intelligence,

original: paṭenāgniṃ prajvalitaṃ yathā bālā yathā jaḍāḥ
analyzed: paṭena agnim prajvalitam yathā bālāḥ yathā jaḍāḥ
translated: Like children or fools covering a blazing fire with a cloth.

original: sātyakes tad vacaḥ śrutvā viduro dīrghadarśivān
analyzed: sātyakeḥ tat vacaḥ śrutvā viduraḥ dīrgha darśivān
translated: Having heard those words of Satyaki, the far-sighted Vidura,

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭram mahā bāhum abravīt kuru saṃsadi
translated: Spoke to the mighty-armed Dhritarashtra in the assembly of the Kurus:

analyzed: yathā vārāṇasī dagdhā sa aśvā sa ratha kuñjarā
translated: Just as Varanasi was burned with its horses, chariots and elephants,

original: sānubandhas tu kṛṣṇena kāśīnām ṛṣabho hataḥ
analyzed: sa anubandhaḥ tu kṛṣṇena kāśīnām ṛṣabhaḥ hataḥ
translated: And the bull of the Kashi people was killed along with his followers by Krishna,

analyzed: tathā nāgapuram dagdhvā śaṅkha cakra gadā dharaḥ
translated: In the same way, after burning down Nagapura, the wielder of conch, discus and club,

analyzed: svayam kāla īśvaraḥ bhūtvā nāśayiṣyati kauravān
translated: Becoming the Lord of Time himself, will destroy the Kouravas.

analyzed: pārijāta haram hi enam ekam yadu sukha āvaham
translated: He who took away the Parijata tree, the sole source of happiness for the Yadus,

analyzed: na abhyavartata saṃrabdhaḥ vṛtrahā vasubhiḥ saha
translated: The enraged Vritra-slayer, along with the Vasus, could not prevail against him.

analyzed: prāpya nirmocane pāśān ṣaṣ sahasrān tarasvinaḥ
translated: Having reached Nirmochana, the swift ones freed themselves from the six thousand nooses,

original: hṛtās te vāsudevena hy upasaṃkramya kauravān
analyzed: hṛtāḥ te vāsudevena hi upasaṃkramya kauravān
translated: They were taken away by Vasudeva after approaching the Kouravas.

original: dvāram āsādya saubhasya vidhūya gadayā girim
analyzed: dvāram āsādya saubhasya vidhūya gadayā girim
translated: Having reached the gate of Saubha, having shattered the mountain with his club,

analyzed: dyumatsenaḥ saha amātyaḥ kṛṣṇena vinipātitaḥ
translated: Dyumatsena was brought down by Krishna along with his ministers.

analyzed: śeṣavat tvāt kurūṇām tu dharma apekṣī tathā acyutaḥ
translated: But Achyuta, out of consideration for dharma, spared the remnants of the Kurus.

analyzed: kṣamate puṇḍarīkākṣaḥ śaktaḥ san pāpa karmaṇām
translated: The lotus-eyed one, though capable, forgives the sinful deeds.

original: ete hi yadi govindam icchanti saha rājabhiḥ
analyzed: ete hi yadi govindam icchanti saha rājabhiḥ
translated: If they desire Govinda along with the kings,

analyzed: adyā eva atithayaḥ sarve bhaviṣyanti yamasya te
translated: all of them will today become guests of Yama.

original: yathā vāyos tṛṇāgrāṇi vaśaṃ yānti balīyasaḥ
analyzed: yathā vāyoḥ tṛṇa agrāṇi vaśam yānti balīyasaḥ
translated: Just as the tips of grass come under the control of the powerful wind,

original: tathā cakrabhṛtaḥ sarve vaśam eṣyanti kauravāḥ
analyzed: tathā cakrabhṛtaḥ sarve vaśam eṣyanti kauravāḥ
translated: in the same way all the Kauravas will come under the control of the wielder of the discus.

original: rājan parītakālās te putrāḥ sarve paraṃtapa
analyzed: rājan parīta kālāḥ te putrāḥ sarve paraṃtapa
translated: O king, all your sons, the scorchers of enemies, are at the end of their time.

original: ayaśasyam aśakyaṃ ca karma kartuṃ samudyatāḥ🔽imaṃ hi puṇḍarīkākṣam abhibhūya prasahya ca
analyzed: ayaśasyam aśakyam ca karma kartum samudyatāḥ  imam hi puṇḍarīkākṣam abhibhūya prasahya ca
translated: They are ready to perform an infamous and impossible deed.🔽Indeed, they desire to capture this lotus-eyed one, having overpowered and subdued him,

analyzed: nigrahītum kila icchanti sahitāḥ vāsava anujam
translated: along with the younger brother of Vasava.

analyzed: imam puruṣa śārdūlam apradhṛṣyam durāsadam
translated: Having approached this tiger among men, who is unassailable and difficult to approach,

original: āsādya na bhaviṣyanti pataṃgā iva pāvakam
analyzed: āsādya na bhaviṣyanti pataṃgāḥ iva pāvakam
translated: they will not exist, like insects before a fire.

original: ete na śaktāḥ sarve hi sāhasāt kartum udyatāḥ🔽ayam icchan hi tān sarvān yatamānāñ janārdanaḥ
analyzed: ete na śaktāḥ sarve hi sāhasāt kartum udyatāḥ  ayam icchan hi tān sarvān yatamānām janārdanaḥ
translated: All of them are not capable of doing this rash act.🔽Janardana, if he so wishes,

original: siṃho mṛgān iva kruddho gamayed yamasādanam
analyzed: siṃhaḥ mṛgān iva kruddhaḥ gamayet yama sādanam
translated: can send all of them, striving their best, to Yama's abode, like an angry lion to the deer.

original: na tv ayaṃ ninditaṃ karma kuryāt kṛṣṇaḥ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na tu ayam ninditam karma kuryāt kṛṣṇaḥ katham cana
translated: But Krishna will never perform such a censurable act.

original: na ca dharmād apakrāmed acyutaḥ puruṣottamaḥ
analyzed: na ca dharmāt apakrāmet acyutaḥ puruṣottamaḥ
translated: And Achyuta, the best of men, will never swerve from dharma.

original: vidureṇaivam ukte tu keśavo vākyam abravīt
analyzed: vidureṇa evam ukte tu keśavaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: When Vidura said this, Keshava spoke these words,

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭram abhiprekṣya suhṛdām śṛṇvatām mithas
translated: looking at Dhritarashtra, while his well-wishers listened to each other:

original: rājann ete yadi kruddhā māṃ nigṛhṇīyur ojasā
analyzed: rājan ete yadi kruddhāḥ mām nigṛhṇīyuḥ ojasā
translated: O king, if these angry ones were to restrain me by force,

original: ete vā mām ahaṃ vainān anujānīhi pārthiva
analyzed: ete vā mām aham vā enān anujānīhi pārthiva
translated: either they or I will restrain them. Give permission, O king.

original: etān hi sarvān saṃrabdhān niyantum aham utsahe
analyzed: etān hi sarvān saṃrabdhān niyantum aham utsahe
translated: For I am capable of restraining all these enraged ones.

original: na tv ahaṃ ninditaṃ karma kuryāṃ pāpaṃ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na tu aham ninditam karma kuryām pāpam katham cana
translated: But I will never perform a censurable and sinful act.

original: pāṇḍavārthe hi lubhyantaḥ svārthād dhāsyanti te sutāḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍava arthe hi lubhyantaḥ svārthāt dhāsyanti te sutāḥ
translated: For, greedy for the sake of the Pandavas, your sons will lose their own interests.

original: ete ced evam icchanti kṛtakāryo yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: ete ced evam icchanti kṛta kāryaḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: If they so desire, Yudhishthira has accomplished his purpose,

analyzed: sa amātyāḥ saha bandhubhiḥ
translated: together with his ministers and relatives.

analyzed: adya eva kṛtakṛtyaḥ tu
translated: He has accomplished his purpose even today,

original: adyaiva hy aham etāṃś ca ye caitān anu bhārata
analyzed: adyā eva hi aham etān ca ye ca etān anu bhārata
translated: For today itself, O Bharata, I will restrain these and those who follow them,

analyzed: nigṛhya rājye rājānam sthāpayiṣyāmi pāṇḍavam
translated: and establish the king, the son of Pandu, in the kingdom.

original: eṣa me niścayo rājan yady eṣo 'sya viniścayaḥ
analyzed: eṣa me niścayaḥ rājan yadi eṣaḥ sya viniścayaḥ
translated: This is my resolve, O king, if this is his resolve.

analyzed: nardantu sahitāḥ śaṅkhāḥ paṇava ānaka nisvanaiḥ
translated: Let the conches be blown together with the sounds of drums and cymbals.

original: anāyāsena pārthānāṃ vartatāṃ ca śivaṃ mahat
analyzed: anāyāsena pārthānām vartatām ca śivam mahat
translated: Let there be great auspiciousness for the Parthas without any exertion.

original: nigṛhya rājan pārthebhyo dadyāṃ kiṃ duṣkṛtaṃ bhavet
analyzed: nigṛhya rājan pārthebhyaḥ dadyām kim duṣkṛtam bhavet
translated: O king, having restrained them, if I were to give them to the Parthas, what wrong would be done?

original: idaṃ tu na pravarteyaṃ ninditaṃ karma bhārata
analyzed: idam tu na pravarteyam ninditam karma bhārata
translated: But I will not engage in this censured action,

analyzed: saṃnidhau te mahā rāja krodha jam pāpa buddhi jam
translated: in your presence, O great king, this anger-born sinful thought.

original: eṣa duryodhano rājan yathecchati tathāstu tat
analyzed: eṣa duryodhanaḥ rājan yathā icchati tathā astu tat
translated: Let it be as Duryodhana wishes, O king.

original: ahaṃ tu sarvān samayān anujānāmi bhārata
analyzed: aham tu sarvān samayān anujānāmi bhārata
translated: But I approve of all the proposals, O Bharata.

analyzed: etat śrutvā tu viduram dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ bhyabhāṣata
translated: Having heard this, Dhritarashtra spoke to Vidura:

original: kṣipram ānaya taṃ pāpaṃ rājyalubdhaṃ suyodhanam
analyzed: kṣipram ānaya tam pāpam rājya lubdham suyodhanam
translated: Quickly bring that sinful Suyodhana, greedy for the kingdom,

analyzed: saha mitram saha amātyam sa sodaryam saha anugam
translated: together with his friends, ministers, uterine brothers, and followers.

analyzed: śaknuyām yadi panthānam avatārayitum punar
translated: If I can make him return to the path again.

original: tato duryodhanaṃ kṣattā punaḥ prāveśayat sabhām
analyzed: tatas duryodhanam kṣattā punar prāveśayat sabhām
translated: Then Kshatta again brought Duryodhana into the assembly hall.

analyzed: akāmam bhrātṛbhiḥ sārdham rājabhiḥ parivāritam
translated: unwilling, along with his brothers, surrounded by kings,

analyzed: atha duryodhanam rājā dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ bhyabhāṣata
translated: Then King Dhritarashtra spoke to Duryodhana,

original: karṇaduḥśāsanābhyāṃ ca rājabhiś cābhisaṃvṛtam🔽nṛśaṃsa pāpabhūyiṣṭha kṣudrakarmasahāyavān
analyzed: karṇa duḥśāsanābhyām ca rājabhiḥ ca abhisaṃvṛtam  nṛśaṃsa pāpa bhūyiṣṭha kṣudra karma sahāyavān
translated: surrounded by Karna, Duhshasana, and the kings,🔽O cruel one, full of sin, having companions in mean deeds,

original: pāpaiḥ sahāyaiḥ saṃhatya pāpaṃ karma cikīrṣasi
analyzed: pāpaiḥ sahāyaiḥ saṃhatya pāpam karma cikīrṣasi
translated: having conspired with sinful companions, you wish to perform a sinful act,

original: aśakyam ayaśasyaṃ ca sadbhiś cāpi vigarhitam
analyzed: aśakyam ayaśasyam ca sadbhiḥ ca api vigarhitam
translated: which is impossible, dishonorable, and condemned by the virtuous,

analyzed: yathā tvādṛśakaḥ mūḍhaḥ vyavasyet kula pāṃsanaḥ
translated: as one like you, a fool, a disgrace to the family, might plan.

analyzed: tvam imam puṇḍarīkākṣam apradhṛṣyam durāsadam
translated: You wish to seize this lotus-eyed one, who is invincible and unassailable,

analyzed: pāpaiḥ sahāyaiḥ saṃhatya nigrahītum kila icchasi
translated: having conspired with sinful companions, it is said.

original: yo na śakyo balātkartuṃ devair api savāsavaiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ na śakyaḥ balāt kartum devaiḥ api sa vāsavaiḥ
translated: He who cannot be overpowered by force even by the gods along with Indra,

original: taṃ tvaṃ prārthayase manda bālaś candramasaṃ yathā
analyzed: tam tvam prārthayase manda bālaḥ candramasam yathā
translated: you desire him, O fool, like a child desiring the moon.

original: devair manuṣyair gandharvair asurair uragaiś ca yaḥ
analyzed: devaiḥ manuṣyaiḥ gandharvaiḥ asuraiḥ uragaiḥ ca yaḥ
translated: He who cannot be borne in battle by gods, men, gandharvas, asuras, and serpents,

original: na soḍhuṃ samare śakyas taṃ na budhyasi keśavam
analyzed: na soḍhum samare śakyaḥ tam na budhyasi keśavam
translated: you do not understand that Keshava.

original: durgrahaḥ pāṇinā vāyur duḥsparśaḥ pāṇinā śaśī
analyzed: durgrahaḥ pāṇinā vāyuḥ duḥsparśaḥ pāṇinā śaśī
translated: The wind is difficult to grasp with the hand, the moon is difficult to touch with the hand,

original: durdharā pṛthivī mūrdhnā durgrahaḥ keśavo balāt
analyzed: durdharā pṛthivī mūrdhnā durgrahaḥ keśavaḥ balāt
translated: The earth is difficult to hold on the head, and Keshava is difficult to grasp by force.

analyzed: iti ukte dhṛtarāṣṭreṇa kṣattā api viduraḥ bravīt
translated: When this was said by Dhritarashtra, Kshatta Vidura also spoke,

analyzed: duryodhanam abhiprekṣya dhārtarāṣṭram amarṣaṇam
translated: looking at Duryodhana, the intolerant son of Dhritarashtra:

analyzed: saubha dvāre vānara indraḥ dvividaḥ nāma nāmataḥ
translated: At Saubha's gate, the king of monkeys named Dvivida

analyzed: śilā varṣeṇa mahatā chādayām āsa keśavam
translated: covered Keshava with a great shower of rocks.

analyzed: duryodhana nibodha idam vacanam mama sāṃpratam
translated: O Duryodhana, listen to these words of mine now.

analyzed: grahītu kāmaḥ vikramya sarva yatnena mādhavam
translated: Desiring to capture Madhava by force and with all his efforts,

original: grahītuṃ nāśakat tatra taṃ tvaṃ prārthayase balāt
analyzed: grahītum nā aśakat tatra tam tvam prārthayase balāt
translated: he was unable to capture him there, yet you desire to forcibly seize him.

original: nirmocane ṣaṭ sahasrāḥ pāśair baddhvā mahāsurāḥ
analyzed: nirmocane ṣaṭ sahasrāḥ pāśaiḥ baddhvā mahā asurāḥ
translated: In the liberation, six thousand great demons, bound by ropes,

original: grahītuṃ nāśakaṃś cainaṃ taṃ tvaṃ prārthayase balāt🔽prāgjyotiṣagataṃ śauriṃ narakaḥ saha dānavaiḥ
analyzed: grahītum na aśakan ca enam tam tvam prārthayase balāt  prāgjyotiṣa gatam śaurim narakaḥ saha dānavaiḥ
translated: were unable to capture him, yet you desire to forcibly seize him.

original: grahītuṃ nāśakat tatra taṃ tvaṃ prārthayase balāt
analyzed: grahītum nā aśakat tatra tam tvam prārthayase balāt
translated: Shouri, who went to Pragjyotisha, was unable to be captured there by Naraka along with the demons, yet you desire to forcibly seize him.

analyzed: aneka yuga varṣa āyuḥ nihatya narakam mṛdhe
translated: Having killed Naraka in battle, whose lifespan was for many eons,

analyzed: nītvā kanyā sahasrāṇi upayeme yathāvidhi
translated: and having taken thousands of maidens, he married them according to the proper rites.

original: anena hi hatā bālye pūtanā śiśunā tathā
analyzed: anena hi hatā bālye pūtanā śiśunā tathā
translated: By him, in his childhood, Pūtanā was killed by that child.

analyzed: govardhanaḥ dhāritaḥ ca gavā arthe bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O best of the Bharata race, he held up the mount Govardhana for the sake of the kine.

original: ariṣṭo dhenukaś caiva cāṇūraś ca mahābalaḥ
analyzed: ariṣṭaḥ dhenukaḥ ca eva cāṇūraḥ ca mahā balaḥ
translated: Arishta, Dhenuka, the mighty Chanura,

original: aśvarājaś ca nihataḥ kaṃsaś cāriṣṭam ācaran
analyzed: aśvarājaḥ ca nihataḥ kaṃsaḥ ca ariṣṭam ācaran
translated: the king of horses, and Kansa who did evil, were all slain by him.

original: jarāsaṃdhaś ca vakraś ca śiśupālaś ca vīryavān🔽bāṇaś ca nihataḥ saṃkhye rājānaś ca niṣūditāḥ
analyzed: jarāsaṃdhaḥ ca vakraḥ ca śiśupālaḥ ca vīryavān  bāṇaḥ ca nihataḥ saṃkhye rājānaḥ ca niṣūditāḥ
translated: Jarasandha, Vakra, the powerful Shishupala,🔽and Vana were slain in battle, and many kings were killed by him.

analyzed: varuṇaḥ nirjitaḥ rājā pāvakaḥ ca amita ojasā
translated: The king Varuna was vanquished, and the god of fire of immeasurable prowess was vanquished by him.

original: pārijātaṃ ca haratā jitaḥ sākṣāc chacīpatiḥ
analyzed: pārijātam ca haratā jitaḥ sākṣāt śacīpatiḥ
translated: When he took away the Parijata flower, the lord of Shachi (Indra) was vanquished by him.

analyzed: ekārṇave śayānena hatau tau madhu kaiṭabhau
translated: When he lay on the one vast expanse of water, he slew Madhu and Kaitabha.

analyzed: janma antaram upāgamya hatavān vālinam tathā
translated: Having taken birth again, he slew Vali.

original: anye ca bhrātaras tasya kumbhakarṇādayo mṛdhe
analyzed: anye ca bhrātaraḥ tasya kumbhakarṇa ādayaḥ mṛdhe
translated: And in battle he slew Kumbhakarna and other brothers of Ravana.

original: bibhīṣaṇaṃ tu saṃsthāpya sītāṃ cādāya maithilīm
analyzed: bibhīṣaṇam tu saṃsthāpya sītām ca ādāya maithilīm
translated: Having installed Vibhishana, and having taken back Maithili Sita,

analyzed: pālayām āsa vidhivat rājyam nihata kaṇṭakam
translated: he ruled the kingdom, free from thorns (enemies), in accordance with the rules.

analyzed: janma antaram upāgamya hayagrīvaḥ tathā hataḥ
translated: Having taken birth again, Hayagriva was slain by him.

original: ayaṃ kartā na kriyate kāraṇaṃ cāpi pauruṣe
analyzed: ayam kartā na kriyate kāraṇam ca api pauruṣe
translated: He is the doer, not to be done, and also the cause in human effort.

original: yad yad icched ayaṃ śauris tat tat kuryād ayatnataḥ
analyzed: yat yat icchet ayam śauriḥ tat tat kuryāt ayatnataḥ
translated: Whatever Shouri (Krishna) desires, he can do it effortlessly.

original: taṃ na budhyasi govindaṃ ghoravikramam acyutam
analyzed: tam na budhyasi govindam ghora vikramam acyutam
translated: You do not understand Govinda, the imperishable one with terrible prowess,

analyzed: āśīviṣam iva kruddham tejaḥ rāśim anirjitam
translated: Like an angry venomous serpent, an unvanquished mass of energy.

analyzed: pradharṣayan mahā bāhum kṛṣṇam akliṣṭa kāriṇam
translated: Challenging the mighty-armed Krishna, the one who acts without fatigue,

analyzed: pataṃgaḥ gnim iva āsādya sa amātyaḥ na bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will be like an insect meeting its end in the fire, along with your ministers.

analyzed: tatas na ādṛtya vākyāni duḥśāsana purogamāḥ
translated: Then, disregarding his words, those led by Duhshasana,

analyzed: niyantu manasaḥ duṣṭāḥ kṛṣṇam matvā suyodhanam
translated: With wicked minds intent on restraining Krishna, considering him to be Suyodhana,

analyzed: babandhuḥ pāśa jālena deva māyā vimohitāḥ

analyzed: vidyāyām artha lābhe vā mātuḥ uccāre eva saḥ
translated: In learning or acquisition of wealth, he is just like his mother's excrement.

original: śrutena tapasā vāpi śriyā vā vikrameṇa vā
analyzed: śrutena tapasā vā api śriyā vā vikrameṇa vā
translated: He who surpasses other people by his learning, austerities, wealth, or valor,

original: janān yo 'bhibhavaty anyān karmaṇā hi sa vai pumān🔽na tv eva jālmīṃ kāpālīṃ vṛttim eṣitum arhasi
analyzed: janān yaḥ abhibhavati anyān karmaṇā hi sa vai pumān  na tu eva jālmīm kāpālīm vṛttim eṣitum arhasi
translated: By his deeds, he is indeed a man.

original: nṛśaṃsyām ayaśasyāṃ ca duḥkhāṃ kāpuruṣocitām🔽yam enam abhinandeyur amitrāḥ puruṣaṃ kṛśam
analyzed: nṛśaṃsyām ayaśasyām ca duḥkhām kāpuruṣa ucitām  yam enam abhinandeyuḥ amitrāḥ puruṣam kṛśam
translated: But you should not resort to the cruel, shameless, painful, and cowardly way of life of a beggar,

analyzed: lokasya samavajñātam nihīna aśana vāsasam
translated: Which is despised by the world, with inferior food and clothing.

analyzed: ahar lābha karam dīnam alpa jīvanam alpakam
translated: Oh, what a miserable, wretched, insignificant, and lowly person,🔽Who does not earn anything,

original: nedṛśaṃ bandhum āsādya bāndhavaḥ sukham edhate
analyzed: na īdṛśam bandhum āsādya bāndhavaḥ sukham edhate
translated: A kinsman who, having attained such a state, does not bring happiness to his relatives.

analyzed: avṛttyā eva vipatsyāmaḥ vayam rāṣṭrāt pravāsitāḥ
translated: We will be ruined by lack of livelihood, banished from the kingdom,

analyzed: sarva kāma rasaiḥ hīnāḥ sthāna bhraṣṭāḥ akiṃcanāḥ
translated: Deprived of all sensual pleasures, fallen from our position, and destitute.

analyzed: avarṇa kāriṇam satsu kula vaṃśasya nāśanam
translated: The bringer of disrepute among the good, the destroyer of the family lineage,

analyzed: kalim putra pravādena saṃjaya tvām ajījanam
translated: O Sanjaya, I have begotten you as my son in the name of Kali,

analyzed: niramarṣam nirutsāham nirvīryam ari nandanam
translated: You who are without anger, without enthusiasm, without vigor, and who delight your enemies,

original: mā sma sīmantinī kā cij janayet putram īdṛśam🔽mā dhūmāya jvalātyantam ākramya jahi śātravān
analyzed: mā sma sīmantinī kā cit janayet putram īdṛśam  mā dhūmāya jvala atyantam ākramya jahi śātravān
translated: May no woman give birth to a son like this.🔽Smoke, blaze, and utterly destroy your enemies.

original: jvala mūrdhany amitrāṇāṃ muhūrtam api vā kṣaṇam
analyzed: jvala mūrdhani amitrāṇām muhūrtam api vā kṣaṇam
translated: Blaze on the heads of your enemies, for a moment or even an instant.

original: etāvān eva puruṣo yad amarṣī yad akṣamī
analyzed: etāvān eva puruṣaḥ yat amarṣī yat akṣamī
translated: A man is only as much as he is resentful and unforgiving.

original: kṣamāvān niramarṣaś ca naiva strī na punaḥ pumān
analyzed: kṣamāvān niramarṣaḥ ca nā eva strī na punar pumān
translated: One who is forgiving and without resentment is neither a woman nor a man.

original: saṃtoṣo vai śriyaṃ hanti tathānukrośa eva ca
analyzed: saṃtoṣaḥ vai śriyam hanti tathā anukrośaḥ eva ca
translated: Contentment destroys prosperity, as does pity.

original: anutthānabhaye cobhe nirīho nāśnute mahat🔽ebhyo nikṛtipāpebhyaḥ pramuñcātmānam ātmanā
analyzed: anutthāna bhaye ca ubhe nirīhaḥ na aśnute mahat  ebhyaḥ nikṛti pāpebhyaḥ pramuñca ātmānam ātmanā
translated: Both are destroyed by fear of inactivity. One who is inactive does not attain greatness.🔽Free yourself from these deceitful evils by yourself.

original: āyasaṃ hṛdayaṃ kṛtvā mṛgayasva punaḥ svakam
analyzed: āyasam hṛdayam kṛtvā mṛgayasva punar svakam
translated: Make your heart like iron and seek your own again.

original: puraṃ viṣahate yasmāt tasmāt puruṣa ucyate
analyzed: puram viṣahate yasmāt tasmāt puruṣaḥ ucyate
translated: Because it endures the city, therefore it is called a man.

original: tam āhur vyarthanāmānaṃ strīvad ya iha jīvati
analyzed: tam āhuḥ vyartha nāmānam strī vat yaḥ iha jīvati
translated: They call him one whose name is in vain, who lives here like a woman.

analyzed: śūrasya ūrjita sattvasya siṃha vikrānta gāminaḥ
translated: Of the hero, of one of powerful spirit, who moves with the valor of a lion,

analyzed: diṣṭabhāvam gatasya api vighase modate prajā
translated: Even though he has gone to the state of fate, his people rejoice in the sacrificial offering.

original: ya ātmanaḥ priyasukhe hitvā mṛgayate śriyam
analyzed: yaḥ ātmanaḥ priya sukhe hitvā mṛgayate śriyam
translated: He who, abandoning his own happiness and pleasure, seeks for prosperity,

original: amātyānām atho harṣam ādadhāty acireṇa saḥ
analyzed: amātyānām atho harṣam ādadhāti acireṇa saḥ
translated: he soon engenders joy in his ministers.

analyzed: putraḥ uvāca
translated: The son said:

original: kiṃ nu te mām apaśyantyāḥ pṛthivyā api sarvayā
analyzed: kim nu te mām a paśyantyāḥ pṛthivyāḥ api sarvayā
translated: What have you to do with the whole earth, not seeing me?

original: kim ābharaṇakṛtyaṃ te kiṃ bhogair jīvitena vā
analyzed: kim ābharaṇa kṛtyam te kim bhogaiḥ jīvitena vā
translated: What need have you for ornaments, for enjoyments, or for life?

analyzed: mātā uvāca
translated: The mother said:

original: kim adyakānāṃ ye lokā dviṣantas tān avāpnuyuḥ
analyzed: kim adyakānām ye lokāḥ dviṣantaḥ tān avāpnuyuḥ
translated: May those who hate us obtain the worlds of those who act for this life alone.

original: ye tv ādṛtātmanāṃ lokāḥ suhṛdas tān vrajantu naḥ🔽bhṛtyair vihīyamānānāṃ parapiṇḍopajīvinām
analyzed: ye tu ādṛta ātmanām lokāḥ suhṛdaḥ tān vrajantu naḥ  bhṛtyaiḥ vihīyamānānām para piṇḍa upajīvinām
translated: May those who are well-disposed towards us go to the worlds of those who are respected.

analyzed: kṛpaṇānām asattvānām mā vṛttim anuvartithāḥ
translated: Do not follow the conduct of those who are destitute of spirit, who are pitied, who are dependent on the alms of others, and who are deprived of servants.

original: anu tvāṃ tāta jīvantu brāhmaṇāḥ suhṛdas tathā
analyzed: anu tvām tāta jīvantu brāhmaṇāḥ suhṛdaḥ tathā
translated: Let the Brahmanas, O father, and your friends live in dependence on you,

original: parjanyam iva bhūtāni devā iva śatakratum🔽yam ājīvanti puruṣaṃ sarvabhūtāni saṃjaya🔽pakvaṃ drumam ivāsādya tasya jīvitam arthavat
analyzed: parjanyam iva bhūtāni devāḥ iva śatakratum  yam ājīvanti puruṣam sarva bhūtāni saṃjaya  pakvam drumam iva āsādya tasya jīvitam arthavat
translated: as all creatures live in dependence on Parjanya, or the gods on Indra.🔽The life of that man, O Sanjaya, is fruitful,🔽on whom all creatures depend, as on a ripe fruit-bearing tree.

original: yasya śūrasya vikrāntair edhante bāndhavāḥ sukham
analyzed: yasya śūrasya vikrāntaiḥ edhante bāndhavāḥ sukham
translated: The life of him is well spent here, whose kinsmen live happily by the prowess of his heroism,

original: tridaśā iva śakrasya sādhu tasyeha jīvitam
analyzed: tridaśāḥ iva śakrasya sādhu tasya iha jīvitam
translated: like the thirty gods by the prowess of Indra.

analyzed: sva bāhu balam āśritya yaḥ bhyujjīvati mānavaḥ
translated: The life of that man is well spent, who, relying on the strength of his own arms, lives in prosperity,

original: sa loke labhate kīrtiṃ paratra ca śubhāṃ gatim
analyzed: sa loke labhate kīrtim paratra ca śubhām gatim
translated: He obtains fame in this world and a good end in the next.

analyzed: vidurā uvāca
translated: Vidura said:

analyzed: atha etasyām avasthāyām pauruṣam hātum icchasi
translated: If in this condition you wish to abandon manliness,

analyzed: nihīna sevitam mārgam gamiṣyasi acirāt iva
translated: You will soon go along the path frequented by the low.

original: yo hi tejo yathāśakti na darśayati vikramāt
analyzed: yaḥ hi tejaḥ yathāśakti na darśayati vikramāt
translated: One who does not display his energy to the best of his ability through valor,

original: kṣatriyo jīvitākāṅkṣī stena ity eva taṃ viduḥ
analyzed: kṣatriyaḥ jīvita ākāṅkṣī stenaḥ iti eva tam viduḥ
translated: That kshatriya who desires to live is known as a thief.

analyzed: arthavanti upapannāni vākyāni guṇavanti ca
translated: Words that are meaningful, appropriate, and virtuous,

original: naiva saṃprāpnuvanti tvāṃ mumūrṣum iva bheṣajam
analyzed: na eva saṃprāpnuvanti tvām mumūrṣum iva bheṣajam
translated: Do not reach you, like medicine to one who is about to die.

original: santi vai sindhurājasya saṃtuṣṭā bahavo janāḥ
analyzed: santi vai sindhurājasya saṃtuṣṭāḥ bahavaḥ janāḥ
translated: There are many people who are content with the king of Sindhu,

analyzed: daurbalyāt āsate mūḍhāḥ vyasana ogha pratīkṣiṇaḥ
translated: Who remain foolishly out of weakness, waiting for a flood of misfortune.

analyzed: sahāya upacayam kṛtvā vyavasāyya tatas tatas
translated: Having gathered allies from here and there, having made preparations,

analyzed: anuduṣyeyuḥ apare paśyantaḥ tava pauruṣam
translated: Others would be displeased, seeing your manliness.

original: taiḥ kṛtvā saha saṃghātaṃ giridurgālayāṃś cara
analyzed: taiḥ kṛtvā saha saṃghātam giri durga ālayān cara
translated: Having made an alliance with them, roam in the inaccessible mountain fortresses,

analyzed: kāle vyasanam ākāṅkṣan na eva ayam ajara amaraḥ
translated: Desiring misfortune at the right time, for this one is not free from old age and death.

original: saṃjayo nāmataś ca tvaṃ na ca paśyāmi tat tvayi
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ nāmataḥ ca tvam na ca paśyāmi tat tvayi
translated: You are named Sanjaya, but I do not see that in you.

original: anvarthanāmā bhava me putra mā vyarthanāmakaḥ
analyzed: anvartha nāmā bhava me putra mā vyartha nāmakaḥ
translated: Be a son with a meaningful name, do not have a meaningless name.

analyzed: samyak dṛṣṭiḥ mahā prājñaḥ bālam tvām brāhmaṇaḥ bravīt
translated: The Brahmana said to you, O greatly wise one, you have right vision.

original: ayaṃ prāpya mahat kṛcchraṃ punar vṛddhiṃ gamiṣyati
analyzed: ayam prāpya mahat kṛcchram punar vṛddhim gamiṣyati
translated: Having attained great difficulty, he will again prosper.

original: tasya smarantī vacanam āśaṃse vijayaṃ tava
analyzed: tasya smarantī vacanam āśaṃse vijayam tava
translated: Remembering his words, I hope for your victory.

original: tasmāt tāta bravīmi tvāṃ vakṣyāmi ca punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt tāta bravīmi tvām vakṣyāmi ca punar punar
translated: Therefore, O son, I tell you, and I will say it again and again,

original: yasya hy arthābhinirvṛttau bhavanty āpyāyitāḥ pare
analyzed: yasya hi artha abhinirvṛttau bhavanti āpyāyitāḥ pare
translated: For one whose enemies are satisfied in the accomplishment of his purpose,

analyzed: tasya artha siddhiḥ niyatā nayeṣu artha anusāriṇaḥ
translated: The accomplishment of his purpose is certain, following the principles of statecraft.

original: samṛddhir asamṛddhir vā pūrveṣāṃ mama saṃjaya
analyzed: samṛddhiḥ asamṛddhiḥ vā pūrveṣām mama saṃjaya
translated: Whether there is prosperity or adversity, O Sanjaya, for me and my ancestors,

original: evaṃ vidvān yuddhamanā bhava mā pratyupāhara
analyzed: evam vidvān yuddha manāḥ bhava mā pratyupāhara
translated: Knowing this, be ready for battle, do not turn back.

original: nātaḥ pāpīyasīṃ kāṃ cid avasthāṃ śambaro 'bravīt
analyzed: na atas pāpīyasīm kām cit avasthām śambaraḥ bravīt
translated: Shambara has not spoken of any state more wretched than this,

original: yatra naivādya na prātar bhojanaṃ pratidṛśyate🔽patiputravadhād etat paramaṃ duḥkham abravīt
analyzed: yatra na eva adya na prātar bhojanam pratidṛśyate  pati putra vadhāt etat paramam duḥkham abravīt
translated: Where neither today nor tomorrow is food to be seen.🔽This is said to be a greater sorrow than the death of a husband or son.

original: dāridryam iti yat proktaṃ paryāyamaraṇaṃ hi tat
analyzed: dāridryam iti yat proktam paryāya maraṇam hi tat
translated: What is called poverty is a succession of deaths.

original: ahaṃ mahākule jātā hradād dhradam ivāgatā
analyzed: aham mahā kule jātā hradāt hradam iva āgatā
translated: I was born in a great family, as if moving from one lake to another.

analyzed: īśvarī sarva kalyāṇaiḥ bhartrā parama pūjitā
translated: I was the mistress of all that is auspicious, greatly honored by my husband.

analyzed: mahārha mālya ābharaṇām su mṛṣṭa ambara vāsasam
translated: Adorned with costly garlands and ornaments, well-dressed in clean clothes,

original: purā dṛṣṭvā suhṛdvargo mām apaśyat sudurgatām
analyzed: purā dṛṣṭvā suhṛd vargaḥ mām apaśyat su durgatām
translated: In the past, my friends and relatives saw me in good circumstances, but now they see me in a very bad state.

original: yadā māṃ caiva bhāryāṃ ca draṣṭāsi bhṛśadurbale
analyzed: yadā mām ca eva bhāryām ca draṣṭāsi bhṛśa durbale
translated: When you see me and my wife extremely weak,

original: na tadā jīvitenārtho bhavitā tava saṃjaya🔽dāsakarmakarān bhṛtyān ācāryartvik purohitān🔽avṛttyāsmān prajahato dṛṣṭvā kiṃ jīvitena te🔽yadi kṛtyaṃ na paśyāmi tavādyeha yathā purā🔽ślāghanīyaṃ yaśasyaṃ ca kā śāntir hṛdayasya me
analyzed: na tadā jīvitena arthaḥ bhavitā tava saṃjaya  dāsa karmakarān bhṛtyān ācārya ṛtvij purohitān  avṛttyā asmān prajahataḥ dṛṣṭvā kim jīvitena te  yadi kṛtyam na paśyāmi tava adyā iha yathā purā  ślāghanīyam yaśasyam ca kā śāntiḥ hṛdayasya me
translated: then, O Sanjaya, you will have no interest in living.

original: neti ced brāhmaṇān brūyāṃ dīryate hṛdayaṃ mama🔽na hy ahaṃ na ca me bhartā neti brāhmaṇam uktavān🔽vayam āśrayaṇīyāḥ sma nāśritāraḥ parasya ca🔽sānyān āśritya jīvantī parityakṣyāmi jīvitam🔽apāre bhava naḥ pāram aplave bhava naḥ plavaḥ🔽kuruṣva sthānam asthāne mṛtān saṃjīvayasva naḥ🔽sarve te śatravaḥ sahyā na cej jīvitum icchasi🔽atha ced īdṛśīṃ vṛttiṃ klībām abhyupapadyase
