original: pitāmahaḥ śāṃtanava ācāryaś ca yudhāṃ patiḥ
analyzed: pitāmahaḥ śāṃtanavaḥ ācāryaḥ ca yudhām patiḥ
translated: The grandfather Shantanu's son, the preceptor, the lord of warriors,

original: karṇaś ca dhārtarāṣṭrārthaṃ vardhayanti bhayaṃ mama
analyzed: karṇaḥ ca dhārtarāṣṭra artham vardhayanti bhayam mama
translated: And Karna, for the sake of the sons of Dhritarashtra, increase my fear.

original: nācāryaḥ kāmavāñ śiṣyair droṇo yudhyeta jātu cit
analyzed: na ācāryaḥ kāmavān śiṣyaiḥ droṇaḥ yudhyeta jātu cit
translated: The preceptor Drona never fights with his disciples out of desire.

original: pāṇḍaveṣu kathaṃ hārdaṃ kuryān na ca pitāmahaḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍaveṣu katham hārdam kuryāt na ca pitāmahaḥ
translated: How can the grandfather act with partiality towards the Pandavas?

original: ayaṃ tv eko vṛthādṛṣṭir dhārtarāṣṭrasya durmateḥ
analyzed: ayam tu ekaḥ vṛthā dṛṣṭiḥ dhārtarāṣṭrasya durmateḥ
translated: But this one, out of vain pride, is the sole cause of the evil policy of the evil-minded son of Dhritarashtra.

original: mohānuvartī satataṃ pāpo dveṣṭi ca pāṇḍavān
analyzed: moha anuvartī satatam pāpaḥ dveṣṭi ca pāṇḍavān
translated: Out of delusion, he always follows him, and the sinner hates the Pandavas.

original: mahaty anarthe nirbandhī balavāṃś ca viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: mahati anarthe nirbandhī balavān ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: He is especially powerful and determined in great evil.

original: karṇaḥ sadā pāṇḍavānāṃ tan me dahati sāṃpratam
analyzed: karṇaḥ sadā pāṇḍavānām tat me dahati sāṃpratam
translated: Karna always sided with the Pandavas, that burns me now.

original: āśaṃse tv adya karṇasya mano 'haṃ pāṇḍavān prati
analyzed: āśaṃse tu adya karṇasya manaḥ ham pāṇḍavān prati
translated: But today I hope to turn Karna's mind towards the Pandavas,

analyzed: prasādayitum āsādya darśayantī yathātatham
translated: approaching him and showing him the truth.

original: toṣito bhagavān yatra durvāsā me varaṃ dadau
analyzed: toṣitaḥ bhagavān yatra durvāsāḥ me varam dadau
translated: When the illustrious Durvasa was pleased with me and granted me a boon,🔽he gave me a divine boon, O king, that I should be able to summon you

analyzed: āhvānam deva saṃyuktam vasantyāḥ pitṛ veśmani
translated: when I am living in my father's house.

analyzed: sā aham antaḥpure rājñaḥ kuntibhoja puraskṛtā
translated: I, being in the inner apartments of the king, honored by Kuntibhoja,

analyzed: cintayantī bahuvidham hṛdayena vidūyatā
translated: thinking in various ways with a sorrowful heart,

original: balābalaṃ ca mantrāṇāṃ brāhmaṇasya ca vāgbalam
analyzed: bala abalam ca mantrāṇām brāhmaṇasya ca vāc balam
translated: the strength and weakness of the mantras and the Brahmana's power of speech,

original: strībhāvād bālabhāvāc ca cintayantī punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: strī bhāvāt bāla bhāvāt ca cintayantī punar punar
translated: thinking again and again because of being a woman and a child,

analyzed: dhātryā viśrabdhayā guptā sakhī jana vṛtā tadā
translated: protected by a confident nurse and surrounded by female companions,

analyzed: doṣam pariharantī ca pituḥ cāritra rakṣiṇī
translated: avoiding faults and preserving my father's character,

original: kathaṃ nu sukṛtaṃ me syān nāparādhavatī katham
analyzed: katham nu su kṛtam me syāt na aparādhavatī katham
translated: how could I do good and not be guilty?

original: bhaveyam iti saṃcintya brāhmaṇaṃ taṃ namasya ca🔽kautūhalāt tu taṃ labdhvā bāliśyād ācaraṃ tadā
analyzed: bhaveyam iti saṃcintya brāhmaṇam tam namasya ca  kautūhalāt tu tam labdhvā bāliśyāt ācaram tadā
translated: Thinking thus and bowing to that Brahmana,🔽but out of curiosity, having obtained him, being foolish, I acted then.

original: kanyā satī devam arkam āsādayam ahaṃ tataḥ
analyzed: kanyā satī devam arkam āsādayam aham tatas
translated: Being a maiden, I approached the god Surya then.

analyzed: yaḥ sau kānīna garbhaḥ me putra vat parivartitaḥ
translated: He who was born as my son, as if exchanged for my son,

original: kasmān na kuryād vacanaṃ pathyaṃ bhrātṛhitaṃ tathā
analyzed: kasmāt na kuryāt vacanam pathyam bhrātṛ hitam tathā
translated: Why would he not do what is beneficial, what is for the good of his brother?

original: iti kuntī viniścitya kāryaṃ niścitam uttamam
analyzed: iti kuntī viniścitya kāryam niścitam uttamam
translated: Thus Kunti, having decided on the best course of action,

analyzed: kārya artham abhiniryāya yayau bhāgīrathīm prati
translated: went towards the Bhagirathi for the sake of her duty.

analyzed: ātmajasya tatas tasya ghṛṇinaḥ satya saṅginaḥ
translated: Then, for the sake of her son, that compassionate one who was true to his word,

analyzed: gaṅgā tīre pṛthā apaśyat upasthāna gatam vṛṣam
translated: Pritha saw a bull standing on the bank of the Ganges.

analyzed: gaṅgā tīre pṛthā a śṛṇvat upādhyayana nisvanam
translated: On the bank of the Ganges, Pritha heard the sound of recitation,

analyzed: prāc mukhasya ūrdhva bāhoḥ sā paryatiṣṭhata pṛṣṭhatas
translated: and she stood behind him, facing east with her arms raised.

analyzed: japya avasānam kārya artham pratīkṣantī tapasvinī
translated: The ascetic one, waiting for the end of the recitation for the sake of her duty,

analyzed: atiṣṭhat sūrya tāpa ārtā karṇasya uttara vāsasi
translated: stood in Karna's upper garment, scorched by the sun's heat.

original: kauravyapatnī vārṣṇeyī padmamāleva śuṣyatī🔽ā pṛṣṭhatāpāj japtvā sa parivṛtya yatavrataḥ
analyzed: kauravya patnī vārṣṇeyī padma mālā iva śuṣyatī  ā pṛṣṭhatāpāt japtvā sa parivṛtya yata vrataḥ
translated: The wife of the Kuru, the Varshneya, was drying up like a lotus garland.🔽Having recited until the heat of the back, that one of firm vows, turning around,

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā kuntīm upātiṣṭhat abhivādya kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: seeing Kunti, approached her, greeting her with folded hands.

analyzed: yathānyāyam mahā tejāḥ mānī dharma bhṛtām varaḥ
translated: The greatly energetic one, proud, best among the upholders of dharma,

original: utsmayan praṇataḥ prāha kuntīṃ vaikartano vṛṣaḥ
analyzed: utsmayan praṇataḥ prāha kuntīm vaikartanaḥ vṛṣaḥ
translated: smiling, bowed down and spoke to Kunti, Vaikartana Vrisha.

analyzed: karṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Karna said:

analyzed: rādheyaḥ ham ādhirathiḥ karṇaḥ tvām abhivādaye
translated: I am Karna, the son of Radha, the son of Adhiratha. I salute you.

original: prāptā kimarthaṃ bhavatī brūhi kiṃ karavāṇi te
analyzed: prāptā kimartham bhavatī brūhi kim karavāṇi te
translated: Why have you come? Tell me what I can do for you.

analyzed: kuntī uvāca
translated: Kunti said:

original: kaunteyas tvaṃ na rādheyo na tavādhirathaḥ pitā
analyzed: kaunteyaḥ tvam na rādheyaḥ na tava adhirathaḥ pitā
translated: You are the son of Kunti, not of Radha. Adhiratha is not your father.

original: nāsi sūtakule jātaḥ karṇa tad viddhi me vacaḥ
analyzed: na asi sūta kule jātaḥ karṇa tat viddhi me vacaḥ
translated: You were not born in a suta's family, Karna. Know these words of mine to be true.

original: kānīnas tvaṃ mayā jātaḥ pūrvajaḥ kukṣiṇā dhṛtaḥ
analyzed: kānīnaḥ tvam mayā jātaḥ pūrvajaḥ kukṣiṇā dhṛtaḥ
translated: You were born from me, O son, carried in my womb as my firstborn.

original: kuntibhojasya bhavane pārthas tvam asi putraka
analyzed: kuntibhojasya bhavane pārthaḥ tvam asi putraka
translated: You are the son of Kunti, O son, born in the house of Kuntibhoja.

analyzed: prakāśa karmā tapanaḥ yaḥ yam devaḥ virocanaḥ
translated: The god who shines, the sun, the illuminator, the resplendent one,

original: ajījanat tvāṃ mayy eṣa karṇa śastrabhṛtāṃ varam🔽kuṇḍalī baddhakavaco devagarbhaḥ śriyā vṛtaḥ
analyzed: ajījanat tvām mayi eṣa karṇa śastrabhṛtām varam  kuṇḍalī baddha kavacaḥ deva garbhaḥ śriyā vṛtaḥ
translated: he begot you in me, O Karna, the best of all wielders of weapons.🔽You were born, O invincible one, with earrings and a bound cuirass, a divine child, surrounded by splendor,

original: jātas tvam asi durdharṣa mayā putra pitur gṛhe
analyzed: jātaḥ tvam asi durdharṣa mayā putra pituḥ gṛhe
translated: in my father's house, O son.

original: sa tvaṃ bhrātṝn asaṃbuddhvā mohād yad upasevase
analyzed: sa tvam bhrātṝn a saṃbuddhvā mohāt yat upasevase
translated: But you, not recognizing your brothers, out of delusion serve

original: dhārtarāṣṭrān na tad yuktaṃ tvayi putra viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: dhārtarāṣṭrān na tat yuktam tvayi putra viśeṣataḥ
translated: the sons of Dhritarashtra. That is not proper for you, O son, especially.

analyzed: etat dharma phalam putra narāṇām dharma niścaye
translated: This, O son, is the fruit of righteousness for men who are firm in righteousness,

original: yat tuṣyanty asya pitaro mātā cāpy ekadarśinī
analyzed: yat tuṣyanti asya pitaraḥ mātā ca api eka darśinī
translated: that their father and mother, who see only once, are satisfied with them.

analyzed: arjunena arjitām pūrvam hṛtām lobhāt asādhubhiḥ
translated: Previously won by Arjuna, but taken away by the wicked through greed,

analyzed: ācchidya dhārtarāṣṭrebhyaḥ bhuṅkṣva yaudhiṣṭhirīm śriyam
translated: Take it back from the sons of Dhritarashtra and enjoy the prosperity of Yudhishthira.

analyzed: adya paśyantu kuravaḥ karṇa arjuna samāgamam
translated: Today let the Kurus see the meeting of Karna and Arjuna,

analyzed: saubhrātreṇa tat ālakṣya saṃnamantām asādhavaḥ
translated: And let the wicked ones, noticing it as fraternal, bow down.

analyzed: karṇa arjunau vai bhavatām yathā rāma janārdanau
translated: Karna and Arjuna are to you as Rama and Janardana,

original: asādhyaṃ kiṃ nu loke syād yuvayoḥ sahitātmanoḥ
analyzed: asādhyam kim nu loke syāt yuvayoḥ sahita ātmanoḥ
translated: What is impossible in the world for you two, whose souls are united?

original: karṇa śobhiṣyase nūnaṃ pañcabhir bhrātṛbhir vṛtaḥ
analyzed: karṇa śobhiṣyase nūnam pañcabhiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: O Karna, you will surely shine, surrounded by your five brothers,

analyzed: vedaiḥ parivṛtaḥ brahmā yathā vedāṅga pañcamaiḥ
translated: As Brahma is surrounded by the Vedas, with the fifth one (the Atharva Veda) as an accessory,

original: upapanno guṇaiḥ śreṣṭho jyeṣṭhaḥ śreṣṭheṣu bandhuṣu
analyzed: upapannaḥ guṇaiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ śreṣṭheṣu bandhuṣu
translated: You are endowed with the best qualities, the eldest among the best relatives,

original: sūtaputreti mā śabdaḥ pārthas tvam asi vīryavān
analyzed: sūtaputra iti mā śabdaḥ pārthaḥ tvam asi vīryavān
translated: Do not utter the word 'son of a suta', you are the valiant Partha.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tataḥ sūryān niścaritāṃ karṇaḥ śuśrāva bhāratīm
analyzed: tatas sūryāt niścaritām karṇaḥ śuśrāva bhāratīm
translated: Then Karna heard a voice coming from the sun,

analyzed: duratyayām praṇayinīm pitṛ vat bhāskara īritām
translated: Indestructible, affectionate, as if spoken by the sun like a father,

original: satyam āha pṛthā vākyaṃ karṇa mātṛvacaḥ kuru
analyzed: satyam āha pṛthā vākyam karṇa mātṛ vacaḥ kuru
translated: O Karna, Pritha has spoken the truth, do as your mother says,

original: śreyas te syān naravyāghra sarvam ācaratas tathā
analyzed: śreyaḥ te syāt nara vyāghra sarvam ācarataḥ tathā
translated: It will be for your good, O best of men, if you do everything as she says.

original: evam uktasya mātrā ca svayaṃ pitrā ca bhānunā
analyzed: evam uktasya mātrā ca svayam pitrā ca bhānunā
translated: Thus addressed by his mother and father, Bhanu,

original: cacāla naiva karṇasya matiḥ satyadhṛtes tadā
analyzed: cacāla nā eva karṇasya matiḥ satyadhṛteḥ tadā
translated: Karna, whose mind was fixed on truth, did not waver at all.

analyzed: karṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Karna said:

original: na te na śraddadhe vākyaṃ kṣatriye bhāṣitaṃ tvayā
analyzed: na te na śraddadhe vākyam kṣatriye bhāṣitam tvayā
translated: I do not disbelieve the words spoken by you, a Kshatriya.

analyzed: dharma dvāram mama etat syāt niyoga karaṇam tava
translated: It would be a gateway to dharma for me to carry out your command.

original: akaron mayi yat pāpaṃ bhavatī sumahātyayam🔽avakīrṇo 'smi te tena tad yaśaḥkīrtināśanam
analyzed: akarot mayi yat pāpam bhavatī su mahā atyayam  avakīrṇaḥ smi te tena tat yaśaḥ kīrti nāśanam
translated: The great sin that you, O lady, have committed on me🔽has defiled me, destroying my fame and glory.

original: ahaṃ ca kṣatriyo jāto na prāptaḥ kṣatrasatkriyām
analyzed: aham ca kṣatriyaḥ jātaḥ na prāptaḥ kṣatra satkriyām
translated: And I, born a Kshatriya, have not received the good treatment of a Kshatriya.

original: tvatkṛte kiṃ nu pāpīyaḥ śatruḥ kuryān mamāhitam🔽kriyākāle tv anukrośam akṛtvā tvam imaṃ mama
analyzed: tvad kṛte kim nu pāpīyaḥ śatruḥ kuryāt mama ahitam  kriyā kāle tu anukrośam a kṛtvā tvam imam mama
translated: What more sinful deed could an enemy do to harm me than this?🔽But now, at the time of action, without showing compassion for me,

analyzed: hīna saṃskāra samayam adya mām samacūcudaḥ
translated: you have goaded me, who is devoid of the proper rites and time.

original: na vai mama hitaṃ pūrvaṃ mātṛvac ceṣṭitaṃ tvayā
analyzed: na vai mama hitam pūrvam mātṛ vat ceṣṭitam tvayā
translated: You have not acted for my welfare before, as if you were a mother,

analyzed: sā mām saṃbodhayasi adya kevala ātma hita eṣiṇī
translated: but now you admonish me, seeking only your own welfare.

original: kṛṣṇena sahitāt ko vai na vyatheta dhanaṃjayāt
analyzed: kṛṣṇena sahitāt kaḥ vai na vyatheta dhanaṃjayāt
translated: Who would not be distressed by Dhananjaya, who is united with Krishna?

original: ko 'dya bhītaṃ na māṃ vidyāt pārthānāṃ samitiṃ gatam
analyzed: kaḥ bhītam na mām vidyāt pārthānām samitim gatam
translated: Who would not know me today as frightened, having gone to the assembly of the Parthas?

analyzed: abhrātā viditaḥ pūrvam yuddha kāle prakāśitaḥ
translated: He was not known as my brother before, but was revealed at the time of war.

original: pāṇḍavān yadi gacchāmi kiṃ māṃ kṣatraṃ vadiṣyati
analyzed: pāṇḍavān yadi gacchāmi kim mām kṣatram vadiṣyati
translated: If I go to the Pandavas, what will the Kshatriyas say to me?

original: sarvakāmaiḥ saṃvibhaktaḥ pūjitaś ca sadā bhṛśam
analyzed: sarva kāmaiḥ saṃvibhaktaḥ pūjitaḥ ca sadā bhṛśam
translated: He was always greatly honored and shared in all desires.

original: ahaṃ vai dhārtarāṣṭrāṇāṃ kuryāṃ tad aphalaṃ katham
analyzed: aham vai dhārtarāṣṭrāṇām kuryām tat aphalam katham
translated: How can I make that fruitless for the sons of Dhritarashtra?

original: upanahya parair vairaṃ ye māṃ nityam upāsate
analyzed: upanahya paraiḥ vairam ye mām nityam upāsate
translated: Those who always attend on me, having taken up enmity with the enemy,

original: namaskurvanti ca sadā vasavo vāsavaṃ yathā
analyzed: namaskurvanti ca sadā vasavaḥ vāsavam yathā
translated: And always bow to me, like the Vasus to Vasava.

original: mama prāṇena ye śatrūñ śaktāḥ pratisamāsitum
analyzed: mama prāṇena ye śatrūm śaktāḥ pratisamāsitum
translated: Those who today consider themselves able to counter the enemies with their own lives,

original: manyante 'dya kathaṃ teṣām ahaṃ bhindyāṃ manoratham
analyzed: manyante dya katham teṣām aham bhindyām manoratham
translated: How can I break their hopes?

analyzed: mayā plavena saṃgrāmam titīrṣanti duratyayam
translated: They desire to cross the unfordable battle by swimming with me.

original: apāre pārakāmā ye tyajeyaṃ tān ahaṃ katham
analyzed: apāre pāra kāmāḥ ye tyajeyam tān aham katham
translated: How can I abandon those who desire the other shore?

analyzed: ayam hi kālaḥ saṃprāptaḥ dhārtarāṣṭra upajīvinām
translated: This is the time that has come for those who depend on the sons of Dhritarashtra.

analyzed: nirveṣṭavyam mayā tatra prāṇān a parirakṣatā
translated: I must fulfill that, even at the cost of my life.

original: kṛtārthāḥ subhṛtā ye hi kṛtyakāla upasthite
analyzed: kṛtārthāḥ su bhṛtāḥ ye hi kṛtya kāle upasthite
translated: Those who are well-remunerated and have had their purpose accomplished, when the time for action has arrived,

analyzed: an avekṣya kṛtam pāpāḥ vikurvanti anavasthitāḥ
translated: Without regard for what has been done, the sinful ones act treacherously and unsteadily.

analyzed: rāja kilbiṣiṇām teṣām bhartṛ piṇḍa apahāriṇām
translated: Of those who are guilty of crimes against the king, who take away the food meant for their master,

original: naivāyaṃ na paro loko vidyate pāpakarmaṇām
analyzed: na eva ayam na paraḥ lokaḥ vidyate pāpa karmaṇām
translated: Neither this world nor the next exists for those who commit evil deeds.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭrasya putrāṇām arthe yotsyāmi te sutaiḥ
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭrasya putrāṇām arthe yotsyāmi te sutaiḥ
translated: I will fight on behalf of Dhritarashtra's sons against your sons,

original: balaṃ ca śaktiṃ cāsthāya na vai tvayy anṛtaṃ vade
analyzed: balam ca śaktim ca āsthāya na vai tvayi anṛtam vade
translated: Relying on strength and ability, I will not speak falsely to you.

analyzed: ānṛśaṃsyam atho vṛttam rakṣan sat puruṣa ucitam
translated: Protecting the non-violent conduct befitting a virtuous man,

original: ato 'rthakaram apy etan na karomy adya te vacaḥ
analyzed: atas ṛtha karam api etat na karomi adya te vacaḥ
translated: Therefore, though this would be beneficial, I do not act on your words now.

original: na tu te 'yaṃ samārambho mayi mogho bhaviṣyati
analyzed: na tu te yam samārambhaḥ mayi moghaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: But this undertaking of yours will not be fruitless on me.

original: vadhyān viṣahyān saṃgrāme na haniṣyāmi te sutān
analyzed: vadhyān viṣahyān saṃgrāme na haniṣyāmi te sutān
translated: I will not kill your sons who are to be killed and who are capable of being killed in battle,

original: yudhiṣṭhiraṃ ca bhīmaṃ ca yamau caivārjunād ṛte
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiram ca bhīmam ca yamau ca eva arjunāt ṛte
translated: Except for Yudhishthira, Bhima, the twins and Arjuna.

original: arjunena samaṃ yuddhaṃ mama yaudhiṣṭhire bale🔽arjunaṃ hi nihatyājau saṃprāptaṃ syāt phalaṃ mayā
analyzed: arjunena samam yuddham mama yaudhiṣṭhire bale  arjunam hi nihatya ājau saṃprāptam syāt phalam mayā
translated: In Yudhishthira's army, my battle is only with Arjuna.🔽For if I kill Arjuna in battle, I will have attained the fruit.

analyzed: yaśasā ca api yujyeyam nihataḥ savyasācinā
translated: And if killed by Savyasachi (Arjuna), I will be endowed with fame.

original: na te jātu naśiṣyanti putrāḥ pañca yaśasvini
analyzed: na te jātu naśiṣyanti putrāḥ pañca yaśasvini
translated: O illustrious lady, your five sons will never be destroyed,

original: nirarjunāḥ sakarṇā vā sārjunā vā hate mayi
analyzed: nirarjunāḥ sa karṇāḥ vā sa arjunāḥ vā hate mayi
translated: Whether with Karna and without Arjuna, or with Arjuna and without me being killed.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: iti karṇavacaḥ śrutvā kuntī duḥkhāt pravepatī
analyzed: iti karṇa vacaḥ śrutvā kuntī duḥkhāt pravepatī
translated: Having heard these words of Karna, Kunti trembled with grief,

original: uvāca putram āśliṣya karṇaṃ dhairyād akampitam
analyzed: uvāca putram āśliṣya karṇam dhairyāt akampitam
translated: Embracing his son Karna, who was unwavering in his courage, he said:

original: evaṃ vai bhāvyam etena kṣayaṃ yāsyanti kauravāḥ
analyzed: evam vai bhāvyam etena kṣayam yāsyanti kauravāḥ
translated: Thus it must be. The Kauravas will perish.

original: yathā tvaṃ bhāṣase karṇa daivaṃ tu balavattaram
analyzed: yathā tvam bhāṣase karṇa daivam tu balavattaram
translated: As you say, Karna, destiny is more powerful.

analyzed: tvayā caturṇām bhrātṝṇām abhayam śatru karśana
translated: O destroyer of enemies, you have given assurance to your four brothers

original: dattaṃ tat pratijānīhi saṃgarapratimocanam🔽anāmayaṃ svasti ceti pṛthātho karṇam abravīt
analyzed: dattam tat pratijānīhi saṃgara pratimocanam  anāmayam svasti ca iti pṛthā atho karṇam abravīt
translated: that you will free them from the battle. Remember that.🔽Pritha then asked Karna about his welfare and well-being.

original: tāṃ karṇo 'bhyavadat prītas tatas tau jagmatuḥ pṛthak
analyzed: tām karṇaḥ bhyavadat prītaḥ tatas tau jagmatuḥ pṛthak
translated: Karna replied to her with delight, and then they departed separately.

analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

analyzed: āgamya hāstinapurāt upaplavyam ariṃdamaḥ
translated: Having come from Hastinapura to Upaplavya, the chastiser of enemies,

analyzed: pāṇḍavānām yathāvṛttam keśavaḥ sarvam uktavān
translated: Keshava told everything about the Pandavas as it had happened.

original: saṃbhāṣya suciraṃ kālaṃ mantrayitvā punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: saṃbhāṣya su ciram kālam mantrayitvā punar punar
translated: Having conversed for a long time and consulted again and again,

original: svam evāvasathaṃ śaurir viśrāmārthaṃ jagāma ha
analyzed: svam eva āvasatham śauriḥ viśrāma artham jagāma ha
translated: Shouri went to his own abode to rest.

analyzed: visṛjya sarvān nṛpatīn virāṭa pramukhān tadā
translated: Having dismissed all the kings headed by Virata,

original: pāṇḍavā bhrātaraḥ pañca bhānāv astaṃgate sati
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ bhrātaraḥ pañca bhānau astaṃgate sati
translated: the five Pandava brothers, when the sun had set,

original: saṃdhyām upāsya dhyāyantas tam eva gatamānasāḥ
analyzed: saṃdhyām upāsya dhyāyantaḥ tam eva gata mānasāḥ
translated: worshipped the evening twilight, their minds absorbed in thought.

original: ānāyya kṛṣṇaṃ dāśārhaṃ punar mantram amantrayan
analyzed: ānāyya kṛṣṇam dāśārham punar mantram amantrayan
translated: Having brought Krishna of the Dasharha lineage, they again consulted.

original: yudhiṣṭhira uvāca🔽tvayā nāgapuraṃ gatvā sabhāyāṃ dhṛtarāṣṭrajaḥ
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca  tvayā nāgapuram gatvā sabhāyām dhṛtarāṣṭra jaḥ
translated: Yudhishthira said:🔽Having gone to Nagapura, what did you tell Dhritarashtra's son in the assembly hall?

original: kim uktaḥ puṇḍarīkākṣa tan naḥ śaṃsitum arhasi
analyzed: kim uktaḥ puṇḍarīkākṣa tat naḥ śaṃsitum arhasi
translated: O lotus-eyed one, it is proper for you to tell us that.

analyzed: vāsudevaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasudeva said:

analyzed: mayā nāgapuram gatvā sabhāyām dhṛtarāṣṭra jaḥ
translated: Having gone to Nagapura, what did I tell Dhritarashtra's son in the assembly hall?

original: tathyaṃ pathyaṃ hitaṃ cokto na ca gṛhṇāti durmatiḥ
analyzed: tathyam pathyam hitam ca uktaḥ na ca gṛhṇāti durmatiḥ
translated: The evil-minded one does not accept the truth, the beneficial, and the helpful that was spoken.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhishthira said:

analyzed: tasmin utpatham āpanne kuruvṛddhaḥ pitāmahaḥ
translated: When he was on the wrong path, what did the Kuru elder, the grandfather,

analyzed: kim uktavān hṛṣīkeśa duryodhanam amarṣaṇam
translated: say, O Hrishikesha, to the intolerant Duryodhana?

original: ācāryo vā mahābāho bhāradvājaḥ kim abravīt
analyzed: ācāryaḥ vā mahā bāho bhāradvājaḥ kim abravīt
translated: O mighty-armed one, what did the teacher, Bharadvaja's son, say?

original: pitā vā dhṛtarāṣṭras taṃ gāndhārī vā kim abravīt
analyzed: pitā vā dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ tam gāndhārī vā kim abravīt
translated: What did his father Dhritarashtra and Gandhari say to him?

original: pitā yavīyān asmākaṃ kṣattā dharmabhṛtāṃ varaḥ
analyzed: pitā yavīyān asmākam kṣattā dharma bhṛtām varaḥ
translated: What did the younger brother of our father, Kshattri, the best among the upholders of dharma,

analyzed: putra śoka abhisaṃtaptaḥ kim āha dhṛtarāṣṭra jam
translated: say to Dhritarashtra's son, being tormented by grief for his sons?

original: kiṃ ca sarve nṛpatayaḥ sabhāyāṃ ye samāsate
analyzed: kim ca sarve nṛpatayaḥ sabhāyām ye samāsate
translated: And what did all the kings who were seated in the assembly hall

original: uktavanto yathātattvaṃ tad brūhi tvaṃ janārdana
analyzed: uktavantaḥ yathātattvam tat brūhi tvam janārdana
translated: say? Tell us that, O Janardana.

original: uktavān hi bhavān sarvaṃ vacanaṃ kurumukhyayoḥ
analyzed: uktavān hi bhavān sarvam vacanam kuru mukhyayoḥ
translated: You have spoken all the words of the two chief Kurus.

original: dhārtarāṣṭrasya teṣāṃ hi vacanaṃ kurusaṃsadi🔽pratikūlam ayuktaṃ ca hṛdayaṃ nopasarpati
analyzed: dhārtarāṣṭrasya teṣām hi vacanam kuru saṃsadi  pratikūlam a yuktam ca hṛdayam na upasarpati
translated: Their words in the assembly of the Kurus🔽do not appeal to our hearts.

analyzed: kāma lobha abhibhūtasya mandasya prājña māninaḥ
translated: Overcome by desire and greed, slow-witted, yet priding himself on his wisdom,

original: apriyaṃ hṛdaye mahyaṃ tan na tiṣṭhati keśava
analyzed: apriyam hṛdaye mahyam tat na tiṣṭhati keśava
translated: that unpleasantness does not stay in my heart, O Keshava.

original: teṣāṃ vākyāni govinda śrotum icchāmy ahaṃ vibho
analyzed: teṣām vākyāni govinda śrotum icchāmi aham vibho
translated: O Govinda, O lord, I wish to hear their words.

original: yathā ca nābhipadyeta kālas tāta tathā kuru
analyzed: yathā ca na abhipadyeta kālaḥ tāta tathā kuru
translated: O father, act in such a way that time does not overtake us.

original: bhavān hi no gatiḥ kṛṣṇa bhavān nātho bhavān guruḥ
analyzed: bhavān hi naḥ gatiḥ kṛṣṇa bhavān nāthaḥ bhavān guruḥ
translated: You are our refuge, O Krishna, you are our protector, you are our guru.

analyzed: vāsudevaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasudeva said:

original: śṛṇu rājan yathā vākyam ukto rājā suyodhanaḥ
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan yathā vākyam uktaḥ rājā suyodhanaḥ
translated: Listen, O king, to the words spoken by me to King Suyodhana,

original: madhye kurūṇāṃ rājendra sabhāyāṃ tan nibodha me
analyzed: madhye kurūṇām rāja indra sabhāyām tat nibodha me
translated: in the midst of the Kurus, O lord of kings, understand that from me.

original: mayā vai śrāvite vākye jahāsa dhṛtarāṣṭrajaḥ
analyzed: mayā vai śrāvite vākye jahāsa dhṛtarāṣṭra jaḥ
translated: When the words were spoken by me, the son of Dhritarashtra laughed.

original: atha bhīṣmaḥ susaṃkruddha idaṃ vacanam abravīt
analyzed: atha bhīṣmaḥ su saṃkruddhaḥ idam vacanam abravīt
translated: Then Bhishma, greatly enraged, spoke these words:

original: duryodhana nibodhedaṃ kulārthe yad bravīmi te
analyzed: duryodhana nibodha idam kula arthe yat bravīmi te
translated: O Duryodhana, understand this for the sake of the family that I tell you.

original: tac chrutvā rājaśārdūla svakulasya hitaṃ kuru
analyzed: tat śrutvā rāja śārdūla sva kulasya hitam kuru
translated: Having heard that, O tiger among kings, do what is beneficial for your own family.

original: mama tāta pitā rājañ śaṃtanur lokaviśrutaḥ
analyzed: mama tāta pitā rājam śaṃtanuḥ loka viśrutaḥ
translated: O father, my father Shantanu, O king, was famous in the world.

original: tasyāham eka evāsaṃ putraḥ putravatāṃ varaḥ
analyzed: tasya aham ekaḥ eva āsam putraḥ putravatām varaḥ
translated: I was his only son, the best among those who have sons.

original: tasya buddhiḥ samutpannā dvitīyaḥ syāt kathaṃ sutaḥ
analyzed: tasya buddhiḥ samutpannā dvitīyaḥ syāt katham sutaḥ
translated: He had the thought, How can I have a second son?

analyzed: eka putram aputram vai pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The wise say that one without a son is like one with only one son.

original: na cocchedaṃ kulaṃ yāyād vistīryeta kathaṃ yaśaḥ
analyzed: na ca ucchedam kulam yāyāt vistīryeta katham yaśaḥ
translated: How can the family line be continued and how can the fame spread?

original: tasyāham īpsitaṃ buddhvā kālīṃ mātaram āvaham
analyzed: tasya aham īpsitam buddhvā kālīm mātaram āvaham
translated: Knowing his desire, I brought Kali as his mother.

original: pratijñāṃ duṣkarāṃ kṛtvā pitur arthe kulasya ca
analyzed: pratijñām duṣkarām kṛtvā pituḥ arthe kulasya ca
translated: For the sake of my father and the family, I made a difficult vow.

original: arājā cordhvaretāś ca yathā suviditaṃ tava
analyzed: a rājā ca ūrdhvaretāḥ ca yathā su viditam tava
translated: That I would be a king without a son, without sexual intercourse, as you know well.

analyzed: pratītaḥ nivasāmi eṣa pratijñām anupālayan
translated: Delighted, I live, fulfilling that vow.

analyzed: tasyām jajñe mahā bāhuḥ śrīmān kuru kula udvahaḥ
translated: In her was born the mighty-armed, prosperous upholder of the Kuru lineage,

analyzed: vicitravīryaḥ dharma ātmā kanīyān mama pārthivaḥ
translated: The righteous king Vichitravirya, my younger brother.

analyzed: svaryāte ham pitari tam sva rājye saṃnyaveśayam
translated: When my father went to heaven, I installed him in his own kingdom.

original: vicitravīryaṃ rājānaṃ bhṛtyo bhūtvā hy adhaścaraḥ
analyzed: vicitravīryam rājānam bhṛtyaḥ bhūtvā hi adhas caraḥ
translated: Becoming a servant, I served King Vichitravirya.

analyzed: tasya aham sadṛśān dārān rāja indra samudāvaham
translated: O lord of kings, I brought him suitable wives.

original: jitvā pārthivasaṃghātam api te bahuśaḥ śrutam🔽tato rāmeṇa samare dvandvayuddham upāgamam
analyzed: jitvā pārthiva saṃghātam api te bahuśas śrutam  tatas rāmeṇa samare dvandva yuddham upāgamam
translated: You have heard many times how I conquered many kings.🔽Then I engaged in a duel with Rama in battle.

original: sa hi rāmabhayād ebhir nāgarair vipravāsitaḥ
analyzed: sa hi rāma bhayāt ebhiḥ nāgaraiḥ vipravāsitaḥ
translated: He was exiled by these citizens out of fear of Rama.

analyzed: dāreṣu ati prasaktaḥ ca yakṣmāṇam samapadyata
translated: And he became excessively attached to his wives and contracted tuberculosis.

original: yadā tv arājake rāṣṭre na vavarṣa sureśvaraḥ
analyzed: yadā tu arājake rāṣṭre na vavarṣa sureśvaraḥ
translated: When the kingdom was without a king and the lord of the gods did not rain,

analyzed: tadā abhyadhāvan mām eva prajāḥ kṣudh bhaya pīḍitāḥ
translated: then the people, afflicted by hunger and fear, ran to me.

analyzed: prajāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The people said:

original: upakṣīṇāḥ prajāḥ sarvā rājā bhava bhavāya naḥ
analyzed: upakṣīṇāḥ prajāḥ sarvāḥ rājā bhava bhavāya naḥ
translated: All the people are declining. Be our king for our welfare.

original: ītayo nuda bhadraṃ te śaṃtanoḥ kulavardhana
analyzed: ītayaḥ nuda bhadram te śaṃtanoḥ kula vardhana
translated: O fortunate one, remove the calamities. O extender of Shantanu's lineage,

original: pīḍyante te prajāḥ sarvā vyādhibhir bhṛśadāruṇaiḥ
analyzed: pīḍyante te prajāḥ sarvāḥ vyādhibhiḥ bhṛśa dāruṇaiḥ
translated: all your people are afflicted by extremely terrible diseases.

analyzed: alpa avaśiṣṭāḥ gāṅgeya tāḥ paritrātum arhasi
translated: O son of Ganga, only a few remain. You should save them.

original: vyādhīn praṇudya vīra tvaṃ prajā dharmeṇa pālaya
analyzed: vyādhīn praṇudya vīra tvam prajāḥ dharmeṇa pālaya
translated: O hero, having removed the diseases, protect the people righteously.

original: tvayi jīvati mā rāṣṭraṃ vināśam upagacchatu
analyzed: tvayi jīvati mā rāṣṭram vināśam upagacchatu
translated: As long as you live, let not the kingdom be destroyed.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: prajānāṃ krośatīnāṃ vai naivākṣubhyata me manaḥ
analyzed: prajānām krośatīnām vai na eva akṣubhyata me manaḥ
translated: The cries of the people did not disturb my mind at all,

analyzed: pratijñām rakṣamāṇasya sat vṛttam smarataḥ tathā
translated: as I was protecting my vow and remembering my good conduct.

original: tataḥ paurā mahārāja mātā kālī ca me śubhā
analyzed: tatas paurāḥ mahā rāja mātā kālī ca me śubhā
translated: Then, O great king, the citizens, my auspicious mother Kali,

analyzed: bhṛtyāḥ purohita ācāryāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ ca bahu śrutāḥ
translated: the servants, the priests, the teachers, and the very learned Brahmanas,

original: mām ūcur bhṛśasaṃtaptā bhava rājeti saṃtatam
analyzed: mām ūcuḥ bhṛśa saṃtaptāḥ bhava rājā iti saṃtatam
translated: greatly afflicted, repeatedly said to me, 'Be our king.'

analyzed: pratīpa rakṣitam rāṣṭram tvām prāpya vinaśiṣyati
translated: The kingdom protected by you will perish.

original: sa tvam asmaddhitārthaṃ vai rājā bhava mahāmate
analyzed: sa tvam asmad hita artham vai rājā bhava mahāmate
translated: Therefore, O you of great intelligence, for our welfare, you become the king.

original: ity uktaḥ prāñjalir bhūtvā duḥkhito bhṛśam āturaḥ
analyzed: iti uktaḥ prāñjaliḥ bhūtvā duḥkhitaḥ bhṛśam āturaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, I became full of anxiety, extremely afflicted and sorrowful.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ nyavedayam putra pratijñām pitṛ gauravāt
translated: O son, out of respect for my father, I announced to them my vow:

original: ūrdhvaretā hy arājā ca kulasyārthe punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: ūrdhvaretāḥ hi a rājā ca kulasya arthe punar punar
translated: I am celibate and not a king. For the sake of the family, I will not do it again and again.

analyzed: tatas ham prāñjaliḥ bhūtvā mātaram saṃprasādayam
translated: Then, with folded hands, I tried to appease my mother:

original: nāmba śaṃtanunā jātaḥ kauravaṃ vaṃśam udvahan
analyzed: nāmba śaṃtanunā jātaḥ kauravam vaṃśam udvahan
translated: O mother, born of Shantanu, upholding the Kuru lineage,

original: pratijñāṃ vitathāṃ kuryām iti rājan punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: pratijñām vitathām kuryām iti rājan punar punar
translated: I will not make my vow false, O king, again and again.

original: viśeṣatas tvadarthaṃ ca dhuri mā māṃ niyojaya
analyzed: viśeṣataḥ tvad artham ca dhuri mā mām niyojaya
translated: And especially for your sake, do not burden me with this responsibility.

original: ahaṃ preṣyaś ca dāsaś ca tavāmba sutavatsale
analyzed: aham preṣyaḥ ca dāsaḥ ca suta vatsale
translated: I am your servant and slave, O mother, fond of your son.

original: evaṃ tām anunīyāhaṃ mātaraṃ janam eva ca
analyzed: evam tām anunīya aham mātaram janam eva ca
translated: Having thus appeased my mother and the people,

analyzed: ayācam bhrātṛ dāreṣu tadā vyāsam mahā munim
translated: I then requested the great sage Vyasa for the wives of my brothers.

original: saha mātrā mahārāja prasādya tam ṛṣiṃ tadā
analyzed: saha mātrā mahā rāja prasādya tam ṛṣim tadā
translated: O great king, along with my mother, having pleased that rishi,

original: apatyārtham ayācaṃ vai prasādaṃ kṛtavāṃś ca saḥ
analyzed: apatya artham ayācam vai prasādam kṛtavān ca saḥ
translated: I requested him for offspring, and he was pleased with me.

original: trīn sa putrān ajanayat tadā bharatasattama
analyzed: trīn sa putrān ajanayat tadā bharata sattama
translated: He then begot three sons for me, O best of the Bharata lineage.

original: andhaḥ karaṇahīneti na vai rājā pitā tava
analyzed: andhaḥ karaṇa hīna iti na vai rājā pitā tava
translated: Your father was not a king, but one blind without means.

original: rājā tu pāṇḍur abhavan mahātmā lokaviśrutaḥ🔽sa rājā tasya te putrāḥ pitur dāyādyahāriṇaḥ
analyzed: rājā tu pāṇḍuḥ abhavat mahātmā loka viśrutaḥ  sa rājā tasya te putrāḥ pituḥ dāyādya hāriṇaḥ
translated: But the great-souled Pandu became king, renowned in the world.🔽That king and his sons are the rightful heirs of the kingdom.

original: mā tāta kalahaṃ kārṣī rājyasyārdhaṃ pradīyatām
analyzed: mā tāta kalaham kārṣiḥ rājyasya ardham pradīyatām
translated: O son, do not cause a quarrel. Give half the kingdom.

original: mayi jīvati rājyaṃ kaḥ saṃpraśāset pumān iha
analyzed: mayi jīvati rājyam kaḥ saṃpraśāset pumān iha
translated: While I am alive, what man can rule this kingdom?

original: māvamaṃsthā vaco mahyaṃ śamam icchāmi vaḥ sadā
analyzed: mā avamaṃsthāḥ vacaḥ mahyam śamam icchāmi vaḥ sadā
translated: Do not disregard my words. I always desire peace for you.

original: na viśeṣo 'sti me putra tvayi teṣu ca pārthiva
analyzed: na viśeṣaḥ sti me putra tvayi teṣu ca pārthiva
translated: O son, there is no difference to me between you and those sons of Pandu.

original: matam etat pitus tubhyaṃ gāndhāryā vidurasya ca
analyzed: matam etat pituḥ tubhyam gāndhāryāḥ vidurasya ca
translated: This is the opinion of your father, Gandhari and Vidura.

original: śrotavyaṃ yadi vṛddhānāṃ mātiśaṅkīr vaco mama
analyzed: śrotavyam yadi vṛddhānām mā atiśaṅkīḥ vacaḥ mama
translated: If you listen to the words of the elders, do not doubt my words.

original: nāśayiṣyasi mā sarvam ātmānaṃ pṛthivīṃ tathā
analyzed: nāśayiṣyasi mā sarvam ātmānam pṛthivīm tathā
translated: You will destroy everything, yourself and the earth.

original: vāsudeva uvāca🔽bhīṣmeṇokte tato droṇo duryodhanam abhāṣata
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ uvāca  bhīṣmeṇa ukte tatas droṇaḥ duryodhanam abhāṣata
translated: Vasudeva said:

original: madhye nṛpāṇāṃ bhadraṃ te vacanaṃ vacanakṣamaḥ
analyzed: madhye nṛpāṇām bhadram te vacanam vacana kṣamaḥ
translated: After Bhishma spoke, Drona, capable of speaking, spoke these words to Duryodhana in the midst of the kings, May you be well:

analyzed: prātīpaḥ śaṃtanuḥ tāta kulasya arthe yathā utthitaḥ
translated: Just as Shantanu, the son of Pratipa, arose for the sake of the family,

analyzed: tathā devavrataḥ bhīṣmaḥ kulasya arthe sthitaḥ bhavat
translated: so Devavrata Bhishma stood for the sake of the family.

analyzed: tatas pāṇḍuḥ narapatiḥ satya saṃdhaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: Then King Pandu, who was devoted to truth and had conquered his senses,

analyzed: rājā kurūṇām dharma ātmā su vrataḥ su samāhitaḥ
translated: the righteous-souled king of the Kurus, who was of good vows and well-concentrated,

analyzed: jyeṣṭhāya rājyam adadāt dhṛtarāṣṭrāya dhīmate
translated: gave the kingdom to his eldest son, the wise Dhritarashtra,

analyzed: yavīyasaḥ tathā kṣattuḥ kuru vaṃśa vivardhanaḥ
translated: and to his younger son, Vidura, the extender of the Kuru lineage.

analyzed: tatas siṃhāsane rājan sthāpayitvā enam acyutam
translated: Then, O king, having established that undeceiving one on the throne,

analyzed: vanam jagāma kauravyaḥ bhāryābhyām sahitaḥ nagha
translated: the sinless Kuru went to the forest, together with his two wives.

original: nīcaiḥ sthitvā tu vidura upāste sma vinītavat
analyzed: nīcais sthitvā tu viduraḥ upāste sma vinīta vat
translated: But Vidura, remaining humble, served him with humility,

analyzed: preṣya vat puruṣa vyāghraḥ vāla vyajanam utkṣipan
translated: holding a yak-tail fan like a servant, O tiger among men.

original: tataḥ sarvāḥ prajās tāta dhṛtarāṣṭraṃ janeśvaram
analyzed: tatas sarvāḥ prajāḥ tāta dhṛtarāṣṭram janeśvaram
translated: Then all the subjects, O son, followed Dhritarashtra, the lord of people,

analyzed: anvapadyanta vidhivat yathā pāṇḍum narādhipam
translated: in the proper way, just as they did King Pandu.

analyzed: sa anukarṣāḥ sa tūṇīrāḥ sa varūthāḥ sa tomarāḥ  sa upāsaṅgāḥ sa śaktīkāḥ sa niṣaṅgāḥ sa pothikāḥ
translated: With stirrups, javelins, quivers, and cushions

original: sadhvajāḥ sapatākāś ca saśarāsanatomarāḥ🔽rajjubhiś ca vicitrābhiḥ sapāśāḥ saparistarāḥ
analyzed: sa dhvajāḥ sa patākāḥ ca sa śarāsana tomarāḥ  rajjubhiḥ ca vicitrābhiḥ sa pāśāḥ sa paristarāḥ
translated: With flags, banners, bows, and iron arrows🔽With various ropes, nooses, and carpets

translated: With hair-pulling and throwing, with oil, jaggery, and sand🔽All with baskets of venomous snakes, with resin, juice, and dust

analyzed: sa ghaṇṭā phalakāḥ sarve vāsī vṛkṣādana anvitāḥ
translated: All with bells and shields, accompanied by razor trees to eat🔽With iron, jaggery, water, and stone

original: saśālabhindipālāś ca samadhūc chiṣṭamudgarāḥ🔽sakāṇḍadaṇḍakāḥ sarve sasīraviṣatomarāḥ
analyzed: sa śāla bhindi pālāḥ ca sa madhūt śiṣṭa mudgarāḥ  sa kāṇḍa daṇḍakāḥ sarve sa sīra viṣa tomarāḥ
translated: With shālabhañjikās, with leftover pestles🔽All with stalks and staffs, with sharp poison arrows and iron arrows

analyzed: sa śūrpa piṭakāḥ sarve sa dātra aṅkuśa tomarāḥ
translated: All with winnowing baskets and baskets, with goads, whips, and iron arrows

analyzed: sa kīla kra kacāḥ sarve  vyāghra carma parīvārāḥ vṛtāḥ ca dvīpi carmabhiḥ
translated: All with keys and pincers🔽Surrounded by tiger skins and leopard skins

original: savastayaḥ saśṛṅgāś ca saprāsavividhāyudhāḥ🔽sakuṭhārāḥ sakuddālāḥ satailakṣaumasarpiṣaḥ
analyzed: sa vastayaḥ sa śṛṅgāḥ ca sa prāsa vividha āyudhāḥ 🔽sa kuṭhārāḥ sa kuddālāḥ sa taila kṣauma sarpiṣaḥ
translated: With horns and spikes, with barbed missiles and various weapons🔽With axes, spades, oil, fine linen, and ghee

analyzed: rukma jāla praticchannāḥ nānā maṇi vibhūṣitāḥ
translated: Covered with nets of gold, adorned with various jewels,🔽Wearing tiger skins, well-dressed, and well-adorned,

original: vyāghracarmaparīdhānāḥ suveṣāḥ samalaṃkṛtāḥ🔽citrānīkāḥ suvapuṣo jvalitā iva pāvakāḥ
analyzed: vyāghra carma parīdhānāḥ su veṣāḥ samalaṃkṛtāḥ  citra anīkāḥ su vapuṣaḥ jvalitāḥ iva pāvakāḥ
translated: With colorful armies, beautiful bodies, blazing like fires,

analyzed: tathā kavacinaḥ śūrāḥ śastreṣu kṛta niśramāḥ
translated: Likewise, the armored heroes, skilled in weapons,

original: kulīnā hayayonijñāḥ sārathye viniveśitāḥ🔽baddhāriṣṭā baddhakakṣyā baddhadhvajapatākinaḥ
analyzed: kulīnāḥ haya yoni jñāḥ sārathye viniveśitāḥ  baddha ariṣṭāḥ baddha kakṣyāḥ baddha dhvaja patākinaḥ
translated: Of noble birth, knowledgeable in horse breeding, appointed as charioteers,🔽With bound misfortune, bound reins, bound flags and banners,

analyzed: baddha ābharaṇa nirvyūhāḥ baddha carma asi paṭṭiśāḥ
translated: With bound ornaments arranged, bound leather shields and axes,

analyzed: catur yujaḥ rathāḥ sarve sarve śastra samāyutāḥ
translated: All the chariots yoked with four horses, all fully equipped with weapons,

original: saṃhṛṣṭavāhanāḥ sarve sarve śataśarāsanāḥ🔽dhuryayor hayayor ekas tathānyau pārṣṇisārathī
analyzed: saṃhṛṣṭa vāhanāḥ sarve sarve śata śarāsanāḥ  dhuryayoḥ hayayoḥ ekaḥ tathā anyau pārṣṇisārathī
translated: All with cheerful mounts, all with hundreds of arrows,🔽One on the two lead horses, and two on the flank charioteers,

original: tau cāpi rathināṃ śreṣṭhau rathī ca hayavit tathā
analyzed: tau ca api rathinām śreṣṭhau rathī ca haya vid tathā
translated: And those two best of charioteers, and the charioteer skilled in horses,

analyzed: nagarāṇi iva guptāni durādeyāni śatrubhiḥ
translated: Like well-guarded cities, difficult for enemies to approach,

analyzed: āsan ratha sahasrāṇi hema mālīni sarvaśas
translated: There were thousands of chariots, all adorned with golden garlands,

original: yathā rathās tathā nāgā baddhakakṣyāḥ svalaṃkṛtāḥ
analyzed: yathā rathāḥ tathā nāgāḥ baddha kakṣyāḥ su alaṃkṛtāḥ
translated: Just as there were elephants with bound reins and fine ornaments,

analyzed: babhūvuḥ sapta puruṣāḥ ratnavantaḥ iva adrayaḥ
translated: There were seven men, like jeweled mountains.

analyzed: dvau aṅkuśa dharau teṣu dvau uttama dhanurdharau
translated: Two of them held goads, two were excellent archers,

analyzed: dvau vara asi dharau rājan ekaḥ śakti patāka dhṛk
translated: two held excellent swords, O king, and one held a spear and a flag.

analyzed: gajaiḥ mattaiḥ samākīrṇam sa varma āyudha kośakaiḥ
translated: It was crowded with maddened elephants, with armor, weapons and treasuries,

original: tad babhūva balaṃ rājan kauravyasya sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: tat babhūva balam rājan kauravyasya sahasraśas
translated: that army of the Kauravas, O king, numbered in the thousands.

original: vicitrakavacāmuktaiḥ sapatākaiḥ svalaṃkṛtaiḥ🔽sādibhiś copasaṃpannā āsann ayutaśo hayāḥ
analyzed: vicitra kavaca āmuktaiḥ sa patākaiḥ su alaṃkṛtaiḥ  sādibhiḥ ca upasaṃpannāḥ āsan ayutaśas hayāḥ
translated: With colorful armor, quivers, flags, and well-adorned,🔽there were ten thousand horses, each with a rider.

analyzed: su saṃgrāhāḥ su saṃtoṣāḥ hema bhāṇḍa paricchadāḥ
translated: Well-trained, well-fed, with golden harnesses,

analyzed: aneka śata sāhasrāḥ te ca sādi vaśe sthitāḥ
translated: and many hundreds of thousands, they were under the control of their riders.

analyzed: nānā rūpa vikārāḥ ca nānā kavaca śastriṇaḥ
translated: With various forms and modifications, with various armors and weapons,

analyzed: padātinaḥ narāḥ tatra babhūvuḥ hema mālinaḥ
translated: there were foot soldiers there, wearing golden garlands.

original: rathasyāsan daśa gajā gajasya daśa vājinaḥ
analyzed: rathasya āsan daśa gajāḥ gajasya daśa vājinaḥ
translated: To each chariot were attached ten elephants, to each elephant ten horses,

analyzed: narāḥ daśa hayasya āsan pādarakṣāḥ samantataḥ
translated: and to each horse were attached ten men for defense on all sides.

original: rathasya nāgāḥ pañcāśan nāgasyāsañ śataṃ hayāḥ
analyzed: rathasya nāgāḥ pañcāśat nāgasya āsam śatam hayāḥ
translated: To each chariot were assigned fifty elephants, to each elephant one hundred horses,

analyzed: hayasya puruṣāḥ sapta bhinna saṃdhāna kāriṇaḥ
translated: and to each horse seven men for repairing any damage.

original: senā pañcaśataṃ nāgā rathās tāvanta eva ca
analyzed: senā pañcaśatam nāgāḥ rathāḥ tāvantaḥ eva ca
translated: An army consisted of five hundred elephants and as many chariots,

original: pañcāśac ca śataṃ cāśvā narāḥ pañcaguṇās tataḥ
analyzed: pañcāśat ca śatam ca aśvāḥ narāḥ pañcaguṇāḥ tatas
translated: Fifty hundred horses, and men five times that number,

analyzed: daśa senā ca pṛtanā pṛtanā daśa vāhinī
translated: Ten senas make one pritana, ten pritanas one vahini,

original: vāhinī pṛtanā senā dhvajinī sādinī camūḥ
analyzed: vāhinī pṛtanā senā dhvajinī sādinī camūḥ
translated: Vahini, pritana, sena, dhanjini, sadi, and chāmu,

analyzed: akṣauhiṇī iti paryāyaiḥ niruktā atha varūthinī
translated: Are synonyms for an army. Then the army is described as an akṣauhiṇī.

analyzed: evam vyūḍhāni anīkāni kauraveyeṇa dhīmatā
translated: Thus the divisions were arranged by the wise Kaurava,

original: akṣauhiṇyo daśaikā ca saṃkhyātāḥ sapta caiva ha
analyzed: akṣauhiṇyaḥ daśa ekā ca saṃkhyātāḥ sapta ca eva ha
translated: Ten and one akṣauhiṇīs were counted, and seven indeed,

original: akṣauhiṇyas tu saptaiva pāṇḍavānām abhūd balam
analyzed: akṣauhiṇyaḥ tu saptā eva pāṇḍavānām abhūt balam
translated: But the army of the Pāṇḍavas consisted of only seven akṣauhiṇīs,

original: akṣauhiṇyo daśaikā ca kauravāṇām abhūd balam
analyzed: akṣauhiṇyaḥ daśa ekā ca kauravāṇām abhūt balam
translated: While the army of the Kauravas consisted of ten and one akṣauhiṇīs.

analyzed: narāṇām pañcapañcāśat eṣā pattiḥ vidhīyate
translated: Fifty-five men are prescribed as one pāṭṭi,

original: senāmukhaṃ ca tisras tā gulma ity abhisaṃjñitaḥ
analyzed: senā mukham ca tisraḥ tāḥ gulmaḥ iti abhisaṃjñitaḥ
translated: And three of those are called a senāmukha, and a gulma.

original: daśa gulmā gaṇas tv āsīd gaṇās tv ayutaśo 'bhavan
analyzed: daśa gulmāḥ gaṇaḥ tu āsīt gaṇāḥ tu ayutaśas bhavan
translated: Ten gulmas made one gaṇa, and the gaṇas numbered in the myriads,

original: duryodhanasya senāsu yotsyamānāḥ prahāriṇaḥ🔽tatra duryodhano rājā śūrān buddhimato narān
analyzed: duryodhanasya senāsu yotsyamānāḥ prahāriṇaḥ  tatra duryodhanaḥ rājā śūrān buddhimataḥ narān
translated: In Duryodhana's army, ready to fight, were the smiters,🔽There the mighty-armed king Duryodhana, having considered the brave and wise men,

analyzed: prasamīkṣya mahā bāhuḥ cakre senāpatīn tadā
translated: Appointed them as generals at that time,

analyzed: pṛthak akṣauhiṇīnām ca praṇetṝn nara sattamān
translated: And separate leaders of the akṣauhiṇīs, the best of men,

analyzed: vidhi pūrvam samānīya pārthivān abhyaṣecayat
translated: Having assembled the kings according to the rules, he consecrated them.

original: kṛpaṃ droṇaṃ ca śalyaṃ ca saindhavaṃ ca mahāratham
analyzed: kṛpam droṇam ca śalyam ca saindhavam ca mahā ratham
translated: Kripa, Drona, Shalya, the great warrior from the west,

original: sudakṣiṇaṃ ca kāmbojaṃ kṛtavarmāṇam eva ca
analyzed: sudakṣiṇam ca kāmbojam kṛtavarmāṇam eva ca
translated: Sudakshina from Kamboja, Kritavarma,

original: droṇaputraṃ ca karṇaṃ ca bhūriśravasam eva ca
analyzed: droṇaputram ca karṇam ca bhūriśravasam eva ca
translated: Drona's son, Karna, and Bhurishrava,

original: śakuniṃ saubalaṃ caiva bāhlīkaṃ ca mahāratham
analyzed: śakunim saubalam ca eva bāhlīkam ca mahā ratham
translated: Shakuni, the son of Subala, and the great warrior Bahlika,

original: divase divase teṣāṃ prativelaṃ ca bhārata
analyzed: divase divase teṣām prativelam ca bhārata
translated: Day after day, O Bharata, at every opportunity,

original: cakre sa vividhāḥ saṃjñāḥ pratyakṣaṃ ca punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: cakre sa vividhāḥ saṃjñāḥ pratyakṣam ca punar punar
translated: He gave them various instructions and repeatedly showed them in person.

original: tathā viniyatāḥ sarve ye ca teṣāṃ padānugāḥ
analyzed: tathā viniyatāḥ sarve ye ca teṣām padānugāḥ
translated: All of them and their followers were thus engaged.

analyzed: hṛṣṭāḥ puṣṭāḥ su saṃnaddhāḥ vikrame dṛḍha niścayāḥ
translated: Delighted, well-nourished, well-equipped, firm in their resolve for valor,

analyzed: babhūvuḥ sainikāḥ rājan rājñaḥ priya cikīrṣavaḥ
translated: The soldiers became, O king, desirous of doing what was pleasing to the king.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca🔽tataḥ śāṃtanavaṃ bhīṣmaṃ prāñjalir dhṛtarāṣṭrajaḥ
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca  tatas śāṃtanavam bhīṣmam prāñjaliḥ dhṛtarāṣṭra jaḥ
translated: Vaishampayana said:🔽Then Dhritarashtra's son, with folded hands,

original: saha sarvair mahīpālair idaṃ vacanam abravīt
analyzed: saha sarvaiḥ mahīpālaiḥ idam vacanam abravīt
translated: together with all the kings, spoke these words to Shantanu's son Bhishma:

analyzed: ṛte senā praṇetāram pṛtanā su mahatī api
translated: Without a commander, even a very large army

analyzed: dīryate yuddham āsādya pipīlika puṭam yathā
translated: is shattered when it encounters battle, like an anthill.

original: na hi jātu dvayor buddhiḥ samā bhavati karhi cit
analyzed: na hi jātu dvayoḥ buddhiḥ samā bhavati karhi cit
translated: For the minds of two people can never be the same.

original: śauryaṃ ca nāma netṝṇāṃ spardhate ca parasparam🔽śrūyate ca mahāprājña haihayān amitaujasaḥ
analyzed: śauryam ca nāma netṝṇām spardhate ca parasparam  śrūyate ca mahā prājña haihayān amita ojasaḥ
translated: And as for heroism, it is a quality that leaders vie with each other for.

analyzed: abhyayus brāhmaṇāḥ sarve samucchrita kuśa dhvajāḥ
translated: O immensely wise one, it is heard that all the Brahmanas, with Kuśa and Dhvaja raised high, once attacked the Haihayas of immeasurable prowess.

original: tān anvayus tadā vaiśyāḥ śūdrāś caiva pitāmaha
analyzed: tān anvayuḥ tadā vaiśyāḥ śūdrāḥ ca eva pitāmaha
translated: O grandfather, the Vaishyas and Shudras followed them.

original: ekatas tu trayo varṇā ekataḥ kṣatriyarṣabhāḥ
analyzed: ekatas tu trayaḥ varṇāḥ ekatas kṣatriya ṛṣabhāḥ
translated: On one side were the three varnas, and on the other were the bulls among the Kshatriyas.

original: te sma yuddheṣv abhajyanta trayo varṇāḥ punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: te sma yuddheṣu abhajyanta trayaḥ varṇāḥ punar punar
translated: Those three varnas were repeatedly defeated in battles.

original: tathāpi niyatāḥ sarve kṣatriyās tu jaghanyajāḥ
analyzed: tathā api niyatāḥ sarve kṣatriyāḥ tu jaghanyajāḥ
translated: Yet all of them, the Kshatriyas who were born last, were bound by that vow.

original: kṣatriyās tu jayanty eva bahulaṃ caikato balam
analyzed: kṣatriyāḥ tu jayanti eva bahulam ca ekatas balam
translated: The Kshatriyas always won, and the strength of the three varnas was great.

original: tatas te kṣatriyān eva papracchur dvijasattamāḥ
analyzed: tatas te kṣatriyān eva papracchuḥ dvijasattamāḥ
translated: Then those best of Brahmanas asked the Kshatriyas themselves.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ śaśaṃsuḥ dharma jñāḥ yāthātathyam pitāmaha
translated: O grandfather, those who knew dharma told them the truth.

analyzed: vayam ekasya śṛṇumaḥ mahā buddhimataḥ raṇe
translated: We hear of the victory of one greatly wise one in battle,

analyzed: bhavantaḥ tu pṛthak sarve sva buddhi vaśa vartinaḥ
translated: but you all are separate, each under your own intelligence.

original: tatas te brāhmaṇāś cakrur ekaṃ senāpatiṃ dvijam
analyzed: tatas te brāhmaṇāḥ cakruḥ ekam senāpatim dvijam
translated: Then those Brahmanas made one of the Brahmanas their general.

original: nayeṣu kuśalaṃ śūram ajayan kṣatriyāṃs tataḥ
analyzed: nayeṣu kuśalam śūram ajayan kṣatriyān tatas
translated: They conquered the Kshatriyas.

original: evaṃ ye kuśalaṃ śūraṃ hite sthitam akalmaṣam
analyzed: evam ye kuśalam śūram hite sthitam akalmaṣam
translated: Thus, those who appoint a skilled and heroic commander who is free from sin and is devoted to their welfare,

original: senāpatiṃ prakurvanti te jayanti raṇe ripūn
analyzed: senāpatim prakurvanti te jayanti raṇe ripūn
translated: They conquer their enemies in battle.

original: bhavān uśanasā tulyo hitaiṣī ca sadā mama
analyzed: bhavān uśanasā tulyaḥ hita eṣī ca sadā mama
translated: You are equal to Ushanas and are always well-wishing towards me.

original: asaṃhāryaḥ sthito dharme sa naḥ senāpatir bhava
analyzed: asaṃhāryaḥ sthitaḥ dharme sa naḥ senāpatiḥ bhava
translated: You are unassailable and steadfast in dharma, be our commander.

analyzed: raśmīvatām iva ādityaḥ vīrudhām iva candramāḥ
translated: Like the sun to those with eyes, like the moon to plants,

original: kubera iva yakṣāṇāṃ marutām iva vāsavaḥ
analyzed: kuberaḥ iva yakṣāṇām marutām iva vāsavaḥ
translated: Like Kubera to the Yakshas, like Vasava to the Maruts,

original: parvatānāṃ yathā meruḥ suparṇaḥ patatām iva
analyzed: parvatānām yathā meruḥ suparṇaḥ patatām iva
translated: Like Meru to the mountains, like Garuda to the birds,

original: kumāra iva bhūtānāṃ vasūnām iva havyavāṭ
analyzed: kumāraḥ iva bhūtānām vasūnām iva havyavāṭ
translated: Like Kumara to the creatures, like the sacrificial fire to the Vasus,

original: bhavatā hi vayaṃ guptāḥ śakreṇeva divaukasaḥ
analyzed: bhavatā hi vayam guptāḥ śakreṇa iva divaukasaḥ
translated: Protected by you, we will be like the gods by Shakra.

original: anādhṛṣyā bhaviṣyāmas tridaśānām api dhruvam🔽prayātu no bhavān agre devānām iva pāvakiḥ
analyzed: anādhṛṣyāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ tridaśānām api dhruvam  prayātu naḥ bhavān agre devānām iva pāvakiḥ
translated: We will surely become unassailable even to the thirty gods.🔽Let you go ahead of us, like the son of Agni for the gods.

analyzed: vayam tvām anuyāsyāmaḥ saurabheyāḥ iva ṛṣabham
translated: We will follow you, like cows follow the bull.

original: ity uktvā pādayos tasya nipapāta narādhipaḥ
analyzed: iti uktvā pādayoḥ tasya nipapāta narādhipaḥ
translated: Having said this, the king fell at his feet.

original: rakṣāsmān rājaśārdūla tvām ahaṃ śaraṇaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: rakṣa asmān rāja śārdūla tvām aham śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: Protect us, O tiger among kings, I have taken refuge in you.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: evam etan mahābāho yathā vadasi bhārata
analyzed: evam etat mahā bāho yathā vadasi bhārata
translated: O mighty-armed one, it is just as you say, O Bharata.

original: yathaiva hi bhavanto me tathaiva mama pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: yathā eva hi bhavantaḥ me tathā eva mama pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: For you are to me as the Pandavas are.

original: api caiva maya śreyo vācyaṃ teṣāṃ narādhipa
analyzed: api ca eva maya śreyaḥ vācyam teṣām narādhipa
translated: And moreover, O lord of men, I should speak what is for their good.

original: yoddhavyaṃ tu tavārthāya yathā sa samayaḥ kṛtaḥ
analyzed: yoddhavyam tu tava arthāya yathā sa samayaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: But I must fight for your sake, as the agreement was made.

original: na tu paśyāmi yoddhāram ātmanaḥ sadṛśaṃ bhuvi
analyzed: na tu paśyāmi yoddhāram ātmanaḥ sadṛśam bhuvi
translated: But I do not see a warrior on earth who is my equal,

analyzed: ṛte tasmāt nara vyāghrāt kuntī putrāt dhanaṃjayāt
translated: Except that tiger among men, Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti.

original: sa hi veda mahābāhur divyāny astrāṇi sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: sa hi veda mahā bāhuḥ divyāni astrāṇi sarvaśas
translated: For that mighty-armed one knows all the divine weapons.

original: na tu māṃ vivṛto yuddhe jātu yudhyeta pāṇḍavaḥ
analyzed: na tu mām vivṛtaḥ yuddhe jātu yudhyeta pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: But the Pandava will never fight with me openly in battle.

original: ahaṃ sa ca kṣaṇenaiva nirmanuṣyam idaṃ jagat
analyzed: aham sa ca kṣaṇena eva nirmanuṣyam idam jagat
translated: I and he could in an instant make this world devoid of men,

analyzed: kuryām śastra balena eva sa sura asura rākṣasam
translated: With its gods, demons and rākshasas, by the power of our weapons.

original: na tv evotsādanīyā me pāṇḍoḥ putrā narādhipa
analyzed: na tu eva utsādanīyāḥ me pāṇḍoḥ putrāḥ narādhipa
translated: But the sons of Pandu are not to be exterminated by me, O lord of men.

analyzed: tasmāt yodhān haniṣyāmi prayogeṇa ayutam sadā
translated: Therefore, I will always kill ten thousand warriors by stratagem.

analyzed: evam eṣām kariṣyāmi nidhanam kuru nandana
