original: abhayaṃ sarvabhūtebhyo dātā tvam iti me matiḥ
analyzed: abhayam sarva bhūtebhyaḥ dātā tvam iti me matiḥ
translated: I think you will be the one to grant fearlessness to all beings.

original: śrūyate hi purā gītaḥ śloko 'yaṃ bharatarṣabha
analyzed: śrūyate hi purā gītaḥ ślokaḥ yam bharata ṛṣabha
translated: For this verse is heard sung in ancient times, O best of the Bharata lineage:

original: prahlādenātha bhadraṃ te hṛte rājye tu daivataiḥ
analyzed: prahlādena atha bhadram te hṛte rājye tu daivataiḥ
translated: O fortunate one, when the kingdom was taken away by the gods, Prahlāda

analyzed: yasya dharma dhvajaḥ nityam surā dhvajaḥ iva ucchritaḥ
translated: Whose banner of dharma was always raised like the banner of the gods,

original: pracchannāni ca pāpāni baiḍālaṃ nāma tad vratam
analyzed: pracchannāni ca pāpāni baiḍālam nāma tat vratam
translated: And whose sins were hidden, that is known as the vow of the cat.

original: atra te vartayiṣyāmi ākhyānam idam uttamam
analyzed: atra te vartayiṣyāmi ākhyānam idam uttamam
translated: Here I shall narrate to you this excellent story,

analyzed: kathitam nāradena iha pituḥ mama narādhipa
translated: Told by Nārada here to my father, O lord of men.

analyzed: mārjāraḥ kila duṣṭa ātmā niśceṣṭaḥ sarva karmasu
translated: It is said that a wicked cat, inactive in all actions,

original: ūrdhvabāhuḥ sthito rājan gaṅgātīre kadā cana
analyzed: ūrdhvabāhuḥ sthitaḥ rājan gaṅgā tīre kadā cana
translated: Once stood with upraised arms on the bank of the Ganges, O king.

original: sa vai kṛtvā manaḥśuddhiṃ pratyayārthaṃ śarīriṇām
analyzed: sa vai kṛtvā manaḥ śuddhim pratyaya artham śarīriṇām
translated: Having purified his mind, for the sake of convincing embodied beings,

original: karomi dharmam ity āha sarvān eva śarīriṇaḥ
analyzed: karomi dharmam iti āha sarvān eva śarīriṇaḥ
translated: He said, I am practicing dharma, to all embodied beings.

original: tasya kālena mahatā viśrambhaṃ jagmur aṇḍajāḥ🔽sametya ca praśaṃsanti mārjāraṃ taṃ viśāṃ pate
analyzed: tasya kālena mahatā viśrambham jagmuḥ aṇḍajāḥ  sametya ca praśaṃsanti mārjāram tam viśām pate
translated: After a long time, the birds gained confidence in him.🔽And, O lord of the people, they gathered and praised that cat.

original: pūjyamānas tu taiḥ sarvaiḥ pakṣibhiḥ pakṣibhojanaḥ
analyzed: pūjyamānaḥ tu taiḥ sarvaiḥ pakṣibhiḥ pakṣi bhojanaḥ
translated: Honored by all those birds, that eater of birds

original: ātmakāryaṃ kṛtaṃ mene caryāyāś ca kṛtaṃ phalam
analyzed: ātma kāryam kṛtam mene caryāyāḥ ca kṛtam phalam
translated: Considered his own purpose accomplished and the fruit of his practice done.

original: atha dīrghasya kālasya taṃ deśaṃ mūṣikā yayuḥ
analyzed: atha dīrghasya kālasya tam deśam mūṣikāḥ yayuḥ
translated: Then, after a long time, the mice went to that place

original: dadṛśus taṃ ca te tatra dhārmikaṃ vratacāriṇam
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ tam ca te tatra dhārmikam vrata cāriṇam
translated: And they saw him there, righteous and observing vows.

analyzed: kāryeṇa mahatā yuktam dambha yuktena bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, they were engaged in a great task, but were full of pride.

original: teṣāṃ matir iyaṃ rājann āsīt tatra viniścaye
analyzed: teṣām matiḥ iyam rājan āsīt tatra viniścaye
translated: O king, this was their decision, which they had made up their minds about.

original: bahumitrā vayaṃ sarve teṣāṃ no mātulo hy ayam
analyzed: bahu mitrāḥ vayam sarve teṣām naḥ mātulaḥ hi ayam
translated: All of us have many friends, and this one is our maternal uncle.

analyzed: rakṣām karotu satatam vṛddha bālasya sarvaśas
translated: Let him always protect the old and the young in every way.

original: upagamya tu te sarve biḍālam idam abruvan
analyzed: upagamya tu te sarve biḍālam idam abruvan
translated: Having approached the cat, they all said this:

analyzed: bhavat prasādāt icchāmaḥ cartum ca eva yathāsukham
translated: We wish to live happily, with your favor.

original: bhavān no gatir avyagrā bhavān naḥ paramaḥ suhṛt
analyzed: bhavān naḥ gatiḥ avyagrā bhavān naḥ paramaḥ suhṛd
translated: You are our undisturbed refuge, you are our supreme friend.

original: te vayaṃ sahitāḥ sarve bhavantaṃ śaraṇaṃ gatāḥ
analyzed: te vayam sahitāḥ sarve bhavantam śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: We all together have come to you for protection.

original: bhavān dharmaparo nityaṃ bhavān dharme vyavasthitaḥ
analyzed: bhavān dharma paraḥ nityam bhavān dharme vyavasthitaḥ
translated: You are always devoted to dharma, you are established in dharma.

original: sa no rakṣa mahāprajña tridaśān iva vajrabhṛt
analyzed: sa naḥ rakṣa mahā prajña tridaśān iva vajrabhṛt
translated: Protect us, O greatly wise one, like the wielder of the thunderbolt protects the thirty gods.

original: evam uktas tu taiḥ sarvair mūṣikaiḥ sa viśāṃ pate
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu taiḥ sarvaiḥ mūṣikaiḥ sa viśām pate
translated: Thus addressed by all those mice, O lord of the earth,

analyzed: pratyuvāca tatas sarvān mūṣikān mūṣika anta kṛt
translated: he, the destroyer of mice, then replied to all the mice:

original: dvayor yogaṃ na paśyāmi tapaso rakṣaṇasya ca🔽avaśyaṃ tu mayā kāryaṃ vacanaṃ bhavatāṃ hitam
analyzed: dvayoḥ yogam na paśyāmi tapasaḥ rakṣaṇasya ca  avaśyam tu mayā kāryam vacanam bhavatām hitam
translated: I do not see how it is possible to combine austerities with protection.🔽But I must certainly do what is beneficial for you.

original: yuṣmābhir api kartavyaṃ vacanaṃ mama nityaśaḥ
analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ api kartavyam vacanam mama nityaśas
translated: And you must always do what I say.

analyzed: tapasā asmi pariśrāntaḥ dṛḍham niyamam āsthitaḥ
translated: I am exhausted from austerities and firmly adhering to strict rules.

original: na cāpi gamane śaktiṃ kāṃ cit paśyāmi cintayan
analyzed: na ca api gamane śaktim kām cit paśyāmi cintayan
translated: But even after thinking, I do not see any ability to go anywhere.

original: so 'smi neyaḥ sadā tātā nadīkūlam itaḥ sukham
analyzed: saḥ smi neyaḥ sadā tātā nadī kūlam itas sukham
translated: Therefore, dear one, I should always be carried comfortably from this riverbank.

analyzed: tathā iti tam pratijñāya mūṣikāḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among the Bharata lineage! The mouse promised to do so.

analyzed: vṛddha bālam atho sarve mārjārāya nyavedayan
translated: And all of them, the old and the young, informed the cat.

original: tataḥ sa pāpo duṣṭātmā mūṣikān atha bhakṣayan
analyzed: tatas sa pāpaḥ duṣṭa ātmā mūṣikān atha bhakṣayan
translated: Then that sinful and evil-minded one, devouring the mice,

original: pīvaraś ca suvarṇaś ca dṛḍhabandhaś ca jāyate
analyzed: pīvaraḥ ca suvarṇaḥ ca dṛḍha bandhaḥ ca jāyate
translated: became fat, golden, and strong.

original: mūṣikāṇāṃ gaṇaś cātra bhṛśaṃ saṃkṣīyate 'tha saḥ
analyzed: mūṣikāṇām gaṇaḥ ca atra bhṛśam saṃkṣīyate saḥ
translated: And the group of mice there greatly diminished.

analyzed: mārjāraḥ vardhate ca api tejaḥ bala samanvitaḥ
translated: And the cat also grew, endowed with energy and strength.

original: tatas te mūṣikāḥ sarve sametyānyonyam abruvan
analyzed: tatas te mūṣikāḥ sarve sametya anyonyam abruvan
translated: Then all those mice assembled and said to each other:

original: mātulo vardhate nityaṃ vayaṃ kṣīyāmahe bhṛśam
analyzed: mātulaḥ vardhate nityam vayam kṣīyāmahe bhṛśam
translated: Our uncle is always growing, while we are greatly diminishing.

original: tataḥ prājñatamaḥ kaś ciḍ ḍiṇḍiko nāma mūṣikaḥ
analyzed: tatas prājñatamaḥ kaḥ cit ḍiṇḍikaḥ nāma mūṣikaḥ
translated: Then a mouse named Dindika, the wisest of them all,

analyzed: abravīt vacanam rājan mūṣikāṇām mahā gaṇam
translated: spoke these words, O king, to the great assembly of mice:

analyzed: gacchatām vaḥ nadī tīram sahitānām viśeṣataḥ
translated: Let all of you go to the riverbank, especially when united.

analyzed: pṛṣṭhatas ham gamiṣyāmi saha eva mātulena tu
translated: But I will go behind, together with my uncle.

original: sādhu sādhv iti te sarve pūjayāṃ cakrire tadā
analyzed: sādhu sādhu iti te sarve pūjayām cakrire tadā
translated: All of them praised him, saying, Well done! Well done!

analyzed: cakruḥ ca eva yathānyāyam ḍiṇḍikasya vacaḥ rthavat
translated: And they duly carried out the meaningful words of the mouse.

original: avijñānāt tataḥ so 'tha ḍiṇḍikaṃ hy upabhuktavān
analyzed: avijñānāt tatas saḥ tha ḍiṇḍikam hi upabhuktavān
translated: Then, out of ignorance, he ate the mouse.

original: tatas te sahitāḥ sarve mantrayām āsur añjasā
analyzed: tatas te sahitāḥ sarve mantrayām āsuḥ añjasā
translated: Then all of them together quickly consulted each other.

original: tatra vṛddhatamaḥ kaś cit koliko nāma mūṣikaḥ
analyzed: tatra vṛddhatamaḥ kaḥ cit kolikaḥ nāma mūṣikaḥ
translated: Among them, an old mouse named Kolika,

analyzed: abravīt vacanam rājam jñāti madhye yathātatham
translated: Spoke these words, O king, in the midst of his relatives, as it is:

original: na mātulo dharmakāmaś chadmamātraṃ kṛtā śikhā
analyzed: na mātulaḥ dharma kāmaḥ chadma mātram kṛtā śikhā
translated: The uncle is not one who desires dharma, the tuft of hair is merely a pretense,

analyzed: na mūla phala bhakṣasya viṣṭhā bhavati lomaśā
translated: The feces of one who eats roots and fruits do not have hair.

original: asya gātrāṇi vardhante gaṇaś ca parihīyate
analyzed: asya gātrāṇi vardhante gaṇaḥ ca parihīyate
translated: His body grows, but the group diminishes.

analyzed: adya sapta aṣṭa divasān ḍiṇḍikaḥ pi na dṛśyate
translated: Today, for seven or eight days, the mouse has not been seen.

original: etac chrutvā vacaḥ sarve mūṣikā vipradudruvuḥ🔽biḍālo 'pi sa duṣṭātmā jagāmaiva yathāgatam
analyzed: etat śrutvā vacaḥ sarve mūṣikāḥ vipradudruvuḥ  biḍālaḥ pi sa duṣṭa ātmā jagāma eva yathāgatam
translated: Hearing these words, all the mice scattered in all directions.🔽And that wicked cat also went away as he had come.

original: tathā tvam api duṣṭātman baiḍālaṃ vratam āsthitaḥ
analyzed: tathā tvam api duṣṭa ātman baiḍālam vratam āsthitaḥ
translated: In the same way, O wicked one, you too, having adopted the cat's vow,

original: carasi jñātiṣu sadā biḍālo mūṣikeṣv iva
analyzed: carasi jñātiṣu sadā biḍālaḥ mūṣikeṣu iva
translated: Always move among your relatives like a cat among mice.

original: anyathā kila te vākyam anyathā karma dṛśyate
analyzed: anyathā kila te vākyam anyathā karma dṛśyate
translated: Your words are one way, but your actions are seen to be another.

original: dambhanārthāya lokasya vedāś copaśamaś ca te
analyzed: dambhana arthāya lokasya vedāḥ ca upaśamaḥ ca te
translated: The Vedas and tranquility are for the deception of the world.

original: tyaktvā chadma tv idaṃ rājan kṣatradharmaṃ samāśritaḥ
analyzed: tyaktvā chadma tu idam rājan kṣatra dharmam samāśritaḥ
translated: Abandoning this deception, O king, resorting to the dharma of kshatriyas,

analyzed: kuru kāryāṇi sarvāṇi dharmiṣṭhaḥ si nara ṛṣabha
translated: do all your duties, you are the most righteous, O best of men.

analyzed: bāhu vīryeṇa pṛthivīm labdhvā bharata sattama
translated: Having obtained the earth through the strength of your arms, O best of the Bharata lineage,

original: dehi dānaṃ dvijātibhyaḥ pitṛbhyaś ca yathocitam
analyzed: dehi dānam dvijātibhyaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ ca yathocitam
translated: give gifts to the twice-born and to the ancestors as is proper.

original: kliṣṭāyā varṣapūgāṃś ca mātur mātṛhite sthitaḥ
analyzed: kliṣṭāyāḥ varṣa pūgān ca mātuḥ mātṛ hite sthitaḥ
translated: And for the welfare of your mother, who has suffered for many years,

original: pramārjāśru raṇe jitvā saṃmānaṃ param āvaha
analyzed: pramārja aśru raṇe jitvā saṃmānam param āvaha
translated: wipe away her tears by conquering in battle and bringing great honor.

original: pañca grāmā vṛtā yatnān nāsmābhir apavarjitāḥ
analyzed: pañca grāmāḥ vṛtāḥ yatnāt na asmābhiḥ apavarjitāḥ
translated: The five villages that were carefully chosen were not abandoned by us.

original: yudhyāmahe kathaṃ saṃkhye kopayema ca pāṇḍavān
analyzed: yudhyāmahe katham saṃkhye kopayema ca pāṇḍavān
translated: How can we fight in battle and provoke the Pandavas?

analyzed: tvad kṛte duṣṭa bhāvasya saṃtyāgaḥ vidurasya ca
translated: And for your sake, the abandonment of the evil-minded Vidura,

original: jātuṣe ca gṛhe dāhaṃ smara taṃ puruṣo bhava
analyzed: jātuṣe ca gṛhe dāham smara tam puruṣaḥ bhava
translated: and the burning of the house of lac, remember that, be a man.

original: yac ca kṛṣṇam avocas tvam āyāntaṃ kurusaṃsadi
analyzed: yat ca kṛṣṇam avocaḥ tvam āyāntam kuru saṃsadi
translated: And what you said to Krishna when he came to the assembly of the Kurus,

original: ayam asmi sthito rājañ śamāya samarāya ca
analyzed: ayam asmi sthitaḥ rājam śamāya samarāya ca
translated: I am here, O king, for peace and for war.

analyzed: tasya ayam āgataḥ kālaḥ samarasya narādhipa
translated: The time for that battle has come, O lord of men.

original: etad arthaṃ mayā sarvaṃ kṛtam etad yudhiṣṭhira
analyzed: etad artham mayā sarvam kṛtam etat yudhiṣṭhira
translated: For this purpose, O Yudhishthira, all this has been done by me.

original: kiṃ nu yuddhāt paraṃ lābhaṃ kṣatriyo bahu manyate
analyzed: kim nu yuddhāt param lābham kṣatriyaḥ bahu manyate
translated: What does a Kshatriya consider to be a greater gain than battle?

original: kiṃ ca tvaṃ kṣatriyakule jātaḥ saṃprathito bhuvi
analyzed: kim ca tvam kṣatriya kule jātaḥ saṃprathitaḥ bhuvi
translated: And why were you born in a Kshatriya family renowned on earth?

original: droṇād astrāṇi saṃprāpya kṛpāc ca bharatarṣabha
analyzed: droṇāt astrāṇi saṃprāpya kṛpāt ca bharata ṛṣabha
translated: Having obtained weapons from Drona and Kripa, O best of the Bharata race,

original: tulyayonau samabale vāsudevaṃ samāśritaḥ🔽brūyās tvaṃ vāsudevaṃ ca pāṇḍavānāṃ samīpataḥ
analyzed: tulya yonau sama bale vāsudevam samāśritaḥ  brūyāḥ tvam vāsudevam ca pāṇḍavānām samīpatas
translated: Relying on Vasudeva, in a family of equal birth and strength,🔽You should tell Vasudeva and the Pandavas in their presence,

original: ātmārthaṃ pāṇḍavārthaṃ ca yatto māṃ pratiyodhaya
analyzed: ātma artham pāṇḍava artham ca yattaḥ mām pratiyodhaya
translated: For your own sake and for the sake of the Pandavas, fight with me to the best of your ability.

original: sabhāmadhye ca yad rūpaṃ māyayā kṛtavān asi
analyzed: sabhā madhye ca yat rūpam māyayā kṛtavān asi
translated: And the form you assumed through illusion in the midst of the assembly hall,

original: tat tathaiva punaḥ kṛtvā sārjuno mām abhidrava
analyzed: tat tathā eva punar kṛtvā sa arjunaḥ mām abhidrava
translated: Assuming that form again, together with Arjuna, attack me.

original: indrajālaṃ ca māyāṃ vai kuhakā vāpi bhīṣaṇā
analyzed: indrajālam ca māyām vai kuhakā vā api bhīṣaṇā
translated: Illusions, magic, or even terrifying tricks,

analyzed: ātta śastrasya saṃgrāme vahanti pratigarjanāḥ
translated: When one is armed and in battle, they only bring forth counter-cries.

original: vayam apy utsahema dyāṃ khaṃ ca gacchema māyayā
analyzed: vayam api utsahema dyām kham ca gacchema māyayā
translated: We too are capable of going to heaven or the sky through illusion,

original: rasātalaṃ viśā 'mopi aindraṃ vā puram eva tu
analyzed: rasātalam viśa aindram vā puram eva tu
translated: Or entering Rasatala or even the city of Indra.

original: darśayema ca rūpāṇi svaśarīre bahūny api
analyzed: darśayema ca rūpāṇi sva śarīre bahūni api
translated: And we can display many forms in our own body,

original: na tu paryāyataḥ siddhir buddhim āpnoti mānuṣīm
analyzed: na tu paryāyataḥ siddhiḥ buddhim āpnoti mānuṣīm
translated: But success does not come through succession, human intelligence is obtained.

original: manasaiva hi bhūtāni dhātaiva kurute vaśe
analyzed: manasā eva hi bhūtāni dhātā eva kurute vaśe
translated: For the Creator himself brings the beings under control by his mind alone.

original: yad bravīṣi ca vārṣṇeya dhārtarāṣṭrān ahaṃ raṇe
analyzed: yat bravīṣi ca vārṣṇeya dhārtarāṣṭrān aham raṇe
translated: What you said, O Varshneya, I will kill the sons of Dhritarashtra in battle,

analyzed: ghātayitvā pradāsyāmi pārthebhyaḥ rājyam uttamam
translated: and give the excellent kingdom to the Parthas,

original: ācacakṣe ca me sarvaṃ saṃjayas tava bhāṣitam
analyzed: ācacakṣe ca me sarvam saṃjayaḥ tava bhāṣitam
translated: and all that Sanjaya told me of your words,

analyzed: mad dvitīyena pārthena vairam vaḥ savyasācinā
translated: You have a quarrel with Partha Savyasachi, who is my second,

analyzed: sa satya saṃgaraḥ bhūtvā pāṇḍava arthe parākramī
translated: that one of firm vows, the powerful one, for the sake of the Pandavas,

original: yudhyasvādya raṇe yattaḥ paśyāmaḥ puruṣo bhava
analyzed: yudhyasva adya raṇe yattaḥ paśyāmaḥ puruṣaḥ bhava
translated: fight with effort in the battle today, be a man and see us.

original: yas tu śatrum abhijñāya śuddhaṃ pauruṣam āsthitaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ tu śatrum abhijñāya śuddham pauruṣam āsthitaḥ
translated: But he who, knowing the enemy, resorts to pure manliness,

original: karoti dviṣatāṃ śokaṃ sa jīvati sujīvitam
analyzed: karoti dviṣatām śokam sa jīvati su jīvitam
translated: and causes grief to the enemies, he lives a good life.

original: akasmāc caiva te kṛṣṇa khyātaṃ loke mahad yaśaḥ
analyzed: akasmāt ca eva te kṛṣṇa khyātam loke mahat yaśaḥ
translated: And suddenly, O Krishna, your great fame is known in the world,

analyzed: adyā idānīm vijānīmaḥ santi ṣaṇḍhāḥ sa śṛṅgakāḥ
translated: now we know that there are eunuchs with horns.

original: madvidho nāpi nṛpatis tvayi yuktaḥ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: madvidhaḥ nā api nṛpatiḥ tvayi yuktaḥ katham cana
translated: And a king like me is in no way fit for you,

analyzed: sannā aham saṃyuge kartum kaṃsa bhṛtye viśeṣataḥ
translated: especially for the servant of Kamsa, to put on armor in battle.

analyzed: amarṣam rājya haraṇam vana vāsam ca pāṇḍava
translated: Remembering the insult, the seizure of the kingdom, the exile to the forest, O Pandava,

original: draupadyāś ca parikleśaṃ saṃsmaran puruṣo bhava
analyzed: draupadyāḥ ca parikleśam saṃsmaran puruṣaḥ bhava
translated: and the distress of Draupadi, be a man.

original: yadarthaṃ kṣatriyā sūte garbhaṃ tad idam āgatam
analyzed: yad artham kṣatriyā sūte garbham tat idam āgatam
translated: For which the Kshatriya woman gives birth to a son, that has come to this.

original: balaṃ vīryaṃ ca śauryaṃ ca paraṃ cāpy astralāghavam
analyzed: balam vīryam ca śauryam ca param ca api astra lāghavam
translated: Strength, valor, heroism, and the highest lightness of hands in the use of weapons,

original: pauruṣaṃ darśayan yuddhe kopasya kuru niṣkṛtim
analyzed: pauruṣam darśayan yuddhe kopasya kuru niṣkṛtim
translated: Displaying your manliness in battle, satisfy your anger.

analyzed: parikliṣṭasya dīnasya dīrgha kāla uṣitasya ca
translated: For one who is afflicted, distressed, and has been living for a long time,

original: na sphuṭed dhṛdayaṃ kasya aiśvaryād bhraṃśitasya ca
analyzed: na sphuṭet dhṛdayam kasya aiśvaryāt bhraṃśitasya ca
translated: Whose heart would not break upon being deposed from sovereignty?

analyzed: kule jātasya śūrasya para vitteṣu gṛdhyataḥ
translated: For one born in a noble family, a hero, greedy for the wealth of others,

original: ācchinnaṃ rājyam ākramya kopaṃ kasya na dīpayet
analyzed: ācchinnam rājyam ākramya kopam kasya na dīpayet
translated: Having his kingdom taken away by force, whose anger would not be kindled?

original: yat tad uktaṃ mahad vākyaṃ karmaṇā tad vibhāvyatām
analyzed: yat tat uktam mahat vākyam karmaṇā tat vibhāvyatām
translated: That great statement which was made, let that be understood by your action.

original: akarmaṇā katthitena santaḥ kupuruṣaṃ viduḥ🔽amitrāṇāṃ vaśe sthānaṃ rājyasya ca punarbhavaḥ
analyzed: akarmaṇā katthitena santaḥ kupuruṣam viduḥ  amitrāṇām vaśe sthānam rājyasya ca punarbhavaḥ
translated: The wise know a man to be a coward if he boasts without action.🔽Two goals for one engaged in battle: either victory over the enemy or death.

original: dvāv arthau yudhyamānasya tasmāt kuruta pauruṣam
analyzed: dvau arthau yudhyamānasya tasmāt kuruta pauruṣam
translated: Therefore, show your manliness.

original: asmān vā tvaṃ parājitya praśādhi pṛthivīm imām
analyzed: asmān vā tvam parājitya praśādhi pṛthivīm imām
translated: Either defeat us and rule this earth,

analyzed: atha vā nihataḥ smābhiḥ vīra lokam gamiṣyasi
translated: or, slain by us, go to the world of heroes.

original: rāṣṭrāt pravrājanaṃ kleśaṃ vanavāsaṃ ca pāṇḍava
analyzed: rāṣṭrāt pravrājanam kleśam vana vāsam ca pāṇḍava
translated: O Pandava, remember the exile from the kingdom, the suffering, the forest life,

original: kṛṣṇāyāś ca parikleśaṃ saṃsmaran puruṣo bhava
analyzed: kṛṣṇāyāḥ ca parikleśam saṃsmaran puruṣaḥ bhava
translated: and the affliction of Krishna, and be a man.

original: apriyāṇāṃ ca vacane pravrajatsu punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: apriyāṇām ca vacane pravrajatsu punar punar
translated: And in the repeated departure of unpleasant words,

original: amarṣaṃ darśayādya tvam amarṣo hy eva pauruṣam
analyzed: amarṣam darśaya adya tvam amarṣaḥ hi eva pauruṣam
translated: Show your intolerance today, for intolerance is indeed manliness.

analyzed: krodhaḥ balam tathā vīryam stra lāghavam
translated: Anger, strength, valor, knowledge, yoga, and lightness in weapons,

original: iha te pārtha dṛśyantāṃ saṃgrāme puruṣo bhava🔽taṃ ca tūbarakaṃ mūḍhaṃ bahvāśinam avidyakam
analyzed: iha te pārtha dṛśyantām saṃgrāme puruṣaḥ bhava  tam ca tūbarakam mūḍham bahu āśinam avidyakam
translated: Here, O Partha, let them be seen. Be a man in battle.🔽And to that foolish, gluttonous, ignorant wretch,

analyzed: ulūka mad vacaḥ brūyāḥ asakṛt bhīmasenakam
translated: O Uluka, speak these words of mine repeatedly to Bhimasena:

original: virāṭanagare pārtha yas tvaṃ sūdo hy abhūḥ purā
analyzed: virāṭa nagare pārtha yaḥ tvam sūdaḥ hi abhūḥ purā
translated: In the city of Virata, O Partha, you were formerly a cook,

original: ballavo nāma vikhyātas tan mamaiva hi pauruṣam
analyzed: ballavaḥ nāma vikhyātaḥ tat mama eva hi pauruṣam
translated: Known by the name of Ballava, that is indeed my manliness.

analyzed: aśaktena eva yat śaptam sabhā madhye vṛkodara
translated: What was cursed by one who was incapable, in the midst of the assembly, O Vrikodara,

analyzed: duḥśāsanasya rudhiram pīyatām yadi śakyate
translated: 'If you are able, drink the blood of Duhshasana,'

original: yad bravīṣi ca kaunteya dhārtarāṣṭrān ahaṃ raṇe
analyzed: yat bravīṣi ca kaunteya dhārtarāṣṭrān aham raṇe
translated: And what you say, O son of Kunti, 'I will quickly slay the sons of Dhritarashtra in battle,'

analyzed: nihaniṣyāmi tarasā tasya kālaḥ yam āgataḥ
translated: The time for that has now come.

original: tvaṃ hi bhojye puraskāryo bhakṣye peye ca bhārata
analyzed: tvam hi bhojye puraskāryaḥ bhakṣye peye ca bhārata
translated: You are to be placed at the head in food, in eatables, and in drink, O Bharata,

original: kva yuddhaṃ kva ca bhoktavyaṃ yudhyasva puruṣo bhava
analyzed: kva yuddham kva ca bhoktavyam yudhyasva puruṣaḥ bhava
translated: Where is battle, and where is eating? Fight, be a man.

original: śayiṣyase hato bhūmau gadām āliṅgya bhārata
analyzed: śayiṣyase hataḥ bhūmau gadām āliṅgya bhārata
translated: You will lie on the ground, slain, embracing your mace, O Bharata.

original: tad vṛthā ca sabhāmadhye valgitaṃ te vṛkodara
analyzed: tat vṛthā ca sabhā madhye valgitam te vṛkodara
translated: O Vrikodara, that boasting of yours in the midst of the assembly is futile.

original: ulūka nakulaṃ brūhi vacanān mama bhārata
analyzed: ulūka nakulam brūhi vacanāt mama bhārata
translated: O Uluka, speak these words of mine to Nakula, O Bharata:

original: yudhyasvādya sthiro bhūtva paśyāmas tava pauruṣam
analyzed: yudhyasva adya sthiraḥ bhūtva paśyāmaḥ tava pauruṣam
translated: Fight now, be steady, we shall see your manliness.

original: yudhiṣṭhirānurāgaṃ ca dveṣaṃ ca mayi bhārata
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhira anurāgam ca dveṣam ca mayi bhārata
translated: And the affection for Yudhishthira, and the hatred for me, O Bharata,

analyzed: kṛṣṇāyāḥ ca parikleśam smara idānīm yathātatham
translated: And the affliction of Krishna, remember them now as they truly are.

original: brūyās tvaṃ sahadevaṃ ca rājamadhye vaco mama
analyzed: brūyāḥ tvam sahadevam ca rāja madhye vacaḥ mama
translated: And speak these words of mine to Sahadeva in the midst of the kings:

original: yudhyedānīṃ raṇe yattaḥ kleśān smara ca pāṇḍava
analyzed: yudhya idānīm raṇe yattaḥ kleśān smara ca pāṇḍava
translated: Fight now with effort in battle, remember the afflictions, O Pandava.

original: virāṭadrupadau cobhau brūyās tvaṃ vacanān mama
analyzed: virāṭa drupadau ca ubhau brūyāḥ tvam vacanāt mama
translated: And speak to both Virata and Drupada these words of mine:

original: na dṛṣṭapūrvā bhartāro bhṛtyair api mahāguṇaiḥ
analyzed: na dṛṣṭa pūrvāḥ bhartāraḥ bhṛtyaiḥ api mahā guṇaiḥ
translated: Husbands have never been seen before by servants, even by those of great qualities.

original: tathārthapatibhir bhṛtyā yataḥ sṛṣṭāḥ prajās tataḥ
analyzed: tathā arthapatibhiḥ bhṛtyāḥ yatas sṛṣṭāḥ prajāḥ tatas
translated: And servants by masters, for from that source the people were created.

analyzed: a ślāghyaḥ yam narapatiḥ yuvayoḥ iti ca āgatam
translated: This king is not worthy of praise for you, thus you have come.

original: te yūyaṃ saṃhatā bhūtvā tadvadhārthaṃ mamāpi ca
analyzed: te yūyam saṃhatāḥ bhūtvā tad vadha artham mama api ca
translated: Therefore, all of you united for the sake of his death and also for mine,

original: ātmārthaṃ pāṇḍavārthaṃ ca prayudhyadhvaṃ mayā saha
analyzed: ātma artham pāṇḍava artham ca prayudhyadhvam mayā saha
translated: Fight for your own sake and for the sake of the Pandavas, together with me.

original: dhṛṣṭadyumnaṃ ca pāñcālyaṃ brūyās tvaṃ vacanān mama
analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumnam ca pāñcālyam brūyāḥ tvam vacanāt mama
translated: And speak to Dhrishtadyumna of Panchala these words of mine:

original: eṣa te samayaḥ prāpto labdhavyaś ca tvayāpi saḥ
analyzed: eṣa te samayaḥ prāptaḥ labdhavyaḥ ca tvayā api saḥ
translated: This is the time for you, and you must obtain what is to be obtained.

original: droṇam āsādya samare jñāsyase hitam uttamam
analyzed: droṇam āsādya samare jñāsyase hitam uttamam
translated: Approaching Drona in battle, you will know what is best for your welfare.

original: yudhyasva sasuhṛt pāpaṃ kuru karma suduṣkaram
analyzed: yudhyasva sa suhṛd pāpam kuru karma su duṣkaram
translated: Fight with your friends, commit a sin, perform a very difficult deed.

original: śikhaṇḍinam atho brūhi ulūka vacanān mama
analyzed: śikhaṇḍinam atho brūhi ulūka vacanāt mama
translated: O Uluka, tell Shikhandi on my behalf,

original: strīti matvā mahābāhur na haniṣyati kauravaḥ
analyzed: strī iti matvā mahā bāhuḥ na haniṣyati kauravaḥ
translated: thinking him to be a woman, the mighty-armed Kaurava will not kill him.

analyzed: gāṅgeyaḥ dhanvinām śreṣṭhaḥ yudhya idānīm su nirbhayam
translated: The son of Ganga, the best of archers, should now fight fearlessly.

original: kuru karma raṇe yattaḥ paśyāmaḥ pauruṣaṃ tava
analyzed: kuru karma raṇe yattaḥ paśyāmaḥ pauruṣam tava
translated: Strive in battle, perform your duty, we will see your manliness.

original: evam uktvā tato rājā prahasyolūkam abravīt
analyzed: evam uktvā tatas rājā prahasya ulūkam abravīt
translated: Having said this, the king laughed and spoke to Uluka,

analyzed: dhanaṃjayam punar brūhi vāsudevasya śṛṇvataḥ
translated: Again tell Dhananjaya, in the hearing of Vasudeva,

analyzed: lohābhihāraḥ nirvṛttaḥ kurukṣetram akardamam
translated: the collection of iron is over, Kurukshetra is free from mud.

original: puṣṭās te 'śvā bhṛtā yodhāḥ śvo yudhyasva sakeśavaḥ
analyzed: puṣṭāḥ te śvā bhṛtāḥ yodhāḥ śvas yudhyasva sa keśavaḥ
translated: Your horses are fattened, your warriors are paid, tomorrow fight with Keshava.

analyzed: a samāgamya bhīṣmeṇa saṃyuge kim vikatthase
translated: Without meeting Bhishma in battle, why do you boast?

analyzed: ārurukṣuḥ yathā mandaḥ parvatam gandhamādanam
translated: Like a slow one trying to climb Mount Gandhamadana,

original: evaṃ katthasi kaunteya akatthan puruṣo bhava
analyzed: evam katthasi kaunteya a katthan puruṣaḥ bhava
translated: so you boast, O son of Kunti, be a man without boasting.

original: sūtaputraṃ sudurdharṣaṃ śalyaṃ ca balināṃ varam
analyzed: sūtaputram su durdharṣam śalyam ca balinām varam
translated: The son of a suta is extremely unassailable, and Shalya is the best among strong ones,

original: droṇaṃ ca balināṃ śreṣṭhaṃ śacīpatisamaṃ yudhi
analyzed: droṇam ca balinām śreṣṭham śacīpati samam yudhi
translated: Drona, the best among the strong, equal to Shachi's husband in battle,

original: ajitvā saṃyuge pārtha rājyaṃ katham ihecchasi
analyzed: a jitvā saṃyuge pārtha rājyam katham iha icchasi
translated: without defeating him in battle, O Partha, how can you desire the kingdom?

original: brāhme dhanuṣi cācāryaṃ vedayor antagaṃ dvayoḥ
analyzed: brāhme dhanuṣi ca ācāryam vedayoḥ antagam dvayoḥ
translated: The preceptor in the brahmanical bow, the knower of the two Vedas,

analyzed: yudhi dhuryam avikṣobhyam anīka caram acyutam
translated: the unswerving leader of the army, the undeteriorating one,

original: droṇaṃ mahādyutiṃ pārtha jetum icchasi tan mṛṣā
analyzed: droṇam mahā dyutim pārtha jetum icchasi tat mṛṣā
translated: Drona of great splendor, O Partha, you desire to conquer him - that is false.

original: na hi śuśruma vātena merum unmathitaṃ girim
analyzed: na hi śuśruma vātena merum unmathitam girim
translated: We have not heard of Meru, the mountain, being uprooted by the wind,

original: anilo vā vahen meruṃ dyaur vāpi nipaten mahīm
analyzed: anilaḥ vā vahet merum dyauḥ vā api nipatet mahīm
translated: or of the wind carrying away Meru, or of the sky falling down on the earth,

original: yugaṃ vā parivarteta yady evaṃ syād yathāttha mām
analyzed: yugam vā parivarteta yadi evam syāt yathā āttha mām
translated: or of the yuga changing - if it were so, then it would be as you tell me.

original: ko hy asti jīvitākāṅkṣī prāpyemam arimardanam
analyzed: kaḥ hi asti jīvita ākāṅkṣī prāpya imam ari mardanam
translated: For who, desiring to live, would approach this crusher of enemies?

original: pārtho vā itaro vāpi ko 'nyaḥ svasti gṛhān vrajet
analyzed: pārthaḥ vā itaraḥ vā api kaḥ nyaḥ svasti gṛhān vrajet
translated: Who else but Partha or another would go home safe and sound?

original: katham ābhyām abhidhyātaḥ saṃspṛṣṭo dāruṇena vā
analyzed: katham ābhyām abhidhyātaḥ saṃspṛṣṭaḥ dāruṇena vā
translated: How could one, touched by these two or by something terrible,

original: raṇe jīvan pramucyeta padā bhūmim upaspṛśan
analyzed: raṇe jīvan pramucyeta padā bhūmim upaspṛśan
translated: touch the ground with his foot and escape alive from the battle?

analyzed: kim darduraḥ kūpa śayaḥ yathā imām
translated: Are you like a frog in a well,

analyzed: na budhyase rāja camūm sametām  durādharṣām deva camū prakāśām
translated: not understanding this assembled royal army,🔽difficult to assail, shining like the army of the gods,

analyzed: guptām narendraiḥ tridaśaiḥ iva dyām
translated: protected by the kings of men, like the sky by the thirty gods?

analyzed: prācyaiḥ pratīcyaiḥ atha dākṣiṇātyaiḥ
translated: By those from the east, west, south,

analyzed: udīcya kāmboja śakaiḥ khasaiḥ ca  śālvaiḥ sa matsyaiḥ kuru madhyadeśyaiḥ
translated: By those from the north, Kamboja, Shakas, Khashas,🔽By Shalvas, Matsyas, Kurus, Madhyadeśyas,

analyzed: mlecchaiḥ pulindaiḥ draviḍa āndhra kāñcyaiḥ
translated: By Mlecchas, Pulindas, Dravidas, Andhras, Kānchis,

analyzed: nānā jana ogham yudhi saṃpravṛddham
translated: By the multitude of various peoples engaged in battle,

analyzed: gāṅgam yathā vegam a pāraṇīyam
translated: Like the irresistible current of the Ganges,

analyzed: mām ca sthitam nāga balasya madhye
translated: And by me standing in the midst of the elephant force,

analyzed: yuyutsase manda kim alpabuddhe
translated: O foolish one, why do you wish to fight?

original: akṣayyāv iṣudhī caiva agnidattaṃ ca te ratham
analyzed: akṣayyau iṣudhī ca eva agni dattam ca te ratham
translated: We know that you have inexhaustible quivers, and the chariot given to you by Agni,

original: jānīmo hi raṇe pārtha ketuṃ divyaṃ ca bhārata
analyzed: jānīmaḥ hi raṇe pārtha ketum divyam ca bhārata
translated: And the divine banner in battle, O Partha, O descendant of Bharata.

analyzed: akatthamānaḥ yudhyasva katthase rjuna kim bahu
translated: Fight without boasting. Why do you boast so much, O Arjuna?

original: paryāyāt siddhir etasya naitat sidhyati katthanāt
analyzed: paryāyāt siddhiḥ etasya na etat sidhyati katthanāt
translated: Success comes from practice, not from boasting.

original: yadīdaṃ katthanāl loke sidhyet karma dhanaṃjaya
analyzed: yadi idam katthanāt loke sidhyet karma dhanaṃjaya
translated: If this work were to be accomplished in the world by boasting, O Dhananjaya,

original: sarve bhaveyuḥ siddhārthāḥ katthane ko hi durgataḥ
analyzed: sarve bhaveyuḥ siddhārthāḥ katthane kaḥ hi durgataḥ
translated: All would be successful in their aims. Who is unfortunate in boasting?

analyzed: jānāmi te vāsudevam sahāyam
translated: I know that Vasudeva is your ally,

analyzed: jānāmi te gāṇḍivam tāla mātram
translated: I know that your Gandiva is a tāla in length,

analyzed: jānāmi aham tvādṛśaḥ nā asti yoddhā
translated: I know that there is no warrior like you,

analyzed: jānānaḥ te rājyam etat dharāmi
translated: Knowing this, I rule this kingdom.

original: na tu paryāyadharmeṇa siddhiṃ prāpnoti mānavaḥ
analyzed: na tu paryāya dharmeṇa siddhim prāpnoti mānavaḥ
translated: But a man does not attain success by the dharma of succession.

analyzed: manasā eva anukūlāni dhātā eva kurute vaśe
translated: The Creator himself makes favorable things subject to the mind.

original: trayodaśa samā bhuktaṃ rājyaṃ vilapatas tava
analyzed: trayodaśa samāḥ bhuktam rājyam vilapataḥ tava
translated: You have ruled for thirteen years while lamenting.

original: bhūyaś caiva praśāsiṣye tvāṃ nihatya sabāndhavam
analyzed: bhūyas ca eva praśāsiṣye tvām nihatya sa bāndhavam
translated: And I will rule again after killing you and your relatives.

original: kva tadā gāṇḍivaṃ te 'bhūd yat tvaṃ dāsapaṇair jitaḥ
analyzed: kva tadā gāṇḍivam te bhūt yat tvam dāsa paṇaiḥ jitaḥ
translated: Where was your Gandiva then, when you were won by the price of a slave?

original: kva tadā bhīmasenasya balam āsīc ca phalguna
analyzed: kva tadā bhīmasenasya balam āsīt ca phalguna
translated: Where was the strength of Bhimasena and Phalguna then?

original: sagadād bhīmasenād vā phālgunād vā sagāṇḍivāt
analyzed: sa gadāt bhīmasenāt vā phālgunāt vā sa gāṇḍivāt
translated: Neither from Bhimasena with his mace, nor from Phalguna with his Gandiva,

original: na vai mokṣas tadā yo 'bhūd vinā kṛṣṇām aninditām
analyzed: na vai mokṣaḥ tadā yaḥ bhūt vinā kṛṣṇām aninditām
translated: was there any escape then, except through the unblemished Krishna.

original: sā vo dāsye samāpannān mocayām āsa pārṣatī
analyzed: sā vaḥ dāsye samāpannān mocayām āsa pārṣatī
translated: She, the daughter of Prishata, liberated you who had become slaves.

analyzed: amānuṣyam samāpannān dāsa karmaṇi avasthitān
translated: You who had become non-human, engaged in the work of slaves,

original: avocaṃ yat ṣaṇḍhatilān ahaṃ vas tathyam eva tat
analyzed: avocam yat ṣaṇḍhatilān aham vaḥ tathyam eva tat
translated: I said to you, Those are indeed barren sesame seeds.

original: dhṛtā hi veṇī pārthena virāṭanagare tadā
analyzed: dhṛtā hi veṇī pārthena virāṭa nagare tadā
translated: For Partha had then taken up a braid in the city of Virata.

analyzed: sūdakarmaṇi viśrāntam virāṭasya mahānase
translated: In the kitchen of Virata, resting in the work of a cook,

original: bhīmasenena kaunteya yat tu tan mama pauruṣam
analyzed: bhīmasenena kaunteya yat tu tat mama pauruṣam
translated: O son of Kunti, that was the manliness of Bhimasena.

original: evam eva sadā daṇḍaṃ kṣatriyāḥ kṣatriye dadhuḥ
analyzed: evam eva sadā daṇḍam kṣatriyāḥ kṣatriye dadhuḥ
translated: Thus did the Kshatriyas always impose punishment on a Kshatriya.

original: veṇīṃ kṛtvā ṣaṇḍhaveṣaḥ kanyāṃ nartitavān asi
analyzed: veṇīm kṛtvā ṣaṇḍha veṣaḥ kanyām nartitavān asi
translated: You made a braid and danced in the guise of a eunuch.

original: na bhayād vāsudevasya na cāpi tava phālguna
analyzed: na bhayāt vāsudevasya na ca api tava phālguna
translated: Not out of fear of Vasudeva, nor of you, O Phalguna,

original: rājyaṃ pratipradāsyāmi yudhyasva sahakeśavaḥ🔽na māyā hīndrajālaṃ vā kuhakā vāpi bhīṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: rājyam pratipradāsyāmi yudhyasva saha keśavaḥ  na māyā hi indrajālam vā kuhakāḥ vā api bhīṣaṇāḥ
translated: I will not give up the kingdom. Fight with Keshava.🔽Neither magic, nor tricks, nor frightening illusions,

analyzed: vyātta śastrasya saṃgrāme vahanti pratigarjanāḥ
translated: Nor gaping weapons in battle carry any response from me.

analyzed: vāsudeva sahasram vā phālgunānām śatāni vā
translated: Even if there are a thousand Vasudevas or a hundred Phalguni warriors,

original: āsādya mām amogheṣuṃ draviṣyanti diśo daśa
analyzed: āsādya mām amogha iṣum draviṣyanti diśaḥ daśa
translated: Having encountered me, whose arrows never miss, they will flee in the ten directions.

original: saṃyugaṃ gaccha bhīṣmeṇa bhindhi vā śirasā girim
analyzed: saṃyugam gaccha bhīṣmeṇa bhindhi vā śirasā girim
translated: Go to battle with Bhishma, or split a mountain with your head,

analyzed: tarasva vā mahā gādham bāhubhyām puruṣa udadhim
translated: Or cross the great and unfathomable ocean of men with your arms.

analyzed: śāradvata mahā mīnam saumadatti timiṃgilam
translated: With the great fish Sharadvata, the timi-fish Somadatta,

analyzed: bhīṣma vegam aparyantam droṇa grāha durāsadam
translated: The irresistible crocodile Drona, the irresistible current of Bhishma,

analyzed: karṇa śalya jhaṣa āvartam kāmboja vaḍavāmukham  duḥśāsana ogham śala śalya matsyam
translated: The whirlpool of Karna and Shalya, the submarine fire Kamboja,🔽The current of Duhshasana, the fish Shalya,

analyzed: suṣeṇa citrāyudha nāga nakram
translated: The elephants and alligators of Sushena and Chitrayudha,

analyzed: jayadratha adrim puru mitra gādham

original: kṛṣṇādīṃś caiva tān sarvān yathoktaṃ vākyam abravīt
analyzed: kṛṣṇa ādīn ca eva tān sarvān yathoktam vākyam abravīt
translated: And he spoke the same words to Krishna and all the others, as he had been instructed to say.

original: ulūkasya tu tad vākyaṃ pāpaṃ dāruṇam īritam
analyzed: ulūkasya tu tat vākyam pāpam dāruṇam īritam
translated: Hearing those sinful and terrible words spoken by Uluka,

original: śrutvā vicukṣubhe pārtho lalāṭaṃ cāpy amārjayat
analyzed: śrutvā vicukṣubhe pārthaḥ lalāṭam ca api amārjayat
translated: Partha became agitated and wiped his forehead.

original: tad avasthaṃ tadā dṛṣṭvā pārthaṃ sā samitir nṛpa
analyzed: tat avastham tadā dṛṣṭvā pārtham sā samitiḥ nṛpa
translated: Seeing Partha in that state, O king,

analyzed: na amṛṣyanta mahā rāja pāṇḍavānām mahā rathāḥ
translated: the great warriors of the Pandavas could not tolerate it, O great king,

analyzed: adhikṣepeṇa kṛṣṇasya pārthasya ca mahātmanaḥ
translated: hearing the insult to Krishna and the great-souled Partha.

original: śrutvā te puruṣavyāghrāḥ krodhāj jajvalur acyutāḥ
analyzed: śrutvā te puruṣa vyāghrāḥ krodhāt jajvaluḥ acyutāḥ
translated: Hearing that, those best of men, the undeceiving ones, blazed with anger.

original: dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ śikhaṇḍī ca sātyakiś ca mahārathaḥ
analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ śikhaṇḍī ca sātyakiḥ ca mahā rathaḥ
translated: Dhrishtadyumna, Shikhandi, and the great warrior Satyaki,

original: kekayā bhrātaraḥ pañca rākṣasaś ca ghaṭotkacaḥ
analyzed: kekayāḥ bhrātaraḥ pañca rākṣasaḥ ca ghaṭotkacaḥ
translated: the five brothers from Kekaya, and the rakshasa Ghatotkacha,

analyzed: draupadeya abhimanyuḥ ca dhṛṣṭaketuḥ ca pārthivaḥ
translated: the sons of Draupadi, Abhimanyu, and King Dhrishtaketu,

original: bhīmasenaś ca vikrānto yamajau ca mahārathau
analyzed: bhīmasenaḥ ca vikrāntaḥ yama jau ca mahā rathau
translated: the powerful Bhimasena, and the twin maharathas,

original: utpetur āsanāt sarve krodhasaṃraktalocanāḥ🔽bāhūn pragṛhya rucirān raktacandanarūṣitān
analyzed: utpetuḥ āsanāt sarve krodha saṃrakta locanāḥ  bāhūn pragṛhya rucirān raktacandana rūṣitān
translated: all rose from their seats, their eyes red with anger.🔽Grasping their beautiful arms, smeared with red sandalwood paste,

original: aṅgadaiḥ pārihāryaiś ca keyūraiś ca vibhūṣitān
analyzed: aṅgadaiḥ pārihāryaiḥ ca keyūraiḥ ca vibhūṣitān
translated: adorned with bracelets, armlets, and golden bands,

analyzed: dantān danteṣu niṣpiṣya sṛkkiṇī parilelihan
translated: gnashing their teeth, and licking the corners of their mouths,

analyzed: teṣām ākāra bhāva jñaḥ kuntī putraḥ vṛkodaraḥ
translated: Vrikodara, the son of Kunti, who knew their intentions,

original: udatiṣṭhat sa vegena krodhena prajvalann iva🔽udvṛtya sahasā netre dantān kaṭakaṭāyya ca
analyzed: udatiṣṭhat sa vegena krodhena prajvalan iva  udvṛtya sahasā netre dantān kaṭakaṭāyya ca
translated: He arose with force, as if blazing with anger.🔽Suddenly opening his eyes and gnashing his teeth,

original: hastaṃ hastena niṣpiṣya ulūkaṃ vākyam abravīt
analyzed: hastam hastena niṣpiṣya ulūkam vākyam abravīt
translated: Squeezing his hands together, he spoke to Uluka:

original: aśaktānām ivāsmākaṃ protsāhananimittakam🔽śrutaṃ te vacanaṃ mūrkha yat tvāṃ duryodhano 'bravīt
analyzed: aśaktānām iva asmākam protsāhana nimittakam  śrutam te vacanam mūrkha yat tvām duryodhanaḥ bravīt
translated: For those who are unable, it is a sign of encouragement.🔽You have heard the words, fool, that Duryodhana spoke to you.

original: tan me kathayato manda śruṇu vākyaṃ durāsadam
analyzed: tat me kathayataḥ manda śruṇu vākyam durāsadam
translated: Listen to my words, O slow-witted one, as I speak them to you.

original: sarvakṣatrasya madhye tvaṃ yad vakṣyasi suyodhanam
analyzed: sarva kṣatrasya madhye tvam yat vakṣyasi suyodhanam
translated: In the midst of all the kshatriyas, you will speak to Suyodhana,

original: śṛṇvataḥ sūtaputrasya pituś ca tvaṃ durātmanaḥ
analyzed: śṛṇvataḥ sūtaputrasya pituḥ ca tvam durātmanaḥ
translated: While the son of a suta and your evil-minded father listen.

original: asmābhiḥ prītikāmais tu bhrātur jyeṣṭhasya nityaśaḥ
analyzed: asmābhiḥ prīti kāmaiḥ tu bhrātuḥ jyeṣṭhasya nityaśas
translated: We, out of love for our elder brother, have always forgiven you.

original: marṣitaṃ te durācāra tat tvaṃ na bahu manyase🔽preṣitaś ca hṛṣīkeśaḥ śamākāṅkṣī kurūn prati
analyzed: marṣitam te durācāra tat tvam na bahu manyase  preṣitaḥ ca hṛṣīkeśaḥ śama ākāṅkṣī kurūn prati
translated: O evil one, you do not value that.🔽Hrishikesha was sent to the Kurus, desiring peace,

original: kulasya hitakāmena dharmarājena dhīmatā🔽tvaṃ kālacodito nūnaṃ gantukāmo yamakṣayam
analyzed: kulasya hita kāmena dharmarājena dhīmatā  tvam kāla coditaḥ nūnam gantu kāmaḥ yama kṣayam
translated: By the wise Dharmaraja, out of love for the welfare of the family.🔽You are surely urged by time, desiring to go to Yama's abode.

original: gacchasvāhavam asmābhis tac ca śvo bhavitā dhruvam
analyzed: gacchasva āhavam asmābhiḥ tat ca śvas bhavitā dhruvam
translated: Go to the battle with us, which will certainly take place tomorrow.

original: mayāpi ca pratijñāto vadhaḥ sabhrātṛkasya te
analyzed: mayā api ca pratijñātaḥ vadhaḥ sa bhrātṛkasya te
translated: And by me also, your slaughter along with your brothers has been vowed.

original: sa tathā bhavitā pāpa nātra kāryā vicāraṇā
analyzed: sa tathā bhavitā pāpa na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: O wicked one, it will happen just as you say. There is no doubt about it.

analyzed: velām atikramet sadyas sāgaraḥ varuṇālayaḥ
translated: The ocean, the abode of Varuṇa, will immediately overstep its shore.

original: parvatāś ca viśīryeyur mayoktaṃ na mṛṣā bhavet
analyzed: parvatāḥ ca viśīryeyuḥ mayā uktam na mṛṣā bhavet
translated: And the mountains will be shattered. What I say cannot be false.

original: sahāyas te yadi yamaḥ kubero rudra eva vā
analyzed: sahāyaḥ te yadi yamaḥ kuberaḥ rudraḥ eva vā
translated: If Yama, Kubera or Rudra himself were to be your ally,

analyzed: yathāpratijñam durbuddhe prakariṣyanti pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: O evil-minded one, the Pāṇḍavas will do as they have vowed.

analyzed: duḥśāsanasya rudhiram pātā ca asmi yathā īpsitam
translated: And I will drink the blood of Duḥśāsana as much as I desire.

analyzed: yaḥ ca iha pratisaṃrabdhaḥ kṣatriyaḥ mā abhiyāsyati
translated: And whoever, enraged, should approach me here as a Kṣatriya,

original: api bhīṣmaṃ puraskṛtya taṃ neṣyāmi yamakṣayam
analyzed: api bhīṣmam puraskṛtya tam neṣyāmi yama kṣayam
translated: even if he places Bhīṣma at the forefront, I will lead him to Yama's abode.

original: yac caitad uktaṃ vacanaṃ mayā kṣatrasya saṃsadi
analyzed: yat ca etat uktam vacanam mayā kṣatrasya saṃsadi
translated: And as for the words I spoke in the assembly of the Kṣatriyas here,

analyzed: yathā etat bhavitā satyam tathā eva ātmānam ālabhe
translated: just as it will come to pass, I swear by my own self.

analyzed: bhīmasena vacaḥ śrutvā sahadevaḥ pi amarṣaṇaḥ
translated: Having heard the words of Bhīmasena, Sahadeva, the intolerant one,

original: krodhasaṃraktanayanas tato vākyam uvāca ha🔽śauṭīraśūrasadṛśam anīkajanasaṃsadi
analyzed: krodha saṃrakta nayanaḥ tatas vākyam uvāca ha  śauṭīra śūra sadṛśam anīka jana saṃsadi
translated: then spoke these words, his eyes red with anger:

original: śṛṇu pāpa vaco mahyaṃ yad vācyo hi pitā tvayā
analyzed: śṛṇu pāpa vacaḥ mahyam yat vācyaḥ hi pitā tvayā
translated: Listen to my words, O wicked one, which should be spoken to your father in the assembly of the troops, which is full of heroes and brave ones.

original: nāsmākaṃ bhavitā bhedaḥ kadā cit kurubhiḥ saha
analyzed: na asmākam bhavitā bhedaḥ kadā cit kurubhiḥ saha
translated: There will never be a split between us and the Kurus.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭrasya saṃbandho yadi na syāt tvayā saha
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭrasya saṃbandhaḥ yadi na syāt tvayā saha
translated: If you had not been born in Dhritarashtra's lineage,

original: tvaṃ tu lokavināśāya dhṛtarāṣṭrakulasya ca🔽utpanno vairapuruṣaḥ svakulaghnaś ca pāpakṛt
analyzed: tvam tu loka vināśāya dhṛtarāṣṭra kulasya ca  utpannaḥ vaira puruṣaḥ sva kula ghnaḥ ca pāpa kṛt
translated: you would have been born for the destruction of the world and the lineage of Dhritarashtra.🔽You are the embodiment of enmity, a sinner who destroys your own lineage.

analyzed: janma prabhṛti ca asmākam pitā te pāpa pūruṣaḥ
translated: From the time of your birth, your father has been a sinful man.

analyzed: ahitāni nṛśaṃsāni nityaśas kartum icchati
translated: He always desires to do evil and cruel deeds to us.

analyzed: tasya vaira anuṣaṅgasya gantāsmi antam su durgamam
translated: I will reach the end of that enmity, which is so difficult to attain.

original: aham ādau nihatya tvāṃ śakuneḥ saṃprapaśyataḥ
analyzed: aham ādau nihatya tvām śakuneḥ saṃprapaśyataḥ
translated: First, I will kill you in front of Shakuni,

analyzed: tatas smi śakunim hantā miṣatām sarva dhanvinām
translated: and then I will kill Shakuni, while all the archers look on.

analyzed: bhīmasya vacanam śrutvā sahadevasya ca ubhayoḥ
translated: Having heard the words of both Bhima and Sahadeva,

original: uvāca phālguno vākyaṃ bhīmasenaṃ smayann iva
analyzed: uvāca phālgunaḥ vākyam bhīmasenam smayan iva
translated: Phalguna spoke these words to Bhimasena, as if smiling,

original: bhīmasena na te santi yeṣāṃ vairaṃ tvayā saha
analyzed: bhīmasena na te santi yeṣām vairam tvayā saha
translated: Bhimasena, those who have enmity with you do not exist.

analyzed: mandāḥ gṛheṣu sukhinaḥ mṛtyu pāśa vaśam gatāḥ
translated: The weak ones are happy in their homes, under the control of the noose of death.

original: ulūkaś ca na te vācyaḥ paruṣaṃ puruṣottama
analyzed: ulūkaḥ ca na te vācyaḥ paruṣam puruṣa uttama
translated: O best of men, you should not speak harshly to Uluka.

analyzed: dūtāḥ kim aparādhyante yathā uktasya anubhāṣiṇaḥ
translated: What fault do messengers commit, who speak as they are told?

analyzed: evam uktvā mahā bāhum bhīmam bhīma parākramam
translated: Having said this to the mighty-armed Bhima, of terrible prowess,

analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumna mukhān vīrān suhṛdaḥ samabhāṣata
translated: And spoke to his heroic friends, headed by Dhrishtadyumna:

original: śrutaṃ vas tasya pāpasya dhārtarāṣṭrasya bhāṣitam
analyzed: śrutam vaḥ tasya pāpasya dhārtarāṣṭrasya bhāṣitam
translated: You have heard the evil words of that sinner, Dhritarashtra's son,

analyzed: kutsanā vāsudevasya mama ca eva viśeṣataḥ
translated: The insults to Vasudeva and especially to me.

analyzed: śrutvā bhavantaḥ saṃrabdhāḥ asmākam hita kāmyayā
translated: Having heard them, you have become angry, desiring our welfare,

analyzed: prabhāvāt vāsudevasya bhavatām ca prayatnataḥ
translated: By the power of Vasudeva and by your own efforts,

original: samagraṃ pārthivaṃ kṣatraṃ sarvaṃ na gaṇayāmy aham
analyzed: samagram pārthivam kṣatram sarvam na gaṇayāmi aham
translated: I do not consider the entire Kshatriya race of kings at all.

original: bhavadbhiḥ samanujñāto vākyam asya yad uttaram
analyzed: bhavadbhiḥ samanujñātaḥ vākyam asya yat uttaram
translated: Permitted by you, I will convey his reply in words

analyzed: ulūke prāpayiṣyāmi yat vakṣyāmi suyodhanam
translated: To Uluka, which I will tell to Suyodhana.

analyzed: śvobhūte katthitasya asya prativākyam camū mukhe
translated: Tomorrow, in the presence of this braggart,

analyzed: gāṇḍīvena abhidhāsyāmi klībāḥ hi vacana uttarāḥ
translated: I will give my reply with the Gandiva, for cowards can only speak in reply.

original: tatas te pārthivāḥ sarve praśaśaṃsur dhanaṃjayam
analyzed: tatas te pārthivāḥ sarve praśaśaṃsuḥ dhanaṃjayam
translated: Then all those kings praised Dhananjaya,

analyzed: tena vākya upacāreṇa vismitāḥ rāja sattamāḥ
translated: And those best of kings were amazed at those words.

original: anunīya ca tān sarvān yathāmānyaṃ yathāvayaḥ
analyzed: anunīya ca tān sarvān yathāmānyam yathāvayas
translated: And having appeased them all according to their honor and age,

original: dharmarājas tadā vākyaṃ tat prāpyaṃ pratyabhāṣata
analyzed: dharmarājaḥ tadā vākyam tat prāpyam pratyabhāṣata
translated: Then Dharmaraja, having received that reply, spoke these words:

original: ātmānam avamanvāno na hi syāt pārthivottamaḥ
analyzed: ātmānam avamanvānaḥ na hi syāt pārthiva uttamaḥ
translated: A king should not despise himself, for he is the best of kings.

original: tatrottaraṃ pravakṣyāmi tava śuśrūṣaṇe rataḥ🔽ulūkaṃ bharataśreṣṭha sāmapūrvam athorjitam
analyzed: tatra uttaram pravakṣyāmi tava śuśrūṣaṇe rataḥ  ulūkam bharata śreṣṭha sāma pūrvam atha ūrjitam
translated: I will now tell you the reply, being engaged in serving you.🔽O best of the Bharatas, I will speak to the owl with conciliation and force.

original: duryodhanasya tad vākyaṃ niśamya bharatarṣabha🔽atilohitanetrābhyām āśīviṣa iva śvasan
analyzed: duryodhanasya tat vākyam niśamya bharata ṛṣabha  ati lohita netrābhyām āśīviṣaḥ iva śvasan
translated: O bull among the Bharata lineage, having heard those words of Duryodhana,🔽with eyes extremely red, sighing like a venomous serpent,

analyzed: smayamānaḥ iva krodhāt parisaṃlihan
translated: as if smiling in anger, licking the corners of his mouth,

analyzed: janārdanam abhiprekṣya bhrātṝn ca eva idam abravīt
translated: looking at Janardana and his brothers, he spoke these words:

analyzed: abhyabhāṣata kaitavyam pragṛhya vipulam bhujam
translated: He spoke to the gambler's son, grasping his mighty arm,

original: ulūka gaccha kaitavya brūhi tāta suyodhanam
analyzed: ulūka gaccha kaitavya brūhi tāta suyodhanam
translated: Go, O son of a gambler, and tell Suyodhana,

analyzed: kṛtaghnam vaira puruṣam durmatim kula pāṃsanam
translated: O ungrateful one, O embodiment of enmity, O evil-minded one, O disgrace to your family,

original: pāṇḍaveṣu sadā pāpa nityaṃ jihmaṃ pravartase
analyzed: pāṇḍaveṣu sadā pāpa nityam jihmam pravartase
translated: O sinful one, you always act deceitfully towards the Pandavas.

original: svavīryād yaḥ parākramya pāpa āhvayate parān
analyzed: sva vīryāt yaḥ parākramya pāpaḥ āhvayate parān
translated: That sinful one, having surpassed his own valor, challenges others,

original: abhītaḥ pūrayan vākyam eṣa vai kṣatriyaḥ pumān
analyzed: abhītaḥ pūrayan vākyam eṣa vai kṣatriyaḥ pumān
translated: fearlessly fulfilling his words, he is indeed a Kshatriya man.

original: sa pāpa kṣatriyo bhūtvā asmān āhūya saṃyuge
analyzed: sa pāpa kṣatriyaḥ bhūtvā asmān āhūya saṃyuge
translated: Having become a sinful Kshatriya, he challenges us to battle,

original: mānyāmānyān puraskṛtya yuddhaṃ mā gāḥ kulādhama
analyzed: mā anya amānyān puraskṛtya yuddham mā gāḥ kula adhama
translated: placing those who should be honored at the forefront. O lowest of your family, do not go to war.

analyzed: ātma vīryam samāśritya bhṛtya vīryam ca kaurava
translated: Relying on your own valor and the valor of your servants, O Kaurava,

original: āhvayasva raṇe pārthān sarvathā kṣatriyo bhava
analyzed: āhvayasva raṇe pārthān sarvathā kṣatriyaḥ bhava
translated: Challenge the Parthas to battle and be a true kshatriya in every way.

analyzed: para vīryam samāśritya yaḥ samāhvayate parān
translated: He who challenges others relying on the prowess of others,

original: aśaktaḥ svayam ādātum etad eva napuṃsakam
analyzed: aśaktaḥ svayam ādātum etat eva napuṃsakam
translated: being himself incapable of seizing (them), is indeed a eunuch.

original: yas tvaṃ pareṣāṃ vīryeṇa ātmānaṃ bahu manyase
analyzed: yaḥ tvam pareṣām vīryeṇa ātmānam bahu manyase
translated: Since you esteem yourself highly on account of the prowess of others,

original: katham evam aśaktas tvam asmān samabhigarjasi
analyzed: katham evam aśaktaḥ tvam asmān samabhigarjasi
translated: how is it that you roar at us, being yourself incapable (of doing anything)?

original: madvacaś cāpi bhūyas te vaktavyaḥ sa suyodhanaḥ
analyzed: mad vacaḥ ca api bhūyas te vaktavyaḥ sa suyodhanaḥ
translated: And again, this should be said by you to that Suyodhana:

original: śva idānīṃ pradṛśyethāḥ puruṣo bhava durmate🔽manyase yac ca mūḍha tvaṃ na yotsyati janārdanaḥ
analyzed: śvas idānīm pradṛśyethāḥ puruṣaḥ bhava durmate  manyase yat ca mūḍha tvam na yotsyati janārdanaḥ
translated: Now, when you are seen as a dog, become a man, O you of wicked understanding.🔽And since you think, O fool, that Janardana will not fight,

original: sārathyena vṛtaḥ pārthair iti tvaṃ na bibheṣi ca
analyzed: sārathyena vṛtaḥ pārthaiḥ iti tvam na bibheṣi ca
translated: and since you are not afraid, thinking that he has been chosen as the charioteer by the Parthas,

original: jaghanyakālam apy etad bhaved yat sarvapārthivān🔽nirdaheyam ahaṃ krodhāt tṛṇānīva hutāśanaḥ
analyzed: jaghanya kālam api etat bhavet yat sarva pārthivān  nirdaheyam aham krodhāt tṛṇāni iva hutāśanaḥ
translated: this (thought of yours) will come at the proper time, that I shall consume all the kings🔽in anger like a fire consuming grass.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhira niyogāt tu phalgunasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: But at the command of Yudhishthira, I shall be the charioteer of the great-souled Phalguna,

analyzed: kariṣye yudhyamānasya sārathyam vidita ātmanaḥ
translated: of the self-controlled Arjuna, while he is fighting.

original: yady utpatasi lokāṃs trīn yady āviśasi bhūtalam
analyzed: yadi utpatasi lokān trīn yadi āviśasi bhū talam
translated: If you fly up to the three worlds, if you enter the earth,

analyzed: tatra tatra arjuna ratham prabhāte drakṣyase gratas
translated: there, there, in the morning, you will see the chariot of Arjuna in front of you.

analyzed: yat ca api bhīmasenasya manyase mogha garjitam
translated: And as for what you think is a futile roar of Bhimasena,

analyzed: duḥśāsanasya rudhiram pītam iti avadhāryatām
translated: know that the blood of Duhshasana has been drunk.

original: na tvāṃ samīkṣate pārtho nāpi rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: na tvām samīkṣate pārthaḥ na api rājā yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Partha does not look at you, nor does King Yudhishthira,

analyzed: na bhīmasenaḥ na yamau pratikūla prabhāṣiṇam
translated: nor Bhimasena, nor the twins, at one who speaks unfavorably.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

analyzed: duryodhanasya tat vākyam niśamya bharata ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: Having heard those words of Duryodhana, the bull among the Bharata lineage,

original: netrābhyām atitāmrābhyāṃ kaitavyaṃ samudaikṣata🔽sa keśavam abhiprekṣya guḍākeśo mahāyaśāḥ
analyzed: netrābhyām ati tāmrābhyām kaitavyam samudaikṣata  sa keśavam abhiprekṣya guḍākeśaḥ mahā yaśāḥ
translated: with eyes extremely red, looked at the son of a gambler.🔽The greatly illustrious Gudakesha, having looked at Keshava,

analyzed: abhyabhāṣata kaitavyam pragṛhya vipulam bhujam
translated: seized his mighty arm and spoke to the son of a gambler:

original: svavīryaṃ yaḥ samāśritya samāhvayati vai parān
analyzed: sva vīryam yaḥ samāśritya samāhvayati vai parān
translated: He who, relying on his own prowess, challenges others,

original: abhītaḥ pūrayañ śaktiṃ sa vai puruṣa ucyate
analyzed: abhītaḥ pūrayam śaktim sa vai puruṣaḥ ucyate

analyzed: kṣatrabandhuḥ a śakta tvāt loke sa puruṣa adhamaḥ

translated: You are full of pride and do not see

analyzed: sūrya udaye yukta senaḥ pratīkṣya

analyzed: śvobhūte katthanā vākyam vijñāsyati suyodhanaḥ

translated: To your brother Duhshasana, who has little foresight:
O you who know no dharma, ever hostile, of sinful mind, a cruel wretch,

analyzed: satyām pratijñām nacirāt rakṣyase tām suyodhana  abhimānasya darpasya krodha pāruṣyayoḥ tathā
translated: You will soon see your promise fulfilled, O Suyodhana.🔽Of pride, arrogance, anger, harshness,

analyzed: naiṣṭhuryasya avalepasya ātma saṃbhāvanasya ca
translated: Of cruelty, insolence, self-conceit,

analyzed: nṛśaṃsa tāyāḥ taikṣṇyasya dharma vidveṣaṇasya ca
translated: Of cruelty, sharpness, and hatred of dharma,

analyzed: adharmasya ativādasya vṛddha atikramaṇasya ca
translated: Of unrighteousness, of excessive speech, of transgressing elders,

analyzed: darśanasya ca vakrasya kṛtsnasya apanayasya ca
translated: Of crooked vision, of complete destruction,

original: drakṣyasi tvaṃ phalaṃ tīvram acireṇa suyodhana
analyzed: drakṣyasi tvam phalam tīvram acireṇa suyodhana
translated: You will soon see the terrible fruits, O Suyodhana,

analyzed: vāsudeva dvitīye hi mayi kruddhe narādhipa
translated: When I, with Vasudeva as my second, am enraged, O lord of men.

original: āśā te jīvite mūḍha rājye vā kena hetunā
analyzed: āśā te jīvite mūḍha rājye vā kena hetunā
translated: What reason do you have, O deluded one, for hope of life or kingdom?

original: śānte bhīṣme tathā droṇe sūtaputre ca pātite
analyzed: śānte bhīṣme tathā droṇe sūtaputre ca pātite
translated: When Bhishma is pacified, and Drona and the son of a suta are brought down,

original: nirāśo jīvite rājye putreṣu ca bhaviṣyasi
analyzed: nirāśaḥ jīvite rājye putreṣu ca bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will be without hope for life, kingdom, and your sons.

analyzed: bhrātṝṇām nidhanam dṛṣṭvā putrāṇām ca suyodhana
translated: Having seen the death of your brothers and sons, O Suyodhana,

analyzed: bhīmasenena nihataḥ duṣkṛtāni smariṣyasi
translated: You will remember your evil deeds, slain by Bhimasena.

original: na dvitīyāṃ pratijñāṃ hi pratijñāsyati keśavaḥ
analyzed: na dvitīyām pratijñām hi pratijñāsyati keśavaḥ
translated: Keshava will not make a second promise,

analyzed: satyam bravīmi aham hi etat sarvam satyam bhaviṣyati
translated: I speak the truth, and all this will come to pass.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ pi kaitavyam ulūkam idam abravīt
translated: Yudhishthira also said this to the gambler's son Uluka:

original: ulūka madvaco brūhi gatvā tāta suyodhanam
analyzed: ulūka mad vacaḥ brūhi gatvā tāta suyodhanam
translated: O Uluka, tell my words to Suyodhana, my son, when you go there:

analyzed: svena vṛttena me vṛttam na adhigantum tvam arhasi
translated: You should not try to understand my conduct by your own conduct.

analyzed: ubhayoḥ antaram veda sūnṛtā anṛtayoḥ api
translated: He knows the difference between the two, between what is true and false.

original: na cāhaṃ kāmaye pāpam api kīṭapipīlayoḥ
analyzed: na ca aham kāmaye pāpam api kīṭa pipīlayoḥ
translated: I do not desire evil even for insects and ants,

original: kiṃ punar jñātiṣu vadhaṃ kāmayeyaṃ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: kim punar jñātiṣu vadham kāmayeyam katham cana

original: etadarthaṃ mayā tāta pañca grāmā vṛtāḥ purā
analyzed: etad artham mayā tāta pañca grāmāḥ vṛtāḥ purā
translated: It was for this purpose, O father, that I formerly accepted five villages.

original: kathaṃ tava sudurbuddhe na prekṣe vyasanaṃ mahat
analyzed: katham tava su durbuddhe na prekṣe vyasanam mahat
translated: How can I, O you of wicked understanding, not foresee your great calamity?

original: sa tvaṃ kāmaparītātmā mūḍhabhāvāc ca katthase
analyzed: sa tvam kāma parīta ātmā mūḍha bhāvāt ca katthase
translated: You, with your mind overwhelmed by passion, boast because of your foolish state,

original: tathaiva vāsudevasya na gṛhṇāsi hitaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: tathā eva vāsudevasya na gṛhṇāsi hitam vacaḥ

analyzed: kim ca idānīm bahu uktena yudhyasva saha bāndhavaiḥ
translated: What is the use of speaking much now? Fight with your relatives.

analyzed: mama vipriya kartāram kaitavya brūhi kauravam
translated: Speak to the son of a gambler, the Kaurava who does me harm:

analyzed: śrutam vākyam gṛhītaḥ rthaḥ matam yat te tathā astu tat

analyzed: bhīmasenaḥ tatas vākyam bhūyas āha nṛpa ātmajam
translated: Then Bhimasena again spoke these words to the prince:

analyzed: ulūka mad vacaḥ brūhi durmatim pāpa pūruṣam
translated: O Uluka, speak my words to the evil-minded, sinful man,

analyzed: śaṭham naikṛtikam pāpam durācāram suyodhanam
translated: the deceitful, treacherous, wicked, ill-behaved Suyodhana.

original: gṛdhrodare vā vastavyaṃ pure vā nāgasāhvaye
analyzed: gṛdhrodare vā vastavyam pure vā nāgasāhvaye
translated: Either he should live in the belly of a vulture, or in the city called after the elephant.

original: pratijñātaṃ mayā yac ca sabhāmadhye narādhama
analyzed: pratijñātam mayā yat ca sabhā madhye nara adhama
translated: O worst of men, what I have vowed in the assembly hall,

analyzed: kartā aham tat vacaḥ satyam satyena eva śapāmi te

analyzed: duḥśāsanasya rudhiram hatvā pāsyāmi aham mṛdhe
translated: I will drink the blood of Duhshāsana in battle.

original: sakthinī tava bhaṅktvaiva hatvā hi tava sodarān
analyzed: sakthinī tava bhaṅktvā eva hatvā hi tava sodarān
translated: Having broken your thighs and killed your brothers,

analyzed: sarveṣām dhārtarāṣṭrāṇām aham mṛtyuḥ suyodhana
translated: I am the death of all the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra, O Suyodhana.

analyzed: sarveṣām rāja putrāṇām abhimanyuḥ asaṃśayam

analyzed: karmaṇā toṣayiṣyāmi bhūyas ca eva vacaḥ śṛṇu

analyzed: hatvā suyodhana tvām vai sahitam sarva sodaraiḥ
translated: Having killed you, Suyodhana, along with all your brothers,

analyzed: ākramiṣye padā mūrdhni dharmarājasya paśyataḥ

original: nakulas tu tato vākyam idam āha mahīpate
analyzed: nakulaḥ tu tatas vākyam idam āha mahīpate
translated: Then Nakula spoke these words, O lord of the earth:

analyzed: ulūka brūhi kauravyam dhārtarāṣṭram suyodhanam

analyzed: tathā kartāsmi kauravya yathā tvam anuśāsi mām
translated: I will do as you instruct me, O Kaurava.

analyzed: sahadevaḥ pi nṛpate idam āha vacaḥ rthavat

analyzed: suyodhana matiḥ yā te vṛthā eṣā te bhaviṣyati

analyzed: śociṣyase mahā rāja sa putra jñāti bāndhavaḥ

analyzed: imam ca kleśam asmākam hṛṣṭaḥ yat tvam nikatthase

analyzed: virāṭa drupadau vṛddhau ulūkam idam ūcatuḥ
translated: The aged Virata and Drupada said this to Uluka:

analyzed: dāsa bhāvam niyaccha iva sādhoḥ iti matiḥ sadā

analyzed: tau ca dāsau a dāsau vā pauruṣam yasya yādṛśam

analyzed: śikhaṇḍī tu tatas vākyam ulūkam idam abravīt

analyzed: vaktavyaḥ bhavatā rājā pāpeṣu abhirataḥ sadā
translated: You should tell the king, who is always devoted to sinful acts,

analyzed: paśya tvam mām raṇe rājan kurvāṇam karma dāruṇam

analyzed: yasya vīryam samāsādya manyase vijayam yudhi
translated: On whose prowess you rely and think of victory in battle,

analyzed: tam aham pātayiṣyāmi rathāt tava pitāmaham
translated: I will bring down that grandfather of yours from his chariot.

translated: Therefore I will kill Bhishma, while all the archers look on.'

analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ pi kaitavyam ulūkam idam abravīt
translated: Dhrishtadyumna also spoke these words to the son of a gambler, Uluka:

analyzed: kartā ca aham tathā karma yathā na anyaḥ kariṣyati

analyzed: tava eva doṣāt durbuddhe sarvam etat tu anāvṛtam

analyzed: avaśyam ca mayā kāryam sarveṣām caritam mahat

analyzed: sa gaccha māciram tāta ulūka yadi manyase

analyzed: iha vā tiṣṭha bhadram te vayam hi tava bāndhavāḥ

analyzed: ulūkaḥ tu tatas rājan dharmaputram yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: Then, O king, the owl, having taken leave of Yudhishthira, the son of Dharma,

analyzed: āmantrya prayayau tatra yatra rājā suyodhanaḥ
translated: went to where king Suyodhana was.

translated: The owl then came and told the wrathful Duryodhana

analyzed: vāsudevasya bhīmasya dharmarājasya pauruṣam

translated: and the words of Sahadeva, Dhrishtadyumna, and Shikhandi,

analyzed: iti uktaḥ kaitavaḥ rājan tat vākyam upadhārya ca
translated: Having been thus addressed, the deceitful one, O king, having understood those words,

translated: was dismissed and returned again as he had come.

analyzed: upāvṛtya tu pāṇḍubhyaḥ kaitavyaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭra jam
translated: Having returned to the Pandavas, the deceitful one told Dhritarashtra's son

analyzed: gatvā yathoktam tat sarvam uvāca kuru saṃsadi
translated: Having gone there, he told everything as it was said in the assembly of the Kurus.

analyzed: keśava arjunayoḥ vākyam niśamya bharata ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: Hearing the words of Keshava and Arjuna, the best of the Bharata race,

analyzed: yathoktam sarvam abravīt
translated: he told everything as it was said.

analyzed: kaitavyasya tu tat vākyam
translated: But the words of the gambler,

analyzed: duḥśāsanam ca karṇam ca śakunim ca abhyabhāṣata
translated: he spoke to Duhshasana, Karna and Shakuni,

analyzed: ājñāpayata rājñaḥ ca balam mitra balam tathā
translated: Instruct the king's army and the army of allies,

original: yathā prāg udayāt sarvā yuktā tiṣṭhaty anīkinī
analyzed: yathā prāk udayāt sarvā yuktā tiṣṭhati anīkinī
translated: so that the entire army may be ready before sunrise.

analyzed: tatas karṇa samādiṣṭāḥ dūtāḥ pratvaritāḥ rathaiḥ
translated: Then messengers commanded by Karna, urged on by chariots,

original: uṣṭravāmībhir apy anye sadaśvaiś ca mahājavaiḥ
analyzed: uṣṭra vāmībhiḥ api anye sat aśvaiḥ ca mahā javaiḥ
translated: and others by camels, mules and very swift excellent horses,

original: tūrṇaṃ pariyayuḥ senāṃ kṛtsnāṃ karṇasya śāsanāt
