original: sarvasya jagataś caiva gāṅgeya na mṛṣā vade
analyzed: sarvasya jagataḥ ca eva gāṅgeya na mṛṣā vade
translated: O son of Ganga, I do not speak falsely to the entire world.

original: kurūṇām ahito nityaṃ na ca rājāvabudhyate
analyzed: kurūṇām ahitaḥ nityam na ca rājā avabudhyate
translated: He is always inimical to the Kurus, but the king does not understand.

analyzed: kaḥ hi nāma samāneṣu rājasu udātta karmasu
translated: For who, among those of equal rank, with their royal and lofty deeds,

analyzed: tejaḥ vadham imam kuryāt vibhedayiṣuḥ āhave
translated: would commit this destruction of splendor, seeking to divide us in battle?

original: yathā tvaṃ guṇanirdeśād aparādhaṃ cikīrṣasi🔽na hāyanair na palitair na vittair na ca bandhubhiḥ
analyzed: yathā tvam guṇa nirdeśāt aparādham cikīrṣasi  na hāyanaiḥ na palitaiḥ na vittaiḥ na ca bandhubhiḥ
translated: As you wish to punish him for his qualities,

original: mahārathatvaṃ saṃkhyātuṃ śakyaṃ kṣatrasya kaurava🔽balajyeṣṭhaṃ smṛtaṃ kṣatraṃ mantrajyeṣṭhā dvijātayaḥ
analyzed: mahā ratha tvam saṃkhyātum śakyam kṣatrasya kaurava  bala jyeṣṭham smṛtam kṣatram mantra jyeṣṭhāḥ dvijātayaḥ
translated: One cannot determine the status of a great warrior by age, gray hair, wealth, or relatives, O Kaurava, among the Kshatriyas.🔽The Kshatriyas are known to be superior in strength, the Brahmins in the power of mantras,

original: dhanajyeṣṭhāḥ smṛtā vaiśyāḥ śūdrās tu vayasādhikāḥ
analyzed: dhana jyeṣṭhāḥ smṛtāḥ vaiśyāḥ śūdrāḥ tu vayasā adhikāḥ
translated: the Vaishyas in wealth, and the Shudras in longevity.

analyzed: yathecchakam svayaṃgrāhāt rathān atirathān tathā
translated: As they wish, they can seize chariots and Atiratha warriors,

analyzed: kāma dveṣa samāyuktaḥ mohāt prakurute bhavān
translated: You are acting out of desire and hatred, out of delusion.

analyzed: duryodhana mahā bāho sādhu samyak avekṣyatām
translated: O mighty-armed Duryodhana, consider this well.

analyzed: tyajyatām duṣṭa bhāvaḥ yam bhīṣmaḥ kilbiṣa kṛt tava
translated: Abandon this evil intention of yours, this sinful act of Bhishma.

original: bhinnā hi senā nṛpate duḥsaṃdheyā bhavaty uta
analyzed: bhinnā hi senā nṛpate duḥsaṃdheyā bhavati uta
translated: For, O king, a broken army is difficult to unite again,

original: maulāpi puruṣavyāghra kim u nānā samutthitā
analyzed: maulā api puruṣa vyāghra kim u nānā samutthitā
translated: even if it consists of the best men, let alone when it is composed of various elements.

original: eṣāṃ dvaidhaṃ samutpannaṃ yodhānāṃ yudhi bhārata
analyzed: eṣām dvaidham samutpannam yodhānām yudhi bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, dissension has arisen among these warriors in battle,

analyzed: tejaḥ vadhaḥ naḥ kriyate pratyakṣeṇa viśeṣataḥ
translated: and our splendor is being destroyed, especially in your presence.

original: rathānāṃ kva ca vijñānaṃ kva ca bhīṣmo 'lpacetanaḥ
analyzed: rathānām kva ca vijñānam kva ca bhīṣmaḥ lpa cetanaḥ
translated: Where is the knowledge of chariots and where is Bhishma of little intelligence?

analyzed: aham āvārayiṣyāmi pāṇḍavānām anīkinīm
translated: I will hold back the army of the Pandavas.

original: āsādya mām amogheṣuṃ gamiṣyanti diśo daśa
analyzed: āsādya mām amogha iṣum gamiṣyanti diśaḥ daśa
translated: Having encountered me, whose arrows never fail, they will go to the ten directions.

analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ saha pañcālāḥ śārdūlam vṛṣabhāḥ iva
translated: The Pandavas with the Panchalas will be like bulls before a tiger.

original: kva ca yuddhavimardo vā mantrāḥ suvyāhṛtāni vā
analyzed: kva ca yuddha vimardaḥ vā mantrāḥ su vyāhṛtāni vā
translated: Where is the turmoil of battle, or well-spoken counsel,

original: kva ca bhīṣmo gatavayā mandātmā kālamohitaḥ
analyzed: kva ca bhīṣmaḥ gata vayāḥ manda ātmā kāla mohitaḥ
translated: and where is Bhishma, old and slow-witted, deluded by time?

original: spardhate hi sadā nityaṃ sarveṇa jagatā saha
analyzed: spardhate hi sadā nityam sarveṇa jagatā saha
translated: He always competes with the entire world.

original: na cānyaṃ puruṣaṃ kaṃ cin manyate moghadarśanaḥ
analyzed: na ca anyam puruṣam kam cit manyate mogha darśanaḥ
translated: He, of false vision, does not consider any other man.

analyzed: śrotavyam khalu vṛddhānām iti śāstra nidarśanam
translated: It is the teaching of the scriptures that the words of the elders must be heard,

original: na tv evāpy ativṛddhānāṃ punar bālā hi te matāḥ
analyzed: na tu eva api ati vṛddhānām punar bālāḥ hi te matāḥ
translated: but not even the words of the extremely aged, for they are considered foolish again.

original: aham eko haniṣyāmi pāṇḍavān nātra saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: aham ekaḥ haniṣyāmi pāṇḍavān na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: I alone will kill the Pandavas, there is no doubt about this.

analyzed: su yuddhe rāja śārdūla yaśaḥ bhīṣmam gamiṣyati
translated: O tiger among kings, if I fight fairly, the fame will go to Bhishma.

original: kṛtaḥ senāpatis tv eṣa tvayā bhīṣmo narādhipa
analyzed: kṛtaḥ senāpatiḥ tu eṣa tvayā bhīṣmaḥ narādhipa
translated: O lord of men, you have made Bhishma the general.

original: senāpatiṃ guṇo gantā na tu yodhān kathaṃ cana
analyzed: senāpatim guṇaḥ gantā na tu yodhān katham cana
translated: The qualities go to the general, never to the soldiers in any way.

original: nāhaṃ jīvati gāṅgeye yotsye rājan kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na aham jīvati gāṅgeye yotsye rājan katham cana
translated: O king, as long as Gangeya lives, I will never fight at all.

original: hate tu bhīṣme yodhāsmi sarvair eva mahārathaiḥ
analyzed: hate tu bhīṣme yodhāsmi sarvaiḥ eva mahā rathaiḥ
translated: But when Bhishma is killed, I will fight with all the great warriors.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

analyzed: samudyataḥ yam bhāraḥ me su mahān sāgara upamaḥ
translated: This great burden, like the ocean, has been taken up by me,

analyzed: dhārtarāṣṭrasya saṃgrāme varṣa pūga abhicintitaḥ
translated: thought of for many years in the battle for the son of Dhritarashtra.

original: tasminn abhyāgate kāle pratapte lomaharṣaṇe🔽mithobhedo na me kāryas tena jīvasi sūtaja
analyzed: tasmin abhyāgate kāle pratapte loma harṣaṇe  mithas bhedaḥ na me kāryaḥ tena jīvasi sūtaja
translated: When that time has come, burning with hair standing on end,🔽I should not have internal dissension, therefore you live, son of Suta.

original: na hy ahaṃ nādya vikramya sthaviro 'pi śiśos tava
analyzed: na hi aham na adya vikramya sthaviraḥ śiśoḥ tava
translated: For I, though old, will not today, having displayed my prowess,

original: yuddhaśraddhāṃ raṇe chindyāṃ jīvitasya ca sūtaja
analyzed: yuddha śraddhām raṇe chindyām jīvitasya ca sūtaja
translated: cut off your desire for battle and your life, son of Suta, in the war.

analyzed: jāmadagnyena rāmeṇa mahā astrāṇi pramuñcatā
translated: When Rama, the son of Jamadagni, was releasing great weapons,

original: na me vyathābhavat kā cit tvaṃ tu me kiṃ kariṣyasi
analyzed: na me vyathā bhavat kā cit tvam tu me kim kariṣyasi
translated: I did not have any pain, what will you do to me?

analyzed: kāmam na etat praśaṃsanti tma bala saṃstavam
translated: The virtuous do not praise this boasting of one's own strength,

original: vakṣyāmi tu tvāṃ saṃtapto nihīna kulapāṃsana
analyzed: vakṣyāmi tu tvām saṃtaptaḥ nihīna kula pāṃsana
translated: but I, being tormented, will speak to you, O you who have defiled a low family.

analyzed: sametam pārthivam kṣatram kāśi rājñaḥ svayaṃvare
translated: The assembled Kshatriya kings at the svayamvara of the king of Kashi,

analyzed: nirjitya eka rathena eva yat kanyāḥ tarasā hṛtāḥ
translated: having conquered them all with a single chariot, you forcibly took away the maidens.

analyzed: īdṛśānām sahasrāṇi viśiṣṭānām atho punar
translated: Thousands of such and even more distinguished ones,

analyzed: mayā ekena nirastāni sa sainyāni raṇa ajire
translated: have been repulsed by me alone, along with their armies, on the battlefield.

original: tvāṃ prāpya vairapuruṣaṃ kurūṇām anayo mahān
analyzed: tvām prāpya vaira puruṣam kurūṇām anayaḥ mahān
translated: Having obtained you as an enemy, a great misfortune has befallen the Kurus,

analyzed: upasthitaḥ vināśāya yatasva puruṣaḥ bhava
translated: leading to their destruction. Strive to be a man.

original: yudhyasva pārthaṃ samare yena vispardhase saha
analyzed: yudhyasva pārtham samare yena vispardhase saha
translated: Fight with Partha in battle, with whom you are competing.

original: drakṣyāmi tvāṃ vinirmuktam asmād yuddhāt sudurmate
analyzed: drakṣyāmi tvām vinirmuktam asmāt yuddhāt su durmate
translated: I will see you freed from this battle, O you of evil mind.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: tam uvāca tato rājā dhārtarāṣṭro mahāmanāḥ
analyzed: tam uvāca tatas rājā dhārtarāṣṭraḥ mahā manāḥ
translated: Then the great-minded king Dhritarashtra's son said to him:

original: mām avekṣasva gāṅgeya kāryaṃ hi mahad udyatam
analyzed: mām avekṣasva gāṅgeya kāryam hi mahat udyatam
translated: Consider me, O son of Ganga, for a great task is undertaken.

original: cintyatām idam evāgre mama niḥśreyasaṃ param
analyzed: cintyatām idam eva agre mama niḥśreyasam param
translated: Let this alone be thought of first, my supreme good.

original: ubhāv api bhavantau me mahat karma kariṣyataḥ
analyzed: ubhau api bhavantau me mahat karma kariṣyataḥ
translated: Both of you will perform a great deed for me.

original: bhūyaś ca śrotum icchāmi pareṣāṃ rathasattamān
analyzed: bhūyas ca śrotum icchāmi pareṣām ratha sattamān
translated: And I wish to hear again about the best charioteers of the enemy,

analyzed: ye ca eva atirathāḥ tatra tathā eva ratha yūthapāḥ
translated: and also about the atiratha and rathas there.

analyzed: balābalam amitrāṇām śrotum icchāmi kaurava
translated: O Kourava, I wish to hear about the strength and weakness of the enemy.

original: prabhātāyāṃ rajanyāṃ vai idaṃ yuddhaṃ bhaviṣyati
analyzed: prabhātāyām rajanyām vai idam yuddham bhaviṣyati
translated: This battle will take place at dawn.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: ete rathās te saṃkhyātās tathaivātirathā nṛpa
analyzed: ete rathāḥ te saṃkhyātāḥ tathā eva atirathāḥ nṛpa
translated: These charioteers have been counted, and also the atiratha, O king.

original: ya cāpy ardharathā rājan pāṇḍavānām ataḥ śṛṇu
analyzed: yaḥ ca api ardharathāḥ rājan pāṇḍavānām atas śṛṇu
translated: And now listen to the half-chariots of the Pandavas, O king.

original: yadi kautūhalaṃ te 'dya pāṇḍavānāṃ bale nṛpa
analyzed: yadi kautūhalam te pāṇḍavānām bale nṛpa
translated: If you have any curiosity today about the strength of the Pandavas, O king,

analyzed: ratha saṃkhyām mahā bāho saha ebhiḥ vasudhādhipaiḥ
translated: count the chariots, O mighty-armed one, along with these lords of the earth.

analyzed: svayam rājā ratha udāraḥ pāṇḍavaḥ kunti nandanaḥ
translated: The king himself, the son of Pandu, the delighter of Kunti, is a great chariot-warrior.

original: agnivat samare tāta cariṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: agni vat samare tāta cariṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: He will move about in battle like fire, there is no doubt.

analyzed: bhīmasenaḥ tu rāja indra rathaḥ ṣṭaguṇa saṃmitaḥ
translated: But Bhimasena, O lord of kings, is a chariot-warrior of eight times the strength.

original: na tasyāsti samo yuddhe gadayā sāyakair api
analyzed: na tasya asti samaḥ yuddhe gadayā sāyakaiḥ api
translated: There is none equal to him in battle with the mace or the arrow.

original: nāgāyutabalo mānī tejasā na sa mānuṣaḥ
analyzed: nāga ayuta balaḥ mānī tejasā na sa mānuṣaḥ
translated: He is proud, with the strength of ten thousand elephants, and his energy is not human.

original: mādrīputrau tu rathinau dvāv eva puruṣarṣabhau
analyzed: mādrī putrau tu rathinau dvau eva puruṣa ṛṣabhau
translated: But the two sons of Madri are chariot-warriors, and they alone are bulls among men.

original: aśvināv iva rūpeṇa tejasā ca samanvitau
analyzed: aśvinau iva rūpeṇa tejasā ca samanvitau
translated: Endowed with beauty and energy like the Ashvins,

analyzed: ete camū mukha gatāḥ smarantaḥ kleśam ātmanaḥ
translated: standing at the head of the army, remembering their own sufferings,

original: rudravat pracariṣyanti tatra me nāsti saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: rudra vat pracariṣyanti tatra me na asti saṃśayaḥ
translated: they will move about like Rudra, there is no doubt about it.

analyzed: sarve eva mahātmānaḥ śāla skandhāḥ iva udgatāḥ
translated: All of them are great souls, risen up like the trunks of shala trees,

original: prādeśenādhikāḥ pumbhir anyais te ca pramāṇataḥ
analyzed: prādeśena adhikāḥ pumbhiḥ anyaiḥ te ca pramāṇataḥ
translated: exceeding other men in size by a span.

analyzed: siṃha saṃhananāḥ sarve pāṇḍu putrāḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: All the sons of Pandu are of the strength of lions, and are greatly powerful.

analyzed: carita brahmacaryāḥ ca sarve ca ati tapasvinaḥ
translated: All of them have observed celibacy and are great ascetics.

analyzed: hrīmantaḥ puruṣa vyāghrāḥ vyāghrāḥ iva bala utkaṭāḥ
translated: Those tigers among men are modest, like tigers intoxicated with strength.

analyzed: jave prahāre saṃmarde sarve eva ati mānuṣāḥ
translated: In speed, striking, and battle, all of them are superhuman.

original: sarve jitamahīpālā digjaye bharatarṣabha🔽na caiṣāṃ puruṣāḥ ke cid āyudhāni gadāḥ śarān
analyzed: sarve jita mahīpālāḥ digjaye bharata ṛṣabha  na ca eṣām puruṣāḥ ke cit āyudhāni gadāḥ śarān
translated: O bull among the Bharata lineage, all of them have conquered kings in the conquest of the directions.🔽O Kauravya, no men of theirs can ever bear their weapons, maces, and arrows,

original: viṣahanti sadā kartum adhijyāny api kaurava🔽udyantuṃ vā gadāṃ gurvīṃ śarān vāpi prakarṣitum
analyzed: viṣahanti sadā kartum adhijyāni api kaurava  udyantum vā gadām gurvīm śarān vā api prakarṣitum
translated: or even their quivers.🔽In raising a heavy mace or in drawing arrows,

analyzed: jave lakṣyasya haraṇe bhojye pāṃsu vikarṣaṇe
translated: in speed, in striking the target, in eating, and in dragging sand,

original: bālair api bhavantas taiḥ sarva eva viśeṣitāḥ🔽te te sainyaṃ samāsādya vyāghrā iva balotkaṭāḥ
analyzed: bālaiḥ api bhavantaḥ taiḥ sarve eva viśeṣitāḥ  te te sainyam samāsādya vyāghrāḥ iva bala utkaṭāḥ
translated: all of you have been surpassed by those boys.

original: vidhvaṃsayiṣyanti raṇe mā sma taiḥ saha saṃgamaḥ
analyzed: vidhvaṃsayiṣyanti raṇe mā sma taiḥ saha saṃgamaḥ
translated: Approaching the army, they will destroy it in battle like intoxicated tigers. Do not engage with them.

original: ekaikaśas te saṃgrāme hanyuḥ sarvān mahīkṣitaḥ
analyzed: ekaikaśas te saṃgrāme hanyuḥ sarvān mahīkṣitaḥ
translated: One by one, they can kill all the kings in battle,

analyzed: pratyakṣam tava rāja indra rājasūye yathā bhavat
translated: as was witnessed by you, O Indra among kings, at the Rajasuya sacrifice.

original: draupadyāś ca parikleśaṃ dyūte ca paruṣā giraḥ
analyzed: draupadyāḥ ca parikleśam dyūte ca paruṣāḥ giraḥ
translated: Remembering the hardships of Draupadi and the harsh words at the gambling match,

analyzed: te saṃsmarantaḥ saṃgrāme vicariṣyanti kāla vat
translated: they will roam in the battle like the Destroyer himself.
The red-eyed Gudakesha, aided by Narayana,

original: ubhayoḥ senayor vīra ratho nāstīha tādṛśaḥ
analyzed: ubhayoḥ senayoḥ vīra rathaḥ nā asti iha tādṛśaḥ
translated: O hero, there is no such chariot in both the armies.

original: na hi deveṣu vā pūrvaṃ dānaveṣūrageṣu vā
analyzed: na hi deveṣu vā pūrvam dānaveṣu urageṣu vā
translated: For in the gods, or in the demons, or in the serpents,

original: rākṣaseṣv atha yakṣeṣu nareṣu kuta eva tu
analyzed: rākṣaseṣu atha yakṣeṣu nareṣu kutas eva tu
translated: or in the Rakshasas, or in the Yakshas, or in men,

original: bhūto 'tha vā bhaviṣyo vā rathaḥ kaś cin mayā śrutaḥ
analyzed: vā bhaviṣyaḥ vā rathaḥ kaḥ cit mayā śrutaḥ
translated: I have never heard of any chariot, past or future,

analyzed: samāyuktaḥ mahā rāja yathā pārthasya dhīmataḥ
translated: that is equal to that of the wise Partha, O great king.

original: vāsudevaś ca saṃyantā yoddhā caiva dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ ca saṃyantā yoddhā ca eva dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: Vasudeva is the charioteer and Dhananjaya is the warrior.

original: gāṇḍīvaṃ ca dhanur divyaṃ te cāśvā vātaraṃhasaḥ
analyzed: gāṇḍīvam ca dhanuḥ divyam te ca aśvāḥ vāta raṃhasaḥ
translated: The Gandiva bow is divine and those horses are swift as the wind.

original: abhedyaṃ kavacaṃ divyam akṣayyau ca maheṣudhī
analyzed: abhedyam kavacam divyam akṣayyau ca mahā iṣudhī
translated: The armor is impenetrable and divine, and the two great quivers are inexhaustible.

original: astragrāmaś ca māhendro raudraḥ kaubera eva ca
analyzed: astra grāmaḥ ca māhendraḥ raudraḥ kauberaḥ eva ca
translated: The weapons are those of Indra, Rudra, Kubera,

original: yāmyaś ca vāruṇaś caiva gadāś cograpradarśanāḥ
analyzed: yāmyaḥ ca vāruṇaḥ ca eva gadāḥ ca ugra pradarśanāḥ
translated: Yama, Varuna, and the maces are terrible to behold.

analyzed: vajra ādīni ca mukhyāni nānā praharaṇāni vai
translated: The foremost weapons are the thunderbolt and others, and various other weapons.

analyzed: dānavānām sahasrāṇi hiraṇyapura vāsinām
translated: Thousands of demons living in Hiranyapura

original: hatāny ekarathenājau kas tasya sadṛśo rathaḥ
analyzed: hatāni eka rathena ājau kaḥ tasya sadṛśaḥ rathaḥ
translated: were killed by him on a single chariot. What chariot can be equal to his?

original: eṣa hanyād dhi saṃrambhī balavān satyavikramaḥ
analyzed: eṣa hanyāt hi saṃrambhī balavān satya vikramaḥ
translated: For this angry and powerful one, whose prowess is truth,

original: tava senāṃ mahābāhuḥ svāṃ caiva paripālayan
analyzed: tava senām mahā bāhuḥ svām ca eva paripālayan
translated: protecting your army and his own, the mighty-armed one🔽can destroy the entire world, not to speak of the Pandava army.

original: ahaṃ cainaṃ pratyudiyām ācāryo vā dhanaṃjayam
analyzed: aham ca enam pratyudiyām ācāryaḥ vā dhanaṃjayam
translated: I myself will advance against him, or the teacher against Dhananjaya.

original: na tṛtīyo 'sti rājendra senayor ubhayor api🔽ya enaṃ śaravarṣāṇi varṣantam udiyād rathī
analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ sti rāja indra senayoḥ ubhayoḥ api  yaḥ enam śara varṣāṇi varṣantam udiyāt rathī
translated: There is no third person, O lord of kings, in both the armies.🔽Which charioteer will advance against him who will shower arrows like a cloud at the end of summer,

analyzed: jīmūtaḥ iva gharma ante mahā vāta samīritaḥ
translated: driven by a great wind?

analyzed: samāyuktaḥ tu kaunteyaḥ vāsudeva sahāyavān
translated: But the son of Kunti, united with Vasudeva as his ally,

original: taruṇaś ca kṛtī caiva jīrṇāv āvām ubhāv api
analyzed: taruṇaḥ ca kṛtī ca eva jīrṇau āvām ubhau api
translated: and being young and skilled, while we two are old.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: etac chrutvā tu bhīṣmasya rājñāṃ dadhvaṃsire tadā
analyzed: etat śrutvā tu bhīṣmasya rājñām dadhvaṃsire tadā

original: bhaginyau mama ye nīte ambikāmbālike nṛpa
analyzed: bhaginyau mama ye nīte ambikā ambālike nṛpa
translated: O king, those two sisters of mine who were taken away, Ambika and Ambalika,

analyzed: prādāt vicitravīryāya gāṅgeyaḥ hi yavīyase
translated: Ganga's son gave them to the younger Vichitravirya.

original: yathā śālvapate nānyaṃ naraṃ dhyāmi kathaṃ cana
analyzed: yathā śālva pate na anyam naram dhyāmi katham cana
translated: O lord of Shalva, just as I never think of any other man

original: tvām ṛte puruṣavyāghra tathā mūrdhānam ālabhe
analyzed: tvām ṛte puruṣa vyāghra tathā mūrdhānam ālabhe
translated: except you, O tiger among men, in the same way I touch my head.

original: na cānyapūrvā rājendra tvām ahaṃ samupasthitā
analyzed: na ca anyapūrvā rāja indra tvām aham samupasthitā
translated: O Indra among kings, I have not been with another man before you.

analyzed: satyam bravīmi śālva etat satyena ātmānam ālabhe
translated: I speak the truth, O Shalva, by this truth I touch my head.

original: bhajasva māṃ viśālākṣa svayaṃ kanyām upasthitām
analyzed: bhajasva mām viśāla akṣa svayam kanyām upasthitām
translated: Accept me, O large-eyed one, I am a maiden who has come to you of her own accord.

analyzed: ananya pūrvām rāja indra tvad prasāda abhikāṅkṣiṇīm
translated: I have not been with another man before you, O Indra among kings, I am eager for your favor.

original: tām evaṃ bhāṣamāṇāṃ tu śālvaḥ kāśipateḥ sutām
analyzed: tām evam bhāṣamāṇām tu śālvaḥ kāśi pateḥ sutām
translated: But Shalva, the lord of Shalva, abandoned that daughter of the king of Kashi,

analyzed: atyajat bharata śreṣṭha tvacam jīrṇām iva uragaḥ
translated: who was speaking in this way, O best of the Bharata lineage, like a snake casts off its old skin.

analyzed: evam bahuvidhaiḥ vākyaiḥ yācyamānaḥ tayā anagha
translated: Thus, O sinless one, though she was thus entreated by her in various words,

analyzed: na aśraddadhat śālva patiḥ kanyāyāḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: the lord of Shalva, O bull among the Bharata lineage, did not believe the maiden.

original: tataḥ sā manyunāviṣṭā jyeṣṭhā kāśipateḥ sutā
analyzed: tatas sā manyunā āviṣṭā jyeṣṭhā kāśi pateḥ sutā
translated: Then that eldest daughter of the king of Kashi, overwhelmed with anger,

analyzed: abravīt sa aśru nayanā bāṣpa vihvalayā girā
translated: With eyes filled with tears and her voice choked with sobs, she said:

original: tvayā tyaktā gamiṣyāmi yatra yatra viśāṃ pate
analyzed: tvayā tyaktā gamiṣyāmi yatra yatra viśām pate
translated: O lord of the people, abandoned by you, I will go wherever I go.

original: tatra me santu gatayaḥ santaḥ satyaṃ yathābruvam
analyzed: tatra me santu gatayaḥ santaḥ satyam yathā abruvam
translated: May my paths be auspicious there, as I have spoken the truth.

original: evaṃ saṃbhāṣamāṇāṃ tu nṛśaṃsaḥ śālvarāṭ tadā
analyzed: evam saṃbhāṣamāṇām tu nṛśaṃsaḥ śālva rāj tadā
translated: While she was speaking thus, the cruel king of Shalva

analyzed: paryatyajata kauravya karuṇam paridevatīm
translated: abandoned her, O Kouravya, as she lamented piteously.

original: gaccha gaccheti tāṃ śālvaḥ punaḥ punar abhāṣata
analyzed: gaccha gaccha iti tām śālvaḥ punar punar abhāṣata
translated: Shalva repeatedly said to her, Go, go!

original: bibhemi bhīṣmāt suśroṇi tvaṃ ca bhīṣmaparigrahaḥ
analyzed: bibhemi bhīṣmāt su śroṇi tvam ca bhīṣma parigrahaḥ
translated: O one with beautiful hips, I fear Bhishma, and you are under Bhishma's protection.

original: evam uktā tu sā tena śālvenādīrghadarśinā
analyzed: evam uktā tu sā tena śālvena adīrgha darśinā
translated: Thus spoken to by Shalva, who lacked foresight,

original: niścakrāma purād dīnā rudatī kurarī yathā
analyzed: niścakrāma purāt dīnā rudatī kurarī yathā
translated: she left the city, miserable and weeping like a female osprey.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: sā niṣkramantī nagarāc cintayām āsa bhārata
analyzed: sā niṣkramantī nagarāt cintayām āsa bhārata
translated: As she was leaving the city, she thought, O descendant of Bharata:

analyzed: pṛthivyām nā asti yuvatiḥ viṣama sthatarā mayā
translated: There is no young woman on earth more unfortunate than I am.

analyzed: bāndhavaiḥ viprahīnā asmi śālvena ca nirākṛtā
translated: I am separated from my relatives and rejected by Shalva.

original: na ca śakyaṃ punar gantuṃ mayā vāraṇasāhvayam
analyzed: na ca śakyam punar gantum mayā vāraṇasāhvayam
translated: And it is not possible for me to go back to Varanasahva again.

analyzed: anujñātā asmi bhīṣmeṇa śālvam uddiśya kāraṇam
translated: I have been permitted by Bhishma for the sake of Shalva.

original: kiṃ nu garhāmy athātmānam atha bhīṣmaṃ durāsadam
analyzed: kim nu garhāmi atha ātmānam atha bhīṣmam durāsadam
translated: Should I blame myself or the invincible Bhishma?

original: āho svit pitaraṃ mūḍhaṃ yo me 'kārṣīt svayaṃvaram
analyzed: āho svid pitaram mūḍham yaḥ me kārṣīt svayaṃvaram
translated: Or is it my foolish father who made me choose my own husband?

original: mamāyaṃ svakṛto doṣo yāhaṃ bhīṣmarathāt tadā
analyzed: mama ayam sva kṛtaḥ doṣaḥ yā aham bhīṣma rathāt tadā
translated: This is my own fault, that I did not fall from Bhishma's chariot

original: pravṛtte vaiśase yuddhe śālvārthaṃ nāpataṃ purā
analyzed: pravṛtte vaiśase yuddhe śālva artham na apatam purā
translated: When the terrible battle was going on, for the sake of Shalva, in the past.

analyzed: tasya iyam phala nirvṛttiḥ yat āpannā asmi mūḍha vat
translated: This is the result of that, that I have fallen like a fool.

original: dhig bhīṣmaṃ dhik ca me mandaṃ pitaraṃ mūḍhacetasam
analyzed: dhik bhīṣmam dhik ca me mandam pitaram mūḍha cetasam
translated: Shame on Bhishma, and shame on my slow-witted father,

analyzed: yena aham vīrya śulkena paṇya strī vat praveritā
translated: By whom I was given away as a bride for a price, like a prostitute.

original: dhiṅ māṃ dhik śālvarājānaṃ dhig dhātāram athāpi ca
analyzed: dhik mām dhik śālva rājānam dhik dhātāram atha api ca
translated: Shame on me, shame on King Shalva, and shame on the creator as well,

analyzed: yeṣām durnīta bhāvena prāptā asmi āpadam uttamām
translated: By whose evil conduct we have attained this great calamity.

original: sarvathā bhāgadheyāni svāni prāpnoti mānavaḥ🔽anayasyāsya tu mukhaṃ bhīṣmaḥ śāṃtanavo mama
analyzed: sarvathā bhāgadheyāni svāni prāpnoti mānavaḥ  anayasya asya tu mukham bhīṣmaḥ śāṃtanavaḥ mama
translated: In every way, a man obtains his own share of fortune.🔽But the beginning of this misfortune is Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, for me.

original: sā bhīṣme pratikartavyam ahaṃ paśyāmi sāṃpratam
analyzed: sā bhīṣme pratikartavyam aham paśyāmi sāṃpratam
translated: I see that I must now repay Bhishma

original: tapasā vā yudhā vāpi duḥkhahetuḥ sa me mataḥ
analyzed: tapasā vā yudhā vā api duḥkha hetuḥ sa me mataḥ
translated: Either through austerities or through battle. He is the cause of my sorrow, in my opinion.

original: ko nu bhīṣmaṃ yudhā jetum utsaheta mahīpatiḥ
analyzed: kaḥ nu bhīṣmam yudhā jetum utsaheta mahīpatiḥ
translated: What king would dare to conquer Bhishma in battle?

original: evaṃ sā pariniścitya jagāma nagarād bahiḥ
analyzed: evam sā pariniścitya jagāma nagarāt bahis
translated: Having thus made up her mind, she went out of the city

analyzed: āśramam puṇya śīlānām tāpasānām mahātmanām
translated: To the hermitage of the great-souled ascetics of pure conduct.

original: tatas tām avasad rātriṃ tāpasaiḥ parivāritā
analyzed: tatas tām avasat rātrim tāpasaiḥ parivāritā
translated: Surrounded by those ascetics, she spent the night there.

original: ācakhyau ca yathā vṛttaṃ sarvam ātmani bhārata
analyzed: ācakhyau ca yathā vṛttam sarvam ātmani bhārata
translated: And she told them everything that had happened to her, O descendant of Bharata.

analyzed: vistareṇa mahā bāho nikhilena śuci smitā
translated: In detail, O mighty-armed one, the pure-smiling one told everything

original: haraṇaṃ ca visargaṃ ca śālvena ca visarjanam
analyzed: haraṇam ca visargam ca śālvena ca visarjanam
translated: about her abduction, her release, and her dismissal by Shalva.

original: tatas tatra mahān āsīd brāhmaṇaḥ saṃśitavrataḥ
analyzed: tatas tatra mahān āsīt brāhmaṇaḥ saṃśita vrataḥ
translated: Then there was a great brahmin there, of rigid vows,

analyzed: śaikhāvatyaḥ tapaḥ vṛddhaḥ śāstre ca āraṇyake guruḥ
translated: an aged ascetic of the Shaikhavatya lineage, a teacher in the Aranyaka scriptures.

original: ārtāṃ tām āha sa muniḥ śaikhāvatyo mahātapāḥ
analyzed: ārtām tām āha sa muniḥ śaikhāvatyaḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: That sage Shaikhavatya, of great austerities,

analyzed: niḥśvasantīm satīm bālām duḥkha śoka parāyaṇām
translated: said to the afflicted, sighing, chaste girl, who was devoted to sorrow and grief:

original: evaṃ gate kiṃ nu bhadre śakyaṃ kartuṃ tapasvibhiḥ
analyzed: evam gate kim nu bhadre śakyam kartum tapasvibhiḥ
translated: What can the ascetics do, O blessed one, when this has happened?

analyzed: āśrama sthaiḥ mahābhāgaiḥ tapaḥ nityaiḥ mahātmabhiḥ
translated: The great souls who dwell in the hermitage, the greatly fortunate ones who are always engaged in austerities?

original: sā tv enam abravīd rājan kriyatāṃ madanugrahaḥ
analyzed: sā tu enam abravīt rājan kriyatām mad anugrahaḥ
translated: She said to him, O king, show me your grace.

analyzed: pravrājitum iha icchāmi tapaḥ tapsyāmi duścaram
translated: I wish to renounce and practice severe austerities here.

analyzed: mayā eva etāni karmāṇi pūrva deheṣu mūḍhayā
translated: These deeds were certainly done by me, in my foolish state, in my former bodies.

original: kṛtāni nūnaṃ pāpāni teṣām etat phalaṃ dhruvam
analyzed: kṛtāni nūnam pāpāni teṣām etat phalam dhruvam
translated: They are surely the fruits of those sinful acts.

original: notsaheyaṃ punar gantuṃ svajanaṃ prati tāpasāḥ
analyzed: na utsaheyam punar gantum sva janam prati tāpasāḥ
translated: I am not eager to go back to my relatives, O ascetics.

original: pratyākhyātā nirānandā śālvena ca nirākṛtā🔽upadiṣṭam ihecchāmi tāpasyaṃ vītakalmaṣāḥ
analyzed: pratyākhyātā nirānandā śālvena ca nirākṛtā  upadiṣṭam iha icchāmi tāpasyam vīta kalmaṣāḥ
translated: Rejected and unhappy, and slighted by Shalva,🔽I desire to be instructed in the practice of asceticism by you, O sinless ones, who are free from sin.

original: yuṣmābhir devasaṃkāśāḥ kṛpā bhavatu vo mayi🔽sa tām āśvāsayat kanyāṃ dṛṣṭāntāgamahetubhiḥ
analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ deva saṃkāśāḥ kṛpā bhavatu vaḥ mayi  sa tām āśvāsayat kanyām dṛṣṭānta āgama hetubhiḥ
translated: O you who are like gods, have mercy on me.🔽He comforted the maiden with examples, scriptures, and reasons,

original: sāntvayām āsa kāryaṃ ca pratijajñe dvijaiḥ saha
analyzed: sāntvayām āsa kāryam ca pratijajñe dvijaiḥ saha
translated: and consoled her, and together with the Brahmanas promised to do what was to be done.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: tatas te tāpasāḥ sarve kāryavanto 'bhavaṃs tadā
analyzed: tatas te tāpasāḥ sarve kāryavantaḥ bhavan tadā
translated: Then all those ascetics became intent on their purpose,

original: tāṃ kanyāṃ cintayanto vai kiṃ kāryam iti dharmiṇaḥ
analyzed: tām kanyām cintayantaḥ vai kim kāryam iti dharmiṇaḥ
translated: and those righteous ones, thinking about the maiden, said, What should be done?

original: ke cid āhuḥ pitur veśma nīyatām iti tāpasāḥ
analyzed: ke cit āhuḥ pituḥ veśma nīyatām iti tāpasāḥ
translated: Some of the ascetics said, Let her be taken to her father's house.

original: ke cid asmadupālambhe matiṃ cakrur dvijottamāḥ
analyzed: ke cid asmad upālambhe matim cakruḥ dvijottamāḥ
translated: Some of the best Brahmanas decided to reproach us.

original: ke cic chālvapatiṃ gatvā niyojyam iti menire
analyzed: ke cit śālva patim gatvā niyojyam iti menire
translated: Some thought that having gone to the lord of Shalva, she should be employed.

original: neti ke cid vyavasyanti pratyākhyātā hi tena sā
analyzed: na iti ke cid vyavasyanti pratyākhyātā hi tena sā
translated: Some decided, No, for she had been rejected by him.

original: evaṃ gate kiṃ nu śakyaṃ bhadre kartuṃ manīṣibhiḥ
analyzed: evam gate kim nu śakyam bhadre kartum manīṣibhiḥ
translated: What can the wise do, O good lady, when things have come to this?

original: punar ūcuś ca te sarve tāpasāḥ saṃśitavratāḥ
analyzed: punar ūcuḥ ca te sarve tāpasāḥ saṃśita vratāḥ
translated: And all those ascetics, firm in their vows, said again:

original: alaṃ pravrajiteneha bhadre śṛṇu hitaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: alam pravrajitena iha bhadre śṛṇu hitam vacaḥ
translated: Enough of wandering forth, O good lady, listen to beneficial words:

original: ito gacchasva bhadraṃ te pitur eva niveśanam
analyzed: itas gacchasva bhadram te pituḥ eva niveśanam
translated: Go from here, blessed one, to your father's house.

original: pratipatsyati rājā sa pitā te yad anantaram
analyzed: pratipatsyati rājā sa pitā te yat anantaram
translated: Your father, the king, will give you what is proper next.

analyzed: tatra vatsyasi kalyāṇi sukham sarva guṇa anvitā
translated: There you will live happily, blessed one, endowed with all virtues.

original: na ca te 'nyā gatir nyāyyā bhaved bhadre yathā pitā🔽patir vāpi gatir nāryāḥ pitā vā varavarṇini
analyzed: na ca te nyā gatiḥ nyāyyā bhavet bhadre yathā pitā  patiḥ vā api gatiḥ nāryāḥ pitā vā varavarṇini
translated: And for you, blessed one, there is no other proper recourse than your father.🔽Or a husband is the recourse for a woman, O you of fair complexion.

original: gatiḥ patiḥ samasthāyā viṣame tu pitā gatiḥ
analyzed: gatiḥ patiḥ samasthāyāḥ viṣame tu pitā gatiḥ
translated: A husband is the recourse for a woman in good times, but in bad times the father is the recourse.

analyzed: pravrajyā hi su duḥkhā iyam sukumāryāḥ viśeṣataḥ
translated: This life of renunciation is very difficult, especially for one delicate.

original: rājaputryāḥ prakṛtyā ca kumāryās tava bhāmini
analyzed: rāja putryāḥ prakṛtyā ca kumāryāḥ tava bhāmini
translated: For you, O beautiful lady, a princess by birth and a maiden.

original: bhadre doṣā hi vidyante bahavo varavarṇini
analyzed: bhadre doṣāḥ hi vidyante bahavaḥ varavarṇini
translated: O blessed one, there are many faults, O you of fair complexion,

original: āśrame vai vasantyās te na bhaveyuḥ pitur gṛhe
analyzed: āśrame vai vasantyāḥ te na bhaveyuḥ pituḥ gṛhe
translated: for one living in an ashram, which would not be in your father's house.

original: tatas tu te 'bruvan vākyaṃ brāhmaṇās tāṃ tapasvinīm
analyzed: tatas tu te bruvan vākyam brāhmaṇāḥ tām tapasvinīm
translated: Then those Brahmanas said to that ascetic woman:

original: tvām ihaikākinīṃ dṛṣṭvā nirjane gahane vane
analyzed: tvām iha ekākinīm dṛṣṭvā nirjane gahane vane
translated: Seeing you alone, in this desolate forest,

original: prārthayiṣyanti rājendrās tasmān maivaṃ manaḥ kṛthāḥ
analyzed: prārthayiṣyanti rāja indrāḥ tasmāt mā evam manaḥ kṛthāḥ
translated: the kings will seek you, therefore do not set your mind on this.

analyzed: ambā uvāca
translated: Amba said:

original: na śakyaṃ kāśinagarīṃ punar gantuṃ pitur gṛhān
analyzed: na śakyam kāśinagarīm punar gantum pituḥ gṛhān
translated: It is not possible to go again to the city of Kashi, to my father's house,

analyzed: avajñātā bhaviṣyāmi bāndhavānām na saṃśayaḥ
translated: I will certainly be despised by my relatives.

original: uṣitā hy anyathā bālye pitur veśmani tāpasāḥ
analyzed: uṣitāḥ hi anyathā bālye pituḥ veśmani tāpasāḥ
translated: O ascetics! I have lived in my father's house in a different way during my childhood.

original: nāhaṃ gamiṣye bhadraṃ vas tatra yatra pitā mama
analyzed: na aham gamiṣye bhadram vaḥ tatra yatra pitā mama
translated: I will not go there where my father is. May you all be fortunate.

analyzed: tapaḥ taptum abhīpsāmi tāpasaiḥ paripālitā
translated: I desire to perform austerities, protected by ascetics.

original: yathā pare 'pi me loke na syād evaṃ mahātyayaḥ
analyzed: yathā pare pi me loke na syāt evam mahā atyayaḥ
translated: So that such a great calamity may not befall me in the other world.

original: daurbhāgyaṃ brāhmaṇaśreṣṭhās tasmāt tapsyāmy ahaṃ tapaḥ
analyzed: daurbhāgyam brāhmaṇa śreṣṭhāḥ tasmāt tapsyāmi aham tapaḥ
translated: O best of Brahmins! I will therefore perform austerities due to this misfortune.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: ity evaṃ teṣu vipreṣu cintayatsu tathā tathā
analyzed: iti evam teṣu vipreṣu cintayatsu tathā tathā
translated: Thus, as those Brahmins were thinking in various ways,

original: rājarṣis tad vanaṃ prāptas tapasvī hotravāhanaḥ
analyzed: rājarṣiḥ tat vanam prāptaḥ tapasvī hotravāhanaḥ
translated: the royal sage Hotravahana, an ascetic, arrived at that forest.

original: tāṃ tathā bhāminīṃ dṛṣṭvā śrutvā codvignamānasaḥ
analyzed: tām tathā bhāminīm dṛṣṭvā śrutvā ca udvigna mānasaḥ
translated: Seeing and hearing that beautiful woman in that state, his mind was distressed.

original: tatas te tāpasāḥ sarve pūjayanti sma taṃ nṛpam
analyzed: tatas te tāpasāḥ sarve pūjayanti sma tam nṛpam
translated: Then all those ascetics honored that king.

analyzed: pūjābhiḥ svāgata ādyābhiḥ āsanena udakena ca
translated: With salutations and welcome, and with a seat and water.

analyzed: tasya upaviṣṭasya tatas viśrāntasya upaśṛṇvataḥ
translated: While he was seated, rested, and listening,

original: punar eva kathāṃ cakruḥ kanyāṃ prati vanaukasaḥ
analyzed: punar eva kathām cakruḥ kanyām prati vanaukasaḥ
translated: the forest-dwellers again spoke about the maiden.

original: ambāyās tāṃ kathāṃ śrutvā kāśirājñaś ca bhārata
analyzed: ambāyāḥ tām kathām śrutvā kāśi rājñaḥ ca bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata! Having heard that story of Amba and the king of Kashi,

analyzed: rājarṣiḥ sa mahā tejāḥ babhūva udvigna mānasaḥ
translated: That royal sage, of great splendour, became anxious in mind.

original: tāṃ tathāvādinīṃ śrutvā dṛṣṭvā ca sa mahātapāḥ
analyzed: tām tathāvādinīm śrutvā dṛṣṭvā ca sa mahā tapāḥ
translated: Having heard her speaking thus and seeing her, that one of great austerities,

analyzed: rājarṣiḥ kṛpayā āviṣṭaḥ mahātmā hotravāhanaḥ
translated: the royal sage, the magnanimous Hotravahana, was filled with compassion.

original: sa vepamāna utthāya mātur asyāḥ pitā tadā
analyzed: sa vepamānaḥ utthāya mātuḥ asyāḥ pitā tadā
translated: Then his father, trembling, rose up,

original: tāṃ kanyām aṅkam āropya paryāśvāsayata prabho🔽sa tām apṛcchat kārtsnyena vyasanotpattim āditaḥ
analyzed: tām kanyām aṅkam āropya paryāśvāsayata prabho  sa tām apṛcchat kārtsnyena vyasana utpattim āditas
translated: and placing that maiden on his lap, comforted her, O lord.🔽He asked her in detail about the origin of her calamity from the beginning.

original: sā ca tasmai yathāvṛttaṃ vistareṇa nyavedayat
analyzed: sā ca tasmai yathāvṛttam vistareṇa nyavedayat
translated: And she told him in detail all that had happened.

analyzed: tatas sa rājarṣiḥ abhūt duḥkha śoka samanvitaḥ
translated: Then that royal sage became filled with sorrow and grief,

original: kāryaṃ ca pratipede tan manasā sumahātapāḥ
analyzed: kāryam ca pratipede tat manasā su mahā tapāḥ
translated: and that one of great austerities mentally resolved upon a course of action.

original: abravīd vepamānaś ca kanyām ārtāṃ suduḥkhitaḥ
analyzed: abravīt vepamānaḥ ca kanyām ārtām su duḥkhitaḥ

translated: Hotravahana said:

analyzed: saṃrambhāt abravīt rāmaḥ krodha paryākula īkṣaṇaḥ  tam aham gīrbhiḥ iṣṭābhiḥ punar punar ariṃdamam

analyzed: yadā prayācyamānaḥ u pi prasādam na karoti me

translated: I bowed my head again to that best of Brahmanas and said:

analyzed: abruvam kāraṇam kim tat yat tvam yoddhum iha icchasi  iṣu astram mama bālasya bhavatā eva caturvidham

analyzed: tatas mām abravīt rāmaḥ krodha saṃrakta locanaḥ

analyzed: jānīṣe mām gurum bhīṣma na ca imām pratigṛhṇase

original: tathā bruvantaṃ tam ahaṃ rāmaṃ parapuraṃjayam
analyzed: tathā bruvantam tam aham rāmam parapuraṃjayam

analyzed: yasmāt saṃśayite rthe smin yathānyāyam pravartase

analyzed: paśya me bāhu vīryam ca vikramam ca ati mānuṣam  evam gate tu mayā yat śakyam bhṛgu nandana

original: tayor brahmāstrayor āsīd antarā vai samāgamaḥ
analyzed: tayoḥ brahmāstrayoḥ āsīt antarā vai samāgamaḥ
translated: There was a collision between those two Brahma weapons,

original: asaṃprāpyaiva rāmaṃ ca māṃ ca bhāratasattama
analyzed: a saṃprāpya eva rāmam ca mām ca bhārata sattama
translated: without reaching Rama and me, O best of the Bharata lineage.

original: tato vyomni prādurabhūt teja eva hi kevalam
analyzed: tatas vyomni prādurabhūt tejaḥ eva hi kevalam
translated: Then only pure energy appeared in the sky,

original: bhūtāni caiva sarvāṇi jagmur ārtiṃ viśāṃ pate
analyzed: bhūtāni ca eva sarvāṇi jagmuḥ ārtim viśām pate
translated: and all the beings, O lord of the people, were afflicted.

original: ṛṣayaś ca sagandharvā devatāś caiva bhārata
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ca sa gandharvāḥ devatāḥ ca eva bhārata
translated: And the sages, along with the Gandharvas and the gods, O Bharata,

analyzed: saṃtāpam paramam jagmuḥ astra tejobhi pīḍitāḥ
translated: were greatly distressed, afflicted by the energy of the weapon.

analyzed: tatas cacāla pṛthivī sa parvata vana drumā
translated: Then the earth with its mountains, forests and trees trembled,

original: saṃtaptāni ca bhūtāni viṣādaṃ jagmur uttamam
analyzed: saṃtaptāni ca bhūtāni viṣādam jagmuḥ uttamam
translated: and the tormented beings became extremely sad.

original: prajajvāla nabho rājan dhūmāyante diśo daśa
analyzed: prajajvāla nabhaḥ rājan dhūmāyante diśaḥ daśa
translated: The sky blazed, O king, and the ten directions smoked,

original: na sthātum antarikṣe ca śekur ākāśagās tadā
analyzed: na sthātum antarikṣe ca śekuḥ ākāśa gāḥ tadā
translated: and those moving in the sky were unable to remain in the sky then.

analyzed: tatas hāhākṛte loke sa deva asura rākṣase
translated: Then, in the world with gods, demons and rākṣasas crying Alas!,

original: idam antaram ity eva yoktukāmo 'smi bhārata
analyzed: idam antaram iti eva yoktu kāmaḥ smi bhārata
translated: thinking This is the opportunity, O descendant of Bharata,

analyzed: prasvāpam astram dayitam vacanāt brahma vādinām
translated: I desired to release the beloved weapon of sleep, at the request of the expounders of Brahman.

original: cintitaṃ ca tad astraṃ me manasi pratyabhāt tadā
analyzed: cintitam ca tat astram me manasi pratyabhāt tadā
translated: And that weapon, thought of by me, appeared in my mind then.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: tato halahalāśabdo divi rājan mahān abhūt
analyzed: tatas halahalā śabdaḥ divi rājan mahān abhūt
translated: Then, O king, there arose a great uproar in the sky,

original: prasvāpaṃ bhīṣma mā srākṣīr iti kauravanandana
analyzed: prasvāpam bhīṣma mā srākṣīḥ iti kaurava nandana
translated: O Bhishma, do not release the sleep-inducing weapon, O delighter of the Kurus.

original: ayuñjam eva caivāhaṃ tad astraṃ bhṛgunandane
analyzed: ayuñjam eva ca eva aham tat astram bhṛgunandane
translated: And even as I was yoking that weapon in the descendant of the Bhrigu lineage,

original: prasvāpaṃ māṃ prayuñjānaṃ nārado vākyam abravīt
analyzed: prasvāpam mām prayuñjānam nāradaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Nārada spoke these words to me as I was about to employ the sleep-inducing weapon:

original: ete viyati kauravya divi devagaṇāḥ sthitāḥ
analyzed: ete viyati kauravya divi deva gaṇāḥ sthitāḥ
translated: These are the hosts of gods stationed in the sky, O descendant of Kuru.

original: te tvāṃ nivārayanty adya prasvāpaṃ mā prayojaya
analyzed: te tvām nivārayanti adya prasvāpam mā prayojaya
translated: They are restraining you today. Do not employ the sleep-inducing weapon.

original: rāmas tapasvī brahmaṇyo brāhmaṇaś ca guruś ca te
analyzed: rāmaḥ tapasvī brahmaṇyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ca guruḥ ca te
translated: Rama is an ascetic, devoted to Brahman, and a brāhmaṇa and your guru.

original: tasyāvamānaṃ kauravya mā sma kārṣīḥ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: tasya avamānam kauravya mā sma kārṣīḥ katham cana
translated: O Kouravya, you should never show disrespect towards him.

original: tato 'paśyaṃ diviṣṭhān vai tān aṣṭau brahmavādinaḥ
analyzed: paśyam diviṣṭhān vai tān aṣṭau brahma vādinaḥ
translated: Then I saw those eight reciters of the Vedas residing in heaven.

original: te māṃ smayanto rājendra śanakair idam abruvan
analyzed: te mām smayantaḥ rāja indra śanakais idam abruvan
translated: They smiled at me, O lord of kings, and slowly said this:

original: yathāha bharataśreṣṭha nāradas tat tathā kuru
analyzed: yathā āha bharata śreṣṭha nāradaḥ tat tathā kuru
translated: O best of the Bharata lineage, do as Narada says.

original: etad dhi paramaṃ śreyo lokānāṃ bharatarṣabha
analyzed: etat hi paramam śreyaḥ lokānām bharata ṛṣabha
translated: For this is the highest good for the worlds, O bull among the Bharata lineage.

original: tataś ca pratisaṃhṛtya tad astraṃ svāpanaṃ mṛdhe
analyzed: tatas ca pratisaṃhṛtya tat astram svāpanam mṛdhe
translated: And then, withdrawing that sleep-inducing weapon in the battle,

original: brahmāstraṃ dīpayāṃ cakre tasmin yudhi yathāvidhi
analyzed: brahmāstram cakre tasmin yudhi yathāvidhi
translated: I duly ignited the Brahma weapon in that battle.

analyzed: tatas rāmaḥ ruṣitaḥ rāja putra
translated: Then Rama, the prince, became angry,

original: dṛṣṭvā tad astraṃ vinivartitaṃ vai🔽jito 'smi bhīṣmeṇa sumandabuddhir /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tat astram vinivartitam vai  jitaḥ smi bhīṣmeṇa su manda buddhiḥ
translated: seeing that weapon turned back,

analyzed: iti eva vākyam sahasā vyamuñcat
translated: and suddenly uttered the words, I have been defeated by the evil-minded Bhishma,🔽as a Kshatriya, especially in going to fight with Bhishma.

analyzed: paśyat pitaram jāmadagnyaḥ
translated: Then Jamadagni's son saw his father,

original: pitus tathā pitaraṃ tasya cānyam🔽ta evainaṃ saṃparivārya tasthur /
analyzed: pituḥ tathā pitaram tasya ca anyam  te eva enam saṃparivārya tasthuḥ
translated: and another father of his father,🔽and they stood surrounding him,

analyzed: ūcuḥ ca enam sāntva pūrvam tadānīm
translated: and then spoke to him with soothing words:

original: mā smaivaṃ sāhasaṃ vatsa punaḥ kārṣīḥ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: mā smā evam sāhasam vatsa punar kārṣīḥ katham cana
translated: O child, never again commit such a rash act,

analyzed: bhīṣmeṇa saṃyugam gantum kṣatriyeṇa viśeṣataḥ
translated: especially as a Kshatriya, to go to fight with Bhishma.

original: kṣatriyasya tu dharmo 'yaṃ yad yuddhaṃ bhṛgunandana
analyzed: kṣatriyasya tu dharmaḥ yam yat yuddham bhṛgunandana
translated: O descendant of the Bhrigu lineage, this is the duty of a Kshatriya - to fight.

original: svādhyāyo vratacaryā ca brāhmaṇānāṃ paraṃ dhanam
analyzed: svādhyāyaḥ vrata caryā ca brāhmaṇānām param dhanam
translated: Reciting the Vedas and observing vows are the supreme wealth of Brahmins.

original: idaṃ nimitte kasmiṃś cid asmābhir upamantritam
analyzed: idam nimitte kasmin cit asmābhiḥ upamantritam
translated: This was advised by us on a certain occasion,

original: śastradhāraṇam atyugraṃ tac ca kāryaṃ kṛtaṃ tvayā
analyzed: śastra dhāraṇam ati ugram tat ca kāryam kṛtam tvayā
translated: The extremely fierce wielding of weapons, and that task has been accomplished by you.

original: vatsa paryāptam etāvad bhīṣmeṇa saha saṃyuge
analyzed: vatsa paryāptam etāvat bhīṣmeṇa saha saṃyuge
translated: O child, this is enough for you in the battle with Bhishma,

original: vimardas te mahābāho vyapayāhi raṇād itaḥ
analyzed: vimardaḥ te mahā bāho vyapayāhi raṇāt itas
translated: O mighty-armed one, desist from this encounter.

original: paryāptam etad bhadraṃ te tava kārmukadhāraṇam
analyzed: paryāptam etat bhadram te tava kārmuka dhāraṇam
translated: This is enough, O fortunate one, of your wielding the bow.

analyzed: visarjaya etat durdharṣa tapaḥ tapyasva bhārgava
translated: O invincible one, O Bhargava, give up this and practice austerities.

original: eṣa bhīṣmaḥ śāṃtanavo devaiḥ sarvair nivāritaḥ
analyzed: eṣa bhīṣmaḥ śāṃtanavaḥ devaiḥ sarvaiḥ nivāritaḥ
translated: This Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, has been restrained by all the gods,

original: nivartasva raṇād asmād iti caiva pracoditaḥ
analyzed: nivartasva raṇāt asmāt iti ca eva pracoditaḥ
translated: And urged thus: Desist from this battle,

original: rāmeṇa saha mā yotsīr guruṇeti punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: rāmeṇa saha mā yotsīḥ guruṇā iti punar punar
translated: And do not fight with Rama, your preceptor, again and again.

original: na hi rāmo raṇe jetuṃ tvayā nyāyyaḥ kurūdvaha
analyzed: na hi rāmaḥ raṇe jetum tvayā nyāyyaḥ kuru udvaha
translated: O extender of the Kuru lineage, it is not proper for you to defeat Rama in battle.

analyzed: mānam kuruṣva gāṅgeya brāhmaṇasya raṇa ajire
translated: O Gangeya, show respect to the Brahmin in the field of battle.

original: vayaṃ tu guravas tubhyaṃ tatas tvāṃ vārayāmahe
analyzed: vayam tu guravaḥ tubhyam tatas tvām vārayāmahe
translated: But we are your elders, therefore we restrain you.

original: bhīṣmo vasūnām anyatamo diṣṭyā jīvasi putraka
analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ vasūnām anyatamaḥ diṣṭyā jīvasi putraka
translated: Bhishma is one of the Vasus, by good fortune you live, O son,

original: gāṅgeyaḥ śaṃtanoḥ putro vasur eṣa mahāyaśāḥ
analyzed: gāṅgeyaḥ śaṃtanoḥ putraḥ vasuḥ eṣa mahā yaśāḥ
translated: The son of Ganga, the son of Shantanu, this Vasu of great fame,

original: kathaṃ tvayā raṇe jetuṃ rāma śakyo nivarta vai
analyzed: katham tvayā raṇe jetum rāma śakyaḥ nivarta vai
translated: How can you be victorious in battle, O Rama? Turn back!

analyzed: arjunaḥ pāṇḍava śreṣṭhaḥ puraṃdara sutaḥ balī
translated: Arjuna, the best of the Pandavas, the powerful son of Purandara,
The hero Prajapati Nara, the ancient and eternal god,

analyzed: savyasācī iti vikhyātaḥ triṣu lokeṣu vīryavān
translated: Known as Savyasachi, the valiant one in the three worlds,

analyzed: bhīṣma mṛtyuḥ yathākālam vihitaḥ vai svayaṃbhuvā
translated: The appointed death of Bhishma by the Self-Existent One in due time,

original: evam uktaḥ sa pitṛbhiḥ pitṝn rāmo 'bravīd idam
analyzed: evam uktaḥ sa pitṛbhiḥ pitṝn rāmaḥ bravīt idam
translated: Thus addressed by the ancestors, Rama said this to the ancestors:

original: nāhaṃ yudhi nivarteyam iti me vratam āhitam
analyzed: na aham yudhi nivarteyam iti me vratam āhitam
translated: I have taken a vow that I will not turn back in battle,

original: na nivartitapūrvaṃ ca kadā cid raṇamūrdhani
analyzed: na nivartita pūrvam ca kadā cid raṇa mūrdhani
translated: And I have never turned back on the field of battle before,

analyzed: nivartyatām āpageyaḥ kāmam yuddhāt pitāmahāḥ
translated: Let the son of Apaga turn back from battle, O grandfathers, if you wish,

original: na tv ahaṃ vinivartiṣye yuddhād asmāt kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na tu aham vinivartiṣye yuddhāt asmāt katham cana
translated: But I will by no means turn back from this battle.

original: tatas te munayo rājann ṛcīkapramukhās tadā
analyzed: tatas te munayaḥ rājan ṛcīka pramukhāḥ tadā
translated: Then those sages, O king, headed by Richika,

analyzed: nāradena eva sahitāḥ samāgamya idam abruvan
translated: Together with Narada himself, having assembled, said this:

analyzed: nivartasva raṇāt tāta mānayasva dvijottamān
translated: Turn back from battle, my son, honor the best of the twice-born,

original: nety avocam ahaṃ tāṃś ca kṣatradharmavyapekṣayā
analyzed: na iti avocam aham tān ca kṣatra dharma vyapekṣayā
translated: But I said to them, No, considering the duty of a kshatriya.

original: mama vratam idaṃ loke nāhaṃ yuddhāt kathaṃ cana
analyzed: mama vratam idam loke na aham yuddhāt katham cana
translated: This is my vow in this world - I will never turn away from battle

original: vimukho vinivarteyaṃ pṛṣṭhato 'bhyāhataḥ śaraiḥ🔽nāhaṃ lobhān na kārpaṇyān na bhayān nārthakāraṇāt
analyzed: vimukhaḥ vinivarteyam pṛṣṭhatas bhyāhataḥ śaraiḥ  na aham lobhāt na kārpaṇyāt na bhayāt na artha kāraṇāt
translated: without being struck from behind by arrows.

original: tyajeyaṃ śāśvataṃ dharmam iti me niścitā matiḥ
analyzed: tyajeyam śāśvatam dharmam iti me niścitā matiḥ
translated: I will not abandon the eternal dharma out of greed, miserliness, fear, or for the sake of wealth - this is my firm resolve.

original: tatas te munayaḥ sarve nāradapramukhā nṛpa
analyzed: tatas te munayaḥ sarve nārada pramukhāḥ nṛpa
translated: Then all those sages, headed by Narada, O king,

original: bhāgīrathī ca me mātā raṇamadhyaṃ prapedire
analyzed: bhāgīrathī ca me mātā raṇa madhyam prapedire
translated: and my mother Bhagirathi, entered the midst of the battle.

analyzed: tathā eva ātta śaraḥ dhanvī tathā eva dṛḍha niścayaḥ
translated: With arrows drawn and bow ready, and with a firm resolve,

original: sthito 'ham āhave yoddhuṃ tatas te rāmam abruvan
analyzed: sthitaḥ ham āhave yoddhum tatas te rāmam abruvan
translated: I stood ready to fight in the battle. Then they spoke to Rama:

analyzed: sametya sahitāḥ bhūyas samare bhṛgunandanam
translated: Having assembled together again in the battle, they addressed the descendant of Bhrigu:

original: nāvanītaṃ hi hṛdayaṃ viprāṇāṃ śāmya bhārgava
analyzed: nāvanītam hi hṛdayam viprāṇām śāmya bhārgava
translated: The hearts of Brahmins are like butter; be pacified, O Bhargava.

original: rāma rāma nivartasva yuddhād asmād dvijottama
analyzed: rāma rāma nivartasva yuddhāt asmāt dvijottama
translated: O Rama, O Rama, turn back from this battle, O best of Brahmins.

original: avadhyo hi tvayā bhīṣmas tvaṃ ca bhīṣmasya bhārgava
analyzed: avadhyaḥ hi tvayā bhīṣmaḥ tvam ca bhīṣmasya bhārgava
translated: Bhishma is unslayable by you, and you are unslayable by Bhishma, O Bhargava.

original: evaṃ bruvantas te sarve pratirudhya raṇājiram
analyzed: evam bruvantaḥ te sarve pratirudhya raṇa ajiram
translated: Saying this, they all obstructed the battlefield

analyzed: nyāsayām cakrire śastram pitaraḥ bhṛgunandanam
translated: and laid down their weapons before the descendant of Bhrigu, the father.

original: tato 'haṃ punar evātha tān aṣṭau brahmavādinaḥ
analyzed: tatas ham punar eva atha tān aṣṭau brahma vādinaḥ
translated: Then I again addressed those eight proclaimers of the Vedas:

original: adrākṣaṃ dīpyamānān vai grahān aṣṭāv ivoditān
analyzed: adrākṣam dīpyamānān vai grahān aṣṭau iva uditān
translated: I saw them shining like the eight rising planets.

original: te māṃ sapraṇayaṃ vākyam abruvan samare sthitam
analyzed: te mām sa praṇayam vākyam abruvan samare sthitam
translated: They spoke to me with affection, as I stood in the battle,

original: praihi rāmaṃ mahābāho guruṃ lokahitaṃ kuru
analyzed: praihi rāmam mahā bāho gurum loka hitam kuru
translated: Go to Rama, O mighty-armed one, and do what is beneficial for the world.

original: dṛṣṭvā nivartitaṃ rāmaṃ suhṛdvākyena tena vai
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā nivartitam rāmam suhṛd vākyena tena vai
translated: Seeing Rama turned back by those words of his friends,

original: lokānāṃ ca hitaṃ kurvann aham apy ādade vacaḥ
analyzed: lokānām ca hitam kurvan aham api ādade vacaḥ
translated: and acting for the welfare of the people, I also accepted those words.

analyzed: tatas ham rāmam āsādya vavande bhṛśa vikṣataḥ
translated: Then, approaching Rama, I paid homage, severely wounded.

original: rāmaś cābhyutsmayan premṇā mām uvāca mahātapāḥ
analyzed: rāmaḥ ca abhyutsmayan premṇā mām uvāca mahā tapāḥ
translated: And Rama, the great ascetic, affectionately said to me with a smile,

original: tvatsamo nāsti loke 'smin kṣatriyaḥ pṛthivīcaraḥ🔽gamyatāṃ bhīṣma yuddhe 'smiṃs toṣito 'haṃ bhṛśaṃ tvayā
analyzed: tvad samaḥ na asti loke smin kṣatriyaḥ pṛthivī caraḥ  gamyatām bhīṣma yuddhe smin toṣitaḥ ham bhṛśam tvayā
translated: There is no kshatriya on this earth equal to you who roams the earth.🔽Go, Bhishma, in this battle I am greatly satisfied with you.

original: mama caiva samakṣaṃ tāṃ kanyām āhūya bhārgavaḥ
analyzed: mama ca eva samakṣam tām kanyām āhūya bhārgavaḥ
translated: And in my presence, the descendant of Bhrigu, having summoned that maiden,

original: uvāca dīnayā vācā madhye teṣāṃ tapasvinām
analyzed: uvāca dīnayā vācā madhye teṣām tapasvinām
translated: spoke with a distressed voice in the midst of those ascetics.

analyzed: rāmaḥ uvāca
translated: Rama said:

original: pratyakṣam etal lokānāṃ sarveṣām eva bhāmini
analyzed: pratyakṣam etat lokānām sarveṣām eva bhāmini
translated: O beautiful lady, this is known to all the worlds,

original: yathā mayā paraṃ śaktyā kṛtaṃ vai pauruṣaṃ mahat
analyzed: yathā mayā param śaktyā kṛtam vai pauruṣam mahat
translated: that I have exerted my great manliness to the utmost of my ability.

original: na caiva yudhi śaknomi bhīṣmaṃ śastrabhṛtāṃ varam
analyzed: na ca eva yudhi śaknomi bhīṣmam śastrabhṛtām varam
translated: But I am unable to defeat Bhishma in battle, that best of wielders of weapons.

analyzed: viśeṣayitum atyartham uttama astrāṇi darśayan
translated: Displaying his supreme weapons to the utmost,

original: eṣā me paramā śaktir etan me paramaṃ balam
analyzed: eṣā me paramā śaktiḥ etat me paramam balam
translated: This is my supreme power, this is my supreme strength,

original: yatheṣṭaṃ gamyatāṃ bhadre kim anyad vā karomi te
analyzed: yatheṣṭam gamyatām bhadre kim anyat vā karomi te
translated: Go as you wish, blessed one, what else can I do for you?

original: bhīṣmam eva prapadyasva na te 'nyā vidyate gatiḥ🔽nirjito hy asmi bhīṣmeṇa mahāstrāṇi pramuñcatā
analyzed: bhīṣmam eva prapadyasva na te nyā vidyate gatiḥ  nirjitaḥ hi asmi bhīṣmeṇa mahā astrāṇi pramuñcatā
translated: Go to Bhishma, you have no other recourse.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: evam uktvā tato rāmo viniḥśvasya mahāmanāḥ
analyzed: evam uktvā tatas rāmaḥ viniḥśvasya mahā manāḥ
translated: Having said this, the great-minded Rama sighed,

original: tūṣṇīm āsīt tadā kanyā provāca bhṛgunandanam
analyzed: tūṣṇīm āsīt tadā kanyā provāca bhṛgunandanam
translated: and then remained silent. The maiden then spoke to the descendant of Bhrigu:

original: bhagavann evam evaitad yathāha bhagavāṃs tathā
analyzed: bhagavan evam eva etat yathā āha bhagavān tathā
translated: Blessed one, it is just as the blessed one has said,

original: ajeyo yudhi bhīṣmo 'yam api devair udāradhīḥ
analyzed: ajeyaḥ yudhi bhīṣmaḥ yam api devaiḥ udāra dhīḥ
translated: this Bhishma of great wisdom is invincible in battle even by the gods,

original: yathāśakti yathotsāhaṃ mama kāryaṃ kṛtaṃ tvayā
analyzed: yathāśakti yathotsāham mama kāryam kṛtam tvayā
translated: You have done my work to the best of your ability and enthusiasm,

original: anidhāya raṇe vīryam astrāṇi vividhāni ca
analyzed: a nidhāya raṇe vīryam astrāṇi vividhāni ca
translated: without laying down your valor in battle and your various weapons,

original: na caiṣa śakyate yuddhe viśeṣayitum antataḥ
analyzed: na ca eṣa śakyate yuddhe viśeṣayitum antatas
translated: and yet he cannot be distinguished in battle at all,

original: na cāham enaṃ yāsyāmi punar bhīṣmaṃ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na ca aham enam yāsyāmi punar bhīṣmam katham cana
translated: and I will never go to Bhishma again in any way,

original: gamiṣyāmi tu tatrāhaṃ yatra bhīṣmaṃ tapodhana
analyzed: gamiṣyāmi tu tatra aham yatra bhīṣmam tapodhana
translated: but I will go there where Bhishma is, O ascetic,

analyzed: samare pātayiṣyāmi svayam eva bhṛgūdvaha
translated: and I will myself bring down Bhishma in battle, O descendant of Bhrigu,

analyzed: evam uktvā yayau kanyā roṣa vyākula locanā
translated: Having said this, the maiden went away, her eyes agitated with anger,

original: tapase dhṛtasaṃkalpā mama cintayatī vadham🔽tato mahendraṃ saha tair munibhir bhṛgusattamaḥ
analyzed: tapase dhṛta saṃkalpā mama cintayatī vadham  tatas mahendram saha taiḥ munibhiḥ bhṛgu sattamaḥ

original: yathāgataṃ yayau rāmo mām upāmantrya bhārata
analyzed: yathāgatam yayau rāmaḥ mām upāmantrya bhārata
translated: Then the best of the Bhrigus, with those sages, went away as they had come, O Rama, after taking leave of me, O descendant of Bharata.

translated: Then, having mounted the chariot, praised by the twice-born,

translated: having entered the city, I informed my mother Satyavati

original: yathāvṛttaṃ mahārāja sā ca māṃ pratyanandata
analyzed: yathāvṛttam mahā rāja sā ca mām pratyanandata
translated: of what had happened, and she rejoiced in me, O great king.

analyzed: puruṣān ca ādiśam prājñān kanyā vṛttānta karmaṇi  divase divase hi asyāḥ gata jalpita ceṣṭitam
translated: And I ordered wise men to attend to the affairs of the maiden,🔽reporting to me day by day her movements, conversations and activities,

analyzed: pratyāharan ca me yuktāḥ sthitāḥ priya hite mama
translated: engaged in my welfare and devoted to me.

analyzed: yadā eva hi vanam prāyāt kanyā sā tapase dhṛtā
translated: As soon as that maiden went to the forest, resolved on austerities,

analyzed: tadā eva vyathitaḥ dīnaḥ gata cetāḥ iva abhavam
translated: I became afflicted, miserable, as if bereft of my senses.

original: na hi māṃ kṣatriyaḥ kaś cid vīryeṇa vijayed yudhi
analyzed: na hi mām kṣatriyaḥ kaḥ cit vīryeṇa vijayet yudhi
translated: No kshatriya could have vanquished me in battle by his prowess,

analyzed: ṛte brahma vidaḥ tāta tapasā saṃśita vratāt
translated: except one who knows Brahman, O son, firm in his vows through austerities.

original: api caitan mayā rājan nārade 'pi niveditam
analyzed: api ca etat mayā rājan nārade niveditam
translated: Moreover, O king, I reported this to Narada also,

analyzed: vyāse ca eva bhayāt kāryam tau ca ubhau mām avocatām
translated: And out of fear of Vyasa, both of them spoke to me, saying:

analyzed: na viṣādaḥ tvayā kāryaḥ bhīṣma kāśi sutām prati
translated: O Bhishma, you should not be sad on account of the daughter of Kashi.

analyzed: daivam puruṣakāreṇa kaḥ nivartitum utsahet
translated: Who can dare to counteract destiny by human effort?

analyzed: sā tu kanyā mahā rāja praviśya āśrama maṇḍalam
translated: O great king, that maiden, having entered the circle of the hermitage,

analyzed: yamunā tīram āśritya tapaḥ tepe timānuṣam
translated: resorted to the banks of the Yamuna and performed superhuman austerities.🔽Without food, emaciated, rough, with matted hair, covered in dirt and mud,

analyzed: ṣaṭ māsān vāyu bhakṣā ca sthāṇu bhūtā tapodhanā  yamunā tīram āsādya saṃvatsaram atha aparam
translated: for six months she subsisted on air, standing like a pillar, a storehouse of austerities.🔽Having reached the banks of the Yamuna, she spent another year

analyzed: uda vāsam nirāhārā pārayām āsa bhāminī  śīrṇa parṇena ca ekena pārayām āsa ca aparam
translated: without food, living in water, the beautiful one.🔽She spent another year subsisting on a single withered leaf,

analyzed: saṃvatsaram tīvra kopā pādāṅguṣṭha agra dhiṣṭhitā
translated: standing on the tips of her toes, her anger intense.

original: evaṃ dvādaśa varṣāṇi tāpayām āsa rodasī
analyzed: evam dvādaśa varṣāṇi tāpayām āsa rodasī
translated: Thus she tormented heaven and earth for twelve years.

analyzed: nivartyamānā api tu sā jñātibhiḥ nā eva śakyate
translated: Though dissuaded, she could not be stopped by her relatives.

analyzed: tatas gamat vatsa bhūmim siddha cāraṇa sevitām
translated: Then she went to the land of Vatsa, frequented by perfected beings and celestial singers,

analyzed: āśramam puṇya śīlānām tāpasānām mahātmanām
translated: to the hermitage of great-souled ascetics of pure conduct.

analyzed: tatra puṇyeṣu deśeṣu sā āpluta aṅgī divāniśam
translated: There, in those sacred places, her body bathed day and night,

analyzed: vyacarat kāśi kanyā sā yathākāma vicāriṇī
translated: The daughter of Kashi roamed as she pleased.

analyzed: nanda āśrame mahā rāja tatas ulūka āśrame śubhe

analyzed: cyavanasya āśrame ca eva brahmaṇaḥ sthāne eva ca
translated: In the hermitage of Chyavana, in the abode of Brahma,

analyzed: prayāge devayajane deva araṇyeṣu ca eva ha
translated: In Prayaga, in the sacrificial ground, and in the forests of the gods,

analyzed: bhogavatyām tathā rājan kauśikasya āśrame tathā
translated: In Bhogavati, O king, in the hermitage of Kushika,

analyzed: māṇḍavyasya āśrame rājan dilīpasya āśrame tathā
translated: In the hermitage of Mandavya, O king, in the hermitage of Dilipa,

analyzed: rāmahrade ca kauravya paila gārgyasya ca āśrame
translated: In Rama's lake, O descendant of Kuru, and in the hermitage of Paila and Gargya,

analyzed: eteṣu tīrtheṣu tadā kāśi kanyāḥ viśām pate  āplāvayata gātrāṇi tīvram āsthāya vai tapaḥ
translated: In these holy places, O lord of the people, the daughter of Kashi🔽Bathed her body, practicing severe austerities.

original: tām abravīt kauraveya mama mātā jalotthitā
analyzed: tām abravīt kauraveya mama mātā jala utthitā
translated: Then, O descendant of Kuru, her mother, standing in the water, said to her,

original: kimarthaṃ kliśyase bhadre tathyam etad bravīhi me
analyzed: kimartham kliśyase bhadre tathyam etat bravīhi me
translated: For what purpose are you tormenting yourself, O blessed one? Tell me the truth of this.

analyzed: sā enām atha abravīt rājan kṛtāñjaliḥ aninditā

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ rāmeṇa samare na jitaḥ cāru locane
translated: O you of beautiful eyes, Bhishma was not defeated by Rama in battle.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ tam utsahet jetum udyata iṣum mahīpatim

analyzed: sā aham bhīṣma vināśāya tapaḥ tapsye su dāruṇam

analyzed: carāmi pṛthivīm devi yathā hanyām aham nṛpam

analyzed: etat vrata phalam dehe parasmin syāt yathā hi me

analyzed: tatas bravīt sāgaragā jihmam carasi bhāmini

analyzed: vrata sthā ca śarīram tvam yadi nāma vimokṣyasi

analyzed: dustīrthā ca an abhijñeyā vārṣikī na aṣṭa māsikī

analyzed: bhīma grāhavatī ghorā sarva bhūta bhayaṃkarī

original: evam uktvā tato rājan kāśikanyāṃ nyavartata
analyzed: evam uktvā tatas rājan kāśi kanyām nyavartata
translated: Having said this, O king, she turned away from the daughter of Kashi.

analyzed: mātā mama mahābhāgā smayamānā iva bhāminī
translated: My greatly fortunate mother, that beautiful lady, as if smiling,

original: kadā cid aṣṭame māsi kadā cid daśame tathā
analyzed: kadā cit aṣṭame māsi kadā cit daśame tathā
translated: sometimes in the eighth month, sometimes in the tenth,

original: na prāśnītodakam api punaḥ sā varavarṇinī🔽sā vatsabhūmiṃ kauravya tīrthalobhāt tatas tataḥ
analyzed: na prāśnīta udakam api punar sā varavarṇinī  sā vatsa bhūmim kauravya tīrtha lobhāt tatas tatas
translated: that best of women did not even drink water again.🔽That daughter of the king of Kashi, wandering here and there out of greed for holy places,

analyzed: patitā paridhāvantī punar kāśi pateḥ sutā
translated: fell down again and again, O Kouravya, in the land of Vatsa.

original: sā nadī vatsabhūmyāṃ tu prathitāmbeti bhārata
analyzed: sā nadī vatsa bhūmyām tu prathitā ambā iti bhārata
translated: That river became famous in the land of Vatsa as Amba, O descendant of Bharata.

analyzed: vārṣikī grāha bahulā dustīrthā kuṭilā tathā
translated: The river was full of rain, infested with crocodiles, difficult to cross, and crooked.

original: sā kanyā tapasā tena bhāgārdhena vyajāyata
analyzed: sā kanyā tapasā tena bhāga ardhena vyajāyata
translated: Due to that penance, the maiden was born as a river occupying half the space.

analyzed: nadī ca rājan vatseṣu kanyā ca eva bhavat tadā
translated: And, O king, the river became known as Vatsagotra in the land of the Vatsas.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

analyzed: tatas te tāpasāḥ sarve tapase dhṛta niścayām

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā nyavartayan tāta kim kāryam iti ca abruvan

analyzed: tān uvāca tatas kanyā tapaḥ vṛddhān ṛṣīn tadā

analyzed: vadha artham tasya dīkṣā me na loka artham tapodhanāḥ

analyzed: nihatya bhīṣmam gaccheyam śāntim iti eva niścayaḥ

analyzed: yad kṛte duḥkha vasatim imām prāptā asmi śāśvatīm

analyzed: pati lokāt vihīnā ca nā eva strī na pumān iha

analyzed: na a hatvā yudhi gāṅgeyam nivarteyam tapodhanāḥ

analyzed: eṣa me hṛdi saṃkalpaḥ yad artham idam udyatam
translated: This is the resolve in my heart for which I have undertaken this.

analyzed: strī bhāve parinirviṇṇā puṃstva arthe kṛta niścayā
translated: Disgusted with womanhood, determined on manhood,

analyzed: bhīṣme praticikīrṣāmi na asmi vāryā iti vai punar
translated: I seek revenge on Bhishma. I cannot be stopped.

original: tāṃ devo darśayām āsa śūlapāṇir umāpatiḥ
analyzed: tām devaḥ darśayām āsa śūlapāṇiḥ umāpatiḥ
translated: The god, the wielder of the trident, the lord of Uma, showed her

analyzed: vadhiṣyasi iti tām devaḥ pratyuvāca manasvinīm

original: tataḥ sā punar evātha kanyā rudram uvāca ha
analyzed: tatas sā punar eva atha kanyā rudram uvāca ha
translated: Then that maiden again spoke to Rudra,

analyzed: upapadyet katham deva striyaḥ mama jayaḥ yudhi

analyzed: strī bhāvena ca me gāḍham manaḥ śāntam umāpate
translated: And my mind is deeply at peace, O lord of Uma, because of my womanhood.

analyzed: pratiśrutaḥ ca bhūteśa tvayā bhīṣma parājayaḥ
translated: And, O lord of beings, the defeat of Bhishma has been promised by you.

original: yathā sa satyo bhavati tathā kuru vṛṣadhvaja
analyzed: yathā sa satyaḥ bhavati tathā kuru vṛṣadhvaja
translated: O bull-bannered one, act in such a way that it becomes true.

analyzed: yathā hanyām samāgamya bhīṣmam śāṃtanavam yudhi
translated: How can I kill Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, when I meet him in battle?

analyzed: tām uvāca mahādevaḥ kanyām kila vṛṣadhvajaḥ
translated: To that maiden, it is said, the great god, the bull-bannered one, said,

analyzed: na me vāc anṛtam bhadre prāha satyam bhaviṣyati
translated: My words are not false, O good lady. It will happen as I say.

analyzed: vadhiṣyasi raṇe bhīṣmam puruṣa tvam ca lapsyase
translated: You will kill Bhishma in battle and attain manhood.

original: smariṣyasi ca tat sarvaṃ deham anyaṃ gatā satī
analyzed: smariṣyasi ca tat sarvam deham anyam gatā satī
translated: And when you have taken another body, you will remember all this.

analyzed: drupadasya kule jātāḥ bhaviṣyasi mahā rathaḥ
translated: Born in the family of Drupada, you will become a great warrior.

analyzed: śīghra astraḥ citra yodhī ca bhaviṣyasi su saṃmataḥ
translated: You will be swift in the use of weapons, skilled in various modes of fighting, and highly esteemed.

original: yathoktam eva kalyāṇi sarvam etad bhaviṣyati
analyzed: yathoktam eva kalyāṇi sarvam etat bhaviṣyati
translated: O fortunate one, all this will come to pass just as you have said.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi pumān paścāt kasmāt cit kāla paryayāt

analyzed: evam uktvā mahā tejāḥ kapardī vṛṣabhadhvajaḥ
translated: Having said this, the greatly energetic one with matted locks and the bull on his banner,

analyzed: paśyatām eva viprāṇām tatra eva antaradhīyata

original: tataḥ sā paśyatāṃ teṣāṃ maharṣīṇām aninditā🔽samāhṛtya vanāt tasmāt kāṣṭhāni varavarṇinī
analyzed: tatas sā paśyatām teṣām mahā ṛṣīṇām aninditā  samāhṛtya vanāt tasmāt kāṣṭhāni varavarṇinī
translated: Then, while the great sages were watching, the irreproachable🔽beautiful woman, after collecting wood from the forest,

original: citāṃ kṛtvā sumahatīṃ pradāya ca hutāśanam
analyzed: citām kṛtvā su mahatīm pradāya ca hutāśanam
translated: built a huge funeral pyre and set fire to it.

analyzed: pradīpte gnau mahā rāja roṣa dīptena cetasā
translated: O great king, when the fire was blazing, with a mind inflamed with anger,

analyzed: uktvā bhīṣma vadhāya iti praviveśa hutāśanam
translated: she entered the blazing fire, saying For the sake of Bhishma's death.

original: jyeṣṭhā kāśisutā rājan yamunām abhito nadīm
analyzed: jyeṣṭhā kāśi sutā rājan yamunām abhitas nadīm
translated: O king, the eldest daughter of the king of Kashi,

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: Duryodhana said:

original: kathaṃ śikhaṇḍī gāṅgeya kanyā bhūtvā satī tadā
analyzed: katham śikhaṇḍī gāṅgeya kanyā bhūtvā satī tadā
translated: O son of Ganga, how did Shikhandi, who was a woman,

original: puruṣo 'bhavad yudhi śreṣṭha tan me brūhi pitāmaha
analyzed: puruṣaḥ bhavat yudhi śreṣṭha tat me brūhi pitāmaha
translated: become a man in battle, O best of warriors? Tell me that, O grandfather.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: bhāryā tu tasya rājendra drupadasya mahīpateḥ
analyzed: bhāryā tu tasya rāja indra drupadasya mahīpateḥ
translated: O lord of kings, the wife of that king Drupada,

original: mahiṣī dayitā hy āsīd aputrā ca viśāṃ pate
analyzed: mahiṣī dayitā hi āsīt aputrā ca viśām pate
translated: And she was the beloved queen, but childless, O lord of the people.

original: etasminn eva kāle tu drupado vai mahīpatiḥ
analyzed: etasmin eva kāle tu drupadaḥ vai mahīpatiḥ
translated: At this time, the king Drupada

analyzed: apatya artham mahā rāja toṣayām āsa śaṃkaram
translated: propitiated Shankara for a child, O great king.

analyzed: asmad vadha artham niścitya tapaḥ ghoram samāsthitaḥ
translated: Resorting to severe austerities, he was determined to kill us.

original: lebhe kanyāṃ mahādevāt putro me syād iti bruvan
analyzed: lebhe kanyām mahādevāt putraḥ me syāt iti bruvan
translated: Saying, May I have a son, he obtained a daughter from Mahadeva.

analyzed: bhagavan putram icchāmi bhīṣmam praticikīrṣayā
translated: O Lord, I desire a son for the purpose of avenging Bhishma.

original: ity ukto devadevena strīpumāṃs te bhaviṣyati
analyzed: iti uktaḥ devadevena strī pumān te bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus addressed by the Lord of the gods, Shiva said, He will be both a woman and a man.

original: nivartasva mahīpāla naitaj jātv anyathā bhavet
analyzed: nivartasva mahīpāla na etat jātu anyathā bhavet
translated: Return, O king, it cannot be otherwise.

original: sa tu gatvā ca nagaraṃ bhāryām idam uvāca ha
analyzed: sa tu gatvā ca nagaram bhāryām idam uvāca ha
translated: Having gone to the city, he said this to his wife:

analyzed: kṛtaḥ yatnaḥ mayā devi putra arthe tapasā mahān
translated: O Goddess, I have made great efforts for a son through austerities.
